title: Financial Analyst (English/Spanish)
description:
Heifer International is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, gender, gender identify, sexual orientation, age, status as a protected veteran, among other things, or status as a qualified individual with disability.
**ROLE FUNCTION**

Promote financial/business analysis, highlighting business issues, risks, and opportunities that that will effectively and responsively support Heifer’s Mission. Help develop and monitor financial planning and analysis tools to measure Heifer’s financial progress for the organization. This position will drive ensuring consistency of financial data across organizational areas and databases toward an integrated global financial system.
**THE SUCCESSFUL CANDIDATE**

To succeed in this role, you will have strong analytical skills with the ability to apply them, demonstrate financial and quantitative skills, build strong working relationships, and show an eagerness to learn. You are detail-oriented and take pride in producing quality and timely work. You are excellent at working collaboratively. You must be able to speak both English and Spanish.
**RESPONSIBILITIES & DELIVERABLES**
**A. Financial Reporting (45%)*** Coordinate financial analysis projects, such as budget variance analysis, capital budgeting and cash management.
* Accurate and complete reporting on a daily, monthly or yearly basis
* Generate, compile and maintain financial and statistical data. When requested, data is available to compose requested reports.

**B. Vena System Administration (35%)*** Report writer, trainer, overall management of the system across the Organization
* Writing HQ and global reports. Collaborate in the development, implementation and training of HQ, global and country- specific budget and forecasting entry.
* Field and HQ personnel possess knowledge and ability to enter data into accounting systems.
* Ongoing administration of Vena Solutions.
* Apply specialized expertise to facilitate organizational financial planning, synchronization of financial plans with periodic budgeting, monitoring and analysis of financial performance, and improved management and regulatory reporting. Includes both routine and special-project analyses and due diligence reviews.

**C. Financial Department Projects (20%)*** Collaborate on financial accounting, reporting, and system process improvement projects from needs identification, to process development, testing, and procedural documentation, continuing through to operational mainstreaming as appropriate.
* Enterprise-wide uniform chart of accounts, global financial system integration and conversions, and improved functional allocation method.
* Working with country staff to create reports within Vena Solutions system.
* Help convert manual processes to automated
* When assigned specific tasks, be able to assimilate and analyze information, provide reasonable conclusions and complete assignments with little input from supervisor.

**D. May perform other job-related duties as assigned.****Minimum Requirements:**

Bachelor’s degree in accounting, business administration or related field plus 3-5 years of job-related experience with progressive responsibility in finance, accounting, and financial planning, and/or project management. Working proficiency in Spanish is required for this role.
**Preferred Requirements:**

Experience with Vena Solutions preferred. Financial planning and analysis experience highly preferred.
**Most Critical Proficiencies:*** Critical thinking; personal motivation; initiative; able to work both independently and collaboratively with a team.
* Commitment to organizational process improvement, including ability to challenge the status quo and productively influence positive change.
* Skilled at quality presentation of financial data in a well-designed format with impeccable attention to detail and data integrity.
* Proven ability to create and monitor financial budgets and forecasts and to apply specialized knowledge in developing complex financial analyses.
* Strong Microsoft Office Suite application usage skills.
* Skilled with variety of accounting software systems and report-writing tools; willing, able and self-motivated to learn other systems as needed.

**Essential Job Functions and Physical Demands:*** Sufficient expertise to work on complex assignments with minimal supervision.
* Effective management of multiple work commitments and deadlines with a positive, constructive attitude.
* Productive collaboration at all levels, both as a team member and as a team leader.
* Ability to motivate, guide and work cooperatively with a diverse staff.
* Strong interpersonal skills required for navigating and contributing in an environment of organizational and systems changes.
* Constant communication with colleagues throughout the organization: in both one on one and group settings, in written, oral, and presentation formats, via face-to-face meetings, teleconferences, email, etc.
* Commitment to confidentiality and protection of sensitive information.
* Commitment to excellence in presentation, detail, quality assurance, documentation standards, and follow-through in all work products.
* Ability to work at a computer for extended periods of time.
* Willingness and ability to travel internationally as needed.
* Ability to work with sensitive information and maintain confidentiality

**Salary Information:**

The expected base salary range for this position is $55,000 to $68,000 annually. Placement within the range will be based on the experience and competency level of the candidate.
**What we offer:*** Heifer International offers a variety of benefits for U.S. based employees working 30 or more hours per week.
* Health and wellness benefits including Flexible Spending Account and/or Health Saving Account
* Employee assistance program
* 403(b) retirement plan (match 1% employee to 2% employer up to a maximum of 4% match +3% employer discretionary contribution regardless of employee contribution)
* 22 vacation days in addition to 12 statutory and discretionary holidays, and 10 sick days per year
* Employer-paid life insurance and accidental death & dismemberment (AD&D)
* Professional development and annual merit increase opportunities
* Optional critical illness insurance, legal assistance plan and pet protection
* And more!

title: Model Risk Analyst
description:
The Model Risk Analyst role contributes to the overall quality of risk management across the Bank by collaborating with Corporate Risk Management directors, senior leaders, business unit managers, and model owners for the purpose of ensuring model development, model implementation, and model monitoring, conforming to the standards set forth by both the Bank’s Model Risk Management Framework and the provided regulatory guidelines. Assesses the Bank’s models for conceptual soundness, application and use, controls and implementation, as well as assurance on the continued performance of the model as it is deployed into production.

 **Essential Job Functions:**

* Assists with in-depth analytical reviews of the Bank’s models, challenging the theoretical and control soundness of the models.
* Supports the maintenance of bank-wide inventory of all quantitative models and qualitative computational tools within The Bank’s Model Inventory system.
* Provides guidelines to model owners for effective model development or acquisition, adequate documentation, input data quality, testing, outcomes analysis and model performance monitoring.
* Informs the Model Risk management of any delays in model implementation arising from documentation, validation, control, or other situations.
* Observes scheduling requirements necessary to execute model validations throughout the year.
* Specifies appropriate remedial action plans for models with identified deficiencies.
* Maintains compliance with applicable rules, regulations, and expectations set by regulators for model risk management including as The Bank grows and becomes more complex (e.g., SR 11-7, SR 12-7, SR 15-18/19).
* Communicates and escalates matters of significant model risk to senior leaders and business unit managers.
* Assists the Model Risk management in the development of model risk education and delivery of education to senior leaders, business unit managers, and model owners.
* Regularly exercises discretion and judgment in the performance of essential job functions.
* Maintains good punctuality and attendance to work.
* Follows Bank policy, procedures, and guidelines.
* Performs other duties as may be required.

 **Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:**

* Knowledge of model building and/or validation (using SAS, R, Python, Matlab, etc.).
* Knowledge of the financial services industry.
* Ability to prepare written deliverables and presentations for board and management committees, senior leaders, and business unit managers.
* Ability to demonstrate effective interpersonal, communication, and analytical skills.
* Ability to demonstrate creativity, critical thinking, initiative, and problem-solving skills.
* Ability to partner effectively with multiple business groups, corporate areas, auditors, and regulators.
* Ability to operate and work collaboratively in a fast-paced, unpredictable environment, with tight deadlines.
* Ability to manage multiple work streams and deliverables, and coordinate across functional initiatives.
* Ability to travel as needed for business purposes.
* Skill in using computer and Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.

 **Equipment Used in Job Performance/Working Environment:**

* Computer
* Multi-function device
* Telephone

 **Major Job Demands:**

* Decision-making
* Problem-solving

 **Note:** This description is not an exhaustive list of all job functions, duties, skills and job standards required. Other job functions, duties, skills, and standards may be added. Management reserves the right to add or change the job requirements at any time.



**Position Requirements:**


**Basic Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree, preferably in finance, economics, or related quantitative field, or commensurate work experience, required; Master’s degree preferred.
* Minimum of six (6) months of experience in model building or validation (using SAS, R, Python, Matlab, etc.) preferred.

title: Senior Financial Analyst II-2
description:
ARKANSAS CHILDREN'S IS A TOBACCO FREE WORKPLACE. FLU VACCINES ARE REQUIRED. ARKANSAS CHILDREN'S IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. ALL QUALIFIED APPLICANTS WILL RECEIVE CONSIDERATION FOR EMPLOYMENT WITHOUT REGARD TO RACE, COLOR, RELIGION, SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, GENDER IDENTITY OR EXPRESSION, NATIONAL ORIGIN, AGE, DISABILITY, PROTECTED VETERAN STATUS OR ANY OTHER CHARACTERISTIC PROTECTED BY FEDERAL, STATE, OR LOCAL LAWS.
CURRENT EMPLOYEES: Please apply via the internal career site by logging into your Workday Account (https://www.myworkday.com/archildrens/)and search the "Find Jobs" report.
Work Shift:
Please see job description for details.
Time Type:
Full time
Department:
CC017085 Financial Decision Support
Summary:
Performs special projects which are financial in nature with an emphasis on researching and reporting costs, charges, trends, patterns and projected reimbursements for patient groups within the hospital
Additional Information:
Required Education:
Bachelor's Degree
Recommended Education:
Required Work Experience:
Accounting - 6 years of experience
Recommended Work Experience:
Required Certifications:
Recommended Certifications:
Description
1. Compiles and prepares complex analysis of financial data for monthly and year-to-date reports. Investigates and reports on variances and other significant findings.  

  

2. Compiles, prepares, and analyzes, trends, profitability, budgets, staffing patterns, charges, and other complex financial data by different groups. Verifies accuracy of documents and provides summarization of findings.  

  

3. Creates adhoc analysis and reports using different financial systems for various departments and in support of special projects.  

  

4. Maintains and manages financial data, files, databases, systems, reports and reporting criteria to ensure the accuracy of information and historical records.  

  

5. Researches and prepares documentation for special projects and presentations.  

  

6. Provides consultation and support to senior management by analyzing and presenting information and insights that aid in the decision making process.  

  

7. Leads and/or participates in financial and cross-functional projects.  

  

8. May lead or mentor other financial analysts.  

  

9. Performs other duties as assigned.

title: Financial Analyst- Collections
description:
Priority1 strives to go beyond simply offering jobs. We foster careers by creating a great working environment for our team members. We hire talented individuals who will provide the best support and can quickly adapt to the rapidly changing world of logistics. These talented men and women drive our business, and we are committed to their success.  

Priority1 strives to go beyond simply offering jobs. We foster careers by creating a great working environment for our team members. We hire talented individuals who will provide the best support and can quickly adapt to the rapidly changing world of logistics. These talented men and women drive our business, and we are committed to their success.
Responsibilities:* Contact customers regarding payment status and document updates in Collections System.
* Responsible for invoice reconciliation process each morning.
* Distribute weekly aging reports to our sales teams.
* Conduct monthly meeting with sales organization to review high risk accounts.
* Researches invoice discrepancies and unapplied checks.
* Processes credit card payments and any necessary credits on a customer’s account.


Qualifications:* Previous Collections/Customer Service experience preferred.
* Skilled in both verbal and written communication
* Proven analytical and problem solving skills
* Capable of identifying customer needs and maintain and support a customer service philosophy
* Ability to use decision making skills to offer options and resolve problems in a variety of contexts in a fast paced environment.
* Has talent to exercise good judgment.
* Knack for adapting to constant changes in work environment, work assignments, and/or changes in priorities
* Ability to have difficult conversations with large customers
* Education: College degree preferred or equivalent work experience. College hours or a college degree may be substituted for some experience as deemed appropriate.


Compensation:* $17-$20 per hour, plus monthly bonuses
* Medical Insurance with premiums paid at 100% for employees AND dependents
* Dental Insurance 100% paid for Employee
* Vision Insurance
* HSA with Employer Contributions
* Life Insurance
* Short Term Disability
* Long Term Disability
* 401(k) Plan
* Profit Sharing: Typical annual contribution of 15% of total eligible compensation
* Paid Holidays AND PTO
* Cancer, Critical Illness, and Accident Policies available


Physical Requirements:
Job functions require long periods of sitting and working from computer workstation; ability to multi-task, problem solve, and prioritize daily workload; excellent organization and record keeping skills; comfortable with oral and written communications, primarily on the telephone and email. Requires extended periods of sitting, normal walking, bending, twisting, and stretching. Capability of sight and hearing required. Ability to deal with stressful situations and occasionally working extended hours. To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Priority1 is proud to be an Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
It's fun to work in a company where people truly BELIEVE in what they're doing!  

We're committed to bringing passion and customer focus to the business.  

Due to Rock Dental Brands continued growth and expansion we are on the search for a highly motivated financial analyst who's laser focused and energetic about their professional career.
This position will be responsible for delivering strategic analysis and insights to the Executive Leadership Team. Additionally, you will work in partnership with business leaders to develop KPIs, provide ongoing reporting and analyze the business impact of strategic initiatives. As a growing company we need someone who is energetic about process improvement and attention to detail. This position is not remote and would require onsite participation at our support center in Little Rock, AR.
Job Duties:* Understand key levers and devise new ways to segment and analyze the business
* Proactively identify insights and recommendations for improvement
* Develop key performance indicators
* Identify trends, outliers, and obscurities in the data and translate them into actionable insights for business leaders
* Provide regular updates to the Executive Team on progress towards goals
* Create simple and compelling visuals to demonstrate business performance for presentations to the Board of Directors
* Participate in strategic initiatives to facilitate forecasting business impact and analyze results of pilot implementations
* Develop financial projections for mergers and acquisitions of the company, coordinate with sales and integration teams


Qualifications:* Bachelor's degree (or equivalent experience) in finance or accounting preferred.
* 2+ years experience of statistical or data analysis preferred
* Experience with business intelligence (BI) and BI visualizations tools preferred
* Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel required
* 3 - 5 years of experience in developing, maintaining, and managing dashboards & analytics
* A strong understanding of relational databases
* Proficiency in use of query and reporting analysis tools


(Please note, this role is not remote and requires onsite participation at our support center in Little Rock, AR)
Personal Characteristics:* Interpersonal Skills: Confident with executive presence and the ability to work effectively and transparently with both the CFO and other members of the senior leadership team, without being too deferential.
* Character: High degree of maturity, integrity, and personal self-confidence tempered by self-awareness and self-reflection. Must be comfortable openly admitting shortcomings.
* Leadership Capability: Ability to build and motivate a team to improve the team’s performance and contributions to the organization.
* Communication Skills: Skill in building consensus for new ideas and initiatives and in communicating effectively with personnel and groups at all organization levels. Genuineness is required to build that consensus.
* Hands-On: Must be willing and have the ability to participate in an early stage growth environment where it is required to “roll sleeves up” to tackle certain issues where bandwidth and/or skills of the team needs hands-on support of leaders.
* Emotional Strength: Must have the ability to hear and support other leaders’ ideas and initiatives regardless of involvement without feeling others ideas aren't valid, or feeling left out.


What we offer:* Total Rewards: You’ll be welcomed into a winning culture that encourages continuous improvement, a challenging and rewarding work environment with a genuine desire to see each other succeed. We will also provide the following:
* Support you Professionally: Competitive pay, career growth opportunities, talented and a motivated team who care about each other, our mission, and our patients.
* Support your Health & Well-being: flexible health and insurance options, including Employee Assistance Program, and complimentary dental and orthodontic treatments that help you and your family stay on track.
* Life Balance: Paid time off and holiday pay with no waiting period.
* Planning for the future: plan for the future with an industry-leading 401K retirement plan with matching company contributions.

title: Market Research Analyst
description:
***Our growing irrigation company is seeking a market research analyst to join our team.***

  

Keeling Company has been a family-owned and operated distributor since 1965. We offer a variety of products and services to meet your irrigation, landscape, and drainage needs. Our knowledgeable staff is committed to providing excellent customer service and generating high-quality job leads. We aim to partner with our customers, delivering the necessary products and expertise to ensure that the job is done right the first time, every time.


We're seeking a talented Market Research Analyst to join our team at our corporate office in North Little Rock. As a Market Research Analyst, you'll be instrumental in identifying or creating data tables to explain matrix usage, branch margins, and profitability. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, proficiency in Excel, and a deep understanding of financial costing concepts.


Additionally, you'll need to be able to provide detailed, fact-based responses to complex problems. If you thrive in a fast-paced environment and love working with numbers, this is the perfect opportunity to advance your skills.

**Essential Functions:**

* Perform pricing audits and analyze Purchase Price Variance reports
* Develop and maintain monthly internal reporting to support decision-making.
* Maintain Pricing and Product Data
* Understanding and utilizing our current ERP pricing and costing matrices
* Collaborate with the management team to implement pricing structure changes to best accommodate market demands.
* Act as a resource to the Sales Manager for data and analysis relating to branch margin and profitability.
* Work with branch managers to better understand their market needs related to their respective market pricing needs.
* Provide daily support to branches utilizing our data and models to make pricing recommendations accordingly.
* The Keeling Company Leadership Team assigns all other duties.

**Required Education and Experience:**

* High school diploma or GED.
* Preferred a four-year college degree in a business-related field, such as accounting, marketing, business administration, finance, etc.
* A distribution Background is preferred but not required
* Two years of related experience and/or training. Or equivalent combination of education and experience.
* Experience with Epicor Eclipse ERP system or equal
* Certified Microsoft Excel Expert (preferred but not required)

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
**About defi SOLUTIONS:**
It’s an exciting time to join defi!  

defi SOLUTIONS partners with captives, banks, credit unions, and finance companies of all types and sizes to allow lenders to focus and transform their operations. The company’s comprehensive suite of originations, servicing, and analytics solutions together with technology-enabled processing services creates a flexible, configurable, and scalable platform that addresses lenders and borrowers ever-evolving needs. defi SOLUTIONS combines the expertise of defi SOLUTIONS and the former Sagent Auto Lending with the backing of Warburg Pincus, Bain Capital Ventures and Fiserv. **Position Purpose**:
The Senior Financial Analyst will report to the Director of Finance and will be responsible for providing analytical support for personnel and non-personnel expenses with a focus on headcount. Key functions include performing analysis on financial performance and headcount data, performing key tasks related to close and forecast, as well as process improvement. **Essential functions:***Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.** Partner with and support each department on expense related items; focus will be on the technology and Managed Services team personnel expense and headcount detail.
* Supports creation of annual and multi-year strategic plan.
* Evaluate transactions and expense data to provide actionable insights and identify opportunities to reduce expense and grow profit through data mining, analytics, and automation.
* Reviews entries in the ledgers to assure accuracy and compliance with established accounting principles and procedures.
* Partner with business segments to develop and drive in-depth financial analyses identifying key drivers, trends, variances, emerging risks and opportunities; regularly communicating findings to senior management in succinct and meaningful reporting that impacts decision making.
* Perform ad hoc analyses for operational and financial management.

**\*\****Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.* **Required education and experience:*** Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business related field.
* 4+ years of applicable accounting/finance and/or other related experience.
* Proficiency with Excel and PowerPoint (advanced skills).
* General Ledger software experience

 **Preferred education and experience:*** Extensive experience in excel based financial modeling and financial planning and analysis.
* Prior experience working in the software development and/or financial services industry is a plus.
* Experience with Dynamics a plus

 **Additional eligibility requirements:**
The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in excel based financial modeling and financial planning and analysis.* Strong organizational skills, in particular, an attention to detail and the ability to prepare reports in a timely and effective manner.
* Ability to examine and verify financial documents and reports and skill in analyzing and interpreting financial data.
* Ability to transform raw data into meaningful and impactful analysis.
* Ability to communicate effectively, verbally and in writing with supervisors and personnel and to establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, business partners and company officials.
* Ability to prepare business cases as needed to support a growing technology business.

 **Affirmative Action/EEO statement:***defi SOLUTIONS is an Equal Opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.*

title: Financial Analyst
description:
Overview:

The primary function of this position is to analyze complex data sets to help drive desired busines s results . This pos ition will aid in analyzing, reporting, and forecas ting sales , gross margins, operating expenses for Equipment North America locations . The position will also beresponsible for month-end closing activities including journal entries and account reconciliations.
Responsibilities:
* Combine and analyze complex data sets that cross several locations and present results in a clear concise manor
* Complete detailed forecast by channel for sales, gross margin, manufacturing expenses and operating expenses for multiple locations
* Quarterly / monthly reporting to Corporate regarding Capital expenditures, deferred revenue,and others as required.
* Aid in mid-month estimates and forecasting.
* Assist with promo and rebate accrual and reporting
* Develop/Upload data sets to Hyperion
* Prepare ad hoc reporting for Senior Management,Corporate Reporting, and Corporate Tax department
* Test, document, and pull records for Audit request
* Freight analysis regarding inbound/outbound and related accruals


Qualifications:
* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting required. Preference for MBA (CPA highly desired).
* Two (2) to Five (5) years of data analysis or managing large data sets.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Strong analytical skills, a must.
* Demonstrated skills and knowledge of general accounting, financial analysis, reporting requirements and computer applications.
* Ability to prioritize and manage time effectively. Must be multi-task oriented.
* Must be able to work with minimal oversight with attention to accuracy and timeliness.
* Be able to develop and maintain relationships with diplomacy and tact.
* Proficiency in MS Office required. Daily use of Excel - intermediate/advanced level needed, including proficiency with lookups and pivot tables a plus. Solid understanding of both Access and PowerPoint desired.
* Proficiency in Hyperion Applications and/or Tableau Data Analysis software a plus

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
**Full-time, Exempt**

**Reports to:** **EVP,** **FP&A**

**Hybrid: Little Rock, AR**

**Pay: $80,000-$100,000/year plus bonus**


Fairway is a Morgan Stanley Capital Partners portfolio company consisting of 20 lawncare, pest control and irrigation brands in over 70 locations spanning throughout the Southeastern, Central, and Midwestern United States with a plan for continued fast-paced growth in the future. We value independence and diversity, and you’ll find that our team consists of talented, dedicated people who share our enthusiasm, commitment to service excellence, and sense of pride. We are always looking for highly motivated individuals who want to refine their skills as well as grow their careers to join our team!


We are currently seeking an experienced Senior Financial Analyst to join our team to support our financial and operational partners.


For this role, you should hold a degree in Finance or Accounting followed by relevant work experience. Knowledge of forecasting models, Tableau, and the ability to prepare and present financial statements are key requirements for this position.

**Responsibilities**

* Prepare monthly reports and analysis on financials to be distributed to the business.
* Perform monthly analysis of revenue vs forecast, with details of under- or over-performance.
* Responsible for the preparation and presentation of accurate monthly summary of expenses such as direct costs (labor & materials) with concise action-oriented commentary and analysis to designated management.
* Responsible for developing forward-looking forecasts, budgets, and scenario planning.
* Drive decision making across the business to meet organizational objectives by providing insightful financial analysis, interpretations, predictions, support, tools and recommendations; and clearly communicate results and recommendations to ensure clarity and optimal decision making.
* Responsible for establishing and maintaining effective relationships across the business to understand the business and the primary drivers, goals, and the needs of stakeholders.
* Develop and perform reporting of operating metrics that ensures financial performance, e.g. customer cohort analysis.

**Requirements and skills**

* Proven work experience as a Senior Financial Analyst, Financial Analyst or similar role
* Hands-on experience with Tableau
* Comfortable using advanced analytical tools (e.g., SQL)
* Expertise in MS Excel (creating spreadsheets and using advanced formulas)
* Experience with putting financial presentations together via PowerPoint
* Familiarity with finance databases
* Excellent analytical skills
* Ability to present financial data using detailed reports and charts
* Demonstrable strategic thinking skills
* Experience in multi-site business is a plus
* Confidentiality in handling sensitive financial information
* BS degree in Finance, Accounting or Economics
* Relevant certification (e.g. CFA/CPA) is a plus

**Physical Requirements**

* Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer, typing
* Specific abilities required by this job include close and distant vision as well as the ability to hear normal conversation and respond, either verbally or in writing, to accurately convey detail and/or instructions
* Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times

**Benefits**

* Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance; company pays a portion of premium
* Paid time off (PTO)
* Paid holidays
* 401(K) plan with matching up to 5%


At Fairway, equal talent will always get equal opportunity.


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Financial Analyst II
description:
ARKANSAS CHILDREN'S IS A TOBACCO FREE WORKPLACE. FLU VACCINES ARE REQUIRED. ARKANSAS CHILDREN'S IS AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER. ALL QUALIFIED APPLICANTS WILL RECEIVE CONSIDERATION FOR EMPLOYMENT WITHOUT REGARD TO RACE, COLOR, RELIGION, SEX, SEXUAL ORIENTATION, GENDER IDENTITY OR EXPRESSION, NATIONAL ORIGIN, AGE, DISABILITY, PROTECTED VETERAN STATUS OR ANY OTHER CHARACTERISTIC PROTECTED BY FEDERAL, STATE, OR LOCAL LAWS.

Work Shift:
Day Shift
Time Type:
Full time
Department:
CC017085 Financial Decision Support
Summary:
Responsible for assisting in preparation, coordination, and documentation of financial analysis projects. Provides support on special projects which are financial in nature with an emphasis on researching and reporting costs, charges, trends, and projected reimbursements for patient groups within the hospital.
Additional Information:
Other Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Required: Proficiency in MS Excel and MS Access. Superior analytical skills. Excellent written/verbal communication skills. Strong organizational/multi-tasking skills. Able to plan and execute complex analyses and reports.
Other Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Preferred: Epic, Power BI, Strata, Workday
Hybrid Schedule
Required Education:
Bachelors Degree or Equivalent Experience
Recommended Education:
Required Work Experience:
Accounting - 2 years of experience
Recommended Work Experience:
Required Certifications:
Recommended Certifications:
Description
1. Compiles and prepares analysis of financial data for monthly and year-to-date reports. Investigates and reports on variances and other significant findings.  

  

2. Compiles, prepares, and analyzes, trends, profitability, budgets, staffing patterns, charges, and other financial data by different groups. Verifies accuracy of documents and provides summarization of findings.  

  

3. Creates adhoc analysis and reports using different financial systems for various departments and in support of special projects.  

  

4. Maintains and manages financial data, files, databases, systems, reports and reporting criteria to ensure the accuracy of information and historical records.  

  

5. Researches and prepares documentation for special projects and presentations.  

  

6. Provides consultation and support to management by analyzing and presenting information and insights that aid in the decision making process.  

  

7. Participates in financial related projects.  

  

8. Performs other duties as assigned.

title: Senior Analyst - Financial Planning & Analysis -CC
description:
* Assists the department in developing and implementing the governance, tools, timelines, and key processes for the five-year forecast and annual budget process for both AECC and AECI.
* Tracks AECC and AECI company-wide and departmental success metrics and completes monthly reporting of AECC and AECI and departmental variance analysis.
* Builds and maintains AECC and AECI’s long-term financial planning models and scenario-based analysis.
* Builds relationships with key stakeholders to facilitate completeness and accuracy of budget inputs and forecast assumptions.
* Assists with ad-hoc financial analysis as requested to evaluate the pro-forma impact of various operational actions to assist in decision-making support.
* Manages and supports the company's forecasting and related reporting processes.
* Executes benchmarking efforts with outside parties and researching best practices and top performance in financial metrics relative to AECC and AECI’s peer companies.
* Assists the Director of Financial Planning and Analysis with special projects as requested.
* Exhibits poise under pressure, communicates well with senior leaders and works collaboratively with others.
* Due to our obligation to provide continuous, reliable electric service to our customers, the ability to maintain regular and punctual attendance and the ability to work outside your regularly scheduled office hours when necessary is an essential function of the job.
* The ability to handle stress and work well with others are essential functions of this position.
* Performs any other related duties as required or assigned.

  


**Minimum Qualifications**  

Bachelor's Degree in Accounting, Finance, Statistics, Data Analytics, Data Science, Data Engineering or related field, plus at least six years of experience or equivalent combination of education and experience. A Master’s Degree or MBA is preferred. Preference for candidates with experience building advanced quantitative financial or economic models.

  



PREFERRED CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS  

Certified Public Accountant (CPA), Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) or equivalent, Data Analytics

  


**Benefits**



Retirement Plans  

Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance  

9 Paid holidays  

Educational assistance  

Paid time off accrual  

Short-term disability  

Long-term disability  

Free & confidential Employee Assistance Program

  

EEO/AA/M/F/VETS/DISABLED



Should you elect to apply for this position, AECC/AECI will review your qualifications. If after reviewing the qualifications and experience of all applicants, your skills and credentials meet our needs, someone from our organization may contact you. Please be advised that the time required to complete the applicant review process typically takes between 30 and 90 days, but could extend beyond that. Once the position has been filled, all applicants will be notified via email.



Arkansas Electric Cooperative Corporation and Arkansas Electric Cooperatives, Inc. are Equal Opportunity Workplace and an Affirmative Action Employers. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age or any other protected category.


Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Accountant/Financial Analyst
description:
```**Position Summary:**

This professional accounting position is responsible for maintaining the general ledger, subsidiary ledgers and journals; closing the general ledger monthly; and assisting in the preparation of the monthly financial and statistical reports of the hospital entity and the clinic entity. Reconciles general ledger accounts. Works closely with managers and directors on accounting, budget and other financial issues. Performs a range of technical duties related to accounting and financial operations, including various analytical assignments related to contracts, patient activity, profitability, budget-to-actual and many other factors. May perform business analysis and project management functions.

**Work Schedule**

Forty hours per week, Monday through Friday. From time-to-time the number of hours per week may vary to meet accounting and project deadlines.

**Primary Duties**

**Ledgers, Journals and Other Accounting Records:**

* Assists in maintaining the general ledger, various sub-ledgers, journal entries, subsidiary ledgers and reconciliations in a timely, thorough manner as directed by procedures and the Controller.
* Assists in closing the books monthly in an accurate, thorough and timely manner.
* Assists in maintaining all ledgers, journals and other accounting records according to GAAP, all governing laws and in compliance with policies and procedures.
* Maintains and files various ledgers and documentation to support all entries in a complete and timely manner.

**Financial, Statistics Reports:**

* Prepares monthly and as-needed financial and statistics reports in a timely, accurate and complete manner.
* Assists in the preparation of financial statements in accordance with GAAP and in compliance with policies and procedures.
* Assists with preparation of cost reports, budgets, etc.
* Files all financial and statistics reports and documentation in a confidential, thorough manner.

**Other Accounting Duties:**

* Coordinates with bank(s) to ensure timely and accurate processing of wires, ACHs, etc.
* Works with outside auditors and accountants in a professional, cooperative manner.
* Assists the Financial Accountant and Controller with cost reports, budgets and other financial management duties.
* Assists with the physical inventory count and valuation.
* Prepares financial analyses as directed by the CFO, VP of Finance and Controller.
* Assists Accounting staff as necessary to effect timely processing of accounts payable and payroll.

**Business Analysis and Project Management:**

* Maintains knowledge of and acts as subject-matter expert on accounting, and scheduling/time and attendance applications.
* Assesses accounting and scheduling/time and attendance business needs as they relate to systems/applications; recommends business process enhancements and coordinates with IT personnel to make necessary changes.
* Assists Accounting department staff in resolving various application user issues, including analyzing/resolving business-related issues, setting up and running complex queries, etc.
* May provide oversight of accounting, payroll and HR projects as they relate to applications and business process improvements.

**Performs Other Duties as Assigned.**

**Qualifications/Specifications:**

* Education: Bachelor of Science in accounting or related field or equivalent, professional-level experience.
* Experience: Minimum of one year experience as an accountant or financial analyst; cash management preferred; healthcare environment preferred.
* Licensure/Certification: CPA preferred.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $1.00 - $20.00 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Physical setting:

* Office

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Job ID 273638 Financial Analyst
description:
**Location** Little Rock, AR
  

**Job Information**
* Developing Financial Functionalities and Strategies and discuss them with all the stakeholders, present them with Test approach and Test cases, methodologies and incorporate changes as suggested to ensure the business requirements are met throughout the life of the project.
* Developing Design Solution Documents and Financial Use Cases in accordance with Federal and State Child support System requirements in Team Foundation Server (TFS) 2015.
* Writing Test Scripts for Financial Screens and executing them in testing tools. Reporting defects using TFS and retesting them once the bugs are resolved.
* Using Requirement Traceability Matrix and burn down chart to ensure the business requirements are met in the application.
* Interface with help desk to resolve tickets as required and assist child support staff and end users regarding all questions on payment posting, payment tracing and error correction on state systems.
* Testing various Palmetto Automated Child Support System (PACSS) business functional features including, Case Initiation, Paternity Establishment, Enforcement, Financial Distribution and Disbursement and Federal Reports.
* Interprets laws, rules and guidelines governing case and financial management and ensure compliance with accounting practices and principles related to financial screens in PACSS.
* Work with Lead Business Analysts to identify risks and provide solutions to resolve and mitigate risks. Assist in tracking status of project documents, test results, post implementation change requests and future enhancements.
* Perform User Acceptance Testing to ensure the developed systems satisfied the needs of end users as specified in the functional requirements.
* Strong understanding of Financial Operations, from receipts to disbursements, distributions, recoupments, order and obligations, adjustments and collections related to child support enforcement.
* Using various tools like TFS, SQL Server to create queries and pull up data for analysis, MS Visual Studio, and generate PPT, Pie Charts, Test metrics and test reports to advise, clarify or educate users on financial management functions and practices.
* Ensure compliance with state recommended practices pertaining to use of the state-wide system and serve as subject matter expert that analyzes and evaluates the functionality of current automated financial management process.
* Participate and contribute to team meetings and peer reviews and come up with ideas to improve and accelerate the development to deliver the data before timeline.
* Strong written/verbal communication skills – able to have clear, concise and accurate communication and an active participant and contributor to team meetings.

  



Requirements:



Master Degree in Finance, IT Management, Information Quality or related is required.

title: Senior IT Financial Analyst
description:
Job Description  
  
SUMMARY: FP&A focuses on the fin activities of the org, such as: controlling its fin resources and ensuring that all fin transactions, systems, and procedures comply with regs, accounting principles, and standards; fin analysis and reporting, taxation, insurance, credit control, AP and AR, inventory and costs control, and budgeting and forecasting; analyzing the org's revenues, liabilities, credit conditions, and other fin indicators to forecast its short, med, and long-term cash flow position; evaluating and recommending investments and other fin instruments to meet cash flow needs; presenting findings and recommendations to top execs; preparing fin reports; ensuring all tax returns, declarations, and other required reports are submitted accurately and timely.  
  
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties.  
* Prepares annual Budget, monthly forecast, and periodically a long range plan
* Owns financial models - builds models from scratch, improves existing models
* Partners with accounting team to ensure the integrity of the results and submits accruals when needed
* Reviews variances against forecast, Budget, and prior year; tells the story about what is going on in the business area.
* Prepares value added financial analyses and drives outcomes in business areas
* Is the trusted financial partner to multiple business partners
* Demonstrates knowledge of proper business practices

  
Supervisory Responsibilities: This position has no formal supervisory responsibilities.  
  
MINIMUM REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:  
* Bachelor's degree in accounting, economics, finance, math or a related field AND
* Three (3) years of experience in financial analysis

  
Certificates and Licenses: None required.  
  
OTHER REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:  
* Experience in Finance (Budgeting, Performance Reporting and financial analysis)
* Understanding of accounting processes, procedures and internal controls
* Experience working within the IT realm and capital expenditures
* Able to work well as part of a team
* Possess very good communication skills - written and verbal
* Excellent time management and organizational skills
* Experience with accounting and finance tools, preferably Net Suite and Hyperion PBCS
* Ability to travel 5% of the time
* Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel and Word
* Ability to clear required background check

  
DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:  
* IT financial background
* OpEx and CapEx

  
WORK ENVIRONMENT: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  
  
This position is virtual and open to residents of the 50 states, D.C.  
  
COMPENSATION & BENEFITS: Stride, Inc. considers a person's education, experience, and qualifications, as well as the position's work location, expected quality and quantity of work, required travel (if any), external market and internal value when determining a new employee's salary level. Salaries will differ based on these factors, the position's level and expected contribution, and the employee's benefits elections. Offers will typically be in the bottom half of the range.  
  
We anticipate the salary range to be $54,447 - $90,714. Eligible employees may receive a bonus. This salary is not guaranteed, as an individual's compensation can vary based on several factors. These factors include, but are not limited to, geographic location, experience, training, education, and local market conditions. Stride offers a robust benefits package for eligible employees that can include health benefits, retirement contributions, and paid time off.  
  
Job Type  
Regular  
  
The above job is not intended to be an all-inclusive list of duties and standards of the position. Incumbents will follow any other instructions, and perform any other related duties, as assigned by their supervisor. All employment is "at-will" as governed by the law of the state where the employee works. It is further understood that the "at-will" nature of employment is one aspect of employment that cannot be changed except in writing and signed by an authorized officer.  
  
Stride, Inc. is a Federal Contractor, an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer and a Drug-Free Workplace. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, protected Veteran status age, or genetics, or any other characteristic protected by law.  
  
Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities  
  
The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor's legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: FP&A Analyst - Virtual/Remote
description:
Enumerate needs a **Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst** for our rapidly growing team!Enumerate has grown rapidly through acquisitions and is backed by a leading Boston-based private equity firm. We expect to continue with strategic acquisitions while diversifying our product offerings to include payments-related services for its core HOA customer base.  
  
In this role, you’ll be responsible for budgeting and forecasting as well as the development and delivery of actionable and insightful analyses of both retrospective trends (actual v. planned) and prospective opportunities. Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will have a leading role in identifying, implementing, and improving upon these core requirements.  
  
You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. This position is remote eligible, with a preference for candidates in CST/EST. **Who will love this job**  
* Someone who is a critical thinker with a meticulous approach, high initiative, and the ability to explain financial concepts in “plain English” to non-financial stakeholders

**You should have*** Required: 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, either within a corporate Finance, FP&A function, or within investment banking, commercial banking, or private equity.
* Required: Bachelors in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other highly quantitative discipline.
* Required: Experience with SaaS (or subscription) revenue recognition, including familiarity with standard SaaS metrics/ KPIs.
* Fluency in O365- especially Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
* Strong financial modeling skills in Excel including a working knowledge of 3 statement models.
* Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.
* Ability to work in the US without sponsorship.
  
**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. When possible, we also like to offer fun in-person perks like pet-friendly offices, paid food trucks and company outings.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
Description:**Full-time, Exempt**

**Reports to:** **EVP,** **FP&A**

**Hybrid: Little Rock, AR**

**Pay: $80,000-$100,000/year plus bonus**

  


Fairway is a Morgan Stanley Capital Partners portfolio company consisting of 20 lawncare, pest control and irrigation brands in over 70 locations spanning throughout the Southeastern, Central, and Midwestern United States with a plan for continued fast-paced growth in the future. We value independence and diversity, and you’ll find that our team consists of talented, dedicated people who share our enthusiasm, commitment to service excellence, and sense of pride. We are always looking for highly motivated individuals who want to refine their skills as well as grow their careers to join our team! 

  


We are currently seeking an experienced Senior Financial Analyst to join our team to support our financial and operational partners. 

  


For this role, you should hold a degree in Finance or Accounting followed by relevant work experience. Knowledge of forecasting models, Tableau, and the ability to prepare and present financial statements are key requirements for this position. 

  


**Responsibilities**

* Prepare monthly reports and analysis on financials to be distributed to the business.
* Perform monthly analysis of revenue vs forecast, with details of under- or over-performance.
* Responsible for the preparation and presentation of accurate monthly summary of expenses such as direct costs (labor & materials) with concise action-oriented commentary and analysis to designated management.
* Responsible for developing forward-looking forecasts, budgets, and scenario planning.
* Drive decision making across the business to meet organizational objectives by providing insightful financial analysis, interpretations, predictions, support, tools and recommendations; and clearly communicate results and recommendations to ensure clarity and optimal decision making.
* Responsible for establishing and maintaining effective relationships across the business to understand the business and the primary drivers, goals, and the needs of stakeholders.
* Develop and perform reporting of operating metrics that ensures financial performance, e.g. customer cohort analysis.

**Requirements and skills**

* Proven work experience as a Senior Financial Analyst, Financial Analyst or similar role
* Hands-on experience with Tableau
* Comfortable using advanced analytical tools (e.g., SQL)
* Expertise in MS Excel (creating spreadsheets and using advanced formulas)
* Experience with putting financial presentations together via PowerPoint
* Familiarity with finance databases
* Excellent analytical skills
* Ability to present financial data using detailed reports and charts
* Demonstrable strategic thinking skills
* Experience in multi-site business is a plus
* Confidentiality in handling sensitive financial information
* BS degree in Finance, Accounting or Economics
* Relevant certification (e.g. CFA/CPA) is a plus

**Physical Requirements**

* Prolonged periods sitting at a desk and working on a computer, typing
* Specific abilities required by this job include close and distant vision as well as the ability to hear normal conversation and respond, either verbally or in writing, to accurately convey detail and/or instructions
* Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times

**Benefits**

* Medical, dental, vision, and life insurance; company pays a portion of premium
* Paid time off (PTO)
* Paid holidays
* 401(K) plan with matching up to 5%

At Fairway, equal talent will always get equal opportunity. 

  


We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

title: Consultant - Business Operations / Management
description:
**Business Operations Consultant/Project Director**

*Design, build, implement, train and evaluate customized solutions and advice that assist organizations in improving productivity and increasing revenues, and that positively impact overall performance. Solution implementation will encompass business development, organizational engineering, process management and financial systems. The Project Director is responsible for the client relationship from the origination of the opportunity to the evaluation of the effectiveness of the completed body of work. Responsibilities include client financial improvement, client relationship management and project management.* 

**Position Description**

**This position provides an outstanding opportunity to work with clients, to help them improve their operational and financial efficiencies and success. This position requires 100% travel.** 

**JOB PURPOSE** 

*Design, build, implement, train and evaluate customized solutions and advice that assist organizations in improving productivity and increasing revenues, and that positively impact overall performance. Solution implementation will encompass business development, organizational engineering, process management and financial systems.*

**QUALIFICATIONS** 

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

**COMPENSATION EXPECTATIONS:**

**135 - 145K+**

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

1. Deliver quantifiable and sustainable value for clients that are reflected through the income statement, balance sheet, cash flow, as well as quality of life. This is achieved through the successful development, implementation, training and evaluation of solutions to client challenges.
2. Oversee the identification and communication of work to be completed on behalf of the client. Responsible for clear and concise communication with assigned Assistant Director or Sr. Project Director.

**OTHER REQUIREMENTS**

1. ***Ability to travel onsite with clients (100% travel requirement).***
2. Authorized to work in the United States.
3. Minimum of four years of consulting experience with a proven track record of delivering value for clients.
4. Administrative duties completed in a timely and accurate manner.
5. Ability to communicate in English, both written and verbal.
6. Valid state issued driver’s license and current auto insurance.
7. Advanced computer skills (Microsoft Suite, financial software, dashboards, CRM’s and PM software)
8. Proven fiduciary responsibility, successfully managing a budget of 10M+, preferred.
9. Prior business ownership, preferred.

**COMPETENCIES REQUIRED**

* **Problem Solving** – Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; develops alternative solutions; uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics.
* **Change Management** – Communicates changes effectively and builds broad consensus; monitors transition and evaluates results.
* **Leadership** – Exhibits confidence in self and others; inspires and motivates others to perform well; accepts feedback from others
* **Judgement** – Displays willingness to make decisions; supports and explains reasoning for decisions. Gains trust of peers and leadership through sound decision making.
* **Results Driven** – Serious about committing and getting to results. Exemplifies this ability through sound decision-making, backed by logic, understanding contingency planning, with an attitude toward appropriate prioritization and effort.
* **People Orientated** – Possess a high EQ and readily able to connect and build relationships with clients, their staff and Cogent team members.
* **Conflict Management –** Empathetic and able to see all perspectives; graciously communicates differing points of view to build understanding; finds agreeable, forward-looking, and policy-aligned solutions to resolve conflicts others would see as irreconcilable.

**CULTURAL EXPECTATIONS**

Given the unique nature of the company and our strong focus on integrity and values, these cultural components of how we operate will be expected:

1. Cogent Analytics strives to always put our clients first, choosing to do what is in their best interest even if that choice may not be the easy or popular path.
2. Cogent Analytics maintains the highest professional standards and pledges to operate with integrity and honesty in all that we endeavor to do.
3. We believe in a collaborative environment between the administrative staff, Leadership (AD and MD) and Project Directors.
4. We understand and embrace the “Obligation to Challenge”, realizing that the status quo can be improved upon based on our unique and diverse capabilities and insights.
5. We embrace diversity realizing the benefit of working together and sharing individual exceptional insights to the group. Through these insights discovered in the pursuit of solving problems we will improve results both for our clients and ourselves.

We value the service and commitment made by our veterans and welcome them to join our company.

*This job description is intended to describe the general nature, complexity, and level of work to be performed by team member assigned to this position and is not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties and/or skills required. It does not prescribe or restrict the work that may be assigned.* 

*We are an equal opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to our team and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.*

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**JOB SUMMARY:**

Responsible for assisting in the development of the budget process including the preparation, consolidation, and distribution of budgets and related financial reports; assist in the design and development of annual water rates as well as the cost of service studies for water rates, service fees and all cost allocations. Responsible for assisting the manager with providing timely and accurate financial and operating data and related analysis that will assist management and executive leadership in making informed decisions.

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:**

Performs complex statistical, cost and corporate level financial analysis of financial reports and data and prepares subsequent narrative analysis for senior level management.

Advises and assists in the preparation of revenue and expense budgets; develops key aspects of the company’s Operating and Maintenance Budget.

Develops forecast modeling that reflects planned corporate changes such as debt issuance and refinancing.

Along with Manager, assists with preparing ten-year financial plan for sources and uses of overall capital program and operating budget; models balance sheet and income statements based on multiple scenario variables.

Along with Manager, assists with designing and developing annual water rates and rate studies that involve acquisition of demand-based data to develop demand peak factors, and other cost of service studies for service fees and cost allocations.

Develops and oversees production of charts, graphs and other statistical presentations for monthly, quarterly and annual reports and publications for Executive Management and Shareholder.

Performs feasibility and cost/benefit analysis as requested for major corporate projects.

Perform other related duties as assigned.

**WORKING CONDITIONS:**

Generally works a 40-hour week in an office environment; work is mostly sedentary using a computer. Occasional travel between Louisville Water facilities required.

MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration or related field; and

Three (3) years of corporate level financial analysis or budgeting experience; and

Valid drivers license.

*Louisville Water provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws.*

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Ability to Relocate:

* Louisville, KY 40202: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Equity Research Analyst
description:
Equity Research Analyst
**Job Summary**
This position at River Road provides insightful equity securities analysis across multiple industries under RRAM’s Absolute Value investing philosophy. Collaborates efficiently with all RRAM Investment Business Groups (IBGs) in evaluating current and prospective portfolio holdings to identify attractive risk and reward investment potential. Applies the appropriate research and modeling techniques to effect sound investment decisions. Please note, we will begin reviewing applications in May.
**Location:** Louisville, KY
**Work Arrangement:** In-office / Hybrid
**Status:** Full-time
**Reports to:** Director of Research
**A typical day may involve**
* Producing timely, accurate, and insightful research summaries of new ideas for Portfolio Managers.
* Building detailed financial models and performing thorough due diligence on business strategy, management, customers, competitors, suppliers and industry dynamics.
* Formulating and maintaining forward looking investment recommendations (Buy/Sell/Hold) and developing strategy for securities held in the portfolio.
* Initiating timely discussions with PMs on current or potential holdings.
* Maintaining a watchlist.
* Contributing to investment team meetings and process discussions.


**Requirements**
**Knowledge, Skills & Abilities**
* Understanding of valuation, accounting, and economic principles across many industries.
* Understanding of the strengths, weaknesses, and nuances of different valuation and investing methodologies in the context of RRAM’s Absolute Value investing approach.
* Fundamental knowledge of RRAM’s IBG investment strategies and individual department functions.
* Fundamental knowledge of SEC company filing structures as related to public equity investing.
* Fundamental knowledge of the Asset Management industry, including client types, communication aspects, customer service, and reporting standards.
* Aptitude for translating valuation subject matter into pragmatic investment discussions.
* Ability to take a contrarian view.
* Ability to read and understand financial statements, industry reports, policy papers, and trade journals.
* Ability to complete core modeling and analysis techniques of both corporate and securities finance.
* Ability to operate with a sense of urgency and meet deadlines.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* Proficient in Microsoft Office 365 (exceptional Excel skills) and FactSet.
* Proficiency in Python, C++, Java, SAS, or a similar language preferred.


**Education, Credentials & Attributes**
* Bachelor’s degree required. Major in finance, economics, accounting, or related field strongly preferred.
* Masters of Business Administration (MBA) and/or progress toward Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA) designation is required.
* Must have 4-8 years of demonstrated experience in business analysis.
* Must be professionally mature and intellectually honest.
* Must be ready to build a career in Louisville, KY.
* Must have a strong passion for the industry and Absolute Value investing.


Applicants are asked to include a cover letter with their application.  


**River Road Asset Management offers**
* An **entrepreneurial** work environment that encourages new ideas and emphasizes diversity of thoughts, attributes, identities, experiences, and backgrounds
	+ Firm-sponsored training and development as well as support while pursuing external education/certification opportunities
* **Hybrid work arrangements**, to include:
	+ Firm-provided **home office equipment**
	+ Firm-paid **cell phone**
* On days you work in the office, you’ll enjoy:
	+ Firm-paid **parking i**n the 4th Street Live Parking Garage
	+ Firm-paid **lunches,** delivered to the office each day
	+ And so many other convenient amenities
* Competitive **base + bonus** compensation structure
* A comprehensive **benefits package** designed to **support the overall wellbeing** of our employees and their families:
	+ **Health insurance** *(95% of premium paid by firm)*
	+ Firm-funded **HSA and HRA** *(between the two sources, full in-network medical deductible for individual and/or family covered)*
	+ **Dental and Vision insurance** *(95% of premium paid by firm))*
	+ Firm-paid **employee Life/AD&D insurance**
	+ Firm-paid **spouse Life/AD&D insurance**
	+ Firm-paid **Long-Term Disability**
	+ **401k** with firm-paid safe harbor contributions and discretionary profit-sharing contributions
	+ Firm-paid **Employee Assistance Program**
	+ **Paid time off** and **paid leave policies**

**About River Road Asset Management**
River Road Asset Management is committed to being a leading, world-class provider of value-oriented equity asset management services.
Established in 2005, River Road specializes in value-oriented equity management for institutional investors around the world. We believe our people are our greatest asset. At River Road we offer our associates a culture of integrity, respect, entrepreneurial thinking, teamwork and shared rewards.
Learn more about **River Road Asset Management**.
**Diversity, Equity & Inclusion Statement**
We believe diversity is at the core of all highly effective entrepreneurial teams. It is through diversity of thoughts, attributes, identities, experiences, and backgrounds that great ideas are born, obstacles are overcome, and objectives are achieved. In our commitment to building and retaining a diverse workforce, we are dedicated to equity and inclusion in every aspect of the associate lifecycle and the culture that shapes the River Road work experience.
**Supporting Equal Employment Opportunity Statement**
River Road Asset Management provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all associates and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws. The firm complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.
River Road Asset Management expressly prohibits any form of unlawful harassment based on race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, genetic information, disability or veteran status. Improper interference with the ability of River Road Asset Management associates to perform their job duties is not tolerated.
