title: Senior Financial Analyst - ONSITE
description:
**Description**  

**\*\*\*\*\*THIS IS AN ONSITE POSITION LOCATED IN EITHER LOUISVLLE, KY OR ST. LOUIS, MO\*\*\*\*\***
**Who we are:**  

At Lifepoint Health, we provide quality healthcare to rural communities. As a valued member of our team, you will be an integral part of a group working together to elevate Lifepoint's healthcare delivery network. Our network includes 60+ community hospitals, 60+ rehabilitation/behavioral health hospitals, and 250 additional sites of care across the United States. As an organization, we are dedicated to serving communities nationwide by providing exceptional care. We believe in the power of our talented teams and strive to create environments where employees find purpose and fulfillment.
What you’ll do:  

This position has a key role within the finance group with the opportunity to work with individuals across the entire division. The senior analyst would primarily provide analytical support for operations, business development and financial reporting.

**Responsibilities:**


* Prepares and analyzes consolidated reporting at all levels of the organization on actuals, forecasts and prior fiscal year
* Analyzes actual operating results and identifies key financial and operating issues to be addressed; quantifies actual results versus forecast
* Manages, in partnership with other staff, operating budgets, weekly forecasts, corporate General & Administrative expenses and revenue targets
* Analysis of weekly, monthly, quarterly, and annual operating statistics
* Conducts thorough research and analysis of variances to ensure data accuracy
* Responsible for developing financial modeling, financial statement analysis, decision modeling, reporting, and ad-hoc analysis to support strategic initiatives
* Support, analyze, and assist in the preparation and review of the company's annual operating budget including:
+ Detailed support and analysis of the company's revenue forecast and departmental budgets
+ Detailed support and analysis of balance sheet forecasts and the associated cash flow forecasts
+ Development of presentations to help summarize budget results in a comprehensive and easy-to-understand format
+ Assists in the continued development of budgeting, financial forecasting, operating plan and modeling tools

Address for the position:



Midwest BankCentre



500 Chesterfield Centre



Chesterfield, MO 63017


**Why choose us:**

As a team member of the Health Support Center, our goal is to support those that are in our facilities who are interfacing and providing care to our patients and community members. Our focus is to attract, retain, and empower a diverse and determined workforce. Our mission statement is at the heart of who we are and what we do: “Making Communities Healthier.” In this shared mission, we believe that our collective efforts will shape a healthier future for the communities we serve.


**Benefits:** We offer an excellent total compensation package, including a competitive salary and benefits. Some of our benefits include 401k, flexible PTO, generous Employee illness benefit (EIB), medical, dental, vision, tuition reimbursement, and an Employee Assistance Program. We believe that happy, healthy people have a passionate engagement with life and work and have designed our package to enhance your wellbeing.

  

**Qualifications** **What you’ll need:**


**Education:**


* Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance or Business required


**Experience:**


* 3+ years’ experience in financial analysis and accounting
* Emphasis on experience conducting financial analysis, building projections and budgeting

title: Financial Analyst II - Department of Medicine - R104083
description:
**Department:**  

  

**Location:** Health Sciences Center  

  

**Time Type:**  

  

Full time  

  

**Worker Type:**  

  

Regular  

  

**Job Req ID:** R104083  

  

**Minimum Requirements:**  

  

Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance or a related field and two years of related experience. Additional experience may be used on a one-to-one basis to offset the educational requirements.
  

Grade 6  

  

**Position Description:**  

  

The Financial Analyst II is responsible for operational management and financial planning of clinical contracts and faculty salaries in the Department of Medicine. This position works with Departmental leadership, division chiefs in 12 divisions, the Executive Director, business managers, and the DOM Faculty Affairs team to analyze data to support initiatives to improve upon the department's academic, clinical, and research missions. There is a significant focus on contract administration and tracking of DOM faculty salaries both on the University side and with clinical partners. This role will support the department with tracking contracts, ensuring all revenue is received and going to the correct speedtype/cost center, and monitoring clinical payroll for accuracy.  

  

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities*** Oversee monthly clinical contract documentation for hospital and clinical service contracts and provide data analysis on contracts by tracking contract data to ensure commitments are realized.
* Manage the clinical contract submission process to Compliance 360 and UL Health Symplr for all divisions within the Department of Medicine, in conjunction with the School of Medicine Contracts Office.� This includes working with clinical partners to determine contract value and services provided as well as working with the School of Medicine contracts team, legal team, and leadership team as well as clinical partners' leadership teams to ensure contracts have been reviewed and authorized by all parties and troubleshoot where needed.
* Monitor payments (for contracts) and ensure all parties are paying on a regular basis.
* Manage and compile clinical data to analyze the productivity of clinical providers on a monthly, quarterly, and annual basis.� Disseminate data reports to division chairs, division business leads, and clinical providers to substantiate clinical activity for budgetary and evaluation purposes.
* Review clinical employment contracts for all department faculty, both on and off the compensation model, and work with clinical partners to assess productivity reports for accuracy between employment contract expectations and actual productivity.� This includes monitoring incentive payments and base salary components to confirm documentation and compensation accuracy, addressing errors, troubleshooting issues, and proactively managing solutions with the revenue cycle business manager, central business office, and other stakeholders.
* Provide oversight and education about the compensation plan and revenue cycle for clinical faculty.
* Prepare and manage the monthly and bi-weekly special pay requests through the clinical partners for moonlighting and additional service efforts of departmental clinical providers.
* Create and maintain internal documentation for monthly faculty payroll details to assess departmental allocation and adherence to budgeting processes, address errors, proactively manage solutions, and work closely with clinical operations managers to ensure the accuracy of the data.
* Work with department leadership, division chiefs and their staff, and Finance team on the annual budget process for UofL and ULP, ensuring faculty and clinical staff salaries are accurate and follow Budget Office guidelines.
* Provide support to the Department Executive Director in the tracking and preparation of data and information used in presentations for special finance projects, including yearly budget process planning.
* Other duties as assigned.

**Preferred Qualifications:**  

  

The ideal candidate should have an extensive background in RVU tracking and reviewing data anomalies as well as experience in a higher education setting, preferably in a medical school setting.
  

  

**Compensation will be commensurate to candidate experience.**  

  

**Equal Employment Opportunity**  

  

The University of Louisville is an equal opportunity, affirmative action employer, and is committed to providing employment opportunities to all qualified applicants without regard to race, sex, age, color, national origin, ethnicity, creed, religion, disability, genetic information, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity and expression, marital status, pregnancy, or veteran status. If you are unable to use our online application process due to an impairment or disability, please contact the Employment team at employment@louisville.edu or 502.852.6258.  

  

**Assistance and** **Accommodations**  

  

Computers are available for application submission at the Human Resources Department located at 215 Central Avenue, Ste 205 - Louisville, Kentucky 40208.  

  

If you require assistance or accommodation with our online application process, please contact us by email at employment@louisville.edu or by phone 502-852-6258.

title: Senior Financial Analyst - Logistics/Warehousing
description:
**Our company**


Congo Brands is at the epicenter of where consumer demand meets product development. Through brand partnerships with lead influencers, we are afforded an inside look at what consumers truly desire. Congo Brands is a health and wellness brand that sells supplements, fitness snacks, hydration drinks, energy drinks, and more through ecommerce and retail partnerships. Congo Brands houses some of the World’s most noted brands including Alani Nu, Prime Hydration, and 3D Energy. Congo Brands is on pace to become one of the World’s most noted consumer product companies, with revenue growth increasing exponentially year over year. Congo Brand’s goal is to be the go-to ‘Better for You Brand’ for everything from ready-to-drink beverages, snacks, supplements and more.

**The Role:**


This role reports to the Finance Manager – Logistics & Warehousing and is responsible for financial support of the logistics and warehousing operations.


**Key Responsibilities:**

* Track and report shipping and storage costs within the supply chain to aid in building future budgets and forecasts, complete variance analyses.
* Own the freight, fulfillment, and 3PL accounts within the P&L. Collaborate with broader finance team to help create the monthly COGS forecast.
* Conduct financial analyses to identify cost-saving opportunities. Partner the Logistics and Transportation operations teams to make business decisions and help achieve savings.
* Track key contractual agreements metrics that have financial implications (e.g. contractual volume agreements).
* Help define, track, and audit supply chain productivity & related KPIs.
* Support efforts in the development, implementation, and maintenance of analytical tools used to analyze data for supporting financial analysis.
* Support Finance Manager – Logistics & Warehousing in ad hoc needs and projects.

  



**Requirements**

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or a related field. Master's degree or professional certification (e.g., CPA, CFA) is preferred.
* 3+ years of finance experience (investment banking, financial consulting, corporate finance, FP&A, etc.).
* Knowledge of financial planning and analysis, budgeting, financial modeling, and financial reporting including GAAP accounting.
* Knowledge of how to read financial statements (e.g. Income Statement, Balance Sheet)
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret financial data and provide actionable insights.
* Demonstrated self-starter and team collaboration skills, with the ability to collaborate and communicate effectively with cross-functional teams.
* Oracle NetSuite experience preferred.
* CPG Industry experience preferred; ideally, with understanding of contract supply chain structures and relationships.

  



**Benefits**

**Benefits & Perks:**

* Competitive Salary
* Health/Vision/Dental Benefits
* 15 days of PTO + 8 paid holidays
* 6 weeks paid parental leave
* 401K plan with employer match
* Monthly cell phone stipend
* AND SO MUCH MORE!

#PRIME


Congo Brands, LLC. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, or any other classification protected by Federal, state, or local law.

title: Investment Analyst
company: Kentucky Farm Bureau Mutual Insurance Company
description:
Overview:

This investment analyst position requires knowledge in multiple financial market areas such as fixed income, common stocks, and alternative investment. A strong desire to develop further expertise in the investment process is a prerequisite. Duties will include both finance and accounting related activities, such as creating investment research, analyzing market data, and resolving discrepancies.  

Other responsibilities include active participation in market outlook meetings, risk tolerance, trading securities and investment related research duties. This team member may also help create and organize an economic update for distribution to the Company’s Senior Leadership Team.
Responsibilities:

Examine and assess economic and market trends, earnings prospects, financial statements and various other indicators and factors to assist in determining suitable investment strategies.
Become familiar with regulatory requirements and internal investment policy and monitor compliance with both.
Maintain working knowledge of financial regulatory environment (NAIC, Kentucky Department of Insurance, etc.) and proactively prepare for pending changes; constantly monitor compliance with regulations and internal policies.
Develop a working knowledge of the Company’s tax model and an understanding of current tax law regarding investments.
Analyze and monitor the various portfolios relative to guidelines and market-based benchmarks.
Participate in the research, sourcing, allocation, and monitoring of investments in alternative asset classes.
Assist in development of economic forecasts and interest rate changes, determining effects on portfolio and adjustment to investment strategy.
Continually improve and add ways to monitor and analyze performance of the fixed income, equity, and alternative portfolios.
Participate in brokerage relationships and develop trading acumen across investment types and always strive for best execution.
Document all investment purchases and sale transactions for a monthly report to the Board of Directors.
Prepare a variety of other internal and external management and regulatory reports.
Validate and reconcile investment related data on financial statements.
Strive to adhere to industry standard professional conduct and code of ethics.
Work in partnership with the other investment team members to ensure key responsibilities for all roles are adequately covered for business continuity and backup purposes.
Highly motivated self-starter, able to thrive with limited supervision.
Regular, predictable attendance as employee must physically be in the office.
The list of essential functions is non-exhaustive and may be supplemented as necessary. **Job Specifications**  

Physical demands: Normal vision and hearing (with or without correction); Reading; Speaking; Sitting; Travel; Mobility
Mental demands: Analytical reasoning; Prolonged concentration
Environmental factors: Standard office lighting, temperature, and noise.
Equipment: Bloomberg System; Keyboard; Telephone; Calculator.
Qualifications:

Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field.
Minimum two years’ experience in investment roles and developing investment strategy, preferably in insurance or banking.
Proficiency in standard software such as Excel, Word, and PowerPoint as well as multi-faceted accounting and financial systems capability and ability to learn new systems as required.
Evidence of specialized training in the financial markets. Advanced degree or FINRA series 7,63,65 licenses are helpful.
Desire to obtain further education or accredited certifications.
Basic understanding of asset allocation and cash flow analysis is required.
Appropriate knowledge of investments, modern portfolio theory, financial concepts, accounting theory, and related terminology.
High level of self-motivation and ability to collaborate with others, both internally and outside the organization.
Confident, articulate presence and excellent presentation skills are vital to success.
Ability to keep a positive attitude and work as a team member.
Experience with report writing software is preferred.
Ability and willingness to strictly adhere to Company Investment Policy.

title: Senior FP&A Analyst
description:
We’re looking for a Senior FP&A Analyst to provide in-depth financial insights to support the various business units within Gopuff’s organization. You’ll be an embedded business unit partner providing financial insights to help drive strategic decision-making. In addition, you will support the financial budget and forecasting process for the various business units. This role will report into the Director of FP&A. We recognize that people come from diverse backgrounds and skills and welcome all to apply.  

Gopuff takes pride in creative problem-solving and in-person collaborating to make quick and informed decisions. This role will have a hybrid work schedule, where you will be able to showcase your creativity and build strong relationships with teams in a cross functional manner three days a week (Tuesday - Thursday) in our Liquor Barn, Louisville HQ!
### **You Will:**

* Accelerate the growth of the business by identifying and implementing new opportunities and solutions for scalability, profitability, and defensibility of our business model
* Collaborate with numerous department leaders to support: Budgeting and forecasting procedures
* Develop operational goals
* Apply business judgment and financial models to assist with strategic decision-making related to new initiatives, products, and business opportunities
* Apply an analytical approach to the review ROI, customer behavior analysis, and unit economic impact of business initiatives
* Monitor the financial statements to understand the impact of current initiatives and to shape future initiatives
* Support Corporate Finance during the budgeting and forecasting process with business vertical communications and objectives
* Provide support for field P&L management

### **You Have:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Economics, or Finance
* 3+ years of Strategic Finance, Corporate Finance, Consulting, or Investment Banking experience at a high-growth startup or well-established company
* Deep understanding of the 3 main financial statements and how they tie together
* Strong Excel/financial modeling and Powerpoint skills
* Highly effective communicator who can easily break down complex information
* Effective self-starter. Able to effectively manage their own time and charge toward results right out of the gate
* Ability to learn on the fly

### **Compensation:**

* Gopuff pays employees based on market pricing and pay may vary depending on your location. The salary range below reflects what we’d reasonably expect to pay candidates. A candidate’s starting pay will be determined based on job-related skills, experience, qualifications, work location, and market conditions. These ranges may be modified in the future. For additional information on this role’s compensation package, please reach out to the designated recruiter for this role.
* Salary Range (varies based on a cost of labor index for geographic area within United States): $79,200 - $132,800

**At Gopuff, we know that life can be unpredictable.** Sometimes you forget the milk at the store, run out of pet food for Fido, or just really need ice cream at 11 pm. We get it—stuff happens. But that’s where we come in, delivering all your wants and needs in just minutes.  

And now, we’re assembling a team of motivated people to help us drive forward that vision to bring a new age of convenience and predictability to an unpredictable world.  

Like what you’re hearing? Then join us on Team Blue. *Gopuff is an equal employment opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive workplace where we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or familial status, age, ancestry, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply.*

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
Description:Commonwealth Pain & Spine (CP&S) is one of the fastest growing, progressive, comprehensive pain management groups in Kentucky and Southern Indiana. Our team of friendly physicians are all board certified in pain medicine and anesthesiology and take the time to educate our staff. Our facilities are brand new with the latest technology. We have a team/family-oriented culture with great hours, competitive pay, benefits, and open interaction between our staff and management.  
**Job Summary:**  
As Senior Financial Analyst, you will be a highly motivated and intellectually curious key contributor. Reporting to the Manager of FP&A, you will collaborate with senior leaders across the organization. In this highly visible role, you will support reporting, analysis, and planning initiatives, helping the company to achieve growth objectives.  
**Job Duties & Responsibilities:**

* Analyze and present financial results against forecast, budget, and prior year, identifying areas of improvement to drive operational efficiencies.
* Develop relationships and act as a trusted business partner and expert on all finance-related activities.
* Prepare standard and specialized financial reports (income statements, balance sheets, cash flow statements, and management reporting) according to Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) or other reporting requirements.
* Lead meetings with leaders across the organization, identifying key financial and operational drivers and articulating relevant and actionable information.
* Prepare pro forma and due diligence analysis for potential new clinics or acquisitions.
* Proactively assess financial and operational performance, risks, and opportunities. Provide timely and actionable recommendations.
* Lead project initiatives to improve reporting, analytical tools, and internal processes to enhance company decision-making.
* Play a critical role in the annual budgeting process, periodic forecasts, and strategic long-term plans. In addition to modeling, you will collaborate with leaders to understand business needs and ensure alignment with company roadmap.
* Take ownership of assigned areas, working under moderate supervision.
* Share administrative responsibilities for our reporting and planning tool, including creating new reporting capabilities, building and maintaining planning models, validating data loads, troubleshooting, and serving as a system expert.
* Maintain professionalism and confidentiality with sensitive information.
* Perform all other duties as assigned to meet the needs of the business or align with strategic initiatives.

Requirements:**Education & Experience:**

* BA/BS degree in Finance, Accounting, or Economics.
* 4 years of relevant experience in FP&A or Corporate Finance.
* Experience working in a private-equity backed company preferred.
* Demonstrated proficiency using financial reporting and planning software.
* Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office Suite (Excel and PowerPoint).
* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and organizational skills.

**Required Skills:**

* Inquisitive mindset with a passion for process improvement.
* Approachable, flexible, and dependable with a high degree of professionalism.
* Self-motivated and agile, with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced, growing organization.
* Strong business acumen with a passion for growth and development.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to concisely articulate complex financial concepts to inform and influence leadership.
* Attention to detail.
* Ability to complete multiple high-priority responsibilities simultaneously and with high quality.
* Have a strong sense of personal accountability and will take the initiative to solve problems independently.
* Ability to work independently in a fast-paced environment.

**Benefits:**

* Competitive compensation
* License and DEA Reimbursement
* Annual Education/CME reimbursement
* Comprehensive Health/Vision/Dental insurance options
* Great PTO plan PLUS Paid Holidays
* 401k and matching available

Commonwealth Pain and Spine is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer!

Job Type: Full-time

Work Location: Hybrid remote in Louisville, KY 40207

title: Startup Financial Analyst
description:
**Forecastr - Startup Financial Analyst**

**Intro to Forecastr**  
Forecastr is a rapidly-growing, venture backed, SaaS company out of Louisville, Kentucky building an online software platform that helps founders build great financial models, make better decisions, and get funded.

We’ve been on-fire since raising our pre-seed of $750k in Q1 2020 and going full-time and to date we've raised $9M in Venture Capital, have ~700 paying customers, $2.1M ARR, and 30 FTEs.

Our product is an online financial model for startups, served as Plug & Play Financial Planning & Analysis and sold on a monthly subscription basis with a 30-Day, ‘White-Glove’ onboarding. During onboarding we take a “deep-dive” to fully understand our customer’s “ins and outs” and help them get a great, ‘investor-grade’ financial model. We then take ownership of the financial model and deliver consistent reporting and insights to drive data-backed value for the founder on an on-going basis!

**Forecastr Culture**  
We believe culture is vitally important, and it’s crucial that you know the culture of the company you are considering working for, to best understand if it’s a good match.

At Forecastr, we believe in a fast-paced but balanced culture that is performance-driven. There is a lot of flexibility in terms of work hours, vacation time, and work style, so long as you excel in your role, and are playing your part to ensure the company achieves its most important objectives.

Our company values are as follows:

**Put People First**: We prioritize the well-being and growth of our employees, fostering a supportive and inclusive work environment.

**Inspire Confidence:** We strive to embody the confidence our customers need to close funding rounds and grow their companies. We lead by example.

**Be Prepared:** We plan for the future, and always keep one eye on the horizon, never losing sight of the forest for the trees.

**Live with balance:** We encourage a harmonious integration of work and personal life, recognizing the importance of maintaining well-rounded lifestyles for sustained success.

**Have Fun:** We believe that a joyful and vibrant workplace cultivates creativity, collaboration, and overall satisfaction among our team members.

**Speak the truth:** We foster a culture of open and honest communication in an empathetic manner, promoting transparency and integrity in all interactions to drive meaningful progress.

**Job Description**  
**We have** two career paths **within the analyst team available:**

* ***Onboarding Analyst***
* ***Support Analyst***

**Onboarding Analyst: Positions Available (1)**

You feel fulfilled being the face of a brand that creates a golden customer experience and puts people first. You also prioritize financial acumen and confidence in equal measure with empathy and supportiveness. You enjoy exposure to a wide-array of industries and personalities and are looking to work with like-minded people.

You’re ready to make a direct impact, and want to work directly with startup founders to help them understand, articulate, and grow their companies. You crave autonomy and personal growth, and you get excited about delighting & ‘wowing’ our customers while embracing change, and acting quickly and collaboratively on new ideas.

You understand the importance of a great financial model, and you know how to build one. You’re as adept at financial modeling as you are listening empathetically and being a guiding hand in a company’s strategic finance journey.

**Support Analyst: Positions Available (1)**

You find joy and fulfillment in being an integral part of a company’s ongoing strategic financial analysis and planning efforts and nurturing a deep relationship with your clients. You’re adept at translating data into meaningful insights, assessing trends, and have a deep understanding for keeping a finger on the pulse of a wide-variety of business models.

You communicate crisply to customers verbally, in writing, and have reporting experience. You love working with people, and enjoy making customers feel secure in their ability to make data-driven decisions in a landscape that requires flexibility as well as quick-thinking.

You understand that a financial model is a living breathing document that needs to grow with a company and you love being there to keep information reliable, actionable, and digestible to a standard of excellence.

**Your Purpose [Onboarding Analyst]**

A champion of our brand values with a skillset that focuses heavily on financial model assessment, building, and strategic consultation with a caring and friendly tone. You will provide white-glove setup of a new customer’s financial model into the Forecastr platform and be a critical component for ensuring customers get world-class operational financial models, have an unforgettable experience with Forecastr, and are extracting the maximum amount of value possible from our product & services. In short, you set the trajectory and tone for our ongoing customer success and activation efforts.

**Your Responsibilities [Onboarding Analyst]**

* Love our customers. They will be your top-priority. We want to build real human relationships with these startup founders. Clearly identify their objectives and put their needs first.
* Independently guide our new customers through our white-glove onboarding and serve as a financial leader to make sure their business is represented in an accurate and operationally useful way.
* Building models into the Forecastr platform from information directly provided by the customer or translating existing customer models when provided.
* Progress customers through onboarding consistently and efficiently to ensure new sales deal flow is uninterrupted.
* Be prepared to train customers on how to use the Forecastr platform as needed.
* Continually engage with our customers through Live Chat, Email, and sometimes Zoom Calls to answer questions, remove blockers, provide support, guidance, and expertise throughout onboarding. Our customers look to us as startup finance experts, and you will be providing this expertise to our customers.
* Work directly with the Director of Customer Onboarding on strategic initiatives designed to improve the experience of customers and optimize how we serve them.
* Maintain Forecastr's internal systems for customers management such as HubSpot and Asana
* While not a part of your primary role, everyone at an early-stage startup can and must wear multiple hats. There will be ample opportunity for you to involve yourself in other areas of the company such as: sales, product testing, operations, content marketing, etc.

**Your Purpose [Support Analyst]**

A champion of our brand values with a skillset that focuses heavily on ongoing financial model management, financial reporting, and customer relations. This role has a strong emphasis on financial reporting and analysis. In order to provide the most effective and useful model, this position keeps the customer's goals and performance in focus to drive data-backed decision making for their customers. Each Analyst will manage their own portfolio of customers and will be expected to build and manage a strong connection between Forecastr and the customer by delivering our standardized reporting services and identifying opportunities for Forecastr to better meet the evolving needs of the customer.

**Your Responsibilities [Support Analyst]**

* Independently manage the financial model for a portfolio of companies and support their financial management, planning, and strategy
* Prepare, review, analyze and distribute monthly and quarterly financial reports for companies
* Lead and organize monthly and quarterly financial review and forecasting calls with each company
* Collaborate regularly with the greater finance & accounting teams of each company to ensure consistency across all systems
* Work as our customers' financial leader to improve financial systems and guide financial strategy
* Maintain Forecastr's internal systems for customers management such as HubSpot and Asana
* Serve our customers as best as you can, engaging through live chats, email, video calls, to help with financial models, or other startup related help
* We encourage all our analysts to go above and beyond for their customers when possible. Helping with projects outside of the financial model when possible
* While not a part of your primary role, everyone at an early-stage startup can and must wear multiple hats. There will be ample opportunity for you to involve yourself in other areas of the company such as: sales, product testing, operations, content marketing, etc.

**Must-Have Skills & Experience [Onboarding & Support Analysts]**

* Must have experience using Excel/Google Sheets
* Must have experience building financial models for startup companies
* Must be able to communicate clearly & effectively
* Must be able to work well with people, and enjoy serving customers
* Must have a minimum of 1 year of well articulated, relevant work experience in financial modeling

**Preferred Skills & Experience [Onboarding & Support Analysts]**

* Bachelor's degree in Finance / Economics / Adjacent studies preferred or the work experience equivalent of this degree

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $65,000.00 - $75,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Preferred)

Experience:

* Microsoft Excel: 1 year (Required)
* Accounting: 1 year (Required)

Work Location: Multiple locations

title: Senior Financial Analyst - GTR Americas
description:
CURRENT EMPLOYEES, CONSULTANTS, AND AGENCY PARTNERS:
If you currently work for Brown-Forman, please apply by clicking the Careers icon on the Workday portal.
For best results, use Google Chrome to view this page.
Meaningful Work From Day One
This position will support the Finance Manager as a key member and business partner of the Global Travel Retail (GTR) Americas team, which includes Americas Travel Retail, Transportation, and Military. You will provide
financial support, reporting, planning and insights to aid commercial decision making and strategic direction. This will include development and management of trackers and reports, various financial, consumer, and P&L analyses, and other ad hoc support.
Accounts include complex, multi-market, multi-channel retailers in the Americas including Ship Chandlers (Cruise Ships), UETA, 3Sixty, Transportation (Airlines) and others, as well as the US Military. These businesses include Airport D.F., Border Shops D.F., Ship Chandlers (Cruise Ships), and Military.
What You Can Expect
Commercial Support and Analytical Insight* Support commercial team with analytics and insights for the region to guide commercial decision making.
* Support the Finance Manager in evaluating and measuring progress toward the long-term strategic vision outlined in the 2030 strategic plans.
* Provide tools to commercial teams, including financial support for agreements/contracts, pricing strategies, promotion strategies, customer profitability assessments, and competitive trends.
* Assist Finance Manager in preparing analysis for presentations for customer negotiations, performance reviews, and other strategic projects.


Financial Planning and Analysis and Reporting* Update charts and slides for the MBR/QBR decks, incorporating impactful visuals and content to facilitate compelling business story-telling around performance
* Provide meaningful analysis and commentary that drives insights on business performance. Types of analysis may include profitability analysis, margin enhancement, variance analysis, pricing effectiveness, cost management and measuring promotional effectiveness.
* Maintain trackers and planners for A&P and Discounts, working with the team to ensure spend is within budgeted amounts.
* Interpret and ensure accuracy of financial statements, working with the accounting team to develop accruals, JEs, pricing approvals and manage queries.
* Support Finance Manager in developing quarterly forecasts, annual targets and strategic long-term planning. Be able to understand and challenge key assumptions and assess risks.


Other* Provide ad hoc support on special projects (by their nature it is difficult to define these projects as they will be driven by requirements that change).
* Support Finance Manager in reviewing and implementing RGM initiatives
* Liaise with Accounting function to ensure proper recording of JEs & accruals, and ensure books are kept in accordance with local & US GAAP. Collaborate with that team to ensure efficiency in processes.
* Submit depletion data on a monthly basis for applicable markets.


What You Bring to the Table* College/University (Bachelors or Equivalent); Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance or Business Administration or Certifications: CPA/Chartered Accountant
* 3-5 years of relevant business experience
* Strong financial analytic capability with a demonstrated ability to influence sound business decisions
* Proactive self-starter with the intellectual curiosity to seek relevant questions to be answered
* Demonstrated oral and written communication skills with ability to clearly discuss business issues and translate into financial and strategic implications and actionable plans
* Team contributor who puts success of the team ahead of personal ambitions
* Strong interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to develop effective working relationships with a broad range of business associates across multiple geographic locations
* Ability to independently plan and prioritize multiple diverse work projects and work outside of normal work hours to meet deadlines and manage time zone differences
* Demonstrated ability and knowledge of various software packages, particularly Microsoft Excel, SAP, BW, Google, Tableau
* Ability to travel, approximately 10% - 15%
* Fluency in English language


What Makes You Unique* Advanced business degree
* Wine & Spirits Industry experience
* Experience in multinational business
* Understanding of Travel Retail Business

  

Who We Are
Imagine working for a company that welcomes you in, inspires you to bring your best self to every opportunity, and encourages you to grow and develop your career in a resilient and fun industry. Brown-Forman offers our employees this kind of career and environment and has for more than 150 years. Together, we proudly live and work by our values, striving each day to be better and do better as people, as a company, and as members of the communities we call home. Come have a seat at our table!
Many Spirits, One Brown‑Forman- We believe that an inclusive culture, one that values the diversity and unique perspective of each individual, allows us each to bring our best self to work and leads to greater teamwork, creativity, and trust.
Cultivating a Caring Culture- We know that our strong culture is one of the many reasons people love working at Brown‑Forman.
Enriching Life. Enriching Careers- At Brown‑Forman, we craft products known for bringing people together. Our employees have made us what we are today and are the reason for our success. Do not just take our word for it. Brown‑Forman is consistently recognized as a Great Place to Work® in countries around the world.
What We Offer
Total Rewards at Brown-Forman is designed to engage our people to ensure sustainable and profitable growth for generations to come. As a premium spirits company, we offer equitable pay structures for individual and company performance alongside a premium employee experience. We offer a range of premium benefits that reflect our company values and meet the needs of our diverse workforce.

Employee
Management Level:
Professional
Global Job Level:
P6

title: Financial Analyst, FP&A
description:
At GE Appliances, a Haier company, we come together to make “good things, for life.” As the fastest-growing appliance company in the U.S., we’re powered by creators, thinkers and makers who believe that anything is possible and that there’s always a better way. We believe in the power of our people and in giving them the freedom to explore, discover and build good things, together.
The GE Appliances philosophy, backed by three simple commitments defines the way we work, invent, create, do business, and serve our communities: *we come together*, *we always look for a better way*, and *we create possibilities*.
Interested in joining us on our journey?
As a GE Appliances Financial Analyst of FP&A you’ll drive improvements in the analysis, reporting, forecasting, and budgeting of the business’s productivity metrics around inventory and cash flow including inventory turns, sales & production planning, orders trends, days sales and payables outstanding, and CFOA. In this role, you will be critical to the FP&A and Fulfillment/Logistics team’s success through development of estimates, sensitivities, new weekly/monthly reporting, and annual Budget activities.  

  

You will play a critical role in analyzing the company’s working capital and cash flows and will have the ability to provide senior leadership with the information they need. This role provides significant exposure to the Executive Director - FP&A, CFO, broader finance organization leaders, Executive Director – Treasury and Executive Director – Fulfillment/Logistics while operating in a dynamic environment with unique challenges to solve.
Position
Financial Analyst, FP&A
Location
USA, Louisville, KY
How You'll Create Possibilities
What will you do? The chosen candidate for this position…
Reporting and Analysis:* Collaborates with the Cash FP&A Senior Manager to analyze monthly financial performance, identify trends, and provides insights to support strategic decision-making around the business’s sales & operations planning, inventory productivity, and working capital metrics.
* Serves as the finance partner for the Logistics/Fulfillment team to support business operations objectives, defines the right metrics to measure success, and reports results to the business.
* Provides analysis to support Parent company, Haier Smart Home International, FP&A.


Development of New Reporting Frameworks:* Drives the development of new and simplified reporting frameworks for inventory balances and productivity metrics, order trends and how they translate to sales, and operational productivity and its impact on inventory to enhance visibility and decision-making processes.
* Works closely with cross-functional teams to understand reporting requirements and develop innovative solutions to streamline reporting processes.


Cash Flow Projection:* Assists in the development and maintenance of cash flow projections, providing accurate forecasts and insights into cash flow trends to support short-term and long-term financial planning.


Data Analysis and Visualization:* Has the ability to work with large data sets, conduct comprehensive analysis, and generate actionable insights to present to business leaders.
* Utilizes data visualization tools such as Tableau or SAAS to analyze complex data sets and present findings in a clear and concise manner.


What You'll Bring to Our Team
The ideal candidate for this position has the following Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities:* University Degree or equivalent experience and a minimum of 3 years prior relevant experience.
* Strong proficiency in manipulating and analyzing large datasets
* Excellent analytical skills with a keen attention to detail and the ability to translate complex financial data into actionable insights.
* Independently sets objectives for own tasks to meet the goals of projects or assignments.
* Has the ability to influence others within the job area through explanation of facts, policies, and practices.


Preferred Qualifications:* Advanced experience working within Microsoft Excel & PowerPoint
* Familiarity with FP&A reporting accounting system i/e Oracle, Hyperion.
* Experience in data visualization tools such as Tableau, SAAS, or Power BI.


Our Culture
At GE Appliances, creativity meets passion and conversations lead to exceptional outcomes and experiences. We respect and value the unique backgrounds and experiences that everyone brings to GE Appliances. We believe a diverse workplace, where everyone is included and people can be their true and authentic selves, fosters creativity and innovation. We know our differences are our greatest strength. The very best innovations across every function of a company come from diverse teams. Our commitment to ensuring a safe and inclusive workplace where everyone is valued allows employees to perform at their best, every day. Diversity at GE Appliances helps us achieve zero distance to our owners, innovate smartly and connect to the communities and customers we serve. We encourage and support the ideas, aspirations, and the wellbeing of everyone - our employees and our communities
GE Appliances is a trust-based organization. It is important we offer our employees the flexibility they need to do their best work while balancing the needs of the business and individuals. When you join GE Appliances, you will have the opportunity to work with your leader to create a flexible work arrangement that balances the needs of the individual, team, and organization.
GE Appliances is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.
GE Appliances participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your Form I-9 information to confirm that you are authorized to work in the U.S*If you are an individual with a disability and need assistance or an accommodation to use our website or to apply, please send an e-mail* *to ask.recruiting@geappliances.com*

title: Warranty Claims Analyst
description:
**Summary** 

We are seeking a detail-oriented Warranty Claims Analyst responsible for warranty claim documentation and claim review or submission. In addition, this position will be responsible for monitoring and reporting warranty claim reimbursement. The Warranty Claims Analyst position will be a direct report of the Warranty Manager. 

**Qualifications**

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**

* Establish and maintain accurate and timely warranty claim submissions and reviews.
* Improve efficiency of warranty claim and review process.
* Identify and implement key performance indicators for improving manufacturer reimbursement.
* Coordination with branch Service and Parts departments for all warranty activities.
* Analyze areas of improvement that would increase claim reimbursement percentages.
* Apply known successful processes to all branches for continuity in claim submission and reimbursement performance.
* Provide instruction on manufacturer’s warranty terms and conditions.
* Work with manufacturers to expedite payment of claims and maximize reimbursement percentage.
* Administer Rudd Warranty, including review and accurate decisions relating to claim coverage.
* Ability to analyze financial and operating data to identify issues or opportunities relative to warranty trends.
* Ability to read, analyze and interpret warranty policy and procedures and coverages.

**Education and/or Experience**

* High School diploma or equivalent required.
* 3-5 years related manufacturer and/or distributor experience.

**Communication Skills**

* Ability to enhance the company's image with manufacturers.
* Ability to diplomatically handle warranty issues and resolve problems using excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Can effectively present information and respond to questions from managers, employees, and manufacturers.

**Computer Skills**

Computer literate- Internal Operating Systems, Microsoft Office Operating Systems: Excel, Access, and Word. 

**Physical Demands**

While performing the duties of this position individual will be required to utilize the computer screen and keyboard for long periods of time. Answer telephone, bend, reach, light lifting of files.

**Work Environment**

General office environment.

**Position Type and Expected Hours of Work**

* This is position is classified as full-time.
* Normal Days of work are Monday through Friday.
* Overtime may be required on occasion as needed.

**Other Duties**

This job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the personnel for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time.

**EEO/AAP Statement**

*Rudd Equipment Company, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. It is our policy not to discriminate against any Incumbent or Applicant. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or status as a qualified individual with a disability or Vietnam era or other protected veteran. To achieve our goal of equal opportunity, we maintain an Affirmative Action Program through which we take good faith efforts to recruit, hire, and advance in the employment of qualified minorities, women, persons with disabilities, Vietnam-era veterans, and other protected veterans.*

title: FP&A Analyst - Virtual/Remote
description:
Enumerate needs a **Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst** for our rapidly growing team!Enumerate has grown rapidly through acquisitions and is backed by a leading Boston-based private equity firm. We expect to continue with strategic acquisitions while diversifying our product offerings to include payments-related services for its core HOA customer base.  
  
In this role, you’ll be responsible for budgeting and forecasting as well as the development and delivery of actionable and insightful analyses of both retrospective trends (actual v. planned) and prospective opportunities. Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will have a leading role in identifying, implementing, and improving upon these core requirements.  
  
You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. This position is remote eligible, with a preference for candidates in CST/EST. **Who will love this job**  
* Someone who is a critical thinker with a meticulous approach, high initiative, and the ability to explain financial concepts in “plain English” to non-financial stakeholders

**You should have*** Required: 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, either within a corporate Finance, FP&A function, or within investment banking, commercial banking, or private equity.
* Required: Bachelors in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other highly quantitative discipline.
* Required: Experience with SaaS (or subscription) revenue recognition, including familiarity with standard SaaS metrics/ KPIs.
* Fluency in O365- especially Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
* Strong financial modeling skills in Excel including a working knowledge of 3 statement models.
* Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.
* Ability to work in the US without sponsorship.
  
**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. When possible, we also like to offer fun in-person perks like pet-friendly offices, paid food trucks and company outings.

title: Senior Financial Analyst - Logistics/Warehousing
description:
**Our company**

Congo Brands is at the epicenter of where consumer demand meets product development. Through brand partnerships with lead influencers, we are afforded an inside look at what consumers truly desire. Congo Brands is a health and wellness brand that sells supplements, fitness snacks, hydration drinks, energy drinks, and more through ecommerce and retail partnerships. Congo Brands houses some of the World’s most noted brands including Alani Nu, Prime Hydration, and 3D Energy. Congo Brands is on pace to become one of the World’s most noted consumer product companies, with revenue growth increasing exponentially year over year. Congo Brand’s goal is to be the go-to ‘Better for You Brand’ for everything from ready-to-drink beverages, snacks, supplements and more.

**The Role:**

This role reports to the Finance Manager – Logistics & Warehousing and is responsible for financial support of the logistics and warehousing operations. 

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Track and report shipping and storage costs within the supply chain to aid in building future budgets and forecasts, complete variance analyses.
* Own the freight, fulfillment, and 3PL accounts within the P&L. Collaborate with broader finance team to help create the monthly COGS forecast.
* Conduct financial analyses to identify cost-saving opportunities. Partner the Logistics and Transportation operations teams to make business decisions and help achieve savings.
* Track key contractual agreements metrics that have financial implications (e.g. contractual volume agreements).
* Help define, track, and audit supply chain productivity & related KPIs.
* Support efforts in the development, implementation, and maintenance of analytical tools used to analyze data for supporting financial analysis.
* Support Finance Manager – Logistics & Warehousing in ad hoc needs and projects.

**Requirements**

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, or a related field. Master's degree or professional certification (e.g., CPA, CFA) is preferred.
* 3+ years of finance experience (investment banking, financial consulting, corporate finance, FP&A, etc.).
* Knowledge of financial planning and analysis, budgeting, financial modeling, and financial reporting including GAAP accounting.
* Knowledge of how to read financial statements (e.g. Income Statement, Balance Sheet)
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to interpret financial data and provide actionable insights.
* Demonstrated self-starter and team collaboration skills, with the ability to collaborate and communicate effectively with cross-functional teams.
* Oracle NetSuite experience preferred.
* CPG Industry experience preferred; ideally, with understanding of contract supply chain structures and relationships.

**Benefits**

**Benefits & Perks:**

• Competitive Salary   
• Health/Vision/Dental Benefits   
• 15 days of PTO + 8 paid holidays   
• 6 weeks paid parental leave   
• 401K plan with employer match   
• Monthly cell phone stipend   
• AND SO MUCH MORE! 

#PRIME 

Congo Brands, LLC. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, veteran status, age, or any other classification protected by Federal, state, or local law.

title: Data Analyst (REMOTE)
description:
Everlight Solar is seeking a skilled Data Analyst who will design and maintain functional programs and applications, producing fully functional software applications according to requirements. As a Data Analyst, you play a key role in serving our clients and team members. This will be a full-time, work-from-home "remote" position.

**This is a role for Apple power-users, must know iWork and be skilled with iOS and macOS.**

Everlight Solar is a rapidly growing company and the leader of solar energy in the Midwest. We offer a unique experience that fosters individual growth and rewards performance. Our culture at Everlight is extremely important to us. The work environment is fast-paced and dynamic. We value teamwork, quality, innovation, and customer success. Our ideal candidate is self-motivated, detail-oriented, has excellent problem-solving abilities, is passionate about delivering results on-time, exceeding expectations, and ensuring success for our teams.

**Responsibilities:**

* Work with large amounts of data to draw meaningful conclusions
* Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
* Provide regular reporting and analysis to team
* Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key metrics and performance indicators
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify areas for improvement and to develop solutions to enhance business operations
* Provide training and support to team members on data analysis techniques and tools

**Requirements:**

* Minimum two years of experience with DOMO
* MajorDOMO Certification Required
* 3+ years experience in data analysis, reporting, business intelligence or financial analysis and a Bachelor's Degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Computer Sciences or related field or equivalent experience
* 2 years experience in providing people analytics reporting to organizations
* Demonstrated experience using SQL, and DOMO
* Experience with sensitive and confidential people data in a global environment
* Analyze, evaluate, improve, and document processes and workflows. Identify and take advantage of opportunities for process automation and simplification.
* Proven ability to design and implement new processes and facilitate user adoption.
* Strong understanding of Salesforce.com best practices and functionality
* Strong data management abilities
* A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion
* A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
* Excellent project management skills and a positive attitude
* Must demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills
* Must demonstrate ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization
* Must own a Mac computer and be fluent with the Apple ecosystem of software (iOS, macOS, iWork, etc.)

**Benefits:**  


* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Life Insurance
* PTO
* Sick and Safe Time
* Paid Holidays Off

**Salary: $65,000-$100,000/year**

*Everlight Solar is proudly an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity of all types and are excited to work with talented individuals from a wide range of backgrounds. Everlight is committed to inclusion and we invite people of any race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex, age groups (18+), and levels of education to apply. Authorized to work in the US and background check required.*

title: Consultant - Business Operations / Management
description:
**Business Operations Consultant/Project Director**

*Design, build, implement, train and evaluate customized solutions and advice that assist organizations in improving productivity and increasing revenues, and that positively impact overall performance. Solution implementation will encompass business development, organizational engineering, process management and financial systems. The Project Director is responsible for the client relationship from the origination of the opportunity to the evaluation of the effectiveness of the completed body of work. Responsibilities include client financial improvement, client relationship management and project management.* 

**Position Description**

**This position provides an outstanding opportunity to work with clients, to help them improve their operational and financial efficiencies and success. This position requires 100% travel.** 

**JOB PURPOSE** 

*Design, build, implement, train and evaluate customized solutions and advice that assist organizations in improving productivity and increasing revenues, and that positively impact overall performance. Solution implementation will encompass business development, organizational engineering, process management and financial systems.*

**QUALIFICATIONS** 

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

**COMPENSATION EXPECTATIONS:**

**135 - 145K+**

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

1. Deliver quantifiable and sustainable value for clients that are reflected through the income statement, balance sheet, cash flow, as well as quality of life. This is achieved through the successful development, implementation, training and evaluation of solutions to client challenges.
2. Oversee the identification and communication of work to be completed on behalf of the client. Responsible for clear and concise communication with assigned Assistant Director or Sr. Project Director.

**OTHER REQUIREMENTS**

1. ***Ability to travel onsite with clients (100% travel requirement).***
2. Authorized to work in the United States.
3. Minimum of four years of consulting experience with a proven track record of delivering value for clients.
4. Administrative duties completed in a timely and accurate manner.
5. Ability to communicate in English, both written and verbal.
6. Valid state issued driver’s license and current auto insurance.
7. Advanced computer skills (Microsoft Suite, financial software, dashboards, CRM’s and PM software)
8. Proven fiduciary responsibility, successfully managing a budget of 10M+, preferred.
9. Prior business ownership, preferred.

**COMPETENCIES REQUIRED**

* **Problem Solving** – Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; develops alternative solutions; uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics.
* **Change Management** – Communicates changes effectively and builds broad consensus; monitors transition and evaluates results.
* **Leadership** – Exhibits confidence in self and others; inspires and motivates others to perform well; accepts feedback from others
* **Judgement** – Displays willingness to make decisions; supports and explains reasoning for decisions. Gains trust of peers and leadership through sound decision making.
* **Results Driven** – Serious about committing and getting to results. Exemplifies this ability through sound decision-making, backed by logic, understanding contingency planning, with an attitude toward appropriate prioritization and effort.
* **People Orientated** – Possess a high EQ and readily able to connect and build relationships with clients, their staff and Cogent team members.
* **Conflict Management –** Empathetic and able to see all perspectives; graciously communicates differing points of view to build understanding; finds agreeable, forward-looking, and policy-aligned solutions to resolve conflicts others would see as irreconcilable.

**CULTURAL EXPECTATIONS**

Given the unique nature of the company and our strong focus on integrity and values, these cultural components of how we operate will be expected:

1. Cogent Analytics strives to always put our clients first, choosing to do what is in their best interest even if that choice may not be the easy or popular path.
2. Cogent Analytics maintains the highest professional standards and pledges to operate with integrity and honesty in all that we endeavor to do.
3. We believe in a collaborative environment between the administrative staff, Leadership (AD and MD) and Project Directors.
4. We understand and embrace the “Obligation to Challenge”, realizing that the status quo can be improved upon based on our unique and diverse capabilities and insights.
5. We embrace diversity realizing the benefit of working together and sharing individual exceptional insights to the group. Through these insights discovered in the pursuit of solving problems we will improve results both for our clients and ourselves.

We value the service and commitment made by our veterans and welcome them to join our company.

*This job description is intended to describe the general nature, complexity, and level of work to be performed by team member assigned to this position and is not to be construed as an exhaustive list of responsibilities, duties and/or skills required. It does not prescribe or restrict the work that may be assigned.* 

*We are an equal opportunity employer. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to our team and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.*
