title: FINANCIAL ANALYST II
description:
**Position Summary Description**

The Financial Analyst II supports the Treasury & Planning department with the following duties: analyze current and past financial data and performance; prepare financial reports and projections; evaluate capital expenditures and depreciation; provide investment, leasing and breakeven analysis; prepare and monitor debt compliance matters; analyze trends in financial performance and provides recommendations for improvement; preparation of rating agency presentations; financial modeling and forecasting.

**Essential Functions**

* Maintains documentations and records of financial transactions and monitors compliance with covenants, terms and conditions.
* Performs special studies and analysis of proposed financing transactions.
* Assists in identifying available sources of financing and performing various assignments as given pertaining to operational and financial transactions.
* Analyzes financial status of potential and current vendors and prepares responses to requests for credit information.
* Performs cost and cash flow analysis as required with respect to operations and capital projects.
* Prepares documentation related to debt service payments.
* Assists in the evaluation and structuring of alternative financing for assets.
* Prepares financial reports and analysis for management decision-making purposes.
* Assists in the preparation of loan applications.
* Maintains finance library and financing documents.
* Assists in developing and implementing plans for the acquisition of capital needed for the Operations and Generation and Transmission expansion programs, analyzing replacement security for Letters of Credit and placement of permanent debt for assets financed on short term basis.
* Prepares annual work plan and capital, cash and operating budgets; reports actual to budget variances and recommends corrective action as necessary.
* Assists in the development of the intermediate and long-range financial forecasts.
* Provides monthly Board Report contributions and debt services reports.
* Performs other duties as applicable to the position or as assigned.

  


**Qualifications and Education Requirements**

Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, or business equivalent is required. Requires three (3) or more years of experience in debt compliance and loan strategies. Additional training in financial management or an advanced accounting or finance degree is desirable. Electrical utility or related industries experience preferred. 

*Core Competencies*: Adaptable, Collaborative, Conscientious, Critical-Thinking, Outcome-Driven and Professional

*Technical Competencies/Skills*:

* Budgets and reporting
* Financial analysis, planning & forecasting
* Utility ratemaking principles
* Enterprise management, planning and control systems
* GAAP, RUS, and FERC accounting standards
* Industry benchmarking
* Proficient with Microsoft Office applications

*Soft Competencies/Skills*:

* Effective verbal/nonverbal, listening and written communications
* Problem analysis & diagnostic information gathering
* Attention to detail
* Coordination
* Analytical
* Strategic Thinking
* Planning and Organizing

**Physical Requirements**

Must be able to follow established protective measures including wearing required personal protective equipment (PPE). Must possess a valid driver’s license and acceptable Motor Vehicle Report.

**Working Conditions**

Some travel and work outside of normal business hours. While working in certain areas of the plant there is the potential for exposure to hazards typical of an industrial working environment. 

“*Disclaimer - Management may modify this job description at any time and may require the performance of additional duties,* *or modification of physical requirements, with or without advance notice.”*

title: FP&A Analyst - Virtual/Remote
description:
Enumerate needs a **Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst** for our rapidly growing team!Enumerate has grown rapidly through acquisitions and is backed by a leading Boston-based private equity firm. We expect to continue with strategic acquisitions while diversifying our product offerings to include payments-related services for its core HOA customer base.  
  
In this role, you’ll be responsible for budgeting and forecasting as well as the development and delivery of actionable and insightful analyses of both retrospective trends (actual v. planned) and prospective opportunities. Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will have a leading role in identifying, implementing, and improving upon these core requirements.  
  
You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. This position is remote eligible, with a preference for candidates in CST/EST. **Who will love this job**  
* Someone who is a critical thinker with a meticulous approach, high initiative, and the ability to explain financial concepts in “plain English” to non-financial stakeholders

**You should have*** Required: 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, either within a corporate Finance, FP&A function, or within investment banking, commercial banking, or private equity.
* Required: Bachelors in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other highly quantitative discipline.
* Required: Experience with SaaS (or subscription) revenue recognition, including familiarity with standard SaaS metrics/ KPIs.
* Fluency in O365- especially Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
* Strong financial modeling skills in Excel including a working knowledge of 3 statement models.
* Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.
* Ability to work in the US without sponsorship.
  
**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. When possible, we also like to offer fun in-person perks like pet-friendly offices, paid food trucks and company outings.

title: Undergraduate Intern - Credit Analyst
description:
**Credit Analyst Intern - Amerant Bank**  
Help Amerant shape our continued success by pursuing a career you feel good about. We are seeking bright, innovative Interns to join our talent community in **Credit Analysis**.  
The Credit Analyst intern role provides the opportunity to excel and to set in motion a Career Path. The role requires the maturity to take on challenges, the desire to learn, and the desire to be part of a team. Our success relies on the passion we put on everything we do.  
This internship is full of opportunities to participate collaboratively in various projects and additional assignments that directly contribute to the success of the unit you assist. In addition, the intern will have opportunities to interact and be mentored by executives and senior leadership.  
Upon completion of the intern program there is potential to obtain a full-time offer.  
**About Amerant Bank**  
At Amerant, employees can build solid careers and make contributions to our dynamic environment. As we continually evolve and move forward to keep pace with the needs of our customers who are transacting business within our markets, we draw upon the talent of our employees to identify new solutions and innovative ideas. We value the unique contribution of each employee and create a culture to combine this individuality to create a thriving and visionary organization.  
The Amerant culture is one that embraces social responsibility. We take our leadership role in the community seriously and reach out to make the markets we serve better places to live and work. Throughout our almost 40-year history, employees have been an integral part of expressing care and concern for our neighbors. Countless volunteer hours create lasting changes in our communities and provide forums for employees who work together to have fun together, too. Our priority is to support the organizations whose causes mean the most to our employees and customers. Amerant Bank is an equal opportunity employer.  
**Growth in Competence and Knowledge:**  
* This intern position provides participants exposure to Credit Analysis.
* Intern will be required to successfully complete all required course work within the allotted timeframe.
* Progress will be monitored by the intern’s performance of required tasks by collaborative coaches, senior management, and the intern program director.
* Interns will be assigned to an intern manager and will also gain exposure to multiple departments at the bank.
* Interns will work with teammates and their manager on projects important to the bank's goals. On the job learning will be provided.
* Interns will participate in team meetings, training, and presentations as available
* Interns will complete a 12-week curriculum, marked with specific milestones.

  
**The Role**  
* Specifically, the purpose is to provide participants with basic skills in credit analysis, loan negotiation and structure
* Gain an understanding of & the purpose of our Credit Policy so to further understand how it affects credit decisions.
* Progress will be monitored by the Interns performance of required tasks by key trainers as well as senior management.
* Analyze credit data and financial statements to determine the degree of credit risk involved in extending credit or lending money.
* Interact with loan officers in order to enhance the quality of information required for underwriting purposes.
* Spread financial statements and prepare comprehensive financial analysis on the creditworthiness of the borrower

  
**Are you a fit?**  
* **Must be an enrolled student at University of South Florida**
+ All other applicants from different schools will not be considered at this time

* Minimum of 2 years college education in Business, Finance, or job-related degree. Seeking 2024 and 2025 Graduates.
* Must be a team player and maintain a professional image
* Must be able to prioritize work and effectively manage time.
* Displays a high level of professionalism
* Good quality computer skills, including Microsoft Word, Excel and PowerPoint
* Excellent interpersonal relations skills.
* Good written and verbal communication skills.
* Detail oriented and self-motivated.
* Ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment.
* Comfortable interacting with senior management and / or non-technical members of the organization

title: Financial Analyst
description:
Opening our doors in 2017, Starlight Homes builds homes designed specifically for the first-time homebuyer. Our goal is to make the dream of homeownership a reality for everyone, offering expertly crafted homes at an affordable price and ensure its customers’ first journey into home buying is simple, smooth, and reassuring. Together with our parent company, 2023’s Builder of the Year Ashton Woods, we have welcomed over 60,000 people to their new home. Our company’s commitment to innovation and continually evolving to meet the needs of the market is a key reason for our success. Headquartered in Atlanta, Georgia, Starlight Homes sells new homes in Atlanta, Austin, Charleston, Dallas, Houston, Nashville, Orlando, Phoenix, Raleigh, San Antonio and Tampa.

**Position Overview:**  
The Financial Analyst position is responsible for supporting the land and finance departments in such areas as land acquisition and development support, financial analysis, reporting, forecasting, budgeting, invoicing, and fee payments.

  
**Responsibilities:**

* Assist in the preparation of project proformas, land banking cash flows, land books, quarterly forecasts, annual plans and other financial projections.
* Control costs by tracking and analyzing land budgets and actuals, project schedules and preparation of cost to complete analysis.
* Assist with community pricing, spec home and backlog margin review and updating Schedule D assumptions for sold homes.
* Prepare and assist with sales margin calculations, land and Indirect cost allocations, construction variance and warranty spend analysis.
* Process and track all fee payments, check requests, bond requests & releases and electronic payments associated with land entitlements/development.
* Ensure all land entitlement/development invoices meet necessary internal requirements, lien waivers and budget coding before submitting to Accounts Payable for payment.
* Manage and update land wires projections; prepare and initiate outgoing wires.
* Support the central accounting team with the monthly close process and reporting.
* Maintain monthly sales pipeline report.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, business, real estate, or related degree.
* At least four (4) years of experience in accounting/finance, performing financial planning, budgeting and analysis.
* Experience in production home building and/or land development preferred.
* Experience with generally accepted accounting principles and cost accounting.
* Experience with Microsoft Excel, Word, Outlook, Power Point and MS Project.

title: Bilingual (Spanish / English) Business Analyst - Operations
description:
**Bilingual (Spanish / English) Business Analyst - Operations**

USC Consulting Group is a forward moving consulting firm with a reputation of excellence since 1968 that partners with clients to provide greater value and competitiveness within their businesses. We provide multiple skills and business techniques such as: systems solutions, data analysis, process improvement, quality function deployment, continuous flow manufacturing and integrated supply chain management.

A Business Analyst with our firm will work as a team member and be assigned to feasibility studies at one of our prospect or client locations. Through practical technique applications, the Business Analyst will benefit from the extensive experience of the USC team members. You will learn the needed skill sets and business analysis techniques required to be successful in our business. You will be responsible for building relationships and coordinating activities with both our USC feasibility study team, as well as with our prospects and clients. The position’s responsibilities are within the scope of analysis management, which focuses on understanding and mapping out process workflows across a variety of industries, in order to identify specific areas of improvement opportunity. Methods applied could be work task analyses, organizational structure review, span of control analyses, performance data mining and review of the effectiveness of the management operating systems, processes, and work disciplines. We work closely with our prospects and clients in a partnership to achieve measurable results in process flow, productivity improvement as well as performance management.

FUNCTIONS AND DUTIES:

**This is a bilingual role within our analytical and business development department. Must be fluent with reading and writing in Spanish.**

The ideal Business Analyst candidate has previous experience working for a consulting firm, functioning in an Analyst / Operations Management role. The Business Analyst can see “muda” or waste when touring a facility or reviewing performance data and translate these into meaningful business opportunities, that drive tangible and measurable value for the prospect or client. The ideal candidate has previous experience as an Analyst with an implementation management consulting firm focusing on operational excellence. This individual can demonstrate:

• Experience across multiple industries and verticals, including experience working internationally.

• Possesses 5-10 years of experience in this specific role.

• Practical experience analyzing multiple work streams, the ability to identify all types of waste, associated non-value added activities and their root cause(s).

• Practical experience converting identified waste into business opportunities and tangible, measurables financial benefits.

• "Street credibility" (i.e., understanding how the technical and tactical elements of large ticket “process improvement initiatives are sold”).

• Experience working in diverse industry segments, selling comprehensive MOS solutions into related environments, i.e.: product development, supply chain, and/or manufacturing, food processing, capital intensive and/or commodity-based operations.

• Strong understanding of front-end SI&OP, planning and scheduling methodologies, related supply chain, product development, and various production, manufacturing operations, asset management and logistics.

• Being adept verbally and with writing skills at clearly articulating issues, selling into new accounts, and possesses a demonstrated ability to develop, qualify, and close large, sometimes politically complex business opportunities, while handling objections seamlessly.

• The ability and willingness to learn, listen, understand, and continually improve his/her skills, without being told to do so.

• Being a team player, able to work effectively with others in structuring, selling and on occasion, supporting delivery of value-added services to top tier clients.

• Travel is dependent on study needs and client requests, but you can live anywhere in the continental U.S or Canada.

TECHNOLOGY EXPERIENCE:

* Advanced computer skills; including MS Office Suite, MS Project, Power BI, Tableau, Web conferencing, and CRM.
* Possessing a working knowledge of Current Business Technology Tools including SPC data analysis, and Power BI. Candidate is well versed in Business Techniques such as APM (Asset Performance Management), Lean Six-Sigma, Spend / Sourcing.

KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIRED:

* Possess a thorough understanding of all aspects of the Analysis process and Analysis tools utilized.
* Exceptional observation, analytical, numerical reasoning, business acumen and leadership skills
* Prior consulting experience preferred.
* Understanding of how technical and tactical elements of large ticket “process improvement initiatives” are sold.
* Excellent communication skills in Business English and Spanish (read, write, speak)
* Ability to balance delivery of results, problem solving, and client management.
* Superior time management skills and the ability to keep the analysis and preparations on schedule to meet critical deadlines.
* Strong ability to review, analyze and present large amounts of data within short time frames.
* Professional in appearance and conduct.
EDUCATION AND WORK EXPERIENCE:  


* An undergraduate business-related degree (advanced degree is a plus).
* Experienced in working diverse industry segments selling comprehensive MOS solutions into related product development, supply chain, and/or manufacturing operations.
* Ability to travel up to 75%.
* Ability to work on international assignments.
* Have a valid driver’s license, and a Canadian or US Passport.

BENEFITS:

The company provides excellent benefits and covers most of the cost for employees. Employees contribute a small percentage to medical and vision plans, but the company fully covers the cost of a telemedicine plan, dental, life insurance, AD&D, STD, and LTD.

PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, and use hands to finger, handle or feel objects, tools, or controls. The employee is constantly required to talk or hear clearly on the phone and in person. The employee is occasionally required to reach with hands and arms and stoop, kneel, or crouch.

The employee must regularly lift and/or move up to 10 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, peripheral vision, depth perception, and the ability to adjust focus.

Must be able to spend extended periods of time on aircraft in-flight and travel long distances.

  


We are a Drug-Free Workplace

This job description is not intended to be all inclusive. Employees may perform other related duties as instructed to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
Salary:   
**This is a 100% remote position, and candidates must be located in the eastern or central time zone.**

**Target salary $55,000 - $70,000**

  


About Us!

  


**Ascension Recovery Services (Ascension RS)** is considered an industry leader in developing and managing comprehensive, fully integrated behavioral health systems, treating SUD and co-occurring mental illness across the full continuum of care. Our mission is to provide culturally competent, comprehensive and fully integrated, behavioral health care to communities and populations that are underserved and/or where people in need are not accessing care. Our experience in the development of treatment facilities encompasses the entire continuum of care, including detoxification and residential treatment facilities, outpatient programming, sober living homes/recovery residences, peer support services, and job training / workforce reintegration.

  


**The **Financial Analyst will be a key part of the team supporting the Consulting division of Ascension RS. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter, professional who is proficient in excel, and an efficient multi-tasker who takes initiative!****

  


**Accountabilities**

* Create budgets for startup expenditures for new substance use disorder treatment programs to include Residential Treatment (RT), Partial Hospitalization (PHP), and Intensive Outpatient Programming (IOP)
* Forecast financial outcomes of the new center to include Balance Sheet, Income Statement, Statement of Cash Flows
* Establish budgeted operating costs for new centers.
* Perform Monthly Budget vs Actual Variance Analysis
* Provide Revenue Cycle Management Assistance
* Complete Other Ad Hoc Analysis
* Deliver Daily Census and Monthly Key Performance Indicator Reporting
* Provide insight to accounts receivable and chargebacks of the new facility (i.e. collection, billing, etc.)
* Develop the estimated revenue stream, through reimbursement rates, from a variety of payers (commercial insurance, Medicaid, self-pay, etc.)
* Establish an annual budget for these various behavioral health / addiction treatment programs, to include RT, PHP, and IOP
* **Core Values** - Promote and adhere to the workplace values of kindness, teamwork, empathy, integrity, excellence and mission

  


**Education and Experience**

* Bachelor’s and/or master’s degree in finance, accounting, or business (health administration
* Direct experience with insurance reimbursement rates (commercial insurance and Medicaid preferred)
* High comfort level with financial reporting on a granular basis to a variety of internal and external constituents
* Revenue cycle experience preferred.
* Direct experience with developing and managing an annual budget.
* Minimum of two years of experience in accounting and/or financial management required; healthcare experience strongly preferred.

title: Financial Analyst, FP&A - Tampa, FL
description:
**Description/Job Summary**

**Summary**

The **Financial Analyst, FP&A** is expected to support month end close reporting, budgeting and forecast reporting, and additional ad hoc work. This position is heavily involved in report building and review, as well as consolidation of data from business units and other sources. In addition, this individual will assist with building presentations for company leadership.

  


 We offer a competitive salary with a range of $65,000-$85,000 based on experience and skill set.   
 A variety of benefits are also available, including medical, dental, life insurance, short-term and long-term disability, as well as Signode's 401(k) program. 

  


**Essential Functions**

* Support the FP&A budgeting and forecasting process, building reports and schedules to collect and analyze information from the business.
* Support month-end reporting activities to ensure timely, well-presented, and accurate P&L, cash flow, and variance analysis.
* Analyze financial results, including both the P&L and balance sheet, and balance sheet, to assist with strategic guidance and decision making.
* Help prepare presentations for the Board of Directors and Senior Management
* Support the development of system solutions and process improvements that meet the needs of the business.
* Ad hoc support and requests.

  


**Position Qualifications**

**Education:** Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Finance or Business Administration.

**Experience:** 2-3 years finance experience. Strong proficiency in with Microsoft Excel. Hyperion Financial Management and / or OneStream experience a plus.

**Functional Success Drivers:** These competencies are what we require for an individual to be successful in this role.

* Interpersonal Savvy
* Communication (Written and Oral)
* Organization / Planning
* Intelligence
* Learning on the Fly
* Time Management

To perform this job successfully, the individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Reasonable Accommodations may be made to enable qualified individuals with disabilities.

title: FIAR/ RMIC Financial Analyst
description:
**SEPS -** FIAR/RMIC Analyst- Financial Management

  
Pueo is known for bringing the best talent and unique tools to every opportunity. Pueo's Parliament (aka workforce) is composed of professionals who are seeking the opportunity to work in a small business with a flat organization that thrives on career development and independence. In support of mission and professional growth, our Parliament has supported the development of multiple patents, proprietary tools, and applications as well as trademarked processes.

Our flat organization emphasizes career development across multiple career environments (at the members own pace) and ensures those who contribute broadly are properly rewarded. Pueo has four career environments where every member of the parliament can participate. Each environment has opportunities available for all levels. Opportunities are framed by an employee's desires and capabilities, and we ensure challenges, growth, and unique experiences are available for employees at all levels.

Our Career Environments (Program, Functional, Service, and Leadership) provide numerous opportunities for employees to invest in their personal growth and those things that offer fulfillment. We invest in helping our members create and execute their career development plans. Our Pods (small teams of 5 or less) are comprised of personnel with similar skillsets to ensure mentorship, understanding, and peer support.

**Role:** Pueo has an opportunity for an experienced Secret cleared FIAR/RMIC Analyst- Financial Management to join our team in Tampa. FL. The FIAR/RMIC Analyst is responsible for ensuring FIAR compliance and financial reporting in direct support for SOCOM. 

**Responsibilities:**

* Development and implementation of corrective action plans (CAPs), prepare and deliver audit sample packages, development of process control narratives (PCNs), develop and conduct audit training,
* Audit remediation requirements for DoD,
* Evaluating program deficiencies and preparing briefings for GO/FO/SES level DoD leadership to address solutions,
* Justifying policy change, systems acquisition, or budget justification,
* Government Finance and Execution including use of systems such as: Procurement integrated Enterprise Environment (PIEE), EDA, DEAMS, FM Suites, Defense Travel System (DTS), CRIS, DAI, ADVANA, G-Invoicing, researching/coordinating financial and contractual information,
* Development and implementation of Corrective Action Plans (CAPS), prepare and deliver audit sample packages, development of Process Control Narratives.

**Qualifications:**

* An active Secret clearance,
* 2+ years' experience in preparing financial and material management reports IAW FIAR compliance or other FIAR-related activities that clearly demonstrate expertise in FIAR requirements,
* Master's Degree in one of the following disciplines: Accounting or Finance, Business Management or Business Administration, OR Licensed CPA with a B.S. Degree in Accounting or Finance, OR 10 years' experience in Financial Management, with a B.S. Degree in one of the following disciplines: Accounting or Finance, Business Management or Business Administration Transcripts.

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Experience with DoD or other federal agency in Financial Management Financial Management experience includes activities such as monitoring budget execution, preparing financial documentation and reports, preparing trial balances, reconciling accounts, and other accounting functions, budget formulation, completing financial transactions in accounting and financial management systems, auditing, or similar tasks.

  
Pueo is an equal employment opportunity employer and affirmative action employer. All interested individuals will receive consideration and will not be discriminated against on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, or protected veteran status. Pueo takes affirmative action in support of its policy to advance diversity and inclusion of individuals who are minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
Description:*Senior Financial Analyst*

Description

**Summary**

Specialty Dental Brands (SDB) is a leading dental service organization focused on partnering with the best doctors with a proven track record of patient care and community involvement. We provide proven operational support, technology, and overall practice management across a nation-wide network of leading class pediatric dentistry, orthodontics, and oral surgery platforms. We are looking for talented and highly motivated individual who has a natural desire to improve and build new processes and thrive in a start-up culture and rapidly growing business.

Specialty Dental Brands is looking for a highly motivated **Senior Financial Analyst** to be a key member of its enterprise finance team who has a natural desire to improve and build new processes in a fast-growing startup culture. This position will support the financial and business planning activities of various units throughout the organization with hands-on forecasting, budgeting, analysis, data management and reporting. The position is based out of the Nashville HQ and reports to the Business Unit FP&A Director.  
  


We are looking for a hands-on financial management professional, comfortable playing a lead role in the management, reporting, and analysis of their business unit throughout the organization.

**Job Type**

· Full-Time

· Hybrid after onboarding period can be earned 

· Some travel may be required; 4-8 times per year

· Based out of SDB basecamp location in Nashville, TN

**Organizational Alignment:**

· Reports to: Business Unit FP&A Director

· Oversees: 

· Other Key Relationships: General Manager, Regional Director, other members of the FP&A Team

 **Responsibilities**

· Supports the preparation of the monthly operating review package and communication to practice 

· Aids in enhancing financial literacy with practice level practice managers and doctors

· Reports, tracks, and monitors financial metrics and assists in identifying abnormalities relative to practice production

· Performs ad-hoc analysis to aid in decision support interfacing with various departments throughout the enterprise

· Contribute to the completion of project milestones and organize own work to meet project task deadlines

· Collaborate closely with data source providers and technology teams to ensure that key decision data is accurate, automated, and timely

· Understand and apply knowledge of best practices for data extraction and manipulation

  


Requirements:**Required Minimum Qualifications**

· 3 years progressive experience

· A bachelor’s degree in finance, economics, or accounting

· Excellent analytical and communications skills

· Understanding of financial statements

· Ability to positively manage change and multiple priorities in response to shifting demands

· Experience working with data mining and reporting tools (SQL, Excel, PowerBI)

· Knowledge of GAAP and all aspects of general accrual and cost accounting

· Highly driven and self-motivated with keen attention to detail and organized

title: FP&A Analyst - Virtual/Remote
description:
Enumerate needs a **Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst** for our rapidly growing team!Enumerate has grown rapidly through acquisitions and is backed by a leading Boston-based private equity firm. We expect to continue with strategic acquisitions while diversifying our product offerings to include payments-related services for its core HOA customer base.  
  
In this role, you’ll be responsible for budgeting and forecasting as well as the development and delivery of actionable and insightful analyses of both retrospective trends (actual v. planned) and prospective opportunities. Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will have a leading role in identifying, implementing, and improving upon these core requirements.  
  
You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. This position is remote eligible, with a preference for candidates in CST/EST. **Who will love this job**  
* Someone who is a critical thinker with a meticulous approach, high initiative, and the ability to explain financial concepts in “plain English” to non-financial stakeholders

**You should have*** Required: 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, either within a corporate Finance, FP&A function, or within investment banking, commercial banking, or private equity.
* Required: Bachelors in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other highly quantitative discipline.
* Required: Experience with SaaS (or subscription) revenue recognition, including familiarity with standard SaaS metrics/ KPIs.
* Fluency in O365- especially Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
* Strong financial modeling skills in Excel including a working knowledge of 3 statement models.
* Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.
* Ability to work in the US without sponsorship.
  
**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. When possible, we also like to offer fun in-person perks like pet-friendly offices, paid food trucks and company outings.

title: Staff Accountant
description:
Our company is growing rapidly and is searching for experienced candidates for the position of construction accountant. Thank you in advance for taking a look at the list of responsibilities and qualifications. We look forward to reviewing your resume.

Responsibilities for construction accountant

· Setting up a paperless office system including organized storage of all correspondence, contracts, bills, POs, liens, and other documents related to construction projects and accounting

· Process all accounts payable and accounts receivable

· Recognize revenue appropriately throughout the course of the project

* Prepare, distribute, and collect supplier lien waivers on a monthly basis for each job.
* Maintain proactive communication with suppliers and customers to ensure forecasted AP and AR targets are being met.

· Preparation of monthly financial statements (balance sheets, income statements and month-end close) GL account review and reconciliation including G&A analysis

· Job cost analysis and reporting

· Prepare audit work papers and schedules

· Analysis of project expenditures and project accounting transactions

· Prepare monthly loan draw request for multiple construction projects and monitor job costs projects

· Review and process subcontract and consultant payment requests

· Prepare bank reconciliations and accrual entries

· Monitor subcontractor contracts and commitments

· Performing day-to-day accounting functions such as month end close, variance analysis, financial reporting, AP, AR, and billing

· Maintenance of General Ledger

· Monitor job progress and any potential overruns against purchase orders or budgets

Qualifications for construction accountant

· Three plus years of experience providing attest services in a professional services firm

· Construction & Real Estate experience with demonstrated technical expertise in this industry highly preferred

· Analyze situations and data to resolve existing or potential problems

· Plan and monitor the activities of areas

· Proficient in PC based applications such as Excel

· Good management and organizational skills including the ability to work on several projects simultaneously, meet critical deadlines, and determine the priority of assignments based on deadlines that must be met

Skills for Construction Accountant

Desired skills for construction accountant include:

Construction cost accounting and general accounting

Accounting and internet software

Microsoft Excel

Microsoft Outlook

Microsoft Word

Concepts

Financial applications

ComputerEase software experience preferred but not required

Construction cost accounting and general accounting principles

Construction process

Education:

Bachelor's Degree in Accounting or similar

title: Domo Data Analyst (REMOTE)
description:
Everlight Solar is seeking a skilled Data Analyst who will design and maintain functional programs and applications, producing fully functional software applications according to requirements. As a Data Analyst, you play a key role in serving our clients and team members. This will be a full-time, work-from-home "remote" position.

**This is a role for Apple power-users, must know iWork and be skilled with iOS and macOS.**

Everlight Solar is a rapidly growing company and the leader of solar energy in the Midwest. We offer a unique experience that fosters individual growth and rewards performance. Our culture at Everlight is extremely important to us. The work environment is fast-paced and dynamic. We value teamwork, quality, innovation, and customer success. Our ideal candidate is self-motivated, detail-oriented, has excellent problem-solving abilities, is passionate about delivering results on-time, exceeding expectations, and ensuring success for our teams.

**Responsibilities:**

* Work with large amounts of data to draw meaningful conclusions
* Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
* Provide regular reporting and analysis to team
* Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key metrics and performance indicators
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify areas for improvement and to develop solutions to enhance business operations
* Provide training and support to team members on data analysis techniques and tools

**Requirements:**

* Minimum two years of experience with DOMO
* MajorDOMO Certification Required
* 3+ years experience in data analysis, reporting, business intelligence or financial analysis and a Bachelor's Degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Computer Sciences or related field or equivalent experience
* 2 years experience in providing people analytics reporting to organizations
* Demonstrated experience using SQL, and DOMO
* Experience with sensitive and confidential people data in a global environment
* Analyze, evaluate, improve, and document processes and workflows. Identify and take advantage of opportunities for process automation and simplification.
* Proven ability to design and implement new processes and facilitate user adoption.
* Strong understanding of Salesforce.com best practices and functionality
* Strong data management abilities
* A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion
* A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
* Excellent project management skills and a positive attitude
* Must demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills
* Must demonstrate ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization
* Must own a Mac computer and be fluent with the Apple ecosystem of software (iOS, macOS, iWork, etc.)

**Benefits:**  


* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Life Insurance
* PTO
* Sick and Safe Time
* Paid Holidays Off

**Salary: $65,000-$100,000/ year**

*Everlight Solar is proudly an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity of all types and are excited to work with talented individuals from a wide range of backgrounds. Everlight is committed to inclusion and we invite people of any race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex, age groups (18+), and levels of education to apply. Authorized to work in the US and background check required.*

title: Associate Financial Advisor
description:
**Associate Financial Advisor  
Location**: Memphis, TN **(RELOCATION TO MEMPHIS IS REQUIRED FOR THIS JOB!**)  
**Compensation**: $90,000 - $100,000  
**Status**: Full-time  
  
The best and brightest in the financial advisory industry always have choices in the wealth management arena. Working with us is an investment in your future that will reap rewards for years to come.  
  
We are a close, tightly knit team that works collaboratively to bring our values to life each day: hard work, humility, optimism, responsiveness, and doing whatever needs to be done to make things right. Our office is committed to delivering high-quality, high-touch experiences to our clients so that, no matter whom they work with, clients know that they are receiving our utmost attention. Being their advocate is the highest honor for us!  
  
We are excited to have an opportunity to welcome a **Associate Financial Advisor** to our team! If you love solving problems, we would love to hear from you. We enjoy sharing what we have learned over the years while embracing the unique points of view that new teammates bring to the table. The attributes that we look for in teammates include:

 

* Insistent attention to detail and follow-through
* Strong team player
* Self-management
* Commitment to exceeding client expectations
* Careful listening skills
* Client first mentality
* High ethical standards
* Consistently providing high quality work
* Ability to work autonomously within an area of responsibility, as well as collaboratively to contribute to the overall client experience
* Flexibility and openness to work on varied assignments with people across the firm
* Ability to learn quickly and improve upon established processes
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills, quickly connecting with others to build relationships within the firm and across our client base
* Ability to convey complex planning issues to clients in easy-to-understand language
* Drive with a desire to be a long-term contributing member of the team
* Growth-oriented: holding a long view of the opportunities presented by the firm and the industry overall

  
**Get in touch today** so that we can get to know you! You will work with some of the most successful business owners, families, and individuals around. You will provide life-changing support to clients who look to us as advocates for their hopes and dreams. Utilizing best-in-class resources and technology, you will roll up your sleeves and work in collaboration with a senior advisor to tackle complex financial, estate, and tax planning situations and deliver an experience to clients that is second to none.  
  
Interested in more details? As a **Associate Financial Advisor**, you can expect to:

 

 

* 
+ Work alongside a lead advisor to learn about our clients, processes, and value proposition
+ Prepare for and attend client meetings by running reports, creating financial plans (both initial and updated), utilizing Holistiplan and reviewing prior notes
+ Provide service to a subset of the lead advisor’s client base after introductions are made; service additional clients may be identified in the future
+ Demonstrate the ability to communicate with clients in terms that they understand, minimizing use of jargon or technical terminology
+ Participate and listen carefully in client and planning meetings and translate the discussions into a strategy for data collection and analysis to help drive financial planning efforts; calculate projections; Take notes in meetings, complete follow up, and correspond with clients
+ Interview clients about their attitudes, financial constraints, and goals; identify and clarify client needs; review statements provided by clients
+ Continuously stay in relationship with clients and understand their unique circumstances, connections, talents, interests, etc.
+ Field calls and prepare for review meetings (reviewing notes, updating plans, determining contributors/detractors to portfolio performance, etc.) for all lead advisor’s clients.
+ Meet with clients to review paperwork; ensure all required forms are completed accurately and answer client requests in an appropriate time frame
+ Support teammates in the financial planning process
+ Create personal financial statements
- Conduct monthly/quarterly/ad hoc client reporting

+ Generate reports, such as position statements, for meetings with clients
+ Organize data
+ Conduct research as requested
+ Complete accurate financial plans in Right Capital and MoneyGuidePro; utilize Holistiplan as needed for tax planning needs
+ Perform complex analysis of planning strategies, risks, and opportunities in the areas of retirement planning, tax planning, estate planning, cash flow planning, asset allocation, asset protection, etc.
+ Develop client deliverables and reports in a timely, accurate, and informative manner

* Respond to client service needs throughout the year
* Research new products and services that will enhance client relationships or fulfill clients’ short- and long-term financial needs; conduct research
+ Stay current on trends in the financial planning area; read trade journals, books, and other publications. A premium subscription to www.kitces.com will be provided.
+ Recommend new or updated tools and resources to keep the firm on the cutting edge (e.g. regarding customer relationship management, trading models, etc.)
+ Draft letters as needed
+ Assist with workflow needs in the office:
- Maintain updated client contact records using CRM software
- Follow up on outstanding transactions with our custodian Commonwealth/NFS (e.g., transfers)
- Maintain up-to-date and organized client files, making sure documents are in the correct folder on the shared hard drive and also uploaded and shared with clients in the client portal.

  
Qualifications for this role include:

 

* Bachelor’s degree in a related discipline
* CFP®, designations a bonus; pursuit of the CFP designation is a job requirement
* Minimum of one year of experience as a financial planner in the financial services industry; experience working with Fidelity processes and forms a plus
* Series 65 required
* Strong understanding of financial planning concepts and terminology
+ Knowledge of mutual fund, stock, bond, insurance, and annuity products
+ Exposure to estate planning issues, tax loss harvesting and asset positioning

* Excellent people skills, including:
+ Active listening
+ Effective communication
+ Professional, knowledgeable demeanor

* Ability to establish rapport with clients and coworkers
* Attention to detail
* Lifelong learner/deep desire to grow and learn
* Genuine interest in helping people
* Self-confidence; able to act decisively and humility to accept feedback.
* Ability to:
+ Proofread and quality check own work in accordance with firm criteria
+ Proactively relate internal concerns to lead advisor
+ Identify and solve problems in a timely, efficient, and effective manner
+ Use resources available to answer questions and resolve problems (e.g., COMMunity Link, operations manual, office procedures, etc.)
+ Use multiple technology platforms (e.g., CRM system and Right Capital, etc.) Proficiency with computer software, including the Microsoft Office Suite (Excel and Word), Right Capital, Holistiplan and CRM
+ Prioritize workload and meet deadlines
+ Work independently
+ Keep lead advisor updated on all client information via Trello or email

* Demonstrated job stability and career progression

  
Successful candidates will be supported in their career progression. For example, an Associate Financial Advisor who wants to become a Lead Financial Advisor will be provided with training and mentoring to help them move into a lead position. They will have opportunities to Senior Financial Advisor/Partner as they master increasing levels of responsibility in the organization. Your commitment to our firm will be reciprocated by our investment in you and your future!  
  
**We welcome a diverse pool of applicants from various backgrounds and urge you to apply to learn more about what we offer and see if it might be an attractive fit for both of us and you. We look forward to meeting you!  
  
#ZR**

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
Spreetail propels brands to increase their ecommerce market share across the globe while improving their operational costs. Learn how we are building one of the fastest-growing ecommerce companies in history: www.spreetail.com.  

Spreetail is hiring a Sr. Financial Analyst who will lead all financial analysis, reporting, forecasting, planning, and optimization for our Platform Services Division. This team will support both day-to-day financial reporting and long-term/strategic projects. As our business continues to grow, strong financial acumen and leadership in this space will ensure we are correctly prioritizing our investments and providing the leadership with the visibility and insights needed to run the business. If you take pride in having ownership and making a large impact, keep scrolling.
### **How you will achieve success:**

* Operate and become known as a trusted advisor to the Supply Chain organization; work closely with the Chief Supply Chain Officer, VP of Fulfillment Centers, and VP of Transportation to drive savings, find efficiencies, provide business support, and drive accountability
* Lead outbound Allocation Optimization and modeling across all 3P partners, with close collaboration with the Supply Chain Transportation team
* Drive the budgeting/planning process, financial analysis of key business operations, and performance management for all Transportation and Fulfillment Centers; ensure the timely and accurate development of monthly, quarterly, and annual forecasts, variance analysis, and budgets
* Create forward-looking financial models and analyses to support key future growth opportunities and strategic projects
* Lead the Supply Chain Finance Team as the company grows; lead, coach, and mentor team members in an ambiguous/dynamic environment, while also managing day-to-day activities with an eye towards continuous improvement

### **What experiences will help you in this role:**

* Experience with Pivot Tables, XLOOKUP, VLOOKUP, and SUMPRODUCT.
* 5+ years in being a building financial models and forecast.
* Demonstrated experience successfully leading cross-functional projects.
* Demonstrated significant initiative, tenacity, and leadership in prior roles.
* Previous experience in analytical roles with an emphasis on business partner support


#LI-MM1  

In an effort to Make Spreetail Better, we hire people that are aligned with our values and are passionate about pursuing ecommerce excellence. We believe the right person can learn what is needed to succeed in their role, so we encourage job applicants to apply even if you don't meet all the qualifications listed. We are looking for diverse backgrounds and perspectives, so we don’t require college degrees and welcome non-linear career paths. If this role highlights your experience and gets you excited – please apply!  

Not the role for you? Check out additional opportunities to join our team on our job board and sign up for our Talent Community Newsletter for exclusive insights into future openings. **What you can expect from us:*** **The flexibility to take care of yourself.** Spreetailers operate in a relationship and experience-driven work culture that promotes results and encourages taking time off when needed. Salaried team members enjoy untracked PTO and hourly team members earn 20 PTO days per year.
* **We invest in your growth.** Our in-house Talent Development team will fuel the impact you can make in your career through leadership development workshops and one-on-one coaching.
* **We believe in celebrating your accomplishments.** Each year is a new milestone with the opportunity to receive special gifts, Spreetail Swag Store credit, or donate to a nonprofit of your choice.
* **We’ll take care of you and your family.** Spreetail will cover 100% of health insurance premiums for you and 50% for your partner and dependents included on the plan, as well as support your growing family with paid time off.
* **The opportunity to revolutionize your community.** With two Volunteer Weeks and 24 hours of paid Community Time Off every year, we encourage team members to give back and make a social impact.

  

Learn more about our full benefits package including parental leave, domestic partner coverage, unit appreciation rights, and more. **Equal Opportunity Employer**
At Spreetail, we are relentless in our pursuit of equity and equality, we embrace cultural differences that raise our bar, we pursue the challenges within ourselves to make Spreetail better, and we humbly acknowledge our duty to build and foster an inclusive workplace where all may succeed.

Spreetail is an affirmative action and equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, disability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, or genetic information.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**Financial Analyst**
**Job Type**
Full Time  


**Position Summary:**
* The Financial Analyst liaises between programs, accounting, support teams, and vendors. This individual will conduct high-level analysis of financial statements, project analysis, and execution throughout the organization.


**Job Duties:**
* Serve as primary point of contact for all financial matters for designated programs.
* Create, prepare, analyze, and report operational and financial performance.
* Provide regular and consistent analysis as part of agency-wide month-end process.
* Take a leadership role in establishing grant and program budgets.
* Guide financial statement analysis process by utilizing and enhancing existing analytical tools, providing trends and forecasts; educating programs about processes and techniques; recommending actions.
* Prepare deliverables (reports and presentations).
* Analyze, interpret, and communicate revenue and billings to programs.
* Recommend improvement actions by analyzing and interpreting data, identifying trends, and making comparative analyses.
* Coordinate with Finance and Leadership teams to review financial data and forecasts.
* Cross-train and provide back-up for other members of the Finance team as needed.
* Evaluate profit and cost efficiencies in various areas of the organization as needed.
* Forecast models for revenue changes and expenditure increases/decreases.
* Participate in cross functional groups to address key issues facing the organization.
* Display a courteous and caring attitude to clients, volunteers, and visitors of the Agency.
* Cooperate and collaborate with program area staff, volunteers, and other Agency staff.
* Assist with process improvement and quality improvement activities.
* Abide by all specific program and Agency procedures, policies, and requirements.
* Develop personal and program related skills through participation in internal and external training opportunities including printed material and audio and/or visual media.
* Strive to make connections between the agency and the larger community whenever possible to contribute to the agency’s ongoing fundraising and friend-raising efforts.
* Perform other job-related duties as assigned.


**Required Skills/Abilities:**
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to maintain favorable relations with internal and external partners.
* Excellent attention to detail with strong organizational skills.
* Excellent initiative and time management skills with a proven ability to meet deadlines.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* Self-starter with ability to effectively deal with uncertainty and complex situations.
* Ability to listen, synthesize what is being examined, and form action plans based on discussions.
* Ability to be objective, logical, and systems oriented.
* Team leadership skills required to develop and implement efficient work processes.
* Ability to prioritize tasks and to delegate them when appropriate.
* Ability to act with integrity, professionalism, and confidentiality.
* Awareness and sensitivity of the constituents and populations served by employees.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office Suite or related software.
* Participate in Performance & Quality Improvement (PQI) activities as assigned.
* Regular and predictable attendance, and promptness for work.
* Commitment to uphold the mission, vision, values of Lutheran Family Services.
* Support Lutheran Family Services in the organization’s objective to be a diverse, equitable, inclusive, and accessible workplace.


**Position Competencies:**
* Taking Initiative
* Adaptability
* Critical Thinking
* Organizational Skills
* Leadership


**Education and Experience:**
* Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Business Administration, or related work experience required.
* Three to five (3–5) years of progressive experience in non-profit finance, healthcare finance, or related business environment, including project management.
* Experience in healthcare/insurance billing preferred.
* Knowledge of budgeting, forecasting, productivity, cost accounting, and financial analysis.
* Demonstrated understanding of and ability to work with people of diverse backgrounds.


**Physical Requirements:**
* Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.
* Hybrid work environment (primarily in-office with remote opportunities as available).
* Company-issued laptop and cell phone.
* Must be available during core work hours as directed by leadership and attend all necessary meetings as needed.


***Lutheran Family Services is an equal opportunity employer. We do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment on the basis of age, race, religion, color, ethnicity, disability, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, or national origin.***

title: Program Control and Financial Analyst
description:
Program Control and Financial Analyst
Job Category: Finance and Accounting
Time Type: Full time
Minimum Clearance Required to Start: None
Employee Type: Regular
Percentage of Travel Required: Up to 10%
Type of Travel: Continental US
\* \* \*
CACI is seeking a Program Financial Analyst experienced in managing government contracts to join our team. As a Program Financial Analyst, you will be responsible for all program level financial analysis and reporting. Requirements may include: management and review of costs and funding, revenue and profit recognition and forecasting, internal and external customer reporting and invoicing support, direct and indirect rate analysis, annual and multi-year planning, monthly forecasting, program compliance with FAR/DFARS and GAAP regulations, and program setup and maintenance.


What You’ll Get to Do:

* The candidate functions as an effective business partner, providing support to Work Plan Managers in the preparation, analysis, and submission of project financial data and other contract-, project- or business-related tasks.
* This position will provide financial support and analysis for planning, forecasting and decision making and overall delivery of financial commitments.
* Ensure assigned day-to-day operations are carried out in accordance with monthly deadlines and established accounting and contractual policies and procedures.
* Manage portfolio and individual work plan funding and PoP, including providing inputs to customers on incremental funding needs and notifying of limitation of funds.
* Baseline and monitor progress of program requirements and cost performance against plans to ensure contractual cost obligations are met.
* Responsible for supporting the timely preparation of invoices, coordination with the PMO, required adjustments to the invoices, invoice support schedules, and ongoing analysis of billed and unbilled receivables.
* Responsible for maintaining program data in CACI financial systems, including contract/program setup, and establishing charge strings for timekeeping and required reporting.
* Duties include subcontractor/consultant financial management such as issuing funding, timesheets, monitoring spend plans, invoice approval, etc.
* Support material procurement process including estimating costs for licenses, materials, equipment, etc.
* Reviews, coordinates, and provides documentation to support various internal and external audit requirements.
* Work collaboratively with other CACI functional personnel (contracts, subcontracts, accounting, billing, etc.) to support program and business objectives.

  

You’ll Bring These Qualifications:* Minimum of 7 years’ experience in finance-related roles supporting government contracts.
* Bachelor's degree in a business, finance, or quantitative related discipline is highly desired.
* Subject Matter Expert with overall program control and financial analysis support.
* Must be able to analyze plans, forecasts, actual costs, variances and communicate trends to leadership.
* Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel and be able to build reports and charts for various internal and external requirements.
* Working knowledge of standard government contracts including FAR/DFARS clauses.
* Ability to handle multiple and shifting priorities efficiently and effectively while meeting internal & external deadlines.
* Must have excellent verbal/written communication skills and effective interpersonal skills to build relationships with leadership, program managers, customers, and functional counterparts.
* A strong candidate will be able to assess existing financial processes/methodologies, recommend improvements, and be able to implement.
* Ability to investigate complex accounting and financial tracking data to resolve issues.
* Experience providing coaching, mentoring, and reviews of work of lower-level professionals.


These Qualifications Would be Nice to Have:

* Experience with Deltek/Costpoint and Cognos Enterprise Reporting.
* Knowledge of all Contract types: CPFF, T&M, FFP.
* Experience working with financial reporting tools.
  

What We Can Offer You:  

  

* We’ve been named a Best Place to Work by the Washington Post.

  

* Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives.

  

* We offer competitive benefits and learning and development opportunities.

  

* We are mission-oriented and ever vigilant in aligning our solutions with the nation’s highest priorities.

  

* For over 60 years, the principles of CACI’s unique, character-based culture have been the driving force behind our success.
 **Company Overview:**


CACI is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic.

**Pay Range**: There are a host of factors that can influence final salary including, but not limited to, geographic location, Federal Government contract labor categories and contract wage rates, relevant prior work experience, specific skills and competencies, education, and certifications. Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives. We offer competitive compensation, benefits and learning and development opportunities. Our broad and competitive mix of benefits options is designed to support and protect employees and their families. At CACI, you will receive comprehensive benefits such as; healthcare, wellness, financial, retirement, family support, continuing education, and time off benefits. Learn more here


Since this position can be worked in more than one location, the range shown is the national average for the position.


The proposed salary range for this position is:


$74,600-$156,700

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**POSITION SUMMARY:** Under the direct supervision of the Finance Director and CFO, this position will be responsible for budgeting, forecasting, financial reporting, and various analysis metrics. This position works closely with managers focusing on researching and analyzing financial information to help the organization make well informed decisions. In addition, this position answers non-routine correspondence and assembles highly confidential and sensitive information for a diverse group of stakeholders within and outside of the organization.

**POSITION-SPECIFIC COMPETENCIES/ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS/DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Assist with the development of the organization’s annual operating and capital expenditure budgets.
* Perform monthly analysis of the organization’s actual financial results in comparison with budgets.
* Provide recommendations and alternatives to increase revenue, reduce expenses, and improve financial performance.
* Provide monthly financial reports and presentations for management meetings.
* Ensure accuracy, completeness, and conformance to standards defined within the department and funding source, and aligned with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) principles.
* Prepare internal reports for program managers and directors to assist with proper and relevant decision making.
* Assist with annual program or grant budget preparation.
* Assist with analyzing program or grant activities in comparison to budgets.
* Assist with annual Audit preparation.
* Attend departmental/Center-wide meetings as required.
* Perform other duties and special projects as assigned.

* Required Education: Bachelor’s degree in finance, Economics, Accounting, Business Administration, or related discipline.
* Desired Education: Master of Business Administration degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, Business Administration, or related discipline
* Required Experience: Proven work experience as a Financial Analyst – 3+ years
* Desired Experience: Previous experience working with Blackbaud – Financial Edge NXT software application in a hospital or medical environment
* Required Skills: Communication and computer skills with proficiency in Microsoft Excel spreadsheets, financial software applications, and Microsoft Power Point presentations
* Desired Skills: Leadership, interpersonal, financial modeling, and presentation skills
* Language: Fluent in English
* Hours of Work: Monday – Friday 8am-5pm
* Travel: Local as required

title: Financial Analyst
description:
Come join a fast-growing team that provides you with the opportunity for advancement! We also have a Gym, Cafe, and Garage Parking as a benefit. This team is growing fast, and we are looking for an initiative-taker, adaptive learner, and someone with a background in accounting and finance!

 **Overview of the Roles and Responsibilities:**


Our financial analyst is a member of the executive leadership team reporting to our VP of Finance, this team is critical in driving the company's financial planning. This position reports to and collaborates with the VP of Finance to create and establish yearly financial objectives that align with the company's plan for growth and expansion. The analyst will strategize with the financial team organizational structure for the company and oversee the various functions and processes ensuring compliance and risk mitigation.

 **Job Duties:**


This professional will be responsible for preparing the company's financial reports as directed by the VP of Finance, which includes balance sheets and income statements. They will also assist in compliance audits and monitoring internal controls to ensure that everyone is adhering to policies and procedures set forth by the financial team.


This role is critical to assist the VP of Finance in delivering all financial information which will assist the team on developing financial strategy, financial decision-making, identifying efficiencies and opportunities for cost reductions across the business.


The financial analyst will be assigned to complete the traditional duties such as closing the books and regulatory compliance, balanced by supporting company strategy, together with the VP of Finance.


Assess and evaluate the financial performance of an organization regarding long-term operational goals, budgets, and forecasts.


Provide insight and recommendations to both short-term and long-term growth plan of organization.


Evaluate departments and make suggestions for automating processes and increasing working efficiency.


Communicate, engage, and interact with the VP of Finance to deliver on all projects and the day-to-day business financial operations of the company.


Participate in pivotal decisions as they relate to strategic initiatives and operational models which is led by the VP of Finance and the team.


Collaborate with VP of Finance with regards to client pricing to ensure company profitability.


Process Maps and SOPs for department functions.

 **Financial Analysis, Budgeting and Forecasting:**


Review and analyze monthly financial results and provide recommendations.


Develop and maintain monthly operating budget and annual company operating budget.


Prepare and present monthly financial budgeting reports including monthly profit and loss, forecast vs. budget and weekly cash flow.

 **Accounting, General Ledger, Administration and Operations:**


Prepare and communicate financial statements.


Ensure compliance regarding all financial functions.


Work with Human Resources to ensure appropriate legal compliance.


Review and ensure application of appropriate internal controls, compliance, and financial procedures.


Perform the month-end closing process, constantly reviewing procedures while eliminating inefficiencies.


Prepare and review all month-end closing activities and process general ledger accounts, balance sheet accounts and overhead cost allocation.


Enhance and implement financial and accounting systems, processes, tools, and control systems!


Serve as a key point of contact for external auditors; Manage preparation and support of all external audits.


Work with the VP of Finance on projects and financial reports which are required to enhance their knowledge of the company!

  



**Financial Management:**


Manage cash flow planning process and ensure funds availability.


Maintain outstanding banking relationships and strategic alliances with vendors and business partners.


Utilize forward-looking models and activity-based analyses to provide financial insight into the organization's plans and operating budgets.


Maintain accounts payable, accounts receivable and provide guidance relating to the collection process.


Responsible for the timely process of payroll

 **Financial Relations and Policies:**


Engage with VP of Finance to develop short term and long-term plans, projections, and budgets.


May represent company to banks, financial partners, institutions, investors, public auditors, and officials.


Remain current on audit best practices as well as state, federal and local laws.


regarding company operations.

North End Teleservices recruits qualified applicants without regard to characteristics such as race, color, national origin, religion, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, veteran status, age, marital status, citizenship status, or any other status protected by law.*
