title: Financial Analyst
company: The University of Vermont Health Network
description:
This role has a flexible office (some days virtual) arrangement after completion of the training period. Any remaining work days will be in the office in South Burlington, VT.


The UVM Medical Center Business Analysis team is seeking a motivated individual with strong Excel and analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to confidently communicate and collaborate with people at all levels of the organization. They will provide the financial support for both clinical and nonclinical operational leaders across the hospital.


As a Financial Analyst on this team, you will:

* Partner with operational leaders to build annual budgets and provide ongoing analytical support,
* Work independently and with a team to support your operational leaders in decision-making that impacts The University of Vermont Medical Center and The University of Vermont Health Network, and
* Thoroughly understand the areas you support in order to creatively problem-solve and develop proactive solutions.


JOB DESCRIPTION:


Provide the primary financial management and related analysis support for one or more assigned clinical business units (e.g. Health Care Service divisions). Act as the liaison for Finance by interpreting the finance support needs of his/her customer group(s)and responding to those needs by facilitating the application of appropriate resources in conjunction with Finance. Organize and present the financial basis for strategic and operational decision making by his/her customers’ leadership team.


EDUCATION:


Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or related discipline preferred. An equivalent combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge and abilities were acquired will be considered.


EXPERIENCE:


Three to five years of related experience that demonstrates knowledge and familiarity with health care finance, accounting and budgeting.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
### **Description**


*Position at KORE Solutions*
KORE Power, Inc. (KORE) is the leading U.S.-based developer of battery cell technology for the clean energy industry. With clients in energy storage, e-mobility, utility, industrial and mission-critical markets, KORE Power provides the backbone for decarbonization across the globe. As the first U.S.-based, American-owned, and fully integrated provider of cells, batteries, and solutions, KORE is uniquely positioned to serve these markets. Through the construction and operations of its large-scale battery cell manufacturing facility in the U.S., KORE is positioned to operate at 12 GWh per year capacity. The facility (the “KOREPlex”) will operate with net-zero carbon emissions through strategic partnerships and solar and storage co-generation.





KORE Power’s differentiated approach provides customers with direct access, unparalleled service, superior technology, and Tier 1 product availability. Focused on building sustainable communities, clean energy jobs, and green economic expansion, KORE Power is proud to offer a functional solution to real-world problems and fulfill market demand to deliver a zero-carbon future.





KORE Solutions, a division of KORE Power, Inc., in Waterbury, Vermont, provides custom power and battery energy storage solutions for all applications. Our products meet any energy demand and are designed to operate under any condition using clean energy sources. We have systems on every continent and in every environment.





We offer employees competitive wages and outstanding benefits in a casual but professional work environment. We are a growing company with a dedicated team supporting one another based on open communication and teamwork.


**Job Overview**
KORE Solutions is seeking an experienced Senior Financial Analyst to join our Finance department. The Senior Financial Analyst’s main responsibilities include financial modeling, budget development and reporting, margin analysis, monthly close support, and revenue forecasting.**Responsibilities*** Creates financial models to support decision making.
* Analyze business operations and strategies to identify new opportunities.
* Provide analytical, forecasting, reporting, and project support to senior management.
* Identify cost reduction initiatives to increase gross margin.
* Produce monthly reports, which include key metrics, financial results, and variance reporting.
* Assist with the annual and quarterly budgeting and forecasting processes.
* Assist with monthly and quarterly reporting.
* Respond to information requests by management.


**Reports To**
The position reports to the Director of FP&A
To be successful in this role, you should be able to timely and accurately perform your duties, pivot to the requests of management, and identify and communicate any issues or concerns in a timely manner. Further, you should possess and demonstrate excellent communication, organizational, and analytical skills.
**Qualifications*** Master's degree in accounting or finance; or relevant work experience
* 3+ years of financial planning & analysis experience.
* Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office, especially Excel.
* Working experience with an ERP/EMP system preferred.
* Strong numeracy and analytical skills.
* Good problem-solving and time-management skills.
* Highly organized and detail oriented.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.


**Physical Requirements**
Ability to communicate orally. Hearing and vision within normal ranges with or without an assisted hearing device.
No heavy lifting is expected, though occasional exertion of up to 25 lbs. of force may be required.
**Work Environment**
The position is full-time in-person/on-site.
The job is primarily performed indoors in a traditional office setting. Extended periods of sitting and extensive work at a computer and phone are normal.*KORE Power is an equal employment opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristics with respect to employment opportunities.*

title: Net Revenue Finance Analyst Sr.
company: The University of Vermont Health Network
description:
***This is a fully remote position.***


JOB DESCRIPTION:


The Senior Net Revenue Finance Analyst is responsible for overseeing the maintenance of the monthly Accounts Receivable net revenue model and schedules, and administering the Kodiak Revenue Cycle Analytics system. The Senior Net Revenue Finance Analyst is a key organizational contact related to all AR and net revenue questions and audits, for both internal leaders and external financial auditors, and provides internal training and education to organizational leaders and peers. The Senior Net Revenue Finance Analyst is a high level independent contributor within the UVM Medical Center. Successful performance in this position directly impacts the financial performance of the organization and is highly visible to Senior Leadership.


EDUCATION:


Minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in finance, accounting or related business discipline required. CPA or Master’s Degree preferred. An equivalent combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge and abilities were acquired may be considered.


EXPERIENCE:


Three or more years of progressive, successful experience in health care finance or accounting required. At least two years of experience in health care AR valuation preferred. The candidate must possess a proven ability to perform sophisticated data analysis and present results to financial and operational leadership.

title: Health System Finances Principal Analyst
description:
**Overview**
------------



The Green Mountain Care Board (GMCB) seeks a Financial Analyst to review, analyze, evaluate, and monitor the healthcare financial activity of Vermont's healthcare system. The Health Systems Finance Principal Analyst will be a member of the Health Systems Finance Team in its financial oversight work relating to the financial budgets and inter-period reporting of Vermont's 14 Community Hospitals, the Brattleboro Retreat, and the All-Payer Model/Accountable Care Organization (APM/ACO). Duties are performed under the general direction of the Director of Health Systems Finance. Additional duties will include developing workflows and using new financial data platforms, such as Tableau, to keep data and reports up-to-date and improve overall efficiency.

  


The Board supports a telework/flexible work environment.


**Who May Apply**
-----------------



This position, **Health Systems Finances Principal Analyst (Job Requisition #49213)**, is open to all State employees and external applicants.  

If you would like more information about this position, please contact Matthew Sutter at matthew.sutter@vermont.gov.  

Resumes will not be accepted via e-mail. You must apply online to be considered.


**Environmental Factors**
-------------------------



Duties are performed mainly in a standard office setting but with frequent need to attend and-or chair meetings in a variety of department, state, and private settings, frequently involving work outside of normal office hours. Travel is involved for which private means of transportation must be available. Short notice of critical meetings, quick deadlines for important reports, and need for rapid response to federal or legislative inquiries can be assumed.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------



Associate’s degree or higher in accounting, finance, statistics, economics, business administration, or related field AND four (4) years or more of experience with accounting, budgeting, fiscal auditing or analysis, or related field that includes experience managing programs, funding sources, or staff.  

OR  

Six (6) years or more of experience with accounting, budgeting, fiscal auditing or analysis, or related field that includes experience managing programs, funding sources, or staff.


**Preferred Qualifications**
----------------------------



Master’s degree or higher in relevant field.  

Experience in program planning and/or evaluation.  

Experience working with regulatory boards under Vermont’s Open Meeting Law.


**Total Compensation**
----------------------



As a State employee you are offered a great career opportunity, but it's more than a paycheck. The State's total compensation package features an outstanding set of employee benefits that are worth about 30% of your total compensation, including:


* 80% State paid medical premium and a dental plan at no cost for employees and their families
* Work/Life balance: 11 paid holidays each year and a generous leave plan
* State Paid Family and Medical Leave Insurance (FMLI)
* Two ways to save for your retirement: A State defined benefit pension plan and a deferred compensation 457(b) plan
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Flexible spending healthcare and childcare reimbursement accounts
* Low cost group life insurance
* Incentive-based Wellness Program
* Qualified Employer for Public Service Student Loan Forgiveness Program


Want the specifics? Explore the Benefits of State Employment on our website.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
------------------------------


The State of Vermont celebrates diversity, and is committed to providing an environment of mutual respect and meaningful inclusion that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The State does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, membership in an employee organization, family medical history or genetic information, or family or parental status. The State’s employment decisions are merit-based. Retaliatory adverse employment actions by the State are forbidden.

title: Cost/FP&A Analyst
description:
**JOB SUMMARY:**

STC’s Cost & Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) Analyst maintains and monitors cost and manufacturing accounting process and provides financial planning and analysis to support continued profit and productivity improvement for the business.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

* Participate in the month-end close, including preparation of required journal entries, account reconciliations, and prepare month end operating review analysis package.
* Lead preparation of the monthly forecast and quarterly operating review.
* Lead and coordinate inventory costing process.
* Coordinate and compile annual physical inventory including end of life and full absorption reserve balances.
* Participate in the annual strategic planning and budgeting processes including establishing assumptions, spreadsheet modeling, consolidation, analysis and presentation preparation.
* Prepare and present various daily and weekly operating metrics to monitor business performance.
* Analyze variances in sales, manufacturing, and general expenses ensuring alignment with budget, forecast, and prior year.
* Analyze and propose improvements in working capital.
* Analyze and review bills of material to ensure accurate product costing.
* Prepare and review product cost estimates as requested by the Sales and Engineering Departments.
* Perform product line profitability analysis.
* Prepare ad-hoc financial analysis to support senior management decisions.
* Support integration into new parent company.

**DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:**

* Degree in Accounting or Finance and/or MBA required.
* 5-7 years of accounting and experience, including cost, in a manufacturing environment.
* Experience in preparing, analyzing, and implementing accounting and reporting requirements.
* Excellent computer and technological skills, including high proficiency in Consolidation Systems, ERP, and Microsoft Office Applications preferred.
* Superior verbal and written communication skills.
* Works effectively in a team environment, within and outside of the Finance Department.
* Consistently operates at the highest level of integrity and is never willing to compromise with regards to ethical standards.
* Working knowledge of SQL a plus

**INTERPERSONAL QUALIFICATIONS:**

Success in this position requires the ability to build a strong partnership with the FM and Business Unit Senior Managers and frequent communication with finance peers. These relationships must be built on respect, integrity, cooperation, teamwork, and professionalism.

* Ability to build relationships at all levels within the organization.
* Clear, precise communication skills.
* Strong business acumen and analytical skills with a demonstrated ability to gather, analyze and present data.
* Operations and commercial literacy.
* Ability to organize multiple responsibilities and deliver results in an accurate and timely manner while adapting to changes in priorities.
* Ability to influence and strategically partner with individuals of various educational and technical backgrounds, both inside and outside the organization.
* Detail and process oriented.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines under pressure.
* Self-starter with a strong sense of urgency and follow up skills.

**WORKING CONDITIONS:**

Work is normally performed on site in St. Albans, Vermont. Office work is performed in a climate-controlled office environment, but substantial time on the shop floor is required, which can be noisy and dusty, as well as hot during the summer. Proper safety equipment is provided by STC where necessary. Travel is anticipated to be a low percentage of time.

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:**

Work involves standing and walking for moderate periods of time, with some duties performed from a seated position. There is potential for eyestrain from reading detailed materials and computer screens. Deadlines, workloads during peak periods, and changing priorities may cause increased stress levels. Work may include occasional lifting and carrying objects or pushing/pulling carts weighing approximately 50 pounds, such as products, tools, gages, and equipment. Work normally requires finger dexterity and eye-hand coordination to operate computer keyboards at a moderate skill level. Repetitive motion injuries may occur. The company will provide adaptive devices as needed.

**Superior Technical Ceramics Corporation is an equal opportunity employer and offers employment opportunity to all qualified persons without regard to race, creed, color, religious belief, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, ancestry, place of birth, physical or mental disability, or veteran status.**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Will you now, or in the future, require sponsorship for employment visa status? (e.g. H-1B visa status)

Work Location: In person

title: Financial Analyst | Finance
description:
onsite  

South Burlington, VT


**Description**


At Beta Technologies, we apply our intellectual curiosity, passion for aviation, and commitment to sustainability toward a shared mission of revolutionizing electric aviation. Regardless of the position one holds, each team member brings their talent and desire to positively impact the environment and lives of others in a refreshing, vibrant, and inclusive culture.  

The Financial Analyst will support Beta Technologies’ financial health through planning and budgeting, integrated financial planning, management and performance reporting, and forecasting and modeling. The analyst will apply FP&A solutions to enhance the finance team's ability to update the company’s operating model, maintain a partnership with team leads, and create internal and externally viewed presentations. The ideal candidate will be a driven problem solver with the ability to work in a dynamic, undefined, fast-paced environment.  


**How you will contribute to revolutionizing electric aviation:**

* Maintain and update the company’s operating model using Adaptive (forecasting software)
* Partner with team leads and TeamOps to understand headcount, non-recurring engineering, other budgeting, and capital expenditure needs, including preparation and distribution of variance analysis
* Provide transactional and due diligence support of corporate M&A activities and capital raises (debt & equity)
* Prepare presentation materials (and supporting analyses and models) for regular leadership reviews, including Executive Team and Board of Directors’ presentations
* Work closely with the accounting and operations teams to understand activity and communicate key points to team leads and leadership
* Identify and drive process improvements and productivity enhancements by developing dynamic reporting/forecasting tools and driving the creation of standard and ad-hoc reports and dashboards


**Minimum Qualifications we are seeking:**


* Experience with Microsoft Excel/Google Sheets (advanced formula writing, complex charts and graphs), Google Slides, PowerPoint
* Ability to comprehend, analyze, and interpret complex financial information and transactions
* Basic understanding of accounting principles (accruals, revenue recognition, etc) and Non-GAAP metrics (EBITDA, Adjusted Earnings)
* Strong organization skills, ability to prioritize and to manage multiple ongoing work streams
* Strong communication, listening, presentation, and writing skills
* BS in Finance or Accounting (or a similar business field)


**Above and Beyond Qualifications that will distinguish you:**


* In-depth knowledge of ERP Systems (PLEX) and manufacturing processes
* Familiarity with budgeting and forecasting software (Adaptive)


**Physical Demands and Work Environment:**


* Periodic extended working hours (especially around the time of board meetings)
* Occasional work with incomplete information and ambiguity
* Ability to operate autonomously in an area which is still developing processes and procedures
* High-paced environment and ability to adjust focus quickly

  


***Inclusivity Statement****Each of our backgrounds influences how we evaluate our own abilities. Research reveals that BIPOC, LGBTQ+, women, those from working-class backgrounds, individuals with disabilities, and other marginalized groups may hesitate to apply for roles if they don't meet all the requirements. Many skills can be learned on the job. If you can envision contributing value to our community and meet most criteria, we encourage you to apply.* *BETA Technologies provides equal employment opportunity to all individuals regardless of their race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, ancestry, place of birth, citizenship, disability, veteran or military status, health coverage status, HIV status, genetic information, crime victim status, pregnancy or a pregnancy-related condition or any other characteristic protected by state, federal, or local law. The company does not discriminate, and will not discriminate, and will not tolerate discrimination, based on any of these characteristics during the application process or in employment.* *All offers of employment at BETA Technologies are contingent upon favorable results of a thorough background check.* *BETA Technologies is an E-Verify employer.*

title: Financial Analyst

As an active member of the Sponsored Project Administration (SPA) grant lifecycle team and a subject matter expert, the financial analyst administers a portfolio of sponsored projects in compliance with applicable award and sponsor-specific guidelines, federal regulations, and University policies and procedures. title: Manager/Senior Manager, Interconnections and Grid Analysis
description:
Invenergy drives innovation in energy. Powered by decades of entrepreneurial experience and unparalleled execution, we solve the energy challenges facing our customers and communities. We provide power generation and storage solutions at scale around the world to create a cleaner energy future. We develop. We build. We own. We operate. We are Invenergy.  
  
This position will be open for application for at least 3 calendar days from the posting date. This position will remain open for application based on business need, which may be before or after the 3-day posting window.  
  
Job Description  
  
Position Overview  
  
The Manager/Senior Manager, Interconnections and Grid Analysis will develop delivery solutions, including transmission solutions for the different utility-scale generation projects. The Manager/Senior Manager, Interconnections and Grid Analysis will monitor transmission expansion plans, develop entrepreneurial transmission solutions and assist sales. The Manager/ Senior Manager, Interconnections and Grid Analysis will be responsible for Transmission/Interconnection functions of the company with NYISO and ISONE regions.  
  
Responsibilities - Act as a primary point of contact for all large-scale generation interconnection activities including:  
* Manage the interconnection queue by submitting applications coordinating with developers, finance and consultants.
* Act as primary interface for ISOs, RTOs and Transmission Service Providers. Coordinate with regulatory team and manage the stakeholder meetings with various Utilities and ISOs and serve as point of contact for the region to maintain queue positions.
* Perform power flow analysis as part of generation development activities.
* Review complex utility studies (feasibility, system impact, and facility) and utility expansion plans to identify potential opportunities.
* Support the Origination, Development, Regulatory, Asset Management, Commercial Analytics and Engineering teams in development and business strategies including:
* Participate in the negotiation of delivery agreements with utilities.
* Evaluate and support sales opportunities.
* Develop conceptual design of interconnection facilities and costs.
* Provide assistance during project design and construction for interconnection related issues.
* Interpret market rules as they apply to the interconnection study, construction, operation of generation projects.
* Provide assistance to trading in developing and implementing bidding and risk management strategies.
* Attend relevant ISO stakeholder and state regulatory meetings.
* Participate in various industry groups dealing with interconnection and market issues.
* Provide assistance with electricity market congestion issues.
* Manage other Transmission staff members as needed.
* Collaborate with other groups in the organization including Finance, Operations and Commercial Execution
* Assist with development of international projects as necessary.
* Advise executive team and other senior management in key generation and transmission projects' decision-making process.

  
Manager, Interconnections & Grid Analysis Minimum Qualifications:  
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in electrical engineering
* 4+ years of experience in transmission system planning or operations including power flow, short circuit, and stability.
* Experience with NYISO interconnection process and understanding of planning processes in NYISO

  
Senior Manager, Interconnections & Grid Analysis Minimum Qualifications:  
* Bachelor's or Master's degree in electrical engineering
* 4+ years of experience in transmission system planning or operations including power flow, short circuit, and stability.
* Experience with managing the NYISO interconnection process and advanced understanding of planning processes in NYISO

  
Preferred Qualifications  
* Experience with cross functional project coordination with development, finance, legal, regulatory etc
* Exhibit high level of individual initiative for developing innovative solutions and strategies.
* Knowledge of FERC and NERC standards related to transmission and interconnections, including Open Access Transmission Tariff (OATT).
* Knowledge of electricity market rules (day ahead, real time, capacity, ancillary services, etc.).
* Experienced in the use of power flow software such as TARA, PSS/E, PowerWorld or similar software package.
* Proficiency in spreadsheet modeling using Microsoft Excel.
* Strong verbal and written communication skills.
* ISO experience preferred.

  
#LI-REMOTE  
  
Salary Range  
  
Manager, Interconnections & Grid Analysis Salary Range: $155,000 - $175,000  
  
Senior Manager, Interconnections & Grid Analysis Salary Range: $180,000 - $195,000  
  
Benefits  
  
Eligible for medical, dental, vision, 401(k), bonus, paid time off, etc.  
  
Invenergy LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to, among other things, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, status as a protected veteran, or disability.

title: Business Analysis
description:
SCOPE OF WORK   
 PURPOSE     
 BACKGROUND  
   
 The BA will work with State resources to elicit, document, and validate business  
 processes, requirements, a release plan/schedule and a minimum viable product  
 (MVP). The BA will further assist the CCB in describing and documenting new  
 processes including key materials, resources and responsibilities as prescribed by the  
 CCB and as required; these operational processes should be the genesis and basis for  
 system requirements.    
 State Project Oversight  
 The Business Analyst shall work with an assigned Project Manager and/or Oversight  
 Project Manager (OPM), from the State Enterprise Project Management Office  
 (EPMO). The SProject Manager and/or OPM shall provide project  
 oversight and guidance on behalf of the client in accordance with their  
 statutory obligation to oversee, monitor, and control State of Vermont information  
 technology activities.   REQUIREMENTS:  
 The selected vendor's resource must satisfy the following requirements:  
 Demonstrated, strong elicitation skills  
 Knowledge and experience with Cannabis legislation, regulation and enforcement to  
 include implementing related software (highly preferred)  
 Demonstrated ability to perform work independently in a self-directed manner  
 Demonstrated experience performing as a Business Analyst on an Agile/Scrum Team  
 (product owner experience is preferred)  
 Business Analyst Deliverables: The Business Analyst shall follow business analysis  
 methodologies that are consistent with the IIBA Business Analysis Body of Knowledge  
 (BABOK) Guide and Agile/SCRUM processes.  
 Azure DevOps   
 The Business Analyst, in conjunction with the State, will utilize the State's Azure  
 DevOps tools as the single source of truth for the tracking of project requirements in the form of epics, features, user stories, as well as creating and executing user  
 acceptance testing, to include bug and issue tracking. The BA shall also be responsible to:  
 1. Analyze and define business objectives and strategies utilizing business process  
 reengineering, future state workflow development and analysis, and use of related  
 tools/techniques to identify opportunities for process improvement.  
 2. Provide input to State leadership, IT architects, and project managers to ensure  
 successful design, development, and implementation of the new CCB system and/or  
 requiredsystem integrations.  
 3. Obtain and maintain a thorough understanding of business concepts and processes  
 related to the CCB.  
 4. Facilitate/participate in Joint Application Design (JAD) sessions for both   
 5. Creation of test plans and test cases, that includes User Acceptance Testing (UAT)  
 training materials and guides, as well as execution and tracking of testing to ensure  
 all test cases are completed or retested as needed until satisfactory use of the system  
 and interfacesare fully validated, and results archived. The RTM must be kept up to  
 date throughout the testing process.  
 6. Coordinate and collaborate with various project team members and stakeholders to  
 ensure all requirements including solution design are implemented.  
 7. Work as liaison to assist communications between end users and IT development  
 staff, including state staff and outside vendors.  
 8. Organize and facilitate technical planning meetings as required.  
 9. Assist as needed in development of CCB reporting needs (design, development,  
 testing, and validation).  
 10. Provide weekly input to the Project Manager for status reporting on work  
 completed and targeted for next period.

title: Chief Financial Officer - Manufacturing Solutions Inc.
description:
* **Client:** Manufacturing Solutions, Inc.
* **Website:** msivt.com
* **Role:** Chief Financial Officer
* **Location:** Morrisville, Vermont

**About Manufacturing Solutions**

Since 1996, Manufacturing Solutions Inc. (MSI) has been a trusted provider of contract manufacturing services, logistics, and fulfillment. Over the last decade, MSI has diversified to include significant business units including commercial and residential rental estate rental, commercial real estate development, and commercial site development and construction.

Based in Morrisville, VT, our 200-person strong team is dedicated to delivering competitive solutions that prioritize quality, delivery, and productivity, enabling clients to focus on their core business strategies. Through business diversification and reinvestment, we seek to leverage resources to expand our robust community and build sustainability as an employer of choice for Lamoille County. Our strong organizational culture is driven by our core values: accountability, flexibility, collaboration, productivity, solutions orientation, diversity, and wellness.

**Your Impact**

MSI is seeking a dynamic and experienced Chief Financial Officer (CFO) to join our executive team. The CFO will play a crucial role in shaping our financial objectives and driving our strategic expansion. While overseeing all aspects of the finance and accounting organization, we are also seeking a strategic leader capable of scaling our operations while managing business risks. The ideal candidate will excel at balancing short and long-term needs across functions to advance the business in alignment with MSI's strategy and values and will not hesitate to engage in hands-on work when necessary. As part of our tight-knit team and a family-run business, we value leaders who can seamlessly transition between strategic planning and practical implementation. MSI is poised for sustained rapid growth and this is an exciting opportunity for a CFO to make a significant impact and contribute to our continued success.

**Your Role**

 **Strategy:**

* Serve as a key strategic advisor to the CEO and COO, providing insightful financial analyses and actionable recommendations to drive informed business decisions.
* Collaborate with the leadership team to develop and execute a comprehensive financial business strategy that optimizes revenue generation while effectively controlling expenses to enhance customer service and quality.

**Financial Analysis:**

* Utilize advanced data analysis techniques to identify sales trends, analyze labor and material costs, and develop comprehensive company-wide annual budgets and 3-year business forecasts incorporating high/low/nominal sales revenue models and corresponding expense projections.
* Identify and communicate opportunities to maximize return on investment (ROI), outlining the potential trade-offs of investments across different business segments.

**Finance Operations:**

* Lead the Accounting and Finance departments, ensuring alignment with MSI's mission and values, and fostering a high-performing team through staff training, orientation, performance evaluations, and effective mentorship and coaching to cultivate a culture of continuous learning and professional excellence.
* Oversee the implementation and optimization of financial software systems to streamline accounting processes, enhance financial reporting accuracy, and improve decision-making capabilities.
* Participate in business development efforts, including negotiating contracts and developing new business opportunities to support MSI's growth objectives.

**Transactional:**

* Oversee debt and equity financing activities, strategically managing cash flow and reviewing loan rates to minimize interest expenses and optimize financial resources for MSI; maintaining relationships with creditors.
* Manage the coordination and services of independent accountants, ensuring timely resolution of financial reporting issues and compliance with regulatory requirements.

**Fiduciary:**

* Coordinate all financial reporting activities including organizational and divisional revenue/expense and balance sheet reports, reports to funding agencies, and the development and monitoring of organizational and contract/grant budgets.
* Produce monthly financial reports, including reconciliations with the 401k plan, balance sheet, profit and loss statement, fixed asset workbook, accounts payable, accounts receivable, and cash flow projections.
* Ensure compliance with all federal and state tax-related filings requirements.

**Required Experience**

* Minimum of 5 years of experience in finance management, with at least 3 years in a CFO role or similar position required.
* Bachelor’s degree in accounting, business administration, or a related field required; CPA desired.
* Demonstrated expertise in GAAP accounting principles and strategic financial planning.
* Proven history of driving financial performance and aligning strategies with overarching business goals.
* Proficiency in complex financial forecasting and strategic financial modeling.
* Strong leadership acumen with a decisive approach to driving strategic initiatives and leading change.
* Exceptional communication skills and a collaborative demeanor, fostering effective cross-functional teamwork and external partnerships.
* Advanced proficiency in financial software and tools, enabling insightful analysis and accurate reporting.
* Comprehensive experience in risk management, including proactive identification and mitigation of financial risks.
* Comfortability in understanding federal and state income tax regulations and ability to interact with outside advisors to minimize tax costs.
* Demonstrated ability to adapt to dynamic operational demands and deliver results with precision.
* Exemplary commitment to upholding MSI's core values and setting a standard for ethical leadership.

**Benefits and Perks:**

* 401(k) matching
* Quarterly performance-based bonus structure
* Health insurance
* Health savings account
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Employee discount
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Professional development assistance
* Retirement plan
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance
* Wellness program

**Equal Employment Opportunity**

 All potential employees are evaluated without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, gender identity, ancestry, place of birth, marital, sexual preference or veteran status, the presence of a non-job-related handicap or any other legally protected status.

#MSI

FP&A Analyst - Virtual/Remote
description:
Enumerate needs a **Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst** for our rapidly growing team!Enumerate has grown rapidly through acquisitions and is backed by a leading Boston-based private equity firm. We expect to continue with strategic acquisitions while diversifying our product offerings to include payments-related services for its core HOA customer base.  
  
In this role, you’ll be responsible for budgeting and forecasting as well as the development and delivery of actionable and insightful analyses of both retrospective trends (actual v. planned) and prospective opportunities. Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will have a leading role in identifying, implementing, and improving upon these core requirements.  
  
You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. This position is remote eligible, with a preference for candidates in CST/EST. **Who will love this job**  
* Someone who is a critical thinker with a meticulous approach, high initiative, and the ability to explain financial concepts in “plain English” to non-financial stakeholders

**You should have*** Required: 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, either within a corporate Finance, FP&A function, or within investment banking, commercial banking, or private equity.
* Required: Bachelors in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other highly quantitative discipline.
* Required: Experience with SaaS (or subscription) revenue recognition, including familiarity with standard SaaS metrics/ KPIs.
* Fluency in O365- especially Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
* Strong financial modeling skills in Excel including a working knowledge of 3 statement models.
* Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.
* Ability to work in the US without sponsorship.
  
**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. When possible, we also like to offer fun in-person perks like pet-friendly offices, paid food trucks and company outings.

title: Principal Financial Analyst
description:
Principal Finance Analyst  
The Principal Finance Analyst distills technical analysis of the current financial climate and trends in financial performance into reports and recommendations for how the business operates. By gathering, analyzing, preparing and summarizing recommendations based on financial analysis, he/she will be critical in advisement of business moves such as acquisitions, operational forecasting and other financial plans. Growth is contingent on finding new avenues to stretch; being well-informed on the financial environment allows us to measure the risk and move forward.   
  
Rewarding Impact. Fulfilling Careers.   
  
Making an impact isn't something reserved for people in corner offices. It comes from people in every corner of the office. People with ambition, optimism and courage. We provide growth and opportunity and give employees flexibility in how they get the job done. You might not expect that from a big company, but we're smart enough to know how to hire the best and when to step aside and let them lead. Our goal is that you never stop learning and you never cease to amaze--especially yourself. If this fits your career goal, we can't wait to welcome you on board.   
  
Responsibilities  
 * Develops, interprets and implements financial concepts for financial planning and control.
* Performs technical analysis to determine present and future financial performance.
* Gathers, analyzes, prepares and summarizes recommendations for financial plans, acquisition activity, trended future requirements and operating forecasts.
* Performs economic research and studies in the areas of rates of return, depreciations, working capital requirements, investment opportunities, investment performance and impact of governmental requirements.
* Having wide-range experience, he/she uses professional concepts and company objectives to resolve complex issues in creative and effective ways.
* Ability to draw on past experience and current data to influence business partners and provide insightful analytics.
* Ability to challenge conclusions and impact business outcomes.
* Extensive knowledge of planning and forecasting with ability to work independently to identify initiatives and recommend actions to business and finance overall.
* Works on complex issues where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors.
* Exercises judgment in selecting methods, techniques and evaluation criteria for obtaining results.
* Networks with key contacts outside own area of expertise.
* Ability to produce strategic analysis to proactively identify issues and provide potential actions.
* High level of expertise in planning & forecasting and levers impacting profitability.
* Ability to influence outcomes and business partner decisions (viewed as trusted business advisor) with extensive subject matter expertise.
* Works in larger cross-functional teams with ability to influence senior leaders in Finance and Business.
* Determines methods and procedures on new assignments and may coordinate activities of other personnel.

Qualifications  
 * Advanced degree in finance and relevant experience in planning & forecasting/budgeting required.
* Requires a minimum of 6 years of experience and a Master's degree or a PhD with 3 years of experience, or equivalent experience.

   
*\*Rainmaker is a search firm focused in Finance, Accounting, Tax, Audit, Risk & Compliance,Treasury, M&A, Investor Relations, Financial Data, Business Intelligence and Analytics recruiting.* *Certified Woman Owned Business by WBENC**7 Consecutive Years named a Largest Executive Search Firm by Cincinnati Business Courier**Largest Women-Owned Business by Columbus Business First**To view more active searches visit our website:**www.RainmakerResourcesLLC.com*

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**Financial Analyst for Family Office**

***This full-time, onsite role is located in the Cincinnati/Northern**-Kentucky area.* 

The Family Office Analyst will be an integral part of the Family Office Team, providing diversified support to the Director, Family Office and Investments as well as Family Members.This dynamic position involves overseeing accounting and finance deliverables, preparing detailed financial statements, and producing investment performance reports. 

As a self-starter, the Family Office Analyst will contribute to the growth of the family office, actively participating in initiatives and gaining hands-on experience. This position offers a unique opportunity for the right candidate to thrive in a supportive and collaborative environment, with ample room for professional growth and advancement within the organization. 

In this role, the ideal candidate will be dynamic and versatile. They will have strong finance accounting background and the ability to navigate complex financial issues to find creative solutions. 

 **Duties and Responsibilities**

**Investment Management:**

* Assist in monitoring investment activities, evaluate performance, and propose adjustments while maintaining accurate books and records.
* Generate detailed investment reports and conduct research on existing and potential investments.
* Stay updated on market trends, presenting findings to the team and gaining exposure to a wide range of asset classes and investment types.

**Financial Reporting:**

* Prepare comprehensive financial reports and analyses for the Director, providing insights into the family’s financial position and investment performance.
* Maintain schedules and reports needed for tax reporting.
* Monitor and evaluate financial trends, highlight potential areas for optimization.

**Accounting & Accounts Payable/Receivable Oversight**

* Oversee day-to-day accounting operations, ensuring accuracy.
* Manage accounts payable/receivable, and reconcile financial discrepancies related to investment and personal activities.
* Prepare capital calls and distributions, monitor cash balances within the various entities maintained.

**Budgeting and Forecasting:** 

* Contribute to the development and maintenance of family and entity budgets.
* Provide input on financial forecasts and variances.

**Collaboration:**

* Work collaboratively with team members to support overall family office objectives.Liaise with external partners, financial institutions, and relevant stakeholders.
* Liaise with external partners financial institutions and relevant stakeholders.

**Learning and Development:**

* Proactively engage in continuous learning to develop expertise in accounting, finance, and investment analysis.
* Take initiative in acquiring new skills and knowledge relevant to the role.

 **All other responsibilities and special projects as assigned.**

Qualifications & Requirements * Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field.
* Proven experience in accounting, finance, and investment analysis.
* Strong analytical skills with attention to detail.
* Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills.
* Demonstrates ability to assume ownership, work independently and achieve results.
* Experience with or willingness to learn investment strategies and reporting.
* Experience using PowerBI or similar Business Intelligence tools preferred.
* Highest standard of integrity, discretion, confidentiality, and professionalism

Competitive compensation package based on the candidate’s experience, they will receive a best-in-class benefit package, and opportunities for continuing professional development.

***Must live in and be eligible to work in the USA. Reserve Squad is an Equal Opportunity Employer.*** 

**To learn** more about Reserve Squad, visit our website at www.reservesquad.com.

title: Enterprise Risk Operations Analyst I
description:
Req ID: 74763
Location: Tulsa -TUL, Oklahoma City -OKC
Areas of Interest: Risk Management; Audit; Internal Audit; Risk Management, BSA/AML; Risk Management, Compliance
Pay Transparency Salary Range: Not Available
Application Deadline: 04/06/2024
BOK Financial, Headquartered in Tulsa, Oklahoma, BOK Financial Corporation (NASDAQ: BOKF) is a top U.S.-based financial services holding company with operations in Oklahoma, Texas, Arizona, Arkansas, Colorado, Kansas, Missouri, Tennessee and New Mexico. The company began more than 100 years ago in Tulsa and has successfully diversified into a variety of industries, businesses and geographies. .

Bonus Type
-----------


Discretionary
Summary
--------



What does it take to join us? We're glad you asked! We expect exceptional skills, discipline, a dedication to being your best, and a commitment to serving our communities and building relationships with teammates, clients and stakeholders. We're building on over a century of service in our industry.

Job Description
----------------



The Enterprise Risk Operations Analyst I identifies, reviews and analyzes enterprise-wide risk. The incumbent prepares and maintains risk management documentation and monitors and tracks operational risk issues employing a strong knowledge of practices and principles of risk management, in addition to a solid understanding of data analytics, visualization, and automation. Ensures continuous improvement in risk mitigation through identification of risk trends and development of key risk indicators.

Team Culture
-------------



Our camaraderie, shared decision-making, and mutual respect for one another are what make us, one big happy family. All team members have a stake in the game and are encouraged to share their ideas on creating efficiencies and impacting our bottom line. We're also focused on your growth and development. We want you to grow your capabilities by actively participating in opportunities to expand your knowledge, influence others, and develop your interpersonal skills.

How You'll Spend Your Time
---------------------------


* You'll be assigned various risk analysis projects in areas such as Internal Control Environment, Risk Profile, Risk Outlook, BOKF's Whistleblower and Standards of Conduct Programs.
* You'll employ data visualization tools to illustrate emerging trends to your team and BOKF leadership.
* You'll work with the entire enterprise risk team to develop and analyze key risk indicators.
* You'll ensure data quality and validation controls are maintained in support of accurate reporting.
* You'll develop and distribute policy management reports and dashboards as assigned by your manager.
Education & Experience Requirements
-----------------------------------

This position is hybrid.

title: Financial Analyst
description:

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
Zeeco fosters a robust work environment where employees, from engineering teams to support groups, benefit from a strong culture, trained leadership, and opportunities for growth. Zeeco collaborates with the biggest names in the industry, enabling individuals to broaden their skills alongside teams of subject matter experts.
### **Job Description:**

* Act as a liaison between Zeeco Global Headquarters and all Zeeco international entities from an accounting perspective. This will mostly be via e-mail, telephone and video conference but may involve overseas travel of one or two trips per year.
* Assist each international entity with the preparation of their annual budget and ensure completion within group deadlines.
* Preparation of departmental and actual vs. budget financial statements for international subsidiaries and ensure compliance with monthly group reporting deadlines.
* Review financial performance of each international subsidiary and obtain explanations for unusual variances.
* Translate monthly international subsidiary financial statements into USD for consolidation purposes.
* Review and assist international subsidiaries with monthly percentage of completion calculations and obtain explanations for unusual current month results on individual projects.
* Reconcile intercompany account balances with international subsidiaries and direct reconciliation process between international subsidiaries.
* Prepare consolidated schedules of international subsidiaries for the annual audit and liaise with outside auditors.
* Assist in selection of outside accounting and audit firms for international subsidiaries.
* Assist in cash disbursement approvals for international subsidiaries with no local internal accounting staff.
* Maintain working knowledge of all applicable US GAAP requirements.
* Assist in preparation and maintenance of standardized reporting package for international subsidiaries.
* Prepare templates for annual budget for all international subsidiaries and manage change control.
+ Participate and/or lead review of financial results with international entities.

### **Qualifications:**

* Excellent financial analysis experience and skill.
* Strong financial analytical skills for researching errors or variances.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills (position includes frequent communication with international personnel).
* Confidence to defend a position with logical reasoning and state position using clear, concise, and compelling reasons in an upbeat manner.
* Professional in all aspects including superior work product
* Ability to produce dependable quality work that is highly accurate.
* EXPERT spreadsheet skills are mandatory; these will have to be demonstrated by an existing spreadsheet created and operated by the candidate.
* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting required.
* Two or more years’ of experience required
* CPA or related certification a plus.


Working at Zeeco means being part of a people-centric culture and environment built on mutual respect, personal encouragement, professional integrity, and limitless opportunity. Join Zeeco and embark on a fulfilling journey where innovation, collaboration, and personal and professional growth converge.

title: Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) / Financial Analyst
description:
**FP&A - Financial Analyst**
============================


This is a great opportunity for an early career Financial Analyst who is looking for a new challenge in an established, well-respected industry leader. A publicly traded, Tulsa headquartered diversified natural resources company is looking to add a Financial Analyst to their FP&A Department. Reporting to the Director, Financial Planning and Analysis, they will work closely with finance, operations management, accounting, and senior management teams in the consolidation of annual operating plan, quarterly plan forecasts, and long-term strategic plan. They will work with finance and treasury in the compilation of debt compliance as well as periodic cash management as needed. They will also assist in compilation of budgets and financial statements for potential new acquisitions as needed. Outstanding benefits including company paid medical, 401(k) match and other generous benefits. This position is performed on site and requires that the selected candidate live in or near Tulsa, OK.


**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**
------------------------------------------


### **The items listed below detail some of the assigned duties and responsibilities for this position. This is not meant to be an all-inclusive list and management reserves the right to change these duties at any time.**


* Collects and analyzes financial information for assigned accounts, products or product lines, or business units in order to track the organization's progress against financial goals.
* Reports current or expected financial performance and creates financial models to guide decision making.
* Analyzes cash flow, expenditures, revenue, depreciation, and investments to make recommendations for action and/or modifications regarding financial procedures, plans, and controls.
* Assists in the preparation of monthly, quarterly, or annual financial statements.
* Research, analyze and gather information to support various business activities, revenue and expense trends, market analysis, etc.
* Perform other ad hoc analysis as requested.


**QUALIFICATIONS:**
-------------------


* 3 - 5 years forecasting and analysis experience in either public accounting or corporate environment.
* Ability to interpret and apply financial planning and analysis methods and procedures.
* Experienced in preparing and analyzing consolidated financial statements
* Experienced in interpreting and applying generally accepted accounting principles.
* Experienced in use of software such as: Microsoft Excel, Word, Power Point, and Visual Basic
* Experienced working in a team environment.
* Ability to prioritize workload and deliverables
* Requires excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Must have excellent analytical thinking skills.

**EDUCATION AND CERTIFICATION:**
--------------------------------


* Bachelor's degree in finance or accounting required

title: Financial Analyst-Central Region
description:
As the Financial Analyst for the Region, you will support key stakeholders by performing a broad range of financial, analytical, and accounting support for multiple manufacturing locations in your region. You will develop, measure, and actively manage results, ensuring business and reporting needs are met. As the Financial Analyst for the Region, you will be responsible for daily/weekly/monthly accounting tasks related to the various manufacturing locations in your region as well as month-end closing activities. In addition, you will support the Regional Controller and plant leadership in understanding variances in their financial performance and any related data reconciliations.


***This position will be located in our Catoosa, Oklahoma office and will work Monday through Friday, standard office hours. A competitive salary and annual bonus are offered, including a full suite of benefits, 401k with company match, paid time off, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, parental leave, sick time and more!***

* ***All candidates must be authorized to work in the United States.***

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Participate in monthly close activities by preparing recurring and non-recurring journal entries to ensure complete and accurate financial statements.
* Perform balance sheet account analysis and reconciliations.
* Analyze actual results in comparison with budget, prior year and/or forecast.
* Collaborate with Estimating, Cost Accounting and FP&A to help maximize profitability.
* Provide actionable manufacturing analysis, cost analysis and business partnering to create value.
* Assist in identifying, evaluating, and prioritizing opportunities to ensure the business is working on the right activities.
* Serve as an agent of change to help reduce costs and improve EBITDA.
* Participate in special projects related to ERP system conversions and finance process optimization initiatives.
* Assist Regional Controller with external audit requests.
* Travel to regional plants as needed, estimated between 10% - 20% annually.
* Additional duties as required.

**Requirements:**  

Education and Experience:


* Bachelor’s degree in business, finance, accounting, or other demonstrated experience
* Prior experience working in a high growth, multisite organization.


Job Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities:


* Excellent analytical and conceptional thinking skills.
* Proficient with Microsoft Office, particularly in Excel.
* Demonstrates initiative, natural curiosity, and effective organizational and communication skills.
* Able to manage time efficiently, prioritize, multi-task, and adapt to change.
* Able to work cross-functionally and collaborate effectively with others.
* Able to maintain a high level of accuracy in the performance of all job duties.
* Able to work independently while promoting and maintaining a productive team working environment.
* Experience using PowerBI.

title: Sr Project Financial Analyst
description:
The Senior Project Financial Analyst is a key member of the Finance and Project Team and works directly with the Project Managers to help support the project’s goals and objectives; maintain project budgets, analyze progress reported against budgets, and recommend and take action to improve progress. This individual will monitor and analyze the financial plan on assigned contracts to ensure that the Project Team and Management are informed as to status and issues which can positively or negatively impact the overall revenue and margin plans and will support the Finance Department with business planning and forecasting of results.  

  

Under the direction of the Project Managers, and in compliance with the processes and procedures established by the Project Management Procedures, prepares project analysis charts, job forecasts, labor forecasts and project completion reports. Requires the ability to execute / revise plans to attain well defined goals, and a high degree of concentration to monitor progress and put in place recovery plans when productivity falls below target. Must be capable of communicating information timely and accurately between departments, to the Project Managers, and to Senior Management.  

  

Work with the Project Team to ensure changes to the Work Scope are identified and documented if and as they occur throughout the Project’s execution. Requires advanced knowledge of Excel to create project specific worksheets for analysis of trends, problems, and forecasts.  

Essential Responsibilities:
* Provide Project financial reports and analysis including monthly Project Status Reports, Cost and Revenue Forecasts, Budget Variance Reporting, Ad-Hoc Analysis, Cashflow, etc.
* Work with the Project Team to ensure changes to Work Scope are identified and documented if and as they occur throughout the Project’s execution.
* Analyze and investigate Budget Variances and working with the Project Team identify the root cause, any lessons learned, and then recommend possible corrective actions.
* Prepare Month-end reports.
* Interface with Divisional Managers to review monthly business results and support the annual and quarterly forecast updates for Project, Resource and Overhead planning.
* Review current workflow and reports and help lead/drive process improvement and automation to completion.

Job Requirements / Skills, Knowledge and Abilities:
* Bachelor’s Degree (B.A. or B.S.), discipline in Finance/Accounting/Economics (Preferred).
* 4 – 6 years of relevant work experience, Current work experiences/Project based experience/Manufacturing or Engineering fields (Preferred).
* Master’s Degree or CPA certification (A Plus).
* Intermediate knowledge of financial and cost accounting including Project Costing, Inventory, Work in Progress and Percent Complete Revenue Recognition, etc.
* Capable of using ERP system and various other database formats and running ad-hoc queries/reports.
* Requires advanced knowledge of Excel to create project specific worksheets for analysis of trends, problems, and forecasts.

title: Financial Planning & Analysis - Senior Financial Analyst 127-2006
description:
**JOB SUMMARY:**  

The Senior Financial Analyst will embrace a strong emphasis on financial modeling and management reporting. As a key member of our finance team, they will be responsible for developing, analyzing, and presenting financial models and reports that drive strategic decision-making across the organization. In addition, the Senior Financial Analyst will be responsible for extracting insights from complex financial data, developing sophisticated financial models, and providing strategic recommendations to senior management. They will possess a deep understanding of financial analysis, advanced modeling techniques, and possess excellent written and verbal communication skills to effectively convey complex financial information to stakeholders at all levels.
  
  

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**  

* Financial Modeling: Develop and maintain comprehensive financial models that project the company's performance, including revenue forecasting, expense planning, and capital investment analysis. Collaborate with various departments to gather relevant data and assumptions for accurate modeling.
* Management Reporting: Prepare regular and ad-hoc financial reports for senior management, department heads, and stakeholders. These reports will include key financial metrics, variance analysis, and insights to support data-driven decision-making.
* Data Analysis and Manipulation: Collect, clean, and analyze large datasets from diverse sources to generate meaningful financial insights. Employ data science techniques, statistical analysis, and predictive modeling to optimize financial strategies and enhance decision-making.
* Forecasting and Budgeting: Financial Planning and Forecasting: Collaborate with business units to develop accurate and insightful financial forecasts, highlighting risks, opportunities, and potential areas for improvement. Participate in the annual budgeting process and ensure alignment with strategic objectives. Utilize historical data, industry trends, and business drivers to ensure accurate financial projections.
* Financial Analysis: Conduct in-depth financial analysis to identify areas of improvement and opportunities for cost optimization. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyze financial performance, identify risks, and recommend actionable solutions.
* Performance Analysis: Analyze financial and operational performance metrics to identify trends, anomalies, and opportunities for improvement. Present findings to key stakeholders and contribute to the development of data-driven business strategies.
* Data Visualization: Present financial data and analysis in a clear, concise, and visually appealing manner. Utilize data visualization tools to enhance the understanding of financial trends and insights.
* Communication and Collaboration: Effectively communicate financial results, forecasts, and recommendations to senior management and other stakeholders. Collaborate with various teams to collect data, understand business drivers, and align financial analysis with strategic initiatives.
* Continuous Improvement: Proactively identify opportunities to enhance financial modeling processes, reporting tools, and overall efficiency within the finance department.


**QUALIFICATIONS:**  

* Strong analytical skills with the ability to translate complex data into meaningful insights and actionable recommendations.
* Strong knowledge of financial principles, accounting practices, and financial statement analysis.
* Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) to create insightful reports and dashboards.
* Proficiency in financial modeling techniques in Excel. Experience with financial planning and analysis (FP&A) software is preferred.
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen eye for detail.
* Strong business acumen and the ability to translate data insights into actionable strategies.
* Effective communication and presentation skills to convey complex financial concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment and manage multiple priorities effectively.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a team and manage multiple priorities effectively.


**EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE:**  

* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Economics, Accounting, Statistics, Data Science, or a related field. MBA preferred.
* Proven experience (3+ years) as a Financial Analyst, with a focus on financial modeling and management reporting.


CommunityCare is an equal opportunity at will employer and does not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of age, race, religion, color, disability, sex, sexual orientation or national origin

title: Financial Analyst
description:
Growing An Economy With Opportunity For All

**Reports To:** Director of Economic Incentives

**Summary of Position**


The Financial Analyst will assist activities related to projects requesting incentives, supporting the proper management and oversight of project pipeline and process from initiation and underwriting, to approval, to ongoing oversight. The Financial Analyst is responsible for understanding the City of Tulsa's and the State of Oklahoma's incentive programs including but not limited to Tax Increment Financing, Downtown Development Redevelopment Fund, Affordable Housing Trust Fund, and others. They must also have knowledge and experience in financial projections, tax analysis, and loan underwriting.


The ideal candidate will understand both market-rate and "affordable" aspects of real estate development, development finance, for-profit and nonprofit finance, and general development aspects such as land acquisition, entitlement, funding sources, and financial structures.

**Duties and Responsibilities**

The Analyst is responsible for the management and financial analysis of Projects within the organization's pipeline. They are part of the deal team, engage with companies and developers, identify key drivers and project gaps and help structure solutions that ensure a project's success.


* Assist the Director of Incentives with evaluation and project application and approval process with clear communication amongst the deal team and client.
* Responsible for preparation of Loan Review Packet, including writeups, risk rating, spreads and term sheet.
* Work alongside Director and Senior Vice President, Finance & Real Estate to assist in development of incentive program guidelines, consult on potential modifications of current guidelines, etc.
* Responsible for the development and management of oversight and compliance of incentive programs and current contracts, including coordination with clients regarding contract and reporting requirements.
* Develop knowledge of local, state and federal loan programs to maximize coordination with the City of Tulsa and ODOC programs and better serve business borrowers.
* Live in, or able to relocate to Tulsa, OK within a reasonable timeframe.

**Desired Qualifications**

* A Bachelor's degree in a related field from an accredited institution is required, a Master's degree is preferred.
* Has worked in/ had exposure to real estate finance and housing development - both market-rate and affordable, development finance, for-profits and nonprofits - bringing a depth of experience in loan underwriting, loan structuring, grant programs, etc.
* Minimum of 3 year' experience in one or more of the following fields: credit analysis; real estate development; real estate finance; government incentive programs; project management, and finance.
* Strong organizational skills and the ability to work under pressure and meet deadlines
* Experience with developing and managing systems and processes to manage and oversee workflow
* Ability to proactively anticipate obstacles and create solutions
* Must possess a strong work ethic, thrive in a fast-paced dynamic work environment, and do it all with a positive and proactive mindset
* Sense of humor required

title: Analyst-Financial
description:
We Are Hiring:
* **Department:** Finance, OK
* **Schedule:** 8-hour day shift, Monday-Friday
* **Hospital:** Ascension St. John Owasso
* **Location:** Owasso, Oklahoma


What You Will Do:

Perform analysis and reporting regarding financial operations and information.* Perform statistical, cost and financial analysis of data extracted from various internal sources.
* Prepare reports based on findings, including health care costs, provider contracts, debt capacity, revenue and profitability.
* Assist with budget preparation and financial planning processes.
* Assist with budget review for compliance and identification of cost-saving opportunities.
* Serve as consultant to all levels of management to provide decision support for initiatives, policies and procedures.
* Perform special projects and duties as assigned, including research, forecasting and exploring viable alternatives.
* Assist with all accounting, financial reporting, portfolio reporting and valuation activities.
* Review financial statements for compliance with GAAP and other internal policies.
* Load final budget spreads into applicable systems and performing required reconciliations.


What You Will Need:

Licensure / Certification / Registration:* Accountant preferred. Licensure required relevant to state in which work is performed.


Education:* High School diploma equivalency with 2 years of cumulative experience OR Associate's degree/Bachelor's degree OR 4 years of applicable cumulative job specific experience required.


Additional Preferences:

No additional preferences.
Why Join Our Team:

Ascension associates are key to our commitment of transforming healthcare and providing care to all, especially those most in need. Join us and help us drive impact through reimagining how we can deliver a people-centered healthcare experience and creating the solutions to do it. Explore career opportunities across our ministry locations and within our corporate headquarters.  

Ascension is a leading non-profit, faith-based national health system made up of over 134,000 associates and 2,600 sites of care, including more than 140 hospitals and 40 senior living communities in 19 states.  

Our Mission, Vision and Values encompass everything we do at Ascension. Every associate is empowered to give back, volunteer and make a positive impact in their community. Ascension careers are more than jobs; they are opportunities to enhance your life and the lives of the people around you.
Equal Employment Opportunity Employer:

Ascension will provide equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all associates and applicants for employment regardless of race, color, religion, national origin, citizenship, gender, sexual orientation, gender identification or expression, age, disability, marital status, amnesty, genetic information, carrier status or any other legally protected status or status as a covered veteran in accordance with applicable federal, state and local laws.  

For further information, view the EEO Know Your Rights (English) poster or EEO Know Your Rights (Spanish) poster.  

As a military friendly organization, Ascension promotes career flexibility and offers many benefits to help support the well-being of our military families, spouses, veterans and reservists. Our associates are empowered to apply their military experience and unique perspective to their civilian career with Ascension.

title: Finance Analyst
description:
**What You’ll Do**

* Unveiling the Big Picture: Analyze mountains of financial data, identifying trends and developments that propel CNE's growth across gaming, entertainment, and hospitality sectors. Become the mastermind behind uncovering hidden opportunities for revenue optimization and cost control.
* Financial Storytelling Champion: Craft compelling reports and presentations that translate complex financial information into clear, concise narratives for leadership. Empower informed decision-making at all levels by becoming a master storyteller with the power of data visualization.
* Building the Financial Fortress: Develop and maintain integrated financial models, projections, and reports – monthly, quarterly, and annually. These will be your tools for ensuring the financial health and well-being of CNE, a cornerstone of our success.
* Data Integrity Defender: Uphold the highest standards of data accuracy by meticulously reconciling internal accounts. Your keen eye for detail will be instrumental in maintaining the integrity of our financial foundation.
* Collaborative Powerhouse: Partner with business teams across CNE, fostering strong relationships and a deep understanding of their financial needs. Become a trusted advisor, translating data-driven insights into actionable recommendations that maximize performance across departments.

**You’re a Perfect Fit If**

* A bachelor's degree in accounting, Finance, or a related field.
* Minimum of 1 year of experience as a Finance Analyst, wielding financial modeling and data analysis expertise like a pro.
* A strategic mindset with a keen eye for detail and exceptional problem-solving skills.
* The ability to communicate effectively, both verbally and in writing, with diverse audiences.
* A collaborative spirit that thrives in a dynamic and results-oriented team environment.
* A strong understanding of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP) is a plus.

**What We Offer**

* Choice of four medical plans with prescription coverage and wellness programs.
* Dental and vision plans available.
* Telemedicine: Access healthcare 24/7, no matter where you are!
* Flexible spending accounts: Save on medical, dependent care, and commuter costs.
* Health savings account (HSA) option for high-deductible health plans.
* Company-paid life and disability insurance for peace of mind.
* Employee Assistance Program (EAP): Free 24/7 support for you and your family.
* Invest in your future with a 401(k)-retirement plan with a generous company match (up to 6%).
* Earned Wage Access (EWA) gets you paid before your payday.
* Paid time off: Vacation, sick leave, bereavement leave, and holidays.
* Welcome new arrivals with paid maternity and paternity leave.
* Salaried employees earn extra based on CNE's performance and your work through our yearly incentive program.
Customize your benefits with optional insurance add-ons like critical illness and identity theft.  
* 

  

*Ready to become a strategic partner and champion CNE's financial success? Join our team and let’s build a winning future together!*
