title: Senior Risk Analyst
description:
Talcott Financial Group is an international life insurance group and the industry’s trusted partner for comprehensive risk solutions. Talcott creatively designs and expertly delivers responsive solutions that transfer risk and manage capital in a way that supports the strategic needs of insurers today and into the future.
  
Talcott Financial Group has a proven track record of well-executed transactions, and the enterprise benefits from its strong financial position with over $120 billion in assets under management, its investment-grade financial strength ratings, and its partnership with Sixth Street, a leading global investment firm.
  
**Talcott Financial Group’s two core business platforms include:** U.S. based Talcott Resolution and Bermuda and Cayman based Talcott Re.
  
  

**Overview:**  

This position will report into the Head of Policy and Risk Reporting in Enterprise Risk Management (ERM). The ERM team is composed of Actuaries, CFA’s, and risk professionals and is tasked with, among other things:
  
* Identifying and Assessing Risks
* Developing and testing of the Company’s Risk Appetite
* Establishing Risk tolerances, and Limits
* Risk monitoring; and internal and external risk reporting


**Primary Responsibilities:**  

* Support the preparation of enterprise risk reports for Talcott Resolution’s Board of Directors, senior leadership team, risk committees, regulators, and rating agencies. Reporting can cover a variety of areas including but not limited to current and stressed exposures, limit exceptions, and derivatives and general account portfolio compliance report
* Drive effective communication to accurately represent Talcott Resolution’s risk profile to the first line and senior management
* Assist with the development, implementation, and maintenance of Talcott’s risk appetite and stress testing framework
* Develop and implement risk management policies and strategies in compliance with applicable regulations and strategic objectives
* Design and maintain risk reporting tools and metrics for the assessment and ongoing monitoring of risks
* Drive global efforts to automate and streamline Risk reporting processes working across ERM and IT organizations
* Liaise with Investment Management, Finance and Actuarial teams to assess impact of new strategies and potential deals on Talcott Resolution’s risk profile


**Qualifications:**  

* Bachelor's degree or higher; FSA or CFA designation preferred
* 5+ years’ experience in a risk, compliance, or credit related job discipline, including but not limited to financial risk, credit risk, enterprise risk, and/or compliance management
* Financial industry, banking, or insurance experience preferred
* Proven quantitative and analytical skills
* Strong technical skills and experience with spreadsheet and database applications, including the ability to automate tasks using Python, and VBA/SQL is highly desirable.
* Ability to perform ad hoc analysis under binding time constraints, the desire to take pride in and ownership of work products and presentation, intellectual curiosity, excellent communication skills, and the willingness to “do what it takes” to meet critical objectives
* Quick learner and able to drive continuous improvement beyond own scope of responsibility; able to constructively challenge status quo
* Ability to prioritize, multi-task, work independently and work well under aggressive deadlines while delivering superior outcomes
* Project management skills; ability to drive tasks effectively to completion
* Ability to form and maintain strong working relationships with individuals of all levels from other departments


**Compensation:**  

The annualized base pay range is mainly based on an evaluation of comparable positions in the external market. The actual base pay could vary and may be above or below the listed range. The base pay is based on factors including but not limited to experience, competence and demonstration of proficiencies essential for the role. The base pay is just one component of Talcott’s total annual compensation for employees. Other compensation may include annual bonuses, long-term incentives, and recognition. The annualized base pay range for this role is:
  
  

$90,000 - $100,000
  
  

* Talcott is an equal employment and affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, sex, religion, age, national origin, disability, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, ancestry or citizenship status, genetic information, pregnancy status or any other characteristic protected by law. Talcott Resolution maintains a drug-free workplace and is committed to building inclusion and leveraging diversity. For more information regarding our Privacy Policy, please go to https://talcott.com/onlineprivacypolicy/onlineprivacypolicy.html

Data Analyst- Aerospace Industry
description:
**Benefits:**

**Job Title: Data Analyst  
Location: Windsor Locks, CT**  
  
**Job Description:**  
This position is for an experienced Data Analyst role to join a growing aerospace team with L&T Technology Services (LTTS). As an important part of the Supply Chain team here at LTTS, you will actively be providing critical value to our customers by helping to ensure customer expectations are met.  
The E-Procurement Data Analyst leverages analytics expertise to translate complex spend data into actionable insights to drive procurement savings and process improvements. Strong data visualization, presentation, and collaboration skills enable impactful reporting and influence with executives and cross-functional leaders.  
  
**Core Responsibilities Includes:**  
 Partner with Procurement leaders to identify savings and improvement opportunities  
  
 Create dashboards, reports to communicate insights  
  
 Collect, structure and analyze large internal data sets related to sourcing/purchasing  
  
 Establish and track KPIs aligned to business decisions and initiatives  
  
 Employ data modeling, statistical analysis, and querying methods to find patterns  
  
 Present findings, recommendations, and next steps to executive audiences  
  
 Collaborate cross-functionally to implement analytical solutions  
  
 Continually seek to challenge status quo with critical thinking  
  
**Basic Qualifications:**  
 Bachelors degree in Supply Chain, Analytics, Finance or related field  
  
 2+ years experience as a data analyst supporting purchasing/sourcing  
  
 Expert level data visualization, dashboarding and reporting skills  
  
 Advanced Excel analytics and statistical modeling capabilities  
  
 Structured critical thinking and quantitative skills  
  
 Comfortable working with large, complex data sets  
  
 Strong written and verbal communication abilities  
  
 ERP experience is a must, SAP preferred  
  
 Tableau experience is a must.  
  
 1+ years of experience with Microsoft Office 365  
  
 Must be a US Citizen/Person  
  
**Preferred Qualifications:**  
 Lean Six Sigma or equivalent process excellence training  
  
 3-5 years turning data into compelling insights in manufacturing industry  
  
 Aerospace industry experience a plus  
  
 An ability to work independently without day-to-say supervision  
  
 An alignment with LTTS company values, including: Being Purposeful, Ethics & Integrity, Caring, A Culture of Learning, and Results with Accountability.

title: FP&A Analyst - Virtual/Remote
description:
Enumerate needs a **Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst** for our rapidly growing team!Enumerate has grown rapidly through acquisitions and is backed by a leading Boston-based private equity firm. We expect to continue with strategic acquisitions while diversifying our product offerings to include payments-related services for its core HOA customer base.  
  
In this role, you’ll be responsible for budgeting and forecasting as well as the development and delivery of actionable and insightful analyses of both retrospective trends (actual v. planned) and prospective opportunities. Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will have a leading role in identifying, implementing, and improving upon these core requirements.  
  
You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. This position is remote eligible, with a preference for candidates in CST/EST. **Who will love this job**  
* Someone who is a critical thinker with a meticulous approach, high initiative, and the ability to explain financial concepts in “plain English” to non-financial stakeholders

**You should have*** Required: 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, either within a corporate Finance, FP&A function, or within investment banking, commercial banking, or private equity.
* Required: Bachelors in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other highly quantitative discipline.
* Required: Experience with SaaS (or subscription) revenue recognition, including familiarity with standard SaaS metrics/ KPIs.
* Fluency in O365- especially Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
* Strong financial modeling skills in Excel including a working knowledge of 3 statement models.
* Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.
* Ability to work in the US without sponsorship.
  
**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. When possible, we also like to offer fun in-person perks like pet-friendly offices, paid food trucks and company outings.

title: Segment Financial Analyst - Controllership
description:
Our client is a world-class producer of aero engine and industrial gas turbine components and is publicly traded. They hold the top global position in their area of aerospace manufacturing and have a rich history of growth and evolution over the last 75 years. The company culture is fantastic, offering great exposure and growth opportunities. In 2022, Forbes named them one of the World's Best Employers, and they were ranked as a "Top Employer for Diversity".

  


This role is open due to a promotion to Controller!

  


**Why work for our client?**

  


* Publicly traded company in a growing trajectory.
* Named by Forbes as one of the worlds top employers
* Full insurance on day 1
* Generous 401k match
* Great company culture and team environment.
* Great training!

  


**Key Responsibilities:**

* Derive business insights from financial and operational analysis and synthesize them into high-impact, targeted recommendations and presentations to support decision-making.
* Review monthly actual, forecast, and plan performance; understand deviations from both forecast and plan to provide insights to senior management.
* Collaborate with cross-functional peers to prepare monthly and quarterly reporting packages for senior management, including schedules, performance tables, and bridge analyses.
* Assist sub-segment Controller with month-end closing activities, including coordination of closing entries and account reconciliations.
* Critically evaluate the segment's capital portfolio and individual project proposals
* Track execution of cost savings projects and coordinate reporting.
* Lead process improvement projects to achieve world-class performance across segment operations
* Support financial forecast preparation and development process utilizing Hyperion.
* Consolidate weekly close data and provide a month-to-date view of financial results and monthly projections to segment leadership, allowing for countermeasures to be deployed.
* Analysis of plant spending and monitoring spend management systems.
* Financial analysis and process development for special projects, as required.
* Completion of internal audit requirements for internal controls, as required.
* Assistance with Peer Review activity across segments, as required.

  


**Basic Qualifications:**

* Three (3) or more years of combined experience in finance/accounting and manufacturing
* Bachelor's degree from an accredited institution
* Employees must be legally authorized to work in the United States. Verification of employment eligibility will be required at the time of hire. Visa sponsorship is not available for this position.
* This position is subject to the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR) which requires U.S. person status. ITAR defines U.S. person as an U.S. Citizen, U.S. Permanent Resident (i.e. 'Green Card Holder'), Political Asylee, or Refugee.

  


**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Cost accounting experience is highly desired
* Previous internal audit experience preferred
* Working knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles
* MBA, CMA, and/or CPA highly desired
* Ability to communicate clearly & concisely in both written and oral form
* Strong interpersonal and negotiation skills
* Experience with querying databases
* Excellent analytical skills

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**Our Mission**

**“Preparing Our Community to Meet Life’s challenges.”**

**We help everyone who comes to our door with resources for both immediate needs and long-term goals.** 

**Our network of programs, services, and experiences strengthen individuals, families, and communities and provides opportunities for growth and economic stability****.** 

 

**Come join our team!**

When you become an employee at the Community Renewal Team (CRT), you will join a host of others with an average tenure of nine years of service. Some of our employees have celebrated more than twenty + years of service. You’ll participate in fun activities, themed- employee appreciation events, organization sponsored golf tournaments, etc. We celebrate the accomplishments of employees using our Wall of Excellence highlighting employees of the month. Opportunities to grow within the organization are plentiful. Most of our employees started in entry level positions and have been promoted throughout their career. 

**BENEFITS**

401K with a matching employer contribution, medical, dental, vision, HSA Spending 

Accounts, Life Insurance, Short-Term Disability (STD)/Long- Term Disability (LTD), 

and an Employee Assistance Program. Eligible employees are also able to participate in 

agency sponsored educational opportunities. Eligible employees receive ten paid vacation days, six sick

paid days annually, and two personal days paid annually. 

**JOB DETAILS**

**POSITION TITLE:** Financial Analyst 

**DEPARTMENT:** Finance

**FLSA STATUS:** Non**-**Exempt

 

**GENERAL DESCRIPTION OF DUTIES**

 

The Financial Analyst is responsible for financial monitoring and analysis to the approved budget, monthly revenue recognition entries, applicable reporting to the funding source, and assistance in the preparation of annual budgets for assigned programs and grants. 

 

 

**ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILIITIES**

The list of essential functions, as outlined herein, is intended to be representative of the tasks performed within this classification. It is not necessarily descriptive of any one position in the class. The omission of an essential function does not preclude management from assigning duties not listed herein if such functions are a logical assignment to the position.

  


* Responsible for providing financial projections, budget variance explanations, and forecasting to Program Managers on a monthly basis.
* Verify all budgeted expenses (salary, fringe, occupancy and direct expense line items) on a monthly basis against the actual expenses and summarize results in monthly scheduled meetings with Program Managers to ensure grants are on track, data is accurately reported and make recommendations to Program Managers for budget line adjustments.
* Ensure proper billing is reported in connection with the monthly financial closing and work with the Accounting Manager and Controller to ensure collection of assigned funds occurs.
* Maintain financial program files for assigned programs.
* Complete all required financial reports to funder based on scheduled due dates as listed in the executed grant contracts.
* Conduct budget analysis in preparation of completing budget revisions. Review and prepare budget modifications and request revisions to efficiently use all funds before the program fiscal year/contract period ends.
* Assist with Funder’s monitoring visits.
* Assist with annual audit and closing of funds.
* Assist with monthly, quarterly, and annual closing processes.
* Prepare journal entries and reconcile general ledger and subsidiary accounts.

  


**ADDITIONAL JOB FUNCTIONS**

* Perform all other duties as assigned.

  


**MINIMUM TRAINING AND EXPERIENCE**

Education: Associate degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics or Business Administration required. Bachelor degree preferred. 

Experience: A minimum of two (2) years of related experience. Knowledge of Generally accepted accounting practices and principles, Fund or governmental accounting practices and principles. 

Demonstrated Skills: Ability to use financial software and MS Office skills with advanced skills in MS Excel and MS Word. Must have excellent oral and written communication skills, customer service and organizational skills. Must exercise confidentiality and educated judgment to perform projections. Demonstrated ability to multitask and be proactive.

 

 

**ADA COMPLIANCE**

**Physical Ability:** Tasks involve the ability to exert very moderate physical effort in light work, typically involving some combination of stooping, kneeling, crouching and crawling, and which may involve some lifting, carrying, pushing and/or pulling of objects and materials of moderate weight (12-20 pounds).

**Sensory Requirements:** Some tasks require visual perception and discrimination. Some tasks require oral communications ability.

**Environmental Factors:** Tasks are regularly performed without exposure to adverse environmental conditions, such as dirt, dust, pollen, odors, wetness, humidity, rain, fumes, temperature and noise extremes, machinery, vibrations, electric currents, traffic hazards, animals/wildlife, toxic/poisonous agents, violence, disease, or pathogenic substances.

title: Financial Planner - Paraplanner
company: Hartford Financial Management Inc./HFM Wealth Management
description:
We are seeking a dedicated Financial Planner/Paraplanner to join our team in providing comprehensive financial planning services to our clients. In this role, you will play a crucial part in helping clients navigate life's financial decisions, providing them with clarity, confidence, and a sense of control over their financial future.

**\*\*Key Responsibilities\*\***

* Act as an in-house expert on fundamental financial planning concepts, techniques, and applications.
* Embrace our philosophy that financial planning is the cornerstone of effective investment portfolio management.
* Engage directly and indirectly with clients and collaborate with other professionals to meet clients' needs.
* Participate in the collection and analysis of client data, including financial resources, risk management, lifestyle considerations, budgeting, tax planning, and other holistic aspects of financial planning.
* Educate clients on financial planning processes, explain strategies, and deliver clear and concise reports on their financial planning activities.

**\*\*Minimum Qualifications & Performance Readiness\*\***

* A four-year college degree in a relevant field of study.
* At least 1 year of relevant industry experience.
* Progress toward obtaining a Certified Financial Planner (CFP) designation is highly desirable.
* Proficiency in financial planning software (e.g., MoneyGuidePro/eMoney) and MS365 Suite (Outlook, Excel, Access, Word, File Explorer, PowerPoint, Publisher).
* Competence in Adobe Acrobat, web meeting applications, CRM systems, and familiarity with data exports and reporting from portfolio accounting software (e.g., Tamarac, SS&C/Advent Axys).
* Understanding of basic concepts, laws, and regulations in estate planning, taxation, and portfolio management. CPA or estate specialist level expertise is not required.
* Knowledge of the characteristics of all publicly traded securities.

**\*\*Remote Work Policy\*\***

Our current policy allows for limited remote work with prior approval. Please note that this policy is subject to change.

**\*\*Join Our Team\*\***  
If you are passionate about financial planning and eager to help clients build a secure financial future, we would love to hear from you. Take the next step in your career with a firm that values the role of financial planning in wealth management.

title: CCAT- Business Analyst
description:
The Connecticut Center for Advanced Technology, Inc. (CCAT) is a non-stock, tax-exempt 501(c)3 corporation incorporated in May 2004. CCAT is an applied technology demonstration and training center that validates, demonstrates, and assists with the adoption of leading-edge technologies into global industrial companies and the advanced manufacturing supply chain, while providing vital workforce training and upskilling necessary for companies to fully-utilize the technology advancement. CCAT partners with State and Federal governmental funding agencies such as the DOD, DOE, NASA, SBA and USDOC on technology development and training utilizing government programs and commercial contracts to address military and civilian industrial manufacturing needs, promote clean-tech planning and policy initiatives and enhance workforce skills for technology competitiveness. The current technology focus of the Advanced Technology Centers is on multi-material additive manufacturing technologies, composites, advanced design, automation, metrology, industrial automation, and Industry 4.0 technologies.

  
**Position Title**: Business Process Analyst 

  
**Job Description**: The Business Process Analyst collects and studies operational and performance data to identify trends and opportunities for improvement. Researches, analyzes, and recommends changes to an organization's business processes to improve operational efficiencies, quality, service, and profitability. Creates flowcharts, process maps, and diagrams. Develops process documentation and project plans. In addition, supports cross-functional activities and working sessions during projects' design and implementation phases. Designs and prepares documentation, training materials, and communications supporting new processes. May deliver training to impacted business units. Gaining exposure to some of the complex tasks within the job function. Reports to COO.

  
**Essential Functions and Responsibilities:** 

* Develop and maintain document management program for filing, protection, and retrieval of records, and assure compliance with program. design, evaluate, recommend, and approve document revisions.
* Assist in creation of internal audit system.
* Prepare and train colleagues to utilize new forms, reports, procedures according to organizational policy.
* Lead process mapping and continuous improvement efforts to develop or improve company processes.
* Confer with personnel concerned to ensure successful functioning of newly implemented systems or procedures.
* Analyze data gathered and develop solutions or alternative methods of proceeding.
* Interview personnel and conduct on-site observation to ascertain unit functions, work performed, and methods, equipment, and personnel involved.
* Prepare reports.
* Chair change control meetings for asset inventory and documentation changes.
* Collaborate with all members of the business teams (leadership, operations, marketing, finance, legal, engineering) to develop process documents.
* Works on projects/matters of limited complexity in a support role.
* Other tasks as assigned.
* Career growth opportunities include access and exposure to technical experts and executive leadership with a growth path to project or program management.
* The position requires the candidate to be on-site at multiple facilities in East Hartford, Connecticut.

**Experience and Skills**:

* Bachelor or Associate Degree and 3-4 years of prior relevant experience/certifications in a technical field.
* Manufacturing, Supply Chain, or Operations related education/experience.
* Process orientation and ability to develop and follow standard work.
* Proven ability to write procedural documents.
* Ability and desire to work in a collaborative, non-profit environment.
* The ability to learn, understand and interpret business processes.
* Ability to act in partnership with the organization and be recognized as a valued contributor to business and program results.

**Physical Demands & Work Environment:** The role involves occasional movement within the office, computer operation, and frequent communication. The position may require visits to manufacturing businesses and adherence to safety protocols in lab and external facilities.

**Reports to**: Chief Operating Officer

**Manage Others**: None

**Job Type**: Exempt

**Employee Type**: Full Time

**Travel:** Limited

**Compensation**: Based on qualifications

**Relocation**: No

  
CCAT is an Equal Opportunity Employer, M/F/D/V. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. VEVRAA Federal Contractor.

  
Please direct resumes to careers@ccat.us

title: Financial Analyst
description:
The Financial Analyst will work within the FP&A group and play a key role in providing cost and margin planning, modeling, and analytical support to business partners throughout the organization. The hired candidate may work in our Danvers, MA office, be hybrid or work remotely residing in the Eastern time zone.  
**What you'll be doing:**

* Create and maintain monthly Revenue and Operating Expense Financial Package; conduct monthly meetings with business partners
+ Track key metrics for revenue and cost across certain business units, functional areas, products, projects, categories, and department; items include: detailed product revenue, cost and margin performance analysis, headcount statistics, discretionary/capital spending and savings and opportunities/risk and exposure
+ Research actual variances versus benchmarks; work with business partners to develop comprehensive explanations of variances and support remediation, as needed
+ Be a thought partner to the organization’s planning processes to support build-out of reporting - partner with business to improve visibility of performance for use and interpretation of results

* Continuously look at opportunities to optimize analytics models and reporting processes to provide more timely and relevant financial insights for organization
* Assist in coordinating company’s planning process including the administration and maintenance of budget and forecast software and compilation of reporting to Executive team and Board of Directors

**What you'll need:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Finance or Equivalent discipline required
* 3+ years’ experience as a financial analyst
* Proficiency in financial forecasting, modeling, and reporting
* Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills, along with superior attention to detail
* Must function at expert level in MS Excel; Proficiency in Outlook, Word, and PowerPoint
* Ability to extract data from financial systems and into environments such as Power BI and other analytical tools
* Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal communications skills
* Exceptional organization skills; must be able to prioritize multiple tasks and work independently
* Oracle and Salesforce experience a plus

**Success Competencies:**

* Nimble learner – readily learns and adopts new technologies; is resourceful and curious
* Highly organized and comfortable managing multiple projects simultaneously, demonstrating excellent time management skills with attention to details
* Considers all relevant factors and uses appropriate decision-making criteria and principles
* Works cooperatively with others across the organization to align and achieve shared objectives.
* Demonstrates self-awareness; possesses a strong work ethic; manages own workload autonomously.

  


**Compensation range:** 65k to 78k USD   
The actual salary offer to the successful candidate will be based on job-related education, training, licensure, certifications, related experience and other related factors.

title: Financial Analyst, Hartford, CT
description:
**Want to hear something crazy? Cars only spend 5% of their time driving. Where do they spend the other 95%? PARKED!**

**LAZ Parking is one of the largest and fastest-growing parking companies in the country. LAZ operates hundreds of thousands of parking spaces across the country. When it comes to parking, we’re the experts!**

**We are also a PEOPLE FIRST company. We often say, “parking is our industry, but people are our passion.” Our mission is to “create opportunities for our employees and value for our clients.” If you’re looking to join a growing company led by passionate people committed to being the best – contact us today!**

**The Spirit of the Position:**

The **Financial Analyst –Government / University Services** provides financial analysis for two complex national portfolios, recording data, identifying trends and generating insights for the assigned locations. This position reports directly to the Financial Director – Airport & Government / University Services.

**Responsibilities:** 

* Participate in the production of monthly client reports, statements, invoices, rent calculations, and rent payments to ensure accuracy and contract compliance.
* Prepare and submit required reports for clients to Financial Director for review.
* Report on client payment distribution to ensure accuracy and compliance.
* Perform revenue reconciliations and follow up as needed on unreconciled variances.
* Supply financial reports or analyses to onsite Government / University Services teams and clients as needed.
* Provide detailed month-end variance analysis, identification of cost deviations, and EAC preparation and updates.
* Support multiple contract types: Management Agreements, Leases, Fixed Fee, Time and Materials (Labor-Hour), and other hybrid models.
* Work with internal and external audits to help resolve or adjudicate any adverse audit findings.
* Review and audit daily logs, timecards, KPIs, LDs, and contract compliance.
* Consolidate data from Business Intelligence system and produce monthly reports, charts, and graphs
* Maintain a contract matrix to ensure contractual compliance
* Continually review performance bonds, KPIs, MBE/DBE requirements, licenses, etc. to confirm each contract is complying with contractual agreement and deliverables.
* Stay current on industry trends, regulatory changes, and best practices to ensure the organization remains competitive and compliant.
* Develop and maintain reports, dashboards, and budget data entry forms that are accurate, concise and easy to digest.

**Experience and Requirements:** 

* Bachelor's in Accounting, Finance, or related fields or equivalent work experience.
* Master’s degree preferred but not required.
* Five or more years of experience in financial management.
* Experience in government finances or contracts preferred.

**Skills:** 

* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* High attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.
* Proactive approach to identifying and resolving issues.
* Ability and willingness to “roll up” your sleeves to help teammates so everyone can be successful.
* Someone who enjoys working in a fun, collaborative environment where all ideas are respected and equally considered.
* One who embodies the LAZ values: trust, respect, honesty and integrity, and commitment to people.
* Someone who can be trusted to work with confidential information with discretion.
* Eager to learn and quickly understand new processes and applications.
* A self-starter that can troubleshoot issues on their own and find solutions.
* Proficiency in developing, maintaining, and strengthening policies and procedures.
* Excellent written, verbal, and interpersonal communication skills; must be able to work well with all levels of employees.
* Ability to work independently and multi-task.
* Ability to stay organized, multi-task, and adhere to critical deadlines in a fast-paced and growing environment.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office skills required, including Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Access, and Outlook.
* Internally Certified Pricing Analyst versed in GAAP, FAR, and IFRS standards and best practices.
* Ability to mitigate and lead others to overcome challenges (Never Ever Give Up Attitude).
* Ability to interpret policies, procedures, and standard business practices.

**Physical Demands:** 

* Ability to lift, push and pull at least 10 pounds.
* Some travel required but not considered frequent (less than 20%).

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with qualified disabilities to perform the essential duties/functions.

description:
Enumerate needs a **Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst** for our rapidly growing team!Enumerate has grown rapidly through acquisitions and is backed by a leading Boston-based private equity firm. We expect to continue with strategic acquisitions while diversifying our product offerings to include payments-related services for its core HOA customer base.  
  
In this role, you’ll be responsible for budgeting and forecasting as well as the development and delivery of actionable and insightful analyses of both retrospective trends (actual v. planned) and prospective opportunities. Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will have a leading role in identifying, implementing, and improving upon these core requirements.  
  
You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. This position is remote eligible, with a preference for candidates in CST/EST. **Who will love this job**  
* Someone who is a critical thinker with a meticulous approach, high initiative, and the ability to explain financial concepts in “plain English” to non-financial stakeholders

**You should have*** Required: 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, either within a corporate Finance, FP&A function, or within investment banking, commercial banking, or private equity.
* Required: Bachelors in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other highly quantitative discipline.
* Required: Experience with SaaS (or subscription) revenue recognition, including familiarity with standard SaaS metrics/ KPIs.
* Fluency in O365- especially Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
* Strong financial modeling skills in Excel including a working knowledge of 3 statement models.
* Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.
* Ability to work in the US without sponsorship.
  
**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. When possible, we also like to offer fun in-person perks like pet-friendly offices, paid food trucks and company outings.

title: Data Analyst (REMOTE)
description:
Everlight Solar is seeking a skilled Data Analyst who will design and maintain functional programs and applications, producing fully functional software applications according to requirements. As a Data Analyst, you play a key role in serving our clients and team members. This will be a full-time, work-from-home "remote" position.

**This is a role for Apple power-users, must know iWork and be skilled with iOS and macOS.**

Everlight Solar is a rapidly growing company and the leader of solar energy in the Midwest. We offer a unique experience that fosters individual growth and rewards performance. Our culture at Everlight is extremely important to us. The work environment is fast-paced and dynamic. We value teamwork, quality, innovation, and customer success. Our ideal candidate is self-motivated, detail-oriented, has excellent problem-solving abilities, is passionate about delivering results on-time, exceeding expectations, and ensuring success for our teams.

**Responsibilities:**

* Work with large amounts of data to draw meaningful conclusions
* Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
* Provide regular reporting and analysis to team
* Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key metrics and performance indicators
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify areas for improvement and to develop solutions to enhance business operations
* Provide training and support to team members on data analysis techniques and tools

**Requirements:**

* Minimum two years of experience with DOMO
* MajorDOMO Certification Required
* 3+ years experience in data analysis, reporting, business intelligence or financial analysis and a Bachelor's Degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Computer Sciences or related field or equivalent experience
* 2 years experience in providing people analytics reporting to organizations
* Demonstrated experience using SQL, and DOMO
* Experience with sensitive and confidential people data in a global environment
* Analyze, evaluate, improve, and document processes and workflows. Identify and take advantage of opportunities for process automation and simplification.
* Proven ability to design and implement new processes and facilitate user adoption.
* Strong understanding of Salesforce.com best practices and functionality
* Strong data management abilities
* A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion
* A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
* Excellent project management skills and a positive attitude
* Must demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills
* Must demonstrate ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization
* Must own a Mac computer and be fluent with the Apple ecosystem of software (iOS, macOS, iWork, etc.)

**Benefits:**  


* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Life Insurance
* PTO
* Sick and Safe Time
* Paid Holidays Off

**Salary: $65,000-$100,000/year**

*Everlight Solar is proudly an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity of all types and are excited to work with talented individuals from a wide range of backgrounds. Everlight is committed to inclusion and we invite people of any race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex, age groups (18+), and levels of education to apply. Authorized to work in the US and background check required.*

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**Global Power Components is interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, at this time we are unable to sponsor Visas.**   
   
**Global Power Components** is a privately held, growing manufacturer of UL heavy gauge steel fuel tanks, trailers, large generator enclosures and modular metal enclosures for housing fully-equipped electrical distribution and control equipment.   
   
In 2018 we moved operations into a newly renovated 300,000 sq. foot facility that will foster our continued growth as we continue to be recognized as the undisputed leaders in our industry.   
  
As a result of continued growth, we are looking for a **Financial Analyst** to join our Accounting team  
  
**Core Responsibilities:** * Maintain, examine, and analyze financial records and transactions.
* Integral role in analysis of monthly performance metrics.
* Collect and compile necessary financial and economic data to perform meaningful. analysis for strategic business decisions.
* Get deep down in the weeds of our data to find meaningful and actionable insights about our business.
* Provide analytical support for design changes and capex decisions.
* Complete misc. projects and ad-hoc reporting as requested.

  
**Requirements for success:*** Passion for your work and a strong desire for continuous improvement. Your team will have this quality, if you don’t, it will show.
* Strong analytical ability and an eye for the details. If you are unsure if this is you, this role may be a struggle.
* Confidence in your ability and the strength of your analysis. You will need to communicate your conclusions which will often represent a problem that needs fixing.
* 1-3+ years of experience with evidence of increasing responsibilities.
* Bachelor’s degree required, CPA a plus.
* Advanced user of MS Excel, PowerBI experience a plus
* Experience working with an ERP system.

   
   
 **Equal Opportunity Employer/Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled**  
Global Power Components is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. Global Power Components is committed to ensuring equal employment opportunities for all job applicants and employees. Employment decisions are based upon job-related reasons regardless of an applicant's race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, marital status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other status protected by law.

title: Financial Analyst 2
description:
Code 6676

Location Milwaukee, WI

 

Job Description

**Financial Analyst 2**

Exciting opportunity to join an iconic American manufacturer! Our client is seeking a dynamic and experienced individual to join their team on a contract basis. This role offers the chance to lead strategic initiatives, manage supplier relationships, and drive performance within the Finance department.

As the **Financial Analyst 2**, you will provide financial guidance, direction, and analytical support for appropriate functional areas and all corresponding departments within the organization. You will coordinate the development of revenue, cost of sales, expense, capital and headcount, budgets, and forecasts for assigned areas.

**Responsibilities**:

* Generate monthly performance reports, financial analysis, revenue.
* Collaborate cross-functionally and influence decision-making.
* Present financial information clearly and concisely to stakeholders at all levels.
* Interpret complex financial data and draw actionable insights.
* Conduct margin and expense variance review.
* Provide recommendations for corrective actions.
* Participate on special projects.

**Qualifications**:

* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, Business Administration, or related field.
* Three (3) or more years of experience in financial analysis, planning, or related roles.
* Prior experience in manufacturing, automotive, or related industries is highly desirable.
* Experience in managing supplier relationships and negotiating contracts preferred.
* Demonstrated experience in leading strategic initiatives and driving performance improvements.
* Experience with ERP systems and financial modeling software.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including financial modeling and data analysis.
* Knowledge of GAAP and financial reporting requirements.
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills; Strong attention to detail and problem-solving, and analytical skills.

If you are interested in this position, please send resumes to info@division10personnel.com. All inquiries are handled in a confidential manner.

title: Financial Analyst II, Hybrid
description:
**FINANCIAL ANALYST II OPPORTUNITY IN OUR MILWAUKEE CORPORATE OFFICE**

**HYBRID**

 

**WWW.ELKAYINTERIORSYSTEMS.COM**

 

**We are thinkers, innovators, and builders crafting extraordinary interior environments. Are you ready to join us?** 

 

At Elkay Interior Systems (EIS), we work side by side, dare to reimagine the future of design and manufacturing, innovate nonstop, and put our people first. Recognized globally for their creativity, craftsmanship, and talent, our people enrich every project and partnership they serve. 

We provide a relaxed and flexible workspace inspired by our creative people. You'll play an essential role in keeping us at the forefront of global innovation and customer satisfaction. Join our thriving creative community where your ideas make a difference. 

 

As a key member of our Corporate Finance team, the **Financial Analyst** in our dynamic environmentwill get exposure to a wide variety of enterprise projects, and will provide project and analytical support for brand, regional, customer, and national account groups within the sales channels for our business. This role will interface with all internal EIS departments and external customers and reps. This is a great chance to work in an entrepreneurial environment with a nimble organization that values new ideas - bring creative solutions and innovative thinking to the table! Will also have regular senior executive exposure!

 

 

**Specific duties include:**

 

* Monitor financial performance on a regular basis, analyze variances, understand business drivers, and identify opportunities to impact results.
* Monitor and track operating expense trends and meaningfully impact cost control/reductions.
* Assist with product cost analysis and burden rate calculations.
* Perform financial forecasting and budgeting.
* Provide reporting and analysis to support business partner needs.
* Assist with Quarterly Business Review and BOD preparation.
* Support cross functional projects.
* Support ad hoc channel specific initiatives as needed.

 

 

**Qualifications:**

 

* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance or related required.
* 3+ years’ experience in a financial analysis role required.
* Advanced Excel and database skills and MS Office skills essential; Epicor or equivalent ERP preferred.
* Must be proficient with data gathering and analysis tools to create meaningful reports with ability to draw conclusions and problem solve.
* Must be able to handle multiple projects at once and prioritize.
* Must be process driven with the ability to think critically required.
* Ability to work independently and take initiative while collaborating with on-site and remote business partners essential.
* Excellent analytical, communication and collaboration skills a must.

  


Benefit Overview: 

* 
Competitive Medical, Dental & Vision Plans 

* 
Company Paid Long and Short-Term Disability Plans 

* 
Paid Company Life Insurance Policy 

* 
Attractive Paid Time Off (PTO) Policies 

* 
401K Program with Company Match 

* 
2 Volunteer Days each year (16 hours) 

* 
11 Paid Holidays per year 

* 
Flex work schedule (3 days a week in office required) 

* 
Tuition Reimbursement Program 

* 
Wellness Program 

 

It is the policy of Elkay Interior Systems to comply with all state and federal equal employment opportunity laws and regulations. EIS is committed to giving fair and equal treatment to all individuals. This policy applies to all matters relating to employment including, but not limited to, hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, demotion, recruitment, advertising or soliciting employment, training, compensation, selection for training, layoff or termination, and social or recreational programs. Equal opportunity, regardless of race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, genetic information, marital status, familial status, or veteran status, is company policy.

title: Insurance Agent
description:
Description Were looking for ambitious, entrepreneurial professionals who want to own their business and help clients prepare for lifes planned and unexpected moments with the right insurance products.  
COUNTRY Financial Insurance Agents have the opportunity and the autonomy to build a rewarding, financially stable career while enriching lives in the communities we serve.  
**The Career**Our Insurance Agents take a consultative approach to grow business with existing and prospective clients. As independent contractors, they are in business for themselves but not by themselves, and they:* **Diversify their income through our portfolio of property and casualty, life and health lines.**
* Have the flexibility to manage their schedules to balance their careers and personal interests.
* Educate clients and prospects about our products and services.
* Collaborate with COUNTRY Trust Bank Financial Advisors to inform clients of our financial products and services.
* Establish an office and build a staff.
**We Offer**COUNTRY Insurance Agents have**uncapped earning potential**without a required buy-in and:* Opportunities to earn performance-based global trips and financial rewards.
* Access to continued learning and marketing resources.
* Affiliation with our 95+ year brand heritage and family-focused culture that values authenticity, integrity, and inclusivity.
 Qualifications Successful COUNTRY Insurance Agents are from different paths, but they are all:

* Entrepreneurial, self-motivated, and goal driven.
* Strong communicators with excellent business acumen.
* Committed to building and maintaining solid connections between their efforts and their rewards.
* Focused on achieving professional success through securing clients trust.
* Passionate about making positive impacts in their communities.

**Required Qualifications**

* Property/Casualty State Insurance License\*
* Life/Health State Insurance License\*

**Preferred Experience**

* Series 6/63 licenses
* Accredited Asset Management Specialist (AAMS)
* Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA)
* Certified Public Accountant (CPA)
* Certified Financial Planner (CFP)
* Chartered Financial Consultant (ChFC)
* Bachelors Degree
* 2+ years of experience in the insurance and or financial services industry
* 5+ years of business ownership or managerial experience

\*These licenses are not required to apply; however, the candidates ability to obtain these licenses is essential when a contract decision is made. About Us COUNTRY Financial is the trade name for a collective of affiliated insurance and financial services companies. This means we have an extended family of support and a large backing.  
For nearly 100 years, COUNTRY Financial has been dedicated to helping others plan for their future while also protecting what matters most to them. What started long ago as a simple commitment on Midwest farmlands has expanded to become a FORTUNE 1000 insurance and financial services organization proudly serving 19 states.  
Our insurance agents, financial advisors, and employees remain dedicated to serving nearly one million households with our diverse range of personal and business insurance products as and financial services products. And our consistent AM Best A+ rating means we have the financial strength to keep the promises we make to our clients.  
  
COUNTRY Financial is the marketing name for the COUNTRY Financial family of affiliated companies (collectively, COUNTRY), which include COUNTRY Life Insurance Company, COUNTRY Mutual Insurance Company, and their respective subsidiaries, located in Bloomington, Illinois.  
Investment management, retirement, trust, and planning services provided by COUNTRY Trust Bank. The investment objectives, risks,charges, and expenses of an investment company should be carefully considered before investing.#CB

  
  
 This is a 1099 position. Commissions, bonuses, and incentives only. The position does not have a salary

title: Vice President of Financial Planning & Analysis
GL Staff Accountant
description:
**Department:**  Accounting

**Direct Reports:** Accounting Supervisor, Controller

**Position Summary:** To maintain associations financials with a degree of accuracy, while performing any and all, staff accountant and related administrative functions.

· Analyze and post journal entries to the General Ledger.

· Prepare and deliver Financial Statement packages.

· Review and analyze transactions from Accounts Receivables and Accounts Payable to ensure they have been accurately coded and recorded. Identify, investigate, resolve and/or report on discrepancies.

· Research, analyze, identify and explain any variances or unexplained items on the Income Statement and changes on the Balance Sheet.

· Answer accounting and financial questions by researching and interpreting data and reports accounting related systems.

· Provide assistance to Community Managers on accounting matters.

· Analyze and post end-of-year audit entries.

· Enter association budgets within the timeline required by department standards.

· Assist on special requests, reporting and projects as necessary.

 

**Additional Duties & Responsibilities**

· Conduct business at all times with the highest standards of personal, professional and ethical conduct.

· Participate in any variety of meetings and work groups to integrate activities, communicate issues, obtain approvals, resolve problems and maintain specified level of knowledge pertaining to new developments, requirements, policies, and regulatory guidelines.

· Follow all policies and Standard Operating Procedures as instructed by Management.

· Perform any range of special projects, tasks and other related duties as assigned.

Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. * Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.

**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. title: Domo Data Analyst (REMOTE)
description:
Everlight Solar is seeking a skilled Data Analyst who will design and maintain functional programs and applications, producing fully functional software applications according to requirements. As a Data Analyst, you play a key role in serving our clients and team members. This will be a full-time, work-from-home "remote" position.

**This is a role for Apple power-users, must know iWork and be skilled with iOS and macOS.**

Everlight Solar is a rapidly growing company and the leader of solar energy in the Midwest. We offer a unique experience that fosters individual growth and rewards performance. Our culture at Everlight is extremely important to us. The work environment is fast-paced and dynamic. We value teamwork, quality, innovation, and customer success. Our ideal candidate is self-motivated, detail-oriented, has excellent problem-solving abilities, is passionate about delivering results on-time, exceeding expectations, and ensuring success for our teams.

**Responsibilities:**

* Work with large amounts of data to draw meaningful conclusions
* Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
* Provide regular reporting and analysis to team
* Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key metrics and performance indicators
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify areas for improvement and to develop solutions to enhance business operations
* Provide training and support to team members on data analysis techniques and tools

**Requirements:**

* Minimum two years of experience with DOMO
* MajorDOMO Certification Required
* 3+ years experience in data analysis, reporting, business intelligence or financial analysis and a Bachelor's Degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Computer Sciences or related field or equivalent experience
* 2 years experience in providing people analytics reporting to organizations
* Demonstrated experience using SQL, and DOMO
* Experience with sensitive and confidential people data in a global environment
* Analyze, evaluate, improve, and document processes and workflows. Identify and take advantage of opportunities for process automation and simplification.
* Proven ability to design and implement new processes and facilitate user adoption.
* Strong understanding of Salesforce.com best practices and functionality
* Strong data management abilities
* A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion
* A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
* Excellent project management skills and a positive attitude
* Must demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills
* Must demonstrate ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization
* Must own a Mac computer and be fluent with the Apple ecosystem of software (iOS, macOS, iWork, etc.)

**Benefits:**  


* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Life Insurance
* PTO
* Sick and Safe Time
* Paid Holidays Off

**Salary: $65,000-$100,000/ year**

*Everlight Solar is proudly an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity of all types and are excited to work with talented individuals from a wide range of backgrounds. Everlight is committed to inclusion and we invite people of any race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex, age groups (18+), and levels of education to apply. Authorized to work in the US and background check required.*

title: Financial Analyst II
description:
**Who We Are:**  
We are at a transformational moment in our company journey and are excited about it. NCC is the leading provider of consumer intelligence to auto dealers, and we’re searching for passionate people who want to join our growing Team. We find new ways to strengthen our culture, accelerate innovation, and deliver unforgettable customer service daily. If this sounds interesting, let’s talk.   
  
**Summary:**  
The **Financial Analyst II** will be responsible for financial forecasting and analyses, budgeting, reporting, the monthly cost of goods calculations, synthesis of complex data into presentable and actionable analyses for senior management, and various ad hoc analyses supporting the entire business but focused on their business unit. The successful candidate will have an exceptional data background and strong financial analytics, forecasting, and reporting knowledge. This position is in the Financial Planning and Analysis department and reports to the department head.  
**What You'll Do:** * Create and manage monthly business unit reporting, including but not limited to financial performance and sales KPIs.
* Manage the business unit's annual budget process, including developing required financial models.
* Process monthly business unit billing and conduct related analyses on trends within the financial statements.
* Forecast financial metrics such as COGS and revenue, utilizing various methodologies.
* Present forecasts, reports, and other analyses to senior management in a professional and thoughtful manner
* Manage the monthly cost of goods calculation for the accounting department.
* Serve as subject matter expert on cost of goods and weekly revenue forecasts.
* Identify and implement initiatives to automate processes within the scope of the role.
* Conduct deep dives into the underlying assumptions and quantitative details of all analyses, step back, and make recommendations based on data insights.
* Conduct all analyses and duties deliberately and thoughtfully to ensure accuracy and relevance.
* Communicate effectively between accounting, sales, operations, and senior management business units.
* Assist as needed in helping the FP&A department be a guiding analytical partner to other business units

**What You'll Bring:** * Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Economics, Business Management, or Accounting (required)
* At least 5 years of related analytical experience (required)
* Advanced Microsoft Excel skills (required)
* SQL / relational database experience (required)
* Experience with data transformation, cleaning, and synthesis (required)
* Must be an effective communicator and interact positively and productively with all levels of the organization, including members of senior management  
Knowledge of SalesForce.com, Alteryx, Tableau, and NetSuite (preferred

**WHAT WE OFFER**  
Base Range: 80K-90K

We offer a generous base salary, a 4-month sales ramp, unlimited PTO, great benefits, and a culture of inclusivity where our Core Values are geared towards aspirational, entrepreneurial, impactful individuals who want to work as One Team in a respectful work environment.

**ABOUT US**

National Credit Center (NCC) has provided credit, soft pull, and compliance solutions to the automotive industry since 1996. NCC’s comprehensive solutions help dealers improve sales, reduce costs, and efficiently comply with regulations. 

Our mission is to Deliver insightful, data-driven solutions that enable our customers to optimize profitable decisions. 

Please visit our website at www.nccdirect.com for company, services, and product information.

We are an equal employment opportunity employer and a drug-free workplace.

title: Insurance Agent
description:
Description Were looking for ambitious, entrepreneurial professionals who want to own their business and help clients prepare for lifes planned and unexpected moments with the right insurance products.  
COUNTRY Financial Insurance Agents have the opportunity and the autonomy to build a rewarding, financially stable career while enriching lives in the communities we serve.  
**The Career**Our Insurance Agents take a consultative approach to grow business with existing and prospective clients. As independent contractors, they are in business for themselves but not by themselves, and they:* **Diversify their income through our portfolio of property and casualty, life and health lines.**
* Have the flexibility to manage their schedules to balance their careers and personal interests.
* Educate clients and prospects about our products and services.
* Collaborate with COUNTRY Trust Bank Financial Advisors to inform clients of our financial products and services.
* Establish an office and build a staff.
**We Offer**COUNTRY Insurance Agents have**uncapped earning potential**without a required buy-in and:* Opportunities to earn performance-based global trips and financial rewards.
* Access to continued learning and marketing resources.
* Affiliation with our 95+ year brand heritage and family-focused culture that values authenticity, integrity, and inclusivity.
 Qualifications Successful COUNTRY Insurance Agents are from different paths, but they are all:

* Entrepreneurial, self-motivated, and goal driven.
* Strong communicators with excellent business acumen.
* Committed to building and maintaining solid connections between their efforts and their rewards.
* Focused on achieving professional success through securing clients trust.
* Passionate about making positive impacts in their communities.

**Required Qualifications**

* Property/Casualty State Insurance License\*
* Life/Health State Insurance License\*

**Preferred Experience**

* Series 6/63 licenses
* Accredited Asset Management Specialist (AAMS)
* Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA)
* Certified Public Accountant (CPA)
* Certified Financial Planner (CFP)
* Chartered Financial Consultant (ChFC)
* Bachelors Degree
* 2+ years of experience in the insurance and or financial services industry
* 5+ years of business ownership or managerial experience

\*These licenses are not required to apply; however, the candidates ability to obtain these licenses is essential when a contract decision is made. About Us COUNTRY Financial is the trade name for a collective of affiliated insurance and financial services companies. This means we have an extended family of support and a large backing.  
For nearly 100 years, COUNTRY Financial has been dedicated to helping others plan for their future while also protecting what matters most to them. What started long ago as a simple commitment on Midwest farmlands has expanded to become a FORTUNE 1000 insurance and financial services organization proudly serving 19 states.  
Our insurance agents, financial advisors, and employees remain dedicated to serving nearly one million households with our diverse range of personal and business insurance products as and financial services products. And our consistent AM Best A+ rating means we have the financial strength to keep the promises we make to our clients.  
  
COUNTRY Financial is the marketing name for the COUNTRY Financial family of affiliated companies (collectively, COUNTRY), which include COUNTRY Life Insurance Company, COUNTRY Mutual Insurance Company, and their respective subsidiaries, located in Bloomington, Illinois.  
Investment management, retirement, trust, and planning services provided by COUNTRY Trust Bank. The investment objectives, risks,charges, and expenses of an investment company should be carefully considered before investing.  
  
 This is a 1099 position. Commissions, bonuses, and incentives only. The position does not have a salary

title: Financial Planning Analyst
description:
**Financial Planning Analyst**

  


 ABOUT NACHO DADDY

Nacho Daddy is a Modern Mexican restaurant founded in 2010 in Las Vegas, Nevada and expanding NATIONALLY! Our goal is to give nachos the respect they deserve! And if you're feeling brave, we dare you to try our world-famous Scorpion Shot!

  


The Finance team is responsible for optimizing the Company’s financial assets, mitigating financial risks and reporting the financial position of the company to business stakeholders and the Board of Directors. The department is comprised of three main pillars: Financial Planning & Analysis

(FP&A), Accounting, and Treasury.

  


ABOUT THE ROLE

As the Financial Analyst, you will play a key role in the preparation of business plans, reforecasts, budgets and monthly/quarterly reporting requirements. In partnership with the Accounting team, you will be responsible for the accurate and timely reporting of financial reports, with comprehensive variance analysis of actual results vs. budget/reforecasts and prior year results. You will also be responsible for the review of P&L accounts on a monthly basis for integrations into budgets and reforecasts and will collaborate with business partners to guide them with managing their respective P&L in the most effective manner.

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES & EXPECTATION 

 SUCCESS OUTCOME #1: Optimize the P&L for Sales and Profitability

o Responsible for all sales reporting (weekly, monthly, annually) and sales planning (budget and forecast), ensuring each time the integrity of the figures

o Responsible for gross margin validation and forecasting

o Drive analysis of item-level demand and sales mix behavior

o Prepare monthly and quarterly business reviews for Board of Directors meetings

· SUCCESS OUTCOME #2: Drive Financial Reporting Success

o Closely collaborate, within the Accounting/Finance department and cross-functionally as needed, during closing, budgeting, and reforecasts preparation

o Analysis of specific overhead expenses – explanation of variances between actual results vs. budget/forecast and

  


· SUCCESS OUTCOME #3: Utilize automated tools to drive reporting

o Be a thought partner to all departments to drive the mantra “know your business” through streamlined, automated reporting tools.

  


QUALIFICATIONS

o Required-

o Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting or related business management.

o Minimum of one year of financial analysis experience required.

o Experience with MS Excel.

o Must have strong problem-solving skills.

o Must be effective as part of a team; ability to interact with internal and external customers, managers, and co-workers in a professional, courteous manner.

o Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**Benefits/Perks*** Competitive Compensation
* Various Insurance
* Career Growth Opportunities

 Financial Analyst  
**Description**  
We are currently seeking an energetic, driven, and responsible financial analyst to join our growing organization. In this position, you will be expected to conduct quantitative analyses of various investment and financial programs.  
  
Fund Experience preferred. You must be VERY organized, detail oriented, strong follow up skills and proactive. You will provide a high level analytical support for our family office. After 90 days we will work with your title or salary. Growth with a high net worth family office and must have the professionalism and confidentiality to work with other high net worth clients.  
  
* The private equity analyst provides analytical and asset valuation support for the company’s *Private Equity Groups*.
* The analyst provides input for strategic development and acquisition opportunities within the specific industry.
* The person develops and implements specific hedging strategies for various regions to maximize profits and minimize price volatility.
* The main objective is to determine whether an investment by the private equity firm in the company would further the investment intentions of the firm or not.
* Effective management of industry-specific trading activities to ensure compliance with the company’s financial, risk, and strategic objectives are part of the job description too.
* The private equity analyst has the function to review and process potential new private equity investment opportunities.
* The analyst conducts in-depth research, monitors portfolios, reports development and monitors business growth.
* If the intention of the private equity firm is to change the capital structure of the company through its investment, then the work of the analyst involves assuming a set of financial variables and preparing financial scenarios.
* Recommend strategies for the highest return on investment (ROI) and an apt mix of equity and debt instruments.
* Reliable valuation measures are used by the private equity analyst to assess stock value and ensure fulfillment of expected profit margins.
* Conduct cost analysis on financial programs and operations
* Determine financial status and analyze forecast results
* Perform month-end client valuation for assigned funds
* Research and assess offshore and domestic fund options
* Resolve accounting errors on a timely basis with documentation
* Prepare profit and loss models
* Keep accurate records of transactions.

**Qualifications:**  
* A background in finance is preferred.
* You should possess strong knowledge of different industries like equity firms, investment management companies, and their business models.
* You should be adept at handling multiple tasks, logical reasoning, due diligence, and analytical reasoning.
* You should have a high energy level as the work hours are typically long.
* You should be a person with excellent spoken and written communication.
* Self-motivation and being a self-starter is important too.
* You should be able to build positive and productive relationships, have professionalism, practical judgment, and integrity and be result oriented.
* You need to have good knowledge of private equity firms and their portfolio companies, investment banking and venture capital landscape.
* Knowledge of Excel, MS Word and PowerPoint is an added advantage, hinting at your competency levels.
* Experienced in structured transactions, banking, consulting, trading or analytical experience for a specific industry are valued by the recruiters.
* Experience in accounting, finance, or other related fields
* Advanced spreadsheet skills
* Strong attention to detail
* Strong analysis and critical thinking skills
* Tech Savvy
* Strong WPM typing skills

title: Financial Analyst
description:
Our Finance and Strategy team is looking for a highly passionate and motivated individual to focus on financial analysis and strategic planning supporting our executive and business teams. We are looking for an individual who will thrive in a start-up environment and can juggle multiple projects. You will be responsible for performing financial analysis and modeling, leading business initiatives, designing and preparing the financial plans and budgets, as well as analyzing, interpreting and communicating financial information to management. The position requires a highly motivated individual who has a demonstrated ability to deliver results in a hyper-growth environment.

About the Team:

Our Finance and Strategy team is a hard working, fun team to be a part of. They help direct Landing and work with every aspect of the company. 

Duties and Responsibilities:

* Supports monthly forecasts and long-range planning, with an emphasis on modeling new product lines and improving model functionality
* Assists with monthly & quarter-end close processes end-to-end for key spend, flagging any potential issues / risks through timely variance analysis
* Monitors key internal and external metrics to prepare financial business reviews and highlight areas of focus
* Performs data-driven analysis for various business initiatives and key stakeholders across the organization
* Maintains a deep understanding of our financial processes and refine them to scale with the growth of the company
* Delivers world-class analytical support for internal departments while enabling our team to move quickly
* Partners with the Accounting group to manage close timelines, processes, and reporting

Required Skills and Abilities:

* Expert in Excel / Google Sheets with experience building complex formulas and manipulating large data sets
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Detail oriented and highly organized self starter with a drive to dig into complex problems
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, team-based environment with minimal supervision
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills

Education and Experience:* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance preferred
* 1-3 years of experience in Corporate FP&A or Strategic Finance
* Experience working in a startup, fast-paced, and dynamic environment preferred

Benefits & Perks:Landing aims to create a workplace that fosters both personal and professional growth. We offer a competitive benefits package we are proud to share with you!

* Solid compensation package + stock options
* Comprehensive benefits - Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and AD&D, Disability, Mental Health, Pet, Commuter, and FSA or HSA
* We’ve got you covered with a 401(k) plan and access to ImmediatePay
* Feel relaxed with super generous PTO policy
* Opportunities for upward mobility - we want you to grow with us!
* Explore and travel comfortably with 7 free nights in a Landing home per year
* Employee perks for temporary or indefinite stays when you choose to live with Landing
