title: Senior Financial Analyst, GTM
description:
Company Description  
  
**Therapy Brands** is the leading healthcare technology partner for mental, behavioral, and rehabilitative therapy. Our purpose-built and all-in-one practice management, data, and billing solutions drive exceptional clinical and financial outcomes. 

Thousands of therapy practices rely on us as a trusted partner, to make their lives simpler and more efficient, improve revenue, and enable them to focus on patient care.

For more information, explore our solutions at therapybrands.com. 

Job Description  
  
The FP&A team’s mission is to operate as an essential Business Partner to Therapy Brand’s Leaders by offering strategic & financial analysis, and by delivering the best possible insights and recommendations for decision-making.

As a GTM Senior Financial Analyst in FP&A, you will be a key member of the GTM Finance team and aim to continuously improve towards the following goals:

* Establish trust and deliver value through accurate, timely, and relevant reporting, analysis, and forecasting.
* Develop a deep understanding of our Leader’s business needs so the FP&A team can help them decide, plan, and execute their mission.
* Work cross-functionally to improve our processes and systems so they can enable fast, in-depth, and accurate insight.

**PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES OF THIS POSITION:**

As a GTM Senior Financial Analyst, you will:

* Be involved in planning, tracking, and monitoring the business across various Sales and Marketing segments of the organization.
* Use key SaaS metrics and Sales & Marketing analytics to build reports, conduct analysis, and derive insight for business leaders.
* Build and own financial forecast models, understand deviations in performance of actuals, and communicate recommendations to drive strategy and operational rigor.
* Help shape the go-to-market strategy and help to set bookings target based on analysis.
* Prepare weekly, monthly, and quarterly reporting for both the Sales and Marketing Organizations.
* Communicate variances to plan/budget to business partners and other key stakeholders.
* Analyze business results providing advice on the financial impact of operating decisions.
* Support the month/quarter-end close process including reviewing bookings & revenue entries, ensuring accurate financial results, and providing variance analysis.
* Proactively identify actionable insights and suggest recommendations to influence the direction of the business.
* Drive process improvements for greater efficiency and accuracy.
* Use key data sources and tools (Salesforce, Hubspot, Adaptive) to build, update, and improve models and analytics to identify areas of risk and opportunity.
* Prepare dynamic excel templates to measure & report GTM productivity and efficiency metrics to drive continuous improvement.
* Help business leaders and their team conceive of and plan for a more effective, scalable, and sustainable approach to GTM strategy development, planning, operations, and execution through best-in-class business intelligence, modelling, and reporting.
* Assist with ad hoc strategic and operational projects as needed.
* Be curious with strong desire to drive issues to root cause, such as in the explanation of key variances between actuals and plans / forecasts.
* Supports the FP&A team leadership in transferring knowledge and mentor junior members of the team.

Qualifications  
  
* Bachelor’s Degree(s) and advanced degree(s) preferred with a concentration in Accounting, Finance, Engineering, Business, Business Analytics, or related fields
* 3+ years of related experience in Financial Planning & Analysis or Sales and Marketing Operations.
* 3+ years of experience as an advanced user of Salesforce and other GTM tech stack solutions such as Outreach.io, HubSpot, 6sense.
* Strong analytical, problem solving, and decision-making skills required to evaluate alternatives and provide recommendations on business issues.
* Expert level proficiency in Excel; comfortable working with Power Query, macros, nested formulas, etc.
* Proficiency in PowerPoint; can easily create and edit professional corporate PowerPoint decks.
* PowerBI, SQL, DAX, and/or Python experience strongly preferred.
* Proactive and takes initiative, willing to do whatever it takes to get the job done.
* Highly collaborative team player with the ability to work with members of the FP&A team, and cross functionally with divisional leaders.
* Ability and strong desire to work in and learn dynamic financial systems.
* Possesses strong attention to detail and accuracy.
* Detail oriented with strong organizational skills and ability to self-review work.
* Ability to work independently and naturally derive solutions to business challenges.
* Takes ownership and shows a proactive attitude, driven to continuously improve our service levels.
* Well-developed written and verbal communications skills.

**Desired** 

* Workday Adaptive experience a plus.
* SaaS experience a plus.

  
  
Additional Information  
  
All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

While we have outlined some key qualities we typically seek, it is essential to remember that there might be additional unique strengths and talents you possess that would make you an exceptional match for us, even if they are not explicitly mentioned. Studies have consistently highlighted the significance of this principle, particularly for individuals from disenfranchised backgrounds, including women and other marginalized groups. These individuals often hesitate to apply unless they meet every single requirement, unlike their male counterparts who are more inclined to apply when they meet around 60% of the criteria. 

The message we want to convey is that taking a leap of faith and applying can be incredibly rewarding. Your distinct abilities and perspectives could be exactly what we need to create a more diverse and inclusive team. So, don't hesitate - apply today and let's explore the exciting possibilities together! 

At **Therapy Brands**, Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging aren’t just words. We celebrate what makes us unique, foster an ecosystem of inclusion for all and harness our talents to promote diversity of thought and action in everything we do.

We instill Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, and Belonging into the fabric of our CARING culture and business, as we strive to be recognized not only as the leader in healthcare technology, but also for our intentional efforts to promote a diverse community. ​

​We will champion non-discriminatory practices throughout the employee and customer lifecycle; caring for every person regardless of race, national origin, color, religion, disability, sex, orientation, or familial status. 

**Therapy Brands** is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
American Process Management (APM) is hiring a Financial Analyst to support projects in Birmingham, AL. This position will include the option to work from home with occasional travel to project sites in the Southeast United States.

**Responsibilities**

* Engage with project management, engineering, and construction teams to develop and maintain project budget and forecast
* Lead monthly meetings with project team to review project actuals, variance, and forecast
* Conduct detailed analysis of project financial actuals, cash flows, estimates, and budgets
* Provide financial variance explanations at the monthly, annual, and project level
* Build project work order structures and account codes
* Develop monthly financial accruals to keep projects SOX compliant
* Communicate forecast changes, variances, and areas of risk

**Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**

* Ability to adapt to evolving environments and handle multiple priorities
* Strong analytical, problem-solving, and conceptual skills
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Proficiency in Microsoft Suite
* Professional
* Customer focused

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:** 

* Support new facility site(s) set up and geographic location that provides company synergies
* Drive financial process standardization and policy compliance
* Justify CAPEX investments and track ROI
* Provide support for month-end reviews, forecasts, and annual operating plans
* Host regular review/ad hoc review with interdepartmental teams to provide financial insights and drive efficiency improvement
* Partner with Operations team to improve forecasting of COGS and overhead expenditures
* Consolidate and analyze financial data (budgets, income statement, forecasts, etc.) by analyzing actual results in comparison with forecasts
* Provide creative alternatives and recommendations to reduce costs and improve financial performance
* Build financial models, presenting analysis and recommendations to senior leadership
* Conduct business studies on past, future and comparative performance
* Develop, maintain, and track key metrics
* Review contractor settlement reports for accuracy and analyzes week-to-week variance
* Track settlement disputes by market and support operations towards resolution and commission changes

* Bachelor of Science in Finance, Accounting, Business, Economics, or highly analytical field, or equivalent and a minimum 3 years of experience in finance or a related analytical field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
* Advanced Excel and business modeling skills
* Strong analytical, financial modeling, and reporting skills
* Ability to develop strategic relationships with business partners and influence
* Prior experience supporting business decision making through financial analysis
* Outstanding written and verbal communication skills
* Ability to meet tight deadlines, prioritize workload, and achieve effective results in a fast-paced, dynamic, ever-changing and often ambiguous environment
* Knowledge of Dynamics GP, SQL, data mining, Power BI, and business intelligence tools
* We pay well with good benefits

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
**Employment Status:** Full-time, benefits eligible


**Location:** NEW Gymreapers’ HQ in Nampa, ID (20 mins outside beautiful Boise, ID)

**Schedule:** On-site M-F, 8-5/flex according to business needs

**Compensation**: $85k to $105k, depending on experience

**Reports To:** CEO

  



**What You’ll Do:**


The Senior Financial Analyst is a newly created role for Gymreapers. This role works directly with the CEO and controller to execute the finance/FP&A function of the business, oversee financial reporting, and partner with executive leadership to deliver on company goals. They will be responsible for budgeting, forecasting, financial reporting, cash flow management, competitive benchmarking and contributing to financial decision-making to drive company performance. They are expected to have strong leadership, organizational, and communication skills. In addition, they will possess a broad knowledge of all accounting, financial and business principles.

 **Responsibilities:**

* Oversees budgeting, including permanent and temporary allocations, and reporting of operating funds.
* Advises, operates, and serves as an internal lead for senior management on budget and financial issues.
* Develops long-term financial forecasting and strategic financial analyses to inform budget development. Implements new and existing budget priorities and strategic initiatives.
* Ensure key deliverables for financial close, forecast reviews, and annual business plans are met.
* Ad-hoc analysis, financial modeling, consolidation, or related duties as required or assigned.
* Drive the financial planning process, including medium, short-term, and quarterly forecasting to ensure all plans and forecasts accurately reflect business strategy and requirements for the organization.
* Leads and facilitates communication with the business regarding best practices in policies and procedures.
* Assist with the implementation of a new ERP system, Fulfil.
* Drive the process to translate business line strategy into financial plans and targets, offering robust and insightful challenges during the budgeting and forecasting process.
* Stay close to the teams you support so that you can proactively surface and address challenges before they become real issues.
* Passion for innovative Finance solutions and process improvement.
* Manages personnel budgets, including salary savings, and carry forward.
* Develops and monitors financial reports which provide critical financial information not available with standard university reports.
* Identify opportunities for streamlining processes and improving efficiencies within the organization.
* Become a trusted advisor on all things FP&A-related to our functional Senior leaders.
* Drive the end-to-end FP&A function with functional leadership.
* Create and maintain the effectiveness of Finance policies, practices, and processes to foster continuous improvement.
* Other projects and duties as assigned.

**What You’ll Bring**

* Minimum of 3+ years of experience in senior financial planning and analysis (FP&A) roles.
* Bachelor’s degree in Business Finance or a related field.
* Understanding the needs of a high growth company from a financial perspective and applying them to cross functional departments.
* Being a team player with a willingness to continue learning.

*Gymreapers LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national or ethnic origin, disability, as well as any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, or local law.*

**PROTECTING YOUR INFORMATION: STAY VIGILANT AGAINST SCAMMERS**


At Gymreapers, we prioritize the security and privacy of our employees and future team members. Unfortunately, scammers may attempt to deceive job seekers by impersonating representatives from reputable companies like ours. We want to assure you that Gymreapers will never ask for sensitive information such as banking details or social security numbers until you are officially hired. We encourage you to contact us directly if you suspect any fraudulent activity. To ensure your safety, please remember that Gymreapers conducts in-person and/or virtual interviews with our applicants from our HQ in Nampa, ID. We prioritize getting to know you through a legitimate and secure process. Please be cautious if you receive any communication claiming to be from Gymreapers but not from our official HR@gymreapers.com email address.

title: Financial Analyst Veg P&S
description:
**Company Description**  

Syngenta Seeds is one of the world’s largest developers and producers of seed for farmers, commercial growers, retailers and small seed companies. Syngenta seeds improve the quality and yields of crops. High-quality seeds ensure better and more productive crops, which is why farmers invest in them. Advanced seeds help mitigate risks such as disease and drought and allow farmers to grow food using less land, less water and fewer inputs.  

  

Syngenta Seeds brings farmers more vigorous, stronger, resistant plants, including innovative hybrid varieties and biotech crops that can thrive even in challenging growing conditions.  

  

Syngenta Seeds is headquartered in the United States.

 **Job Description** **Purpose**


Provide strategic and operation finance business partner support to management of the Americas Vegetables seed production and supply (P&S). As a finance business analyst for the Americas Vegetable P&S organization, you will be responsible for providing both strategic and operational support. Your role will cover various areas including field production, plant processing, tolling, primary distribution, and residual (management spend). Additionally, you will collaborate with finance business partners in similar roles across different countries and regions to contribute to the team's efficiency, simplification, and harmonization of processes.

**Accountabilities**

* Support all finance processes related to the Americas Vegetables P&S operations, which include field production, plant processing, tolling, primary distribution, and residual.
* Prepare monthly management reports, identify/analyze variances, conduct business reviews and forecasts (including risks & opportunities). Communicate findings appropriately within the P&S organization and monitor the execution of identified actions.
* Ensure month end financial reporting is accurate and explained appropriately by completing analysis of variances and preparing any necessary JVs in a timely manner.
* Manage/support the annual budgeting and standard costing processes.
* Support the Business leaders on capital project development, management of capital spend, and forecasting of that spend.
* Provide support for periodic internal audits and ensure implementation of remediation actions.
* Lead/support the implementation of new financial processes and systems across the Americas.
* Support and drive compliance agenda to ensure appropriate controls are in place and monitored.
* Train business stakeholders on finance matters as needed to increase their financial acumen.

  

**Qualifications** **Knowledge, experience & capabilities**

**Critical experience**

* 7 years of finance experience, preferably in (agricultural / production environment)
* Excellent knowledge of SAP and MS Office applications
* Experience working with cross functional teams and ability to work with all levels of the organization.

**Education required:**

* Undergrade in Finance / Economics and/or Master in finance

**Leadership Capabilities:**


Syngenta Leadership commitments, in particular:

* Customer success and profitable market share growth guide our decisions.
* We work together to deliver – one team, one plan.
* We trust and hold each other accountable.
* We encourage people to say what they think and feel to benefit from diverse perspectives.
* We give and welcome prompt and actionable feedback.
* We constantly raise performance expectations for ourselves and our teams.
* We act on performance issues.
* We are energized by our work and celebrate our achievements.

  

**Additional Information** **WL: 4B**


Syngenta is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion or any other employment practices for reasons of race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, sexual orientation, marital or veteran status, disability, or any other legally protected status.


Family and Medical Leave Act (FMLA)  

(http://www.dol.gov/whd/regs/compliance/posters/fmla.htm)


Equal Employment Opportunity Commission's (EEOC)  

(http://webapps.dol.gov/elaws/firststep/poster\_direct.htm)


Employee Polygraph Protection Act (EPPA)  

(http://www.dol.gov/whd/regs/compliance/posters/eppa.htm)


#LI-BH1


Syngenta is a global leader in agriculture, with 28,000 employees across 90 countries dedicated to solving one of humanity's biggest challenges: growing more food with fewer resources. Join our inclusive and collaborative team to help shape the future of agriculture and make a difference in feeding the world safely while protecting the planet.

title: Finance Analyst - Mass Electric Industrial
description:
**Requisition ID:** 171855
**Job Level:** Entry Level
**Home District/Group:** MEC Industrial District
**Department:** Operational Finance
**Market:** Industrial
**Employment Type:** Full Time  

**POSITION OVERVIEW**
---------------------



Are you interested in helping be responsible for the business management of projects ranging from $1 million to $4 billion? How about taking part in key forecasting and accounting practices? If this is something that interests you, Kiewit is looking for individuals who can make a profound impact on our company culture every day!  



The Finance Analyst is an entry level role focused on supporting a project in accounting and finance related functions. Each project at Kiewit is run like a small business, with the Finance Analyst concentrated on critical tasks such as cost control, payroll, accounts payable/receivable, human capital management, and compliance. This position will become skilled executing processes and utilizing tools related to different types of cost and revenue components such as labor, construction equipment, materials, and subcontracts. The Finance Analyst will be an integral part of the month end close out process, and assist with preparing a financial reporting package for project management.
At Kiewit, the scale of our operations is huge. Our construction and engineering projects span across the United States, Canada and Mexico, improving and connecting communities with every initiative. We depend on our high-performing operations support professionals — they’re the glue that holds multiple areas of the business together and the catalysts that make things happen. We hire only the most driven people and we offer them diverse career opportunities, strong leadership and mentorship, rewarding, collaborative work, and responsibility they won’t find just anywhere. We’re always pushing new limits. You can too.
**DISTRICT OVERVIEW**
---------------------



Mass Electric Construction Co. is a subsidiary of the Kiewit Corporation. Since our founding in 1928 in Boston, Massachusetts, Mass. Electric Construction’s philosophy has been to pursue electrical projects that require a higher level of technical and logistical skill. MEC Industrial has organized strategically to actively participate and capture projects in the growing industrial market. We intend to effectively compete and win in traditional and alternate delivery procurements and position ourselves for a sustainable future. We self-perform the majority of our work and are looking for people committed to the industrial construction industry.
**LOCATION**
------------



This position is based out of our Waltham, MA office. One of the many things that makes our culture unique is that we go where the work is, which exposes your career to abundant opportunities. We relocate our teams based on the work that is available, combined with the development plans, skill sets and career goals of each team member. This means your MEC adventure is custom-designed to meet our shared needs. MEC Industrial is based out of Waltham, MA and has work all across the country. Must be able to travel and relocate as frequently as business needs require. These projects are happening in large cities and small towns, so you have a chance to experience it all!
**RESPONSIBILITIES**
--------------------


* Recognizes the importance of being a team player by adapting to project needs and helping in other areas as needed
* Fosters relationships with the Operations team and shows a willingness to learn about the work
* Understands the payroll and HR process workflow, and masters the systems used to properly hire, transfer, terminate, and pay all employees
* Comprehends how goods are purchased, invoices are received and paid, and maintains purchasing workflow internal controls
* Demonstrates understanding of the accounts payable process workflow and is able troubleshoot payment or vendor issues
* Understands intercompany and client billing process workflow, importance of timely and accurate billing documentation, and the effects of timeliness on cash management
* Ensures that all cost and cost adjustments are reviewed for accuracy to meet company standards and accounting rules
* Reviews costs, quantity claiming, budget structure and exception reports and makes appropriate corrections to ensure accurate reporting for management
* Identifies, adjusts, and reviews forecast and budget issues with the cost report to confirm proper recognition of cost and revenue
* Displays first-rate customer service skills – maintains a positive attitude and always willing to offer a helping hand to other team members
* Maintains highly organized work environment, understands importance of time management, and communicates in a clear, concise and effective manner
* Follows the Corporate Compliance Program and works in conjunction with the compliance department to implement all EEO and labor laws at the project level
**QUALIFICATIONS**
------------------


* 0 - 2 years of financial/data analysis experience
* Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, Economics, Statistics, Business Management, and/or equivalent degree
* Minimum GPA of 3.0 or above
* Ability to relocate anywhere in the country
* Working knowledge of Microsoft Excel, Word and Outlook
* Travel and/or relocation may be required for this position (up to 50%)
* Experience working with Pivot Tables, V-Look Ups, and other key excel functions is preferred
* Effective communication (both oral and written), organization and interpersonal skills.
* Good attention to detail with the ability to recognize discrepancies
* Positive attitude, eagerness to learn, and passionate for continuous improvement
* Must be able to freely access all parts of a construction site in wide-ranging climates and environments
* Ability to work independently, as well as part of a team.
* Ability to work in the United States without sponsorship, both now and in the future
* Must have a valid Driver’s License
* Previous internship experience is preferred.
Other Requirements:  

* Regular, reliable attendance
* Work productively and meet deadlines timely
* Communicate and interact effectively and professionally with supervisors, employees, and others individually or in a team environment
* Perform work safely and effectively. Understand and follow oral and written instructions, including warning signs, equipment use, and other policies.
* Work during normal operating hours to organize and complete work within given deadlines. Work overtime and weekends as required.
  

Base Compensation: $57,100 - $87,689
(Actual compensation is subject to variation due to such factors as education, experience, skillset, and/or location)
We offer our fulltime staff employees a comprehensive benefits package that’s among the best in our industry, including top-tier medical, dental and vision plans covering eligible employees and dependents, voluntary wellness and employee assistance programs, life insurance, disability, retirement plans with matching, and generous paid time off.
We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

title: Financial Data Analyst
description:
Job Summary:
The Financial Data Analyst is responsible for monitoring and maintaining asset data for Clearwater’s clients. As content experts, FDAs advise internal and external constituents on the proper handling of critical data topics such as security master, reference data, asset classes, corporate actions, cash flows, analytics, pricing, amortization, performance, derivatives, and alternative assets etc.  

Responsibilities:* Responds promptly and accurately to both internal and external inquiries.
* Plans, designs, develops, and assesses data elements to ensure quality.
* Utilizes a combination of manual and automated processes to validate data accuracy.
* Evaluates data vendors for accuracy, timeliness, and completeness of data.
* Serves as a content expert in their specialized area of data management.
* Collaborates with clients and prospects to brainstorm and implement innovative data solutions.
* Maintains and updates securities data in real-time, ensuring accuracy.
* Establishes a repository for process documentation, covering workflows not included in standard operating procedures.
* Performs basic SQL tasks and acquires fundamental SQL skills.
* Validates investment data by comparing it against third-party market data sources.
* Nurtures relationships with data providers, clients, and service delivery managers.
* Contributes to the operational maintenance of reference data products.
* Develops a foundational understanding of fixed income and equity investments.
* Reviews and updates procedures to ensure they remain current and effective.
* Escalates spending queries in a timely manner to address potential issues.
* Acts as a reliable reference point for assigned tasks, clients, or processes.
* Ensures compliance with risk and control checks in data management.
* Analyzes information flow between accounting and custody systems.
* Develops a working knowledge of corporate bonds and new bond issuance procedures.

Required Skills:* Proficiency in advance Excel.
* SQL skills.
* Familiarity with technology and tools related to Reference Data.
* Ability to work independently and collaboratively.
* Willingness to learn new things and adapt to change.
* Strong computer skills, including proficiency in Microsoft Office.
* Excellent attention to detail and strong documentation skills.
* Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.
* Strong organizational and interpersonal skills.
* Exceptional problem-solving abilities.

Education and Experience:* Bachelor’s or master's degree in Business-related field.
* 1+ years relevant experience.

title: Deductions Analyst
description:
**COMPANY OVERVIEW**


Oppenheimer Companies, Inc. (OCI) is a team-oriented, broad-based corporation with divisions and affiliates spanning a wide array of disciplines primarily in the food and real estate businesses; each focused on helping customers meet their goals. We develop long-standing partnerships by providing the greatest values to our customers with the best quality products and services which maximizes their profitability. This also creates internal opportunities for personal growth, responsibility, and reward to our team members. Entrepreneurial spirit drives us as we build companies from food service, branded and private label food products, to commercial real estate development, property management and logistics.

**POSITION PURPOSE**


The Deductions Analyst will be responsible for managing various types of deductions. The individual in this role will work closely with Sales, Operations and Accounting as well as with our customers, distributors, and broker partners. This is an opportunity to exercise analytical skills, organizational skills, communication skills, and help drive improved financial performance. The ideal candidate is organized, detail oriented, analytical in nature, and wants to work in a fast-paced environment.

**KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Obtain and analyze backup documentation for deductions/billbacks and determine their legitimacy.
* Investigate and resolve chargebacks including shortages, price discrepancies, trade promotions, etc.
* Organize and submit deductions for approval, if approved, process to the appropriate general ledger accounts, if denied, chargeback to the customer.
* Follow up on all outstanding documentation requests, approval requests, and payback requests (for illegitimate deductions) in a timely manner.
* Work closely with Sales Team to determine authorized deduction categorization.
* Determine what follow up activity is necessary to resolve unauthorized open deductions in a timely manner; these might include reasons such as damaged products, short pays, or accruals for approved deductions.
* Report status of deduction to Peak Foods Management Team.

**QUALIFICATIONS:**

* Experience in Accounting, Finance or Trade/Deduction processing.
* Strong Excel and Outlook skills
* Experience using accounting systems to process deductions.
* Experience in food manufacturing/wholesale industry with Big Box, retail, and wholesale customers required.
* Self-starter with the ability to work effectively in a high volume, fast paced environment.
* Positive attitude and motivated by contributing to the overall success of the team.
* Able to develop strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders.
* Creative problem-solving skills and analytical approach.
* Well organized and able to juggle many tasks at once.
* Comfortable moving at a fast pace with minimum supervision.
* Detail oriented, quick learner with strong organizational skills.
* Able to meet deadlines and effectively adapt to shifting priorities.
* Tenacious.

**OCI BENEFITS**


OCI is committed to investing in our associates to help them unleash their potential. We offer competitive salaries, flexible vacation, a 401(k)-matching program, and a wide selection of health and wellness benefits. These benefits also include wellness activities, parking allowances, access to continuous learning, paid holidays, workplace giving, free access to financial resources, gym membership discounts, and more!

**COMPANY CULTURE**


Our associates work collectively toward our vision. We share a set of truths referred to as ***P.A.C.E.!.***

* **PEOPLE** first. Everything else follows. We work hard to develop respectful, collaborative relationships and meet shared goals.
* **ACTION.** We are passionate entrepreneurs and execute with a sense of urgency and strong will to win. We fuel creativity and innovation.
* **CURIOSITY.** We have a deep desire to learn and grow.
* **ETHICS.** We do the right thing in our community, even when no one is looking.
* **!** We have fun and make our mark! We get excited about what we do, we enjoy the process and recognize that enthusiasm and engagement are contagious.


The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by associates to this job title. They are not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and skills required.


Oppenheimer Companies, Inc. provides employment, training, compensation, promotion, and other conditions of employment without regard to race, color, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, sex, age, disability, veteran status, medical condition, marital status or any other legally protected status.


Oppenheimer Companies, Inc. is an equal employment opportunity employer.

title: Insurance Risk Management Analyst / Senior Risk Management Analyst
description:
The J.R. Simplot Company is a diverse, privately held organization, with roots firmly planted in agriculture and agriculture-related businesses. The J.R. Simplot Company is a true farm-to-table company with operations that touch every aspect of agriculture, including seed production, farming and ranching, plant sciences, fertilizer manufacturing, food processing, commercial product development, and distribution.

**Summary**
-----------


Simplot is looking for either senior level experienced professional or individual just starting commercial insurance underwriting, brokerage, or risk management career. The Risk Analyst play a key role securing global insurance programs mitigating risk. This position collaborates with other Simplot colleagues as well as with Insurance Advisors, Insurers, Claims Advisors, Captive Administrators, Regulators and Actuaries to structure risk transfer programs to preserve the Simplot legacy.


We are looking for someone committed to the Boise area and enjoys working in a customer-focused, team environment. In addition, this person needs to be collaborative, accountable, agile, and able to think strategically.

**Key Responsibilities**
------------------------

* As a participant in our insurance program strategy meetings, you will collect and maintain information necessary to complete underwriting submissions for the placement of global insurance program, including liability, property, auto, worker’s compensation, cyber, aviation, surety, management liability and other insurance programs.
* Evaluates insurance proposals, makes recommendations, and contributes to insurance placements decisions.
* Initiates and allocates premium payments and expenses globally.
* Reviews insurance binders and policies for accuracy and works with brokers and underwriters to resolve discrepancies.
* Supports the Simplot Risk Manager and leads department initiatives as assigned.
**Typical Education**
---------------------


Bachelor's Degree (B.A. or B.S.) from 4 year college or university  

**Relevant Experience**
-----------------------


5+ years Sr. Risk Management Analyst or entry level 1+ years Risk Management Analyst with commercial property and casualty experience securing insurance, underwriting, or insurance agency/brokerage experience.

  

Equivalent experience in data analytics, accounting, or finance with an interest in risk financing and insurance will be considered for entry level Risk Management Analyst role.

**Required Certifications**
---------------------------


Insurance related certificates desirable but not required (CPCU, ARM, AU etc..)

**Other Information**
---------------------

* Detail oriented
* Microsoft Office with Excel Proficiency
* Accounting Basics/Financial Acumen
* Data Management and Analysis
* Power BI working knowledge a plus
* Optional hybrid work schedule. Up to 2 days remote work
**Job Requisition ID**: 16529

**Travel Required**: None

**Location(s)**: Simplot Headquarters - Boise

**Country:** United States

 **\*\*The J.R. Simplot Company is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer and will consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, age, sex, gender, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information, physical or mental disability, medical condition, sexual orientation, military or veteran status, marital status, or any other protected status. \*\***

title: Financial Analyst
description:

**Dillon Toyota Lift****Eagle, Idaho**
We are seeking a detail-oriented and analytical Financial Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing financial data, preparing financial reports, and providing insights to help make strategic business decisions. The Financial Analyst will work closely with senior management to develop financial models, forecast future financial performance, and identify trends. The successful candidate will have a strong background in finance, excellent analytical skills, and the ability to communicate complex financial information clearly and concisely.
Essential Job Functions:

* Consult with management to guide and influence long term and strategic decision making within the broad scope

* Strong analytical skills and attention to detail.

* Well informed in current financial subjects, accounting, tax laws, money market and business environments.

* Competitive salary

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
**About defi SOLUTIONS:**
It’s an exciting time to join defi!  

defi SOLUTIONS partners with captives, banks, credit unions, and finance companies of all types and sizes to allow lenders to focus and transform their operations. The company’s comprehensive suite of originations, servicing, and analytics solutions together with technology-enabled processing services creates a flexible, configurable, and scalable platform that addresses lenders and borrowers ever-evolving needs. defi SOLUTIONS combines the expertise of defi SOLUTIONS and the former Sagent Auto Lending with the backing of Warburg Pincus, Bain Capital Ventures and Fiserv. **Position Purpose**:
The Senior Financial Analyst will report to the Director of Finance and will be responsible for providing analytical support for personnel and non-personnel expenses with a focus on headcount. Key functions include performing analysis on financial performance and headcount data, performing key tasks related to close and forecast, as well as process improvement. **Essential functions:***Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform these essential functions.** Partner with and support each department on expense related items; focus will be on the technology and Managed Services team personnel expense and headcount detail.
* Supports creation of annual and multi-year strategic plan.
* Evaluate transactions and expense data to provide actionable insights and identify opportunities to reduce expense and grow profit through data mining, analytics, and automation.
* Reviews entries in the ledgers to assure accuracy and compliance with established accounting principles and procedures.
* Partner with business segments to develop and drive in-depth financial analyses identifying key drivers, trends, variances, emerging risks and opportunities; regularly communicating findings to senior management in succinct and meaningful reporting that impacts decision making.
* Perform ad hoc analyses for operational and financial management.

**\*\****Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.* **Required education and experience:*** Bachelor’s degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business related field.
* 4+ years of applicable accounting/finance and/or other related experience.
* Proficiency with Excel and PowerPoint (advanced skills).
* General Ledger software experience

 **Preferred education and experience:*** Extensive experience in excel based financial modeling and financial planning and analysis.
* Prior experience working in the software development and/or financial services industry is a plus.
* Experience with Dynamics a plus

 **Additional eligibility requirements:**
The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in excel based financial modeling and financial planning and analysis.* Strong organizational skills, in particular, an attention to detail and the ability to prepare reports in a timely and effective manner.
* Ability to examine and verify financial documents and reports and skill in analyzing and interpreting financial data.
* Ability to transform raw data into meaningful and impactful analysis.
* Ability to communicate effectively, verbally and in writing with supervisors and personnel and to establish and maintain effective working relationships with employees, business partners and company officials.
* Ability to prepare business cases as needed to support a growing technology business.

 **Affirmative Action/EEO statement:***defi SOLUTIONS is an Equal Opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.*

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
**Our vision is to transform how the world uses information to enrich life for** ***all*****.**

Micron Technology is a world leader in innovating memory and storage solutions that accelerate the transformation of information into intelligence, inspiring the world to learn, communicate and advance faster than ever.


As a Senior Financial Analyst supporting the Technology and Products Group at Micron Technology, Inc., you will be a business partner to Central Engineering senior leadership. Additionally, you will support DRAM wafer processing during the new product introduction phase of the product lifecycle. You will develop strategic partnerships with senior engineering leadership and other key stakeholders by supporting strategic analysis, providing valued insights, and supporting decisions that optimizes deployment of Capex, Opex, and return on investments. You will be responsible for maintaining an engaging, proactive, and customer-focused relationship with your internal customers.


As a world leader in the semiconductor industry, Micron is dedicated to your personal wellbeing and professional growth. Micron benefits are designed to help you stay well, provide peace of mind and help you prepare for the future. We offer a choice of medical, dental and vision plans in all locations enabling team members to select the plans that best meet their family healthcare needs and budget. Micron also provides benefit programs that help protect your income if you are unable to work due to illness or injury, and paid family leave. Additionally, Micron benefits include a robust paid time-off program and paid holidays. For additional information regarding the Benefit programs available, please see the Benefits Guide posted on micron.com/careers/benefits.


Micron is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, age, national origin, citizenship status, disability, protected veteran status, gender identity or any other factor protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws.

description:

Are you seeking a career where you can directly impact the success of a global high-tech company? As a Senior Financial Analyst, you will help Micron achieve its goals by providing important analysis to its sales organization and business units! You will serve as a key business partner by providing insight on how selling prices, volume, and mix effect forecasted and actual revenue. title: Financial Analyst
description:
Animal Farm Family LLC is a holding company for three rapidly growing E-commerce companies based in Boise, Idaho:

* Gorilla Mind (gorillamind.com) - An innovative fitness & health supplements store centering around pre-workout, post-workout, protein, energy drinks, and other products to support all fitness goals.
* Happy Hippo (happyhippo.com) - The world’s leading online kratom retailer, along with other popular botanical and herbal supplements.
* Intelligent Shop (intelligent.shop) - A men’s lifestyle store, creating innovative new products to help men become the best version of themselves.

**Overview:**  
Animal Farm Family is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented Financial Analyst to join our dynamic team. As a Financial Analyst, you will play a crucial role in analyzing financial data, preparing reports, and providing insights to support strategic decision-making within the organization. The ideal candidate will possess strong analytical skills, a solid understanding of financial principles, and the ability to communicate complex information effectively.

\*  
Responsibilities:\*

* Assist in closing financials through various processes and streamline them for efficiency.
* Identify opportunities to optimize financial processes and enhance efficiency.
* Evaluate financial performance during close periods, analyzing sales results, gross margin, and operating expenses.
* Collaborate with the Director of FP&A to identify trends or anomalies and provide insights.
* Work with the Director of FP&A/CFO to develop and publish SKU-level insights, including sales, ASP, volume, costs, gross margin, inventory valuation, and turns.
* Support marketing, commercial retail, and supply chain by providing relevant information for decision-making.
* Manage broker calculations and other sales-driven expenses as the retail presence expands.
* Conduct detailed financial analysis, including revenue, expenses, and profitability trends, utilizing various modeling techniques to forecast performance.
* Assist in developing annual budgets and forecasts, collaborating with department heads for input and accuracy.
* Prepare and distribute regular financial reports to management, highlighting insights and variances from budgeted expectations.
* Monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and identify trends affecting financial performance, offering recommendations for strategic adjustments.
* Evaluate financial risks and opportunities, including market fluctuations and regulatory changes, developing mitigation strategies as needed.
* Perform ad hoc financial analysis, such as scenario planning and investment assessments, as requested.
* Implement best practices to improve the accuracy and timeliness of financial reporting.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Finance, Accounting, Economics, or a related field. Master's degree or professional certification (e.g., CFA, CPA) is a plus.
* Proven experience 3 years working as a Financial Analyst or in a similar role, preferably in CPG or grocery retail
* Experience with evaluating components of sales, gross margin, and inventory is also preferred
* Strong proficiency in financial modeling, forecasting, and analysis techniques.
* Advanced proficiency in MS Excel, Google Sheets, and financial software (e.g., NetSuite or Accumatica is a plus).
* Excellent analytical skills with a keen attention to detail.
* Ability to communicate complex financial concepts in a clear and concise manner.
* Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment.
* Proactive mindset with a focus on continuous improvement and driving results.
* Team player with strong interpersonal skills and the ability to collaborate effectively across functions.

**Pay Transparency:**  
The base salary range for this position is $70,000 to $79,000. The total compensation package may include performance bonuses, benefits, and/or other applicable compensation plans.

At Animal Farm Family, we aim to provide all team members with competitive wages and salaries that are motivating, fair, and equitable. Actual compensation packages are based on several factors unique to each candidate, including, but not limited to, skill set, depth of experience, certifications, and specific work location.

\*  
Benefits\*

* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Health Savings Account (HSA)
* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Paid Holidays
* 401(k) Retirement Plan
* Maternity & Paternity Leave
* Hybrid Schedule
* Employee Discounts

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 - $79,000.00 per year

title: Provider Financial Analyst II Full-Time Days
description:
**Employment Type:**
Full time**Shift:**
Day Shift**Description:**
At Saint Alphonsus Health System, we are looking for people who are living out their calling. We want you to be passionate about coming to work, and challenged to achieve your potential. Living by these virtues, we pride ourselves on exceptional service and the highest quality of care.
The Saint Alphonsus Medical Group is now hiring for a collaborative and experienced Provider Financial Analyst II supporting the physician compensation area within the Physician/Provider Contracts Team!


Position Summary & Highlights:* As the Provider Financial Analyst II you will be responsible for accurately paying providers employed by the Saint Alphonsus Health System.
* You will oversee and support administration of various provider compensation plans, ensuring compliance with Saint Alphonsus policies, procedures, and guidelines.
* This role works closely with: practice administration and clinic managers to ensure accurate labor reporting and production calculations; Legal for proper interpretation of contracts; and, Accounting and Payroll departments for variable payment processing and accurate reporting.
* The Saint Alphonsus Medical Group is a multi-specialty, physician-led organization focused on serving the needs of over 800,000 people in Idaho, Oregon and northern Nevada.
* Our health system provides faster access to lifesaving care for emergencies such as heart attack, stroke, trauma, pregnancy complications and other situations that require immediate, expert care.


What You Will Do:* You will review physician contracts and amendments for administrative feasibility and also maintain the web-based provider compensation system to ensure that payments stay compliant with the contractual terms, SAMG Policy, and Stark Law.
* Work with medical group to budget provider compensation appropriately among variable components (wRVU incentive compensation, quality compensation, etc.).
* Provide maintenance and oversight of web-based compensation system, including regular auditing and reconciliation. Guide future development and enhancements to the system. Educate providers on meaningful user capabilities.
* Perform regular analysis of complex compensation calculations including wRVU incentive forecasting, pooled wRVU incentive models, clinical quality compensation, value-based metrics, etc.
* Perform and report compensation activities including analysis such as modeling, reconciliation, and forecasting; provides general consultation to leadership and physicians regarding the same.
* Perform robust financial analysis on physicians' practices and make sound, data-driven recommendations to senior leadership on fiscal viability of a contract renewals.
* Generate and maintain compensation reports, loan repayment and forgiveness records, and repayment obligations.
* Serve as a subject matter expert and consult with providers and all levels of leadership throughout the organization on provider compensation policies, practices, and applicable federal regulations (Stark, anti-kickback, etc.).


You will also have a great deal of visibility and interaction with high level leaders and physicians. You will also have the opportunity to learn about medical group operations and will have the ability to grow and develop a variety of skills.


Learn More about Saint Alphonsus:
https://www.saintalphonsus.org/about-us/


Minimum Qualifications:* Must possess knowledge normally acquired through completion of a Bachelor’s degree in business or healthcare related field, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Master's degree in Healthcare Administration, Business Administration, or other related field preferred.
* Five (5) years minimum experience, preferably in a health care setting, with background in accounting, finance, or provider compensation.


Highlights and Benefits:
When Saint Alphonsus takes care of you, you can take better care of our patients. We foster personal and professional growth and offer opportunities that empower our colleagues to develop their careers. Our belief in work-life balance compliments the natural beauty, diverse landscapes, and outdoor recreation lifestyle that is unique to Idaho and Oregon.


* We offer market-competitive pay, generous PTO, and multiple options for comprehensive benefits that begin on day one.
* Benefits for your future include retirement planning and matching, college savings plans for your family, and multiple life insurance plans that can change as your needs develop.
* We are proud to offer Employee Assistance Programs, tuition reimbursement, and educational opportunities to help you learn and grow.


Visit www.saintalphonsus.org/careers to learn more!


Saint Alphonsus Facility Information:
Saint Alphonsus Health System is a faith-based ministry and not-for-profit health system serving Idaho, Oregon, and northern Nevada communities. The health system boasts 4 hospitals, 609 licensed beds, and 73 clinic locations. Through innovative technologies, compassionate staff, and healing environments, Saint Alphonsus' goal is to improve the health and well-being of people by emphasizing care that is patient-centered, physician-led, innovative, and community-based.

* Top 15 Health Systems in the country by IBM Watson Health;
* The region’s most advanced Trauma Center (Level II);
* Commission on Cancer Accredited Program through demonstrating an uncompromising commitment to improving patient survival and quality of life.

**Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion**

  

Trinity Health is one of the largest not-for-profit, Catholic healthcare systems in the nation. Built on the foundation of our Mission and Core Values, we integrate diversity, equity, and inclusion in all that we do. Our colleagues have different lived experiences, customs, abilities, and talents. Together, we become our best selves. A diverse and inclusive workforce provides the most accessible and equitable care for those we serve. Trinity Health is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other status protected by law.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
**Employment Status:** Full-time, benefits eligible 

**Location:** NEW Gymreapers’ HQ in Nampa, ID (20 mins outside beautiful Boise, ID)

**Schedule:** On-site M-F, 8-5/flex according to business needs

**Compensation**: $85k to $105k, depending on experience

**Reports To:** CEO

 

**What You’ll Do:**

The Senior Financial Analyst is a newly created role for Gymreapers. This role works directly with the CEO and controller to execute the finance/FP&A function of the business, oversee financial reporting, and partner with executive leadership to deliver on company goals. They will be responsible for budgeting, forecasting, financial reporting, cash flow management, competitive benchmarking and contributing to financial decision-making to drive company performance. They are expected to have strong leadership, organizational, and communication skills. In addition, they will possess a broad knowledge of all accounting, financial and business principles.  
 

Responsibilities:

* Oversees budgeting, including permanent and temporary allocations, and reporting of operating funds.
* Advises, operates, and serves as an internal lead for senior management on budget and financial issues.
* Develops long-term financial forecasting and strategic financial analyses to inform budget development. Implements new and existing budget priorities and strategic initiatives.
* Ensure key deliverables for financial close, forecast reviews, and annual business plans are met.
* Ad-hoc analysis, financial modeling, consolidation, or related duties as required or assigned.
* Drive the financial planning process, including medium, short-term, and quarterly forecasting to ensure all plans and forecasts accurately reflect business strategy and requirements for the organization.
* Leads and facilitates communication with the business regarding best practices in policies and procedures.
* Assist with the implementation of a new ERP system, Fulfil.
* Drive the process to translate business line strategy into financial plans and targets, offering robust and insightful challenges during the budgeting and forecasting process.
* Stay close to the teams you support so that you can proactively surface and address challenges before they become real issues.
* Passion for innovative Finance solutions and process improvement.
* Manages personnel budgets, including salary savings, and carry forward.
* Develops and monitors financial reports which provide critical financial information not available with standard university reports.
* Identify opportunities for streamlining processes and improving efficiencies within the organization.
* Become a trusted advisor on all things FP&A-related to our functional Senior leaders.
* Drive the end-to-end FP&A function with functional leadership.
* Create and maintain the effectiveness of Finance policies, practices, and processes to foster continuous improvement.
* Other projects and duties as assigned.

**What You’ll Bring**

* Minimum of 3+ years of experience in senior financial planning and analysis (FP&A) roles.
* Bachelor’s degree in Business Finance or a related field.
* Understanding the needs of a high growth company from a financial perspective and applying them to cross functional departments.
* Being a team player with a willingness to continue learning.

*Gymreapers LLC is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, age, national or ethnic origin, disability, as well as any other characteristic protected by federal, provincial, or local law.*

**PROTECTING YOUR INFORMATION: STAY VIGILANT AGAINST SCAMMERS** 

At Gymreapers, we prioritize the security and privacy of our employees and future team members. Unfortunately, scammers may attempt to deceive job seekers by impersonating representatives from reputable companies like ours. We want to assure you that Gymreapers will never ask for sensitive information such as banking details or social security numbers until you are officially hired. We encourage you to contact us directly if you suspect any fraudulent activity. To ensure your safety, please remember that Gymreapers conducts in-person and/or virtual interviews with our applicants from our HQ in Nampa, ID. We prioritize getting to know you through a legitimate and secure process. Please be cautious if you receive any communication claiming to be from Gymreapers but not from our official HR@gymreapers.com email address.

Powered by JazzHR

title: FP&A Analyst - Virtual/Remote
description:
Enumerate needs a **Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst** for our rapidly growing team!Enumerate has grown rapidly through acquisitions and is backed by a leading Boston-based private equity firm. We expect to continue with strategic acquisitions while diversifying our product offerings to include payments-related services for its core HOA customer base.  
  
In this role, you’ll be responsible for budgeting and forecasting as well as the development and delivery of actionable and insightful analyses of both retrospective trends (actual v. planned) and prospective opportunities. Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will have a leading role in identifying, implementing, and improving upon these core requirements.  
  
You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. This position is remote eligible, with a preference for candidates in CST/EST. **Who will love this job**  
* Someone who is a critical thinker with a meticulous approach, high initiative, and the ability to explain financial concepts in “plain English” to non-financial stakeholders

**You should have*** Required: 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, either within a corporate Finance, FP&A function, or within investment banking, commercial banking, or private equity.
* Required: Bachelors in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other highly quantitative discipline.
* Required: Experience with SaaS (or subscription) revenue recognition, including familiarity with standard SaaS metrics/ KPIs.
* Fluency in O365- especially Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
* Strong financial modeling skills in Excel including a working knowledge of 3 statement models.
* Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.
* Ability to work in the US without sponsorship.
  
**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. When possible, we also like to offer fun in-person perks like pet-friendly offices, paid food trucks and company outings.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
**Responsibilities of this Sr Financial Analyst position include:**

* 
Prepare Costpoint billings for submission to government contract customers.

* 
Collaborate with project managers to determine accurate costs for monthly invoicing.

* 
Extract and analyze financial and billing details from contracts.

* 
Set up federal contracts in Deltek Costpoint and align with work breakdown structure and billing formulas.

* 
Submit invoices through third-party electronic billing portals and government platforms.

* 
Coordinate with director of contracts for contract reconciliation and closeout procedures.

* 
Reconcile cash receipts, resolve variances, and account for unallocated cash.

* 
Complete analysis and report inception-to-date costs, contract expenses, billing, and revenue in Costpoint.

* 
Prepare and submitting incurred cost proposal models.

* 
Generate and present weekly account receivable aging reports to senior leadership, pursuing timely resolution of outstanding invoices.

* 
Provide project reporting and analysis support to project managers.

* 
Identify and rectify quality control issues, such as duplicate billing and data entry errors.

* 
Support monthly and year-end closing processes.

* 
Fulfill additional responsibilities, ad-hoc reporting, and analysis as required.

* 
Review, approve, and process expense reimbursements in Deltek Costpoint.

* 
Reconcile balance sheet accounts.

* 
Answer Costpoint inquiries regarding system access and expense reports.


 

 

**Minimum requirements:**

* 
3+ years of experience in government contracting.

* 
Familiarity with cost accounting standards and federal acquisition regulation rules and regulations.

* 
Proficiency in Generally GAAP.

* 
Understanding of standard contract terms and their application in the billing process.

* 
Proficient in Microsoft Office, particularly Excel, as well as Costpoint Time and Expense, Costpoint accounting software, and Costpoint Enterprise Reporting.


 

If you are interested in this Sr Financial Analyst job please apply today or email your resume to jody.goss@LHH.com. To view our other accounting opportunities in the greater San Diego area, please visit our website at www.LHH.com.

 

 

Benefit offerings include employee stock ownership plan, retirement 401k plan, medical, dental, and vision benefits or health and welfare payments for service contract act, PTO, vacation, and sick leave, company-paid group term life and accidental death insurance, company-paid group long-term disability insurance, health care flexible spending account, dependent care flexible spending account, 11 federal holidays, and EAP.

*Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled*. *To read our Candidate Privacy Information Statement, which explains how we will use your information, please visit* *https://www.lhh.com/us/en/privacy-policy/*

  
  
**Pay Details:** $70,000.00 to $90,000.00 per year  
  
**Search managed by:** Jody Goss   
  
Benefit offerings available for our associates include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, additional voluntary benefits, EAP program, commuter benefits and a 401K plan. Our benefit offerings provide employees the flexibility to choose the type of coverage that meets their individual needs. In addition, our associates may be eligible for paid leave including Paid Sick Leave or any other paid leave required by Federal, State, or local law, as well as Holiday pay where applicable.

To read our Candidate Privacy Information Statement, which explains how we will use your information, please navigate to https://www.lhh.com/us/en/candidate-privacy

title: Senior Financial Analyst – SAAS
description:
**Job Summary** The Senior Financial Analyst is a key financial position supporting our fast-growing SaaS business. Initial responsibilities include working with a cross functional team to enhance/create key performance indicators (“KPI”) and reporting for our SaaS business including both financial and non-financial information. This position will work closely with our Finance teams as well as senior leaders in cross functional areas of the business. This position will work intimately with the executive leadership team in developing financial models for key strategic projects, reporting on weekly KPI’s and provided analysis. You are also expected to work closely with Accounting, HR, IT, and Sales Operations to drive system and process improvements.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:** 

• Working with a cross functional team to help enhance & create KPI's and reporting packages using both financial and operational based metrics. 

• Assist in developing and maintaining SaaS business metrics that help drive business success 

• Work closely with Information Technology and CFO to leverage existing Corporate systems and recommend enhancements, changes, or new systems to support SaaS KPIs and reporting 

• Perform variance and trend analysis between actual, budget and forecast targets for our SaaS business 

• Gain an understanding of our SAAS Dashboard within SageIntacct, auditing and reconciliation of data and building of online dashboard within the tool 

• Assist with in-depth analysis including new bookings (ACV), Upgrades, Downgrades and churn to monitor Gross and Net Revenue retention 

• Create monthly forecasts (bookings, revenue, expense, capital and headcount) that incorporates current data and any relevant functional input 

• Ensure off-line or batch reporting reconciles with existing system-based management reporting (SageIntacct and Salesforce) 

• Create ad hoc analysis as needed 

**Key Performance Indicator Reporting**

• Report on weekly KPI’s such as ACV (Orders), Recurring revenue, customer and unit roll forwards, attrition rates, CAC, LTV and customer retention. 

• Investigate variances vs. plan and meeting with department managers for input. 

• Utilize SalesForce and ERP systems (SageIntacct), together with BI tools (Intacct's ICRW, Power Pivot) for consolidation of data. 

**Financial Modeling** 

• Develop complex financial models and present analytics to support Sales, Marketing, and R&D teams 

• Assist in developing complex models that support the financial modeling related to potential Mergers & Acquisitions activity. 

• Build analytical models that utilize both financial and non-financial data to forecast operating results, scenario modeling. 

• Develop, interpret, and implement financial concepts for financial planning 

• Prepare various industry and market analyses and benchmarking, as required 

**Accounting/Financial** Systems 

• Access SageIntacct general ledger system and financial reporting systems to pull actual financials for use in trending and forecasting analyses and play a key role in developing and enhancing SageIntacct Reporting. 

• Prepare the monthly financial report with Director of Financial Planning & Analysis and executive commentary 

• Develop, communicate, and manage requirements for reporting and SAAS system enhancements and serves as point person to facilitate business support throughout the technical development process as it relates to the SAAS Dashboard and metrics. 

**Other** 

• Regular and reliable attendance is expected as this is a full-time position 

• Other duties as assigned by management 

**Position Requirements:** 

• Experience in financial modeling, business analysis, FP&A, business integration, analytics in 

• Excellent MS Office skills, specifically MS Word and MS Excel (INDEX,VLOOKUP, PIVOT TABLES, NPV, IRR, DATA TABLE, WHAT-IF ANALYSIS) 

• Advanced experience working with SAAS Metrics. 

• Strong analytical and problem-solving skills 

• Good communication skills (verbal, written and listening). 

• Ability to switch from complex to routine tasks when required. 

• Experience using Microsoft-Great Plains, SageIntacct, Oracle NetSuite, Cognos Financial Performance Management Software and Zuora, in a corporate environment. 

• Experience creating financial models, including use of database manipulation (e.g. Tableau, Power Pivot, ICRW & Excel). 

• Minimum of 5 years of financial analyst experience in software-as-a-service, software, and/ or other related technology industries preferred. Solid understanding of recurring revenue and related KPI’s is required. 

• Bachelor’s degree in Finance/Accounting. CPA, ACA, CFA, MBA preferred 

**Physical/Mental Requirements for the Job:** 

• Prolonged periods of sedentary movement 

• May be requested to work overtime and weekends if deemed necessary 

• Must be able to lift at least 20 pounds 

• Certain management positions might be required to occasional trave
