title: Senior FMS Financial Analyst - MIDS
description:
At MBC, we believe we can. We believe in working hard to meet our clients’ outcomes. We believe in laughter to help us recharge, draw people together, foster a positive work environment, and boost creativity. We believe in listening to our employees, partners, and clients. We believe in always challenging ourselves, for it is through pushing our boundaries that we achieve our greatest successes. This mindset propels our employees and our teams to accomplish our goals. That’s where you come in. If you believe in these things too, you’re our kind of person!   
  
We are currently seeking a **Senior** **Foreign Military Sales (FMS) Financial Analyst** to join our team in San Diego, CA.   
**What you’ll do:**

The Senior FMS Financial Analyst will provide financial management support to the U.S. Navy’s MIDS program office.

**Responsibilities:**

* Provide funding establishment, allocation and transfer in NERP
* FMS Administrative funding budget exhibit development, submission and execution
* Provide case reconciliation, financial anomaly resolution and FMS case closure

**Qualifications:**

* 7+ years’ experience in NAVWARSYSCOM/PEO C4I OR NAVAIRSYSYCOM FMS
* Expert NERP skills
* Prior FMS budgeting experience
* Active DOD Secret security clearance
* Proficiency using Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint
* Excellent attention to detail and organizational skills
* Strong verbal and written interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills
* Ability to travel domestically and internationally using a credit card or prepaid debit card as required by MBC and/or clients
* Attend meetings and provide client support onsite/in person when required

**What MBC offers:**

* Competitive salaries
* Comprehensive medical plans (Aetna) with Employee Assistance Program (EAP), heath savings and flexible spending accounts, and dental and vision coverage options
* Opportunity to earn spot awards and annual, performance, and chargeability bonuses
* Traditional and Roth 401(K) plans
* Professional development including up to $2,500/year reimbursement for pre-approved courses, trainings, continued education, and/or certifications
* Paid Flexible Time Off
* 10 paid holidays

**Equal Employment Opportunity Statement**

MBC is an Equal Opportunity / Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, or protected veteran status. We participate in the E-Verify Employment Verification Program.

title: Sr. Financial Analyst
description:
4Liberty is a Technology Solutions and Integration Partner specializing in IT Infrastructure & Support, Facility Communications Services, Security, and Professional and Energy Services supporting Government, Commercial, Industrial and Utility Customers.

We are always seeking talented, enthusiastic and innovative professionals who are passionate, customer focused and want to make a difference. If you are self-motivated, interested in achieving your full potential and enjoy working with like-minded professionals – we invite you to review our opportunities and submit your application!

**LOCATION**

San Diego, California. Candidate must currently live in the greater San Diego County region or be willing to relocate by date of hire.

**CANDIDATE**

Seeking a high-energy, detail oriented, team player with experience working as part of a high performing team of financial analysts in support of complex financial controls, budgeting, and forecasting in a client-based environment. Successful candidate will have excellent verbal and written communication skills across all levels of the business environment from engineering to C-Suite. Ideal candidate will have experience working in a regulated utility or equivalent financial environment.

**OVERVIEW**

The Financial Analyst / Sr. Financial Analyst performs project financial analysis and modeling with varying levels of complexity for various business units. May directly partner with one or multiple business units to design and develop costing/profitability models and reports for the Finance Team. May directly provide specialized financial consulting and analytical support at the assigned project level identifying key emerging financial trends, measurement of key performance metrics and success factors, capital budget and key initiative evaluation and planning, cost analyses and customized reporting. Monthly, quarterly, annual and ad-hoc reporting requirements across multiple projects or programs.

**SUPERVISION LEVEL**

* Reports to the Finance Manager, may assume Lead role for assigned work. Work is highly independent and collaborative in nature

**TYPICAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Leverage standardized financial models utilizing advanced MS Excel, Business Objects, and IBM Cognos TM1 functionalities to conduct monthly, quarterly, and annual budgeting, forecasting and reporting exercises
* Build and manage project and program costing models, custom and ad-hoc reports, and dashboards for use by Project/Program Managers, Team Leads, Business Unit Managers and Senior Management
* Utilize BI tools to deliver meaningful insights into business performance
* Work with Project/Program Managers and department heads to build monthly, quarterly, annual and ad-hoc budgets and forecasts and re-forecasts
* Provide financial, analytical, planning, and forecasting expertise to assist in the development and completion of projects
* Communicate to management the reasons behind capital project performance and results
* Review existing processes and procedures to develop recommendations for and coordinate improvement efforts
* Materials and labor requisitions; materials forecasting and modeling
* Ad Hoc requests and one-off projects as assigned

**EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS**

A combination of experience, education, and/or training which substantially demonstrates the following knowledge, skills and abilities:

* 8+ years of related specialized financial controls experience
* 5+ years in-depth experience with SAP; BI, ECM, CCMS Modules
* Energy/Utility, DOE, DOD or equivalent environment
* Established track record with proven ability to successfully lead a finance team within complex fast-paced corporate environments
* Budget management exposure from $100K to $100M
* 3 years exposure working with critical path deadline-driven budget models utilizing Microsoft Project, Project Enterprise, Primavera (P6) or equivalent project tools
* Subject matter expert and specialist on complex finance, accounting, and business matters
* In-depth understanding of financial analysis, financial modeling and capital budgeting techniques and concepts
* In-depth understanding of Finance and Accounting concepts and mechanisms, both general and company-specific in nature
* Expert level, hands-on knowledge of Excel & PowerPoint, Financial Modeling, and Financial Systems
* Experience with PowerBI and data tables highly desirable

**EDUCATION & TRAINING**

* Master's degree or higher in Finance or Accounting

**SOFT SKILLS**

* Excellent verbal and written communication
* Demonstrated interpersonal skills in day-to-day operations and under-pressure
* Demonstrated ability to influence others and convey schedule deliverables in a concise manner
* Ability to work both in a team environment and independently with minimal supervision
* Detail oriented with excellent organizational, planning and follow-up skills

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS**

Physical demands are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential job functions. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform essential functions:

* Sit or stand at a desk and use a computer workstation for up to 6 hours per day
* Reach and use hands and fingers to feel objects or controls
* Occasionally lift and/or move up to 15 pounds

title: Financial/Accounting Analyst For Cardiology Practice
company: San Diego Cardiac Center Medical Group Inc
description:
**POSITION SUMMARY:**

As an internal client-facing professional, the Financial/Accounting Analyst is a key position in the Administration department. The incumbent will assist in the clarification and development of process improvements and the reconciliation of monthly, quarterly, and yearly financial reporting for the San Diego Cardiac Center (SDCC). 

**PRIMARY DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:** The primary job functions required of our Financial/Accounting Analyst includes the following, but not limited to:

* Recording monthly journal entries into the general ledger system for assigned locations
* Manage month-end closing process
* Assist with accounts payable processing
* Manage close process by producing revenue reports and produce financial statements
* Reconcile balance sheets and cash accounts
* Create monthly operation statements for locations and verify monthly financials are turned in by deadline
* Assist with the preparation of other reports provided by management
* Prepare analysis of financial results for multiple entities on a monthly basis
* Compile semi-annual productivity reports for providers, compute bonuses
* Input physician bonuses in payroll
* Communicate problems to the CEO and/or HR Manager, as appropriate
* Maintain strictest confidentiality; adhere to all HIPAA guidelines/regulations
* Be a team player: Identify how you might assist fellow team members
* Always represent SDCC and its staff and Providers in a professional, courteous, and respectful manner on or off property
* Perform other duties as assigned or requested

**CORE COMPENTENCIES AND EXPECTATIONS:** A successful Accounting Analyst will possess the necessary core competencies and meet the general expectations and position requirements, such as:

* Associate or Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance
* 2+ Years of Experience in a Corporate or Public Accounting setting
* Ability to manage multiple assignments and meet internal financial deadlines
* Experience with Accounting Software package such as Sage, PeopleSoft, Quickbooks, PowerBI, etc.
* Strong analytical and problem solving skills
* Strong organizational skills
* Build relationships with your locations and vendors
* Team player and ability to work independently
* Understand how to read and interpret financial records and reports
* Proficiency in Excel and other Microsoft Office Suite programs
* Professional written and oral

**WORKING ENVIRONMENT:**

* **Physical demands:**
+ The position may involve sitting for long periods of time, standing, bending, and stooping.
+ Responsibilities may also require the incumbent to travel between SDCC offices for support purposes.
+ Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential job functions

* **Working Conditions:**
+ Ability to function in a fast-paced/high stress healthcare office environment, which may involve dealing with a high traffic volume of people and stressful situations requiring the ability to think clearly; respond quickly; and to be able to perform multiple tasks simultaneously.

title: Principal Financial Analyst
description:
Prinicipal Financial Analyst**Location:** San Diego, CA, US

**Hours:** Monday – Friday, 8:30 am – 5:00 pm

**Salary Range:** $110,000 To 125,000 Annually

This is an exciting opportunity for a Principal Financial Analyst to join a growing, technology-focused and service-oriented team. If you thrive in a fast- paced and dynamic environment, and want to be a part of an organization with an unwavering commitment to quality dental solutions, this position is perfect for you. 

**About Us**

We are a family-owned and privately held company based in San Diego, CA with a state-of-the-art manufacturing center that provides high quality dental solutions to dental labs of all sizes. We are a technology-based manufacturing organization focused on three key business segments, including dental alloys, zirconia, and digital dentistry solutions. We continue to invest in innovative product improvement initiatives through our Quality Management System to provide our global customers with affordable, high-performance products and industry-leading excellent service. Our products are FDA regulated and ISO certified.

**About the Opportunity**

The Principal Financial Analyst – Sales is responsible for analyzing sales data showing trends, views, and projections. The role develops different reporting and data views of sales information in order for management to make informed decisions and for sales team members to have prioritized action items for focused sales efforts. The role proactively watches over sales data to identify opportunities and issues to be addressed by sales or other key leaders in the organization.

**In this role, the successful candidate will:**

* Partners with the executives, sales managers, sales reps, sales operations, and finance to determine business needs and analyses to be performed that will drive sales and improve company profitability.
* Works closely with sales managers, reps, and operations in planning and budgeting work; participates in and drives the budgeting process as it relates to sales.
* Creates and develops DOMO views, dashboards, and reports that focus on sales and sales operations that will drive strategy and management decisions.
* Determines and recommends different strategies to drive sales success and growth.
* Works closely with the Information Systems department to ensure the appropriate data is accurate and able to be accessed and queried on easily and efficiently.
* Prepares sales and cost projections in a variety of ways (e.g. regionally, salesperson focused, geographically, by product line/business unit etc.).
* Assists with and determines useful KPIs and metrics to gauge sales effectiveness.
* Manages cross-functional projects as it relates to sales initiatives, changes, and/or analyses.
* Manages incoming requests for financial information related to sales.
* Prepares reports of findings and recommendations to management.
* Performs ad hoc analyses of business situations, systems, issues and problems, and financial impact/profitability.
* Develops financial modeling through benchmarking and analysis.
* Reviews and analyzes financial data and creates reports on financial status based on the analysis results.
* Communicates clearly both in written and verbal form to a variety of constituents.
* Prepares and distributes monthly and quarterly reports.
* Compares anticipated and actual results and identifies areas of improvement.
* Reviews accounting transactions for data accuracy as needed.
* Operates in a dynamic environment with competing priorities, while maintaining attention to detail with little supervision
* Maintains confidentiality of financial information and investment decisions.
* Other duties as assigned.

**What does it take to be successful?**

* Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting or economics.
* 10+ years of experience in data analytics.
* Ability to present financial data using detailed reports and charts.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
* Strong knowledge of SQL, Access, and VBA a plus.
* Demonstrable critical thinking skills.
* Expertise in MS Excel (creating spreadsheets and using advanced formulas) and PowerPoint.
* Working knowledge of financial analytic software programs (e.g. Domo, Tableau, or Hyperion).
* Working knowledge of and implementation experience with enterprise performance management software programs a plus.
* Experience with systems integrations.
* Familiar with financial analytics databases.
* Basic understanding of Enterprise Resource Planning systems (ERP).
* Working knowledge of customer relationship management software (e.g., Salesforce)
* Working knowledge of incentive compensation models and software (e.g. Xactly)
* Excellent communication skills with both technical and non-technical colleagues and all levels of management.
* Confidentiality in handling sensitive financial information.
* Ability to learn technical concepts by reading work instructions and standard operating procedures and completing on-the-job training.
* Knowledge of cGMP regulations ISO 13485, 21CFR Part 820, CMDR SOR/98-282, 93/42/EEC, RDC 16 2013, MHLW MO 169 and TG(MD)R Sch3 preferred.

**Our Awesome Benefits!**

We offer exciting opportunities for training and learning, career development and advancement from only the best in the dental industry. With all that hard work, we are committed to ensuring the welfare of our employees and provides an amazing benefit package that includes:

* Health Plans
* Dental Plans
* Vision Plan
* 401k with Employer Match
* Paid Time Off and Paid Holidays
* Employee Events
* Wellness Programs
* Discounts for home, travel, entertainment, relaxation that includes Mobile phone service, Technology, Airline and Hotel, Theater/Theme Park tickets, Restaurants and so much more!

title: Housing Finance Analyst II
description:
**REPORTS TO:****Managing Director, Financial Consulting**

**STATUS: Full-Time (40 hours/week), Non-exempt**

**STARTING SALARY:** **$43.27 - $49.28 per hour**   
  
**LOCATION: California, U.S. (Remote or Hybrid)**

**ABOUT**  
The California Housing Partnership (the "Partnership") is seeking to hire a Housing Finance Analyst II to join our Housing Finance Consulting team. Unlike typical financial advisors, the Partnership’s Housing Finance staff do not see themselves as third-party consultants whose sole task is to run financial projections and advise on important financial decisions. Because we take to heart the part of our mission that focuses on building the long-term capacity of our clients, who we see as long-term partners, Housing Finance staff must be able and willing, after appropriate training, to provide intensive coaching and mentoring to less experienced project managers from our partner organizations as well as to engage more experienced project managers and Directors of Housing Development in detailed conversations about the pros and cons of various approaches to financing their developments and tips on avoiding pitfalls in the development process. Housing Finance staff also provide inside information on the latest trends in pricing and likely changes to program regulations and funding sources before they change.Housing Finance Analysts assist the Partnership's Housing Finance team to advise clients on financial strategies to structure and maximize equity and bond or loan proceeds raised; guide clients on the selection of equity investors and lenders and negotiation of deal terms; prepare financial projections; and obtain funding from an array of competitive programs including:

* Low Income Housing Tax Credits (LIHTC)
* Tax-Exempt Bond Financing
* State of California Housing and Community Development (HCD) programs
* Local government HOME, CDBG, bond programs and other housing funds
* Project-based Section 8 Vouchers and contract extensions
* HUD and Rural Development Programs

Housing Finance Analysts will be trained and supervised by Housing Finance Consultants. After an appropriate initial training period, Housing Finance Analysts will provide assistance to the Housing Finance Consulting team in such tasks including, but not limited to:

* Running or assisting in running in-house financial proformas, including initial feasibility analyses; updates for further analyses such as funding applications, closings, conversions, investor updates, and placed in service submittals;
* Reviewing investor and lender letters of intent and commitment letters; assisting with bid comparison analyses;
* Preparing and/or reviewing financial sections of funding applications, including TCAC, CDLAC, HCD, AHP, local government and others;
* Preparing and/or reviewing additional submittals to federal, state and/or local housing agencies, such as TCAC Subsidy Layering Review, Readiness, Carryover, and Placed in Service submittals; and updates to other agencies as required;
* Assisting with bond, loan and syndication closings and loan conversions;
* Reviewing federal, state and local housing program regulations and/or guidelines;
* Assisting with data analysis to support consulting practice or policy recommendations;
* Reviewing lender and investor loan, partnership and bond documents;
* Time and skills permitting, providing direct assistance to clients, under supervision of Housing Finance Consultants;
* Time and skills permitting, assisting in design and delivery of housing financing training sessions and presentations.

Housing Finance Analysts, like other California Housing Partnership employees, must periodically assist with basic office administrative functions consistent with a small nonprofit organization. 

**QUALIFICATIONS & REQUIREMENTS**

Our **ideal candidate** is a self-starter, detail-oriented, possesses strong organizational skills and the ability to multitask overlapping deadlines and assignments, has the capacity for independent research and analysis and has strong interpersonal and communication (verbal and written) skills. 

We recognize that each applicant for this role will bring unique skills, knowledge, experiences, and background to this position. We welcome diverse experiences and perspectives in our applicant pool, and at a minimum are seeking candidates who possess the following: 

* At least two (2) years’ experience in affordable multifamily housing development and financing
+ *Bachelor’s or master’s degree in a directly related subject area may substitute for one year of work experience*

* Basic knowledge of current multifamily financing techniques and resources, including the Low Income Housing Tax Credit (LIHTC) program;
* Proficiency with Microsoft Excel including basic equations and spreadsheet structure;
* Competency in Microsoft Word and PowerPoint;
* Proficiency with Apple computers and various cloud-based tools such as Salesforce, DropBox, Google Drive, and Microsoft OneDrive or willingness and ability to learn such tools.
* Basic knowledge of and ability to communicate about affordable rental housing policy issues;
* Alignment with the Partnership’s mission and commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion.
* Able and willing to travel within California

**ABOUT THE CALIFORNIA HOUSING PARTNERSHIP**

The Partnership is a dynamic nonprofit “think and do tank” providing critical technical assistance, training, applied research and policy leadership to increase the production and preservation of affordable and sustainable homes serving Californians who are low-income.

To achieve this mission, the Partnership’s three technical assistance teams (finance, clean energy, applied research) work closely with a network of more than 60 mission-driven nonprofit and government housing agencies throughout California, as well as the nonprofit associations who represent them.

A deep commitment to racial equity and inclusion grounds the Partnership’s work and policies – click here to learn more about our core equity values. An Equity Policy Advisory Board ensures that the perspectives and experiences of low-income renters also grounds our work – click here to learn more about this board . 

**COMPENSATION**

The Partnership provides annual performance-based raises and maintains competitive salary ranges. Compensation for all permanent employees working 20 or more hours per week includes a robust benefits package of 100% employer-paid health, dental, vision, chiropractic/acupuncture, transit subsidy, cellphone reimbursement, health reimbursement account, employee assistance plan, and employer contributions to 403(b) retirement plan.

**EQUAL OPPORTUNITY EMPLOYER**

The California Housing Partnership is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to creating a diverse, equitable, and inclusive workplace. We strongly encourage people of diverse backgrounds and identities to apply. For more information about the Partnership, visit our website at www.chpc.net.

title: Financial Analysis Curriculum Writer/Subject Matter Expert (Talent Pool - Contract)
description:
Job Description  
  
Who We Are   
  
Chegg Skills/Thinkful is a new type of school that brings high-growth tech careers to ambitious people everywhere. We provide 1-on-1 learning through our network of industry experts, hiring partners, and online platform to deliver a structured and flexible education to help upskill and reskill the workforce. We offer programs in tech and tech adjacent fields, such as AI, cybersecurity, web development, data science, data analytics, UX design, and project management, as well as power skills and leadership disciplines like sales and frontline management.   
  
Job Description   
  
We are looking for a Financial Analysis subject matter expert/curriculum writer to join us in creating curriculum content on the topic of Financial Analysis. In this role, you will work with an Instructional Designer to produce written content for curriculum designs, images, videos, assessments, learning objectives, and other educational content to support student learning. These materials will be used to support our students as they master the core skills of Financial Analysis.   
  
Our Talent Pool   
  
Our talent pool is for qualified candidates not necessarily seeking immediate employment however, open to being considered for a position when it becomes available. There is no need to follow-up on your application. Our recruiters will review resumes on a regular basis to determine and notify candidates if their qualifications match the requirements for the role.   
  
Responsibilities   
  
* Consistently deliver content that meets set criteria and is on time to support our program launch roadmap
* Create new and revised lesson content for the online program curriculum

  
* Use AI platforms like ChatGPT to generate content and then review and validate that content for accuracy and relevance
* Validate and refine the list of objectives, skills, and topics taught in the curriculum
* Create assets to support lesson plans, student activities, and written curriculum content such as:

  
* Formative and summative assessments
* Individual projects and presentations

  
* Video scripts for topic and demonstration videos
* Visual assets and/or reference images (diagrams, charts) and sample templates as needed

  
* Iterate on deliverables based on user and instructional design feedback

  
Requirements   
  
* 3+ years of hands-on experience in finance or financial analysis

  
* Demonstrated subject matter expert in financial analysis
* Previous experience developing finance curriculum materials for adults in topics like:

  
* Accounting Foundations (3 Financial Statements)
* Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A)
* Excel

  
* Presentation skills

  
* Collaborative (e.g., you enjoy partnering with people and have excellent project management skills and follow through)
* Excellent writing skills (e.g., you can produce high-quality prose as well as high-quality presentations. You have a gift for writing about complicated concepts in a beginner-friendly way, and can appropriately scaffold content for beginners)
* Comfort with scripting and recording demo videos
* Capable of remote work. You enjoy collaborating and partnering with people in a remote environment and have excellent project management skills and follow through.

  
* Demonstrated experience using Microsoft tools (i.e., Word, PowerPoint, and Excel)
* Ideally available 20-40 hours per week, but do not hesitate to apply if you have less availability

  
Ideal Skills   
  
* Experience in Instructional Design
* Experience with Adult Learning Theories

  
* Experience using AI platforms like ChatGPT
* Experience using project management software like Jira
* Visual design skills (e.g., you can translate complex ideas or concepts into charts, infographics, diagrams, or video scripts/demos)
* Editorial experience and skills

  
Compensation and Benefits   
  
* Compensation range between $40-$120/hour. Final rate will be determined at hire, and will depend on many factors, including program domain, market demand, expertise, location, etc.
* Contract position with a collaborative team
* Ability to work remotely with flexible hours

  
Why do we exist?  
  
Students are working harder than ever before to stabilize their future. Our recent research study called State of the Student shows that nearly 3 out of 4 students are working to support themselves through college and 1 in 3 students feel pressure to spend more than they can afford. We founded our business on provided affordable textbook rental options to address these issues. Since then, we've expanded our offerings to supplement many facets of higher educational learning through Chegg Study, Chegg Math, Chegg Writing, Chegg Internships, Thinkful Online Learning, and more to support students beyond their college experience. These offerings lower financial concerns for students by modernizing their learning experience. We exist so students everywhere have a smarter, faster, more affordable way to student.  
  
Video Shorts  
  
Life at Chegg: http://youtu.be/Fwf90zgaOLA  
  
Certified Great Place to Work!: http://reviews.greatplacetowork.com/chegg  
  
Chegg Corporate Career Page: https://jobs.chegg.com/  
  
Chegg India: http://www.cheggindia.com/  
  
Chegg Israel: http://www.chegg.com/about/working-at-chegg/israel/  
  
Thinkful (a Chegg Online Learning Service): https://www.thinkful.com/about/#careers  
  
Chegg out our culture and benefits!  
  
http://www.chegg.com/about/working-at-chegg/benefits/  
  
http://techblog.chegg.com/  
  
Chegg is an equal opportunity employer

title: Financial Business Analyst
description:
**Job Description:** * Develop Biannual and Annual Project Budgets.
* Track, Evaluate, and Report on Project Budgets.
* Use the Commonwealth's enhanced Management Accounting and Reporting System (eMars).
* Develop and maintain federal financial proposals (similar to grants), reports, and planning documents within required timelines.
* Research projects and programs related to the proposals and documents.
* Work closely with agency management and project teams to gain an understanding of the project and related requirements in order to develop appropriate document content.
* Organize material and complete assignments according to agency standards regarding order, clarity, conciseness, style, and terminology.
* Work with subject matter experts to develop content for document budgets and facilitate document review meetings for submission to federal sponsors.
* Utilize a combination of computer and critical thinking skills.
* Maintaining confidentiality and exercising discretion is essential with data and information.

 Qualifications: * Bachelor's degree or equivalent combination of recent, relevant work experience.
* 3+ years of budget development and accounting experience.
* Knowledge of State and Federal financial requirements/methodologies.
* Have exceptional written and oral communication skills.
* Proficient in Microsoft Product Suites (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio).
* Experience in the development of budgets based on information obtained through requirements gathering.
* Experience utilizing time management capabilities in high-stress environments.
* Must be well organized and possess excellent team-building skills.
* Prior writing experience of financial request documents in a governmental environment.
* Prior experience with the Commonwealth's eMars system (including Budgeting, Accounting, and Procurement).
* Working knowledge of government regulations as they pertain to the grant proposal and advance planning document request process.
* Prior experience preparing healthcare information technology proposals or working in the healthcare technology environment.

 Key Competencies: * Organizational and planning skills.
* Outstanding communication skills.
* Information gathering and monitoring skills.
* Problem analysis and problem-solving skills.
* Judgment and decision-making ability.
* Initiative and Adaptability.
* Attention to detail and accuracy.

title: Business Loan Servicing Analyst
description:
**Build Your Future Here:**

Thinking of changing jobs or starting your career at a growing company? Well you are in the right place. Join us on our journey to being the Best Community Bank in America. Our motto is *Working Together. Building Success.* and by joining Peoples Bank, we will work together to help you achieve your career goals, just like we help thousands of clients reach their financial goals.

Peoples Bank is one of the largest 200 banks in the United States with 132 full-service bank branches in Ohio, West Virginia, Kentucky, Virginia, Washington D.C. and Maryland. Peoples Bank prides itself as a community bank and dedicates its resources to improving our communities. The Peoples Bank Foundation celebrated its 20th anniversary in 2023 and is proud to share over $7 million has been donated to local organizations since its inception.

Some of Peoples Bank recent nationwide accolades:

* American Banker Best Banks to Work For in 2021, 2022 and 2023
* Top Workplaces USA national award in 2022 and 2023
* Newsweek's America's Best Banks 2023

At Peoples Bank, we know that there is more to life than work. But we also understand that the quality of the work environment and employee benefits can greatly impact an associate's life. That's why we seek to create a great benefits package for our associates including: 401(k) retirement plan with an employer match, employee stock purchase plan, various education assistance programs, paid vacation and holidays, and much more. For full details of our benefits offerings, please visit: peoplesbancorp.com/about-us/find-a-career/ 

**Job Purpose:** 

This position is responsible for individual credit portfolio servicing and management of assigned credits within the Business Loan Servicing Group’s overall portfolio. Responsibilities include analyzing and evaluating required financial information pertaining to each individual type, size and complexity of credits assigned which includes gathering, analyzing, and reporting various credit metrics. Will assist Business Loan Portfolio Managers with credit transactions and overall portfolio tasks, including but not limited to, financial statement collection, financial results spreading, analyses, risk rating validation, annual reviews, and general credit underwriting, monitoring, and early stage collection efforts. Will be required to operate within the Bank’s risk appetite while adhering to the Bank’s Commercial Lending Policy and best practices. Analysts Will consistently and continually identify, assess, monitor, and report risks of all types and collaborate with team members to ensure implementation of strategies to mitigate that risk. 

**Job Duties:** 

* Responsible for analyzing and evaluating required financial information pertaining to each individual type, size and complexity of credits assigned which includes gathering, analyzing and reporting various credit metrics.
* Review loan documents and monitor loan payment histories, past dues, loan collateral and inspections, monetary compliance/defaults.
* Perform guarantor and business financial analyses, track and test covenant compliance, financial statement reporting and compliance, identify financial trends, assess and validate risk ratings.
* Responsible for ordering and reviewing credit bureaus, background checks, and other third party reports as may be warranted.
* Directly communicate with commercial borrowers regarding credit events and actions, including but not limited to, delinquency, required financial statement collection, covenant compliance, defaults, loan renewals, refinances, criticized asset reviews, annual or shelf reviews.
* Provide timely and accurate reporting to management and assist management in monitoring and following-up on monthly reporting, including but not limited to, collateral or documentation exception, delinquency, financial statement, financial covenant tracking, borrowing base, and maturity reports.
* Accountable for accuracy of risk ratings, identifying early warning signs of deteriorating loans and the timely escalation of defaults, potential issues, risks, or ‘red flags’ suggesting elevated loan or portfolio risk; collaborate in the devise of appropriate credit actions to mitigate said risk.
* Assist Business Loan Portfolio Manager in defining borrowers and guarantors, deal structure, credit terms and conditions, financial reporting, covenant structure and prepare written credit memoranda to memorialize the same.
* Collaborate with internal partners such as Commercial Documentation Preparation and Funding and Commercial Loan Operations to close approved transactions.
* Record collection and or progress notes into the CARM PRO system
* Partner with Commercial Collections on defaulted lines and troubled credits.
* Focus on execution within defined credit lending policies and procedures.
* Monitor market and industry specific segment trends, continuous learning to keep pace with ever-changing market dynamics.
* Manage internal and external resources and deliver on our core values to support a high level of customer experience and reduce attrition while effectively controlling expenses.
* Will perform special projects as assigned.

**Education, Job Skills and Qualifications:**

* Bachelors or Associates Degree preferred, or equivalent relevant work experience.
* Credit underwriting, financial and credit risk analytical skills and experience required.
* Business credit, underwriting, or portfolio monitoring experience preferred.
* Familiarity with U.S. Small Business Administration loan programs and other federal, state, and municipal alternative lending programs preferred, but not required.
* Working knowledge of the following:
1. Business Lending (Retail, service, small commercial, manufacturing, construction, real estate, and small agricultural).
2. Banking regulations
3. Credit approval preparation and presentation.
4. Loan documentation, ordering, assembly, review and execution.
5. Collateral valuation, gathering/ordering and evaluation.
6. Bank policy adherence and execution.
7. Financial and risk analyses.
* Must possess highly developed interpersonal skills.
* Ability to work independently with minimal guidance/supervision but also be a team player to ensure departmental goals are achieved.
* Strong business acumen, attention to detail with organizational and analytical skills, and well-honed written, oral and presentation skills.
* Proficient with technology and ability to learn new applications.
* Ability to travel to business sites or to company related activity as required.

**Basic Qualifications:**

* Bachelors or Associates Degree preferred, or equivalent relevant work experience.
* Credit underwriting, financial and credit risk analytical skills and experience required.
* Ability to travel to business sites or to company related activity as required.

**Equal Opportunity Employer M/F/Disabled/Vet;****If you are unable to complete this application due to a disability, contact** **humanresources@pebo.com** **to ask for an accommodation, alternative application process, or other inquiries.**

title: Senior Accountant - Audit
description:
**Senior Accountant, Audit**

Ready to work at a Top 60 CPA Firm? Blue has been named as a “Best Place to Work” in Indiana and Kentucky, and “Best Employer” in Ohio. At Blue, you are a person, not a number, and a valued member of the team. We take pride in fostering a great culture, providing competitive salaries- including 401k match and generous PTO, flexible work environments, health and well-being benefits, and engaging you in our award-winning, in-house professional development programs. At Blue, we truly value the development of ALL employees and encourage them to bring their true authentic selves to work. 

  


At Blue, our professionals embody more than just technical skills. Here is what you would do in the role of Senior Accountant, Audit:

 

* Listen carefully to clients. Our clients consider us their trusted advisors. They have problems to solve and come to us for help. Understand their needs and seek to understand the root of their issues.
* Build relationships with clients. Talk to clients and get to know them. We value words as much as we value numbers, and it is through engaged conversations you will come to learn what is important to a client. We are looking for individuals willing to engage in conversation beyond audit matters.
* Find solutions. You are the client’s advisor and as such you own the matter you are working on. Sometimes you will have the answer. Sometimes you will have to research it. Other times you will need to seek guidance from other people in the firm. Your role is to make sure the client has the answer they need.
* Continually learn and become a subject matter expert in your area(s) of interest.
* Involvement in all aspects and levels of assurance engagements.
* Perform field work and supervise Staff Accountants.
* Draft financial statements and client communication letters.
* Ensure engagement completion.
* Help clients implement effective and efficient processes and controls.
* Training and mentoring Staff Accountants.

 

Here are the qualifications you should bring to the table:

 

* A genuine interest in helping clients and coworkers.
* A desire to solve problems.
* A drive to continually learn.
* CPA Certification or eligible and actively pursuing certification.
* 3-5 years of relevant audit experience in a similar public accounting firm position.
* Proven financial, analytical, technical and interpersonal skills.
* Excellent client service and demonstrated business development skills.
* Senior Accountants must have demonstrated ability to oversee and manage engagements, prioritize engagements and supervise/motivate staff.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
* Ability to travel up to 20 overnights annually; work at other offices and driving to and from client locations is required.

 

*Blue is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status.* *We will not sponsor an employment related visa for this position. A background check will be required for employment in this position.*

title: Financial Services Representative  State Farm Agent Team Member
description:
Clint Conrad is an award-winning State Farm Agent looking to grow our excellent, hardworking team. Our team's mission is to help people manage the risks of everyday life, recover from the unexpected and realize their dreams.  
  
**Role Description:** As a Financial Services Representative with Clint Conrads State Farm Agency, you will successfully market the financial products that manage everyday risks. Your proficient knowledge of financial products reinforces your sales-minded and consultative approach to educating customers on their financial options. Your analytical precision makes you an invaluable resource to customers and a competitive addition to a successful agency.   
  
**Qualifications:**  
* Bachelors degree in finance, economics, or related field.
* Must be able to obtain Property & Casualty and Life & Health Licenses,
* Must be able to obtain relevant financial service licenses.
* Proven experience working as a financial services representative in the investment field preferred.
* Sound knowledge in financial legislation.
* Experience in sales of 401k and small business retirement plans preferred.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications.
* Strong mathematical skills.
* Excellent analytical, organizational, and problem-solving skills.
* Effective communication skills.
* Exceptional customer service skills.
* Successfully track record of meeting sales goals/quotas preferred.
* Current, active Securities License strongly preferred.

**Responsibilities:**  
* Use a customer-focused, needs-based review process to educate customers about insurance options.
* Work with the agent to establish and meet marketing goals
* Develop leads, schedule appointments, identify customer needs, and market appropriate products and services.

**What do we offer?** We offer a variety of benefits to support our team, including:   
* Simple IRA
* Salary & Commission/Bonus
* We reimburse for P/C and L/H Licensing
* Paid Sales, Customer Service Software Training
* Paid Time Off (Vacation and Personal/Sick Days)
* Work/Life Balance: Monday through Friday Work Work with Weekends Off
* Valuable Work Experience
* Growth Potential & Opportunity for Advancement within my Agency
* Agent Aspirant Program: 1-3 year Career Track to become an Agent and own a business which equates to potential of earning annual compensation over 6-figures

**Hours:** Monday-Friday 9:00 AM 5:00 PM with 2 locations in Lexington, KY. (3090 Harrodsburg Rd and 1510 Newtown Pike)  
  
**Compensation**: $55,000-$85,000  
Our compensation expectations show a range of our salary plus commission system. With our profitable and thriving market and business model, team development, and intentional hiring process, we are confident that you will be successful in achieving high-earning compensation amounts.  
  
**About Clint Conrads Agency:** Clint has proudly served his community as a second-generation State Farm Agent since 2013. As risk managers, he feels that it is his teams responsibility to teach customers about coverages and gaps that families dont tend to think about. His team is consistently recognized as one of the top State Farm Agencies in the USA, and Clints agency brings a diverse group of talents and expertise to Lexington area. Come see how you can join the team and become a good neighbor, and we hope to bring in a new member that is just as positive and enthusiastic about supporting and engaging with our local community.

description:

title: Financial Analyst Internship - Summer 2024 PT
description:
Salary: $13.50/hour  
At Madhouse, our people are our greatest differentiator and competitive advantage. We are all united in delivering the best communities possible for our residents. Throughout the internship, you will work closely with members of the team including Development Managers, Asset Managers, and the Executive Team in developing and enhancing the next Madhouse communities. You will participate in financial and market analysis, financial reporting, the development entitlement process, site acquisition, the completion of lender and investor due diligence, and construction project management. The environment will be collaborative in nature and provide the opportunity to improve your skillsets in finance, accounting, and general real estate development. Madhouse has a commitment to being a leader in the multifamily industry and you will be part of a team leading the way into the future.

  


**PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITIES**

Participate in the financial analysis of the development process for multifamily communities and financial activities for Madhouse Development including:

* Assessing the economic performance of specific real estate projects and providing a detailed analysis.
* Maintaining Madhouse databases by entering, verifying, and backing up data; updating an operating expense database for the Madhouse real estate portfolio.
* Building financial models and performing valuation analysis for multifamily communities and other real estate investments.
* Recommending actions by analyzing and interpreting data and making comparative analyses; studying proposed changes in methods and materials.
* Increasing efficiencies by developing automated accounting applications; coordinating information requirements.
* Determining cost of operations by establishing standard costs; collecting operational data.
* Assisting with the cost analysis process by establishing and enforcing policies and procedures, providing trends and forecasts, explaining processes and techniques, and recommending actions to improve the analysis process.
* Tracking expenses and revenues vs. budget and reforecast and analyzing any fluctuations.
* Preparing monthly consolidation and executive financial packages as needed.
* Analyzing quarterly operating reports.
* Evaluating profit and cost efficiencies in various areas of the organization as needed.
* Measuring financial risks associated with a specific investment.
* Writing reports and making presentations for purposes of recommending the purchase or selling of specific investments.
* Creating monthly expense reports/P&Ls and providing variance analysis for management review.
* Reviewing monthly expenses to ensure that expenses are booked correctly and working with the accounting team to make any necessary reclassification.
* Assisting with the preparation of construction-related draws, cost certifications, and certified audits.
* Preparing and providing brief development status reports for Madhouse to be used in connection with periodic staff meetings, and ensuring that all required reporting deadlines are met, including those with Madhouse and those with third parties, such as governmental authorities and financing entities.
* Working with the Development department to complete due diligence activities and other project-related duties.
* Performing activities associated with government relations, project acquisition, and development for Madhouse.
* Assisting in locating markets and municipalities for proposed developments, along with evaluating and procuring properties for acquisition and rehabilitation for the purpose of Housing Tax Credit allocations.
* Assisting Madhouse in working with neighborhood groups, local organizations, adjacent property owners, and other parties interested in the development, organizing meetings with such parties, if requested, and preparing information on the development for such parties.
* Providing advice and recommendations as to the selection procedures for the Housing Tax Credit application for scoring purposes.
* Providing input for the creation of budgets and timelines for the various stages of acquisition and development of Housing Tax Credit applications.

  


**KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & ABILITIES**

* Advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office, with an emphasis on Excel.
* Strong initiative and ability to manage multiple projects as well as strong follow-through skills.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Ability to complete projects timely and accurately.
* Detail oriented with strong organizational and analytical skills.
* Ability to work well with others in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Calculative mind with problem-solving skills.
* Attention to detail for purposes of finding some of the obscure facts in their line of work.
* Must be able to make a convincing presentation.

  


**EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS**

* Currently enrolled sophomore, junior, senior, or graduate students at an accredited college/university.
* Focus in Finance, Economics, Accounting, or Real Estate required.
* Accounting/GAAP knowledge.
* Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.00

  


**WAGE AND SCHEDULE**

* Initial salary shall be $13.50 per hour paid bi-weekly.
* Must be able to commit a minimum of 25 hours per week for a minimum of 10 weeks.
+ Up to 40 hours per week are available.

* Internships are on-site, in our office located in Austin, TX.

  


**BENEFITS** 

* Work/Life/Fun balance in a casual and collaborative work environment.
* Interns enjoy company-wide events and celebrations.

  


**SUMMARY**

* Employment Type: Seasonal, Temporary
* Location: On site in Austin, Texas; Corporate Office
* Work Hours/Week: 25 hours per week
* Compensation: $13.50/hour
* Required Travel: None

  


 

*Applicants must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S. We are unable to sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment visa at this time.*

  
*Madhouse is an equal opportunity employer. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.*

title: FP&A Analyst - Virtual/Remote
description:
Enumerate needs a **Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst** for our rapidly growing team!Enumerate has grown rapidly through acquisitions and is backed by a leading Boston-based private equity firm. We expect to continue with strategic acquisitions while diversifying our product offerings to include payments-related services for its core HOA customer base.  
  
In this role, you’ll be responsible for budgeting and forecasting as well as the development and delivery of actionable and insightful analyses of both retrospective trends (actual v. planned) and prospective opportunities. Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will have a leading role in identifying, implementing, and improving upon these core requirements.  
  
You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. This position is remote eligible, with a preference for candidates in CST/EST. **Who will love this job**  
* Someone who is a critical thinker with a meticulous approach, high initiative, and the ability to explain financial concepts in “plain English” to non-financial stakeholders

**You should have*** Required: 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, either within a corporate Finance, FP&A function, or within investment banking, commercial banking, or private equity.
* Required: Bachelors in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other highly quantitative discipline.
* Required: Experience with SaaS (or subscription) revenue recognition, including familiarity with standard SaaS metrics/ KPIs.
* Fluency in O365- especially Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
* Strong financial modeling skills in Excel including a working knowledge of 3 statement models.
* Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.
* Ability to work in the US without sponsorship.
  
**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. When possible, we also like to offer fun in-person perks like pet-friendly offices, paid food trucks and company outings.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**Position Purpose:** Analysis of past financial performance to predict future performance for the Company. Providing data to Senior Management to contribute to the Company’s financial strategy. 

**Responsibilities:**

* Support senior executives with key strategic initiatives and analysis
* Develop financial reporting materials for all relevant constituents including potential investors, the Board of Directors, lenders, customers, and internal management
* Responsible for analysis and interpretation of complex financial information utilizing independent judgment and discretion, identifying trends, variances, and key issues, and providing recommendations for adjustment
* Create and produce management and executive reporting including, but not limited to budgeting, capital planning, P&L, balance sheet, cash flow, working capital, and CAPEX
* Deliver high value-added financial analyses for internal (e.g. senior leadership) and ownership stakeholders to drive strategic planning and decision making
* Ensure information is complete and accurate
* Enhance profitability awareness across the organization and practice network
* Prepare presentations as necessary, summarizing key findings of analyses and projects
* Support leadership in the development and maintenance of key performance indicators (KPIs)
* Lead a broad range of ad-hoc projects focused on reducing costs and driving operational efficiencies
* Provide financial support to the organization and partner with departments to monitor their financial results
* Identify areas for improvement in processes and reporting
* Perform various ad hoc analyses as requested
* Assist in the management of financial models to forecast the business and support the periodic reporting of financial results and variances, including recommended actions for moving forward
* Support accounting by using your modeling skills to help improve/automate the process and ensure flawless coordination of planning/analysis
* Reconcile transactions by comparing and correcting data
* Other duties as assigned.

  
  
**Requirements*** 2-3 years’ experience as a Financial Analyst
* Excellent Excel skills a must
* Finance or accounting degree
* Experience working with data from financial systems (NetSuite preferred)
* Demonstrated analytical skills and problem-solving acumen.
* Highly motivated and able to take ownership of analysis projects from start to finish.
* Passion for working in a fast-paced environment, with an ability to adapt quickly to changing priorities.
* Strong communication skills, and the ability to translate the results of complex analysis into a simple and actionable explanation.
* An exemplary work ethic, a "get it done" attitude, and high personal accountability.

title: Treasury Analyst
description:
Description:The Treasury Analyst role at First National Assets Management involves a variety of responsibilities related to financial reporting, cash management, loan funding, and investor relations. The role requires strong financial analysis skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work effectively in a team environment. This role will serve multiple business units and require the ability to support various leaders.

**Essential Functions**

* Prepare financial and operational reports to support lending portfolio performance and intermediary borrowing relationships.
* Manage cash balances, cash forecasting, and assist in overseeing loan funding and flow management.
* Conduct thorough financial analyses and develop financial models using Excel spreadsheets.
* Develop, produce, and monitor key metrics and other financial indicators using automated processes and KPI dashboards.
* Act as a liaison between business units and investors/intermediaries to ensure post-closing file compliance, including addressing any deficiencies.
* Collaborate with team members to resolve issues with credit or collateral documents to meet investor requirements and mitigate financial risk for the business units.
* Provide regular assessments and feedback to improve loan file quality, identifying areas for potential training or coaching.
* Work diligently to eliminate manual tasks wherever possible to enhance efficiency.
* Produce ad-hoc analyses and reports as needed.
* Prepare monthly financial reconciliations for loan cash receipts and investor payments.
* Participate in cross-functional process improvement teams to develop operational efficiencies and report outcomes to senior management.

Requirements:* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or related discipline.
* Strong analytical and communication skills.
* Previous experience with financial modeling preferred.
* Previous experience with Salesforce and Encompass reporting preferred.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office.
* Advanced knowledge of Excel functions; SQL experience a plus.
* Strong attention to detail, especially when analyzing, presenting, and defending financial forecasts and assumptions.
* Ability to support multiple stakeholders throughout the organization and manage shifting priorities.
* Effective interaction at all internal organizational levels.
* Demonstrated professionalism, judgment, and discretion in handling sensitive information.
* Proven ability to complete projects in a timely manner.
* Capable and motivated to grow.

title: Financial Analyst 1790a
description:
Salary: $70,000.00  
**Who we are**

Over 500 employees strong, Asure sees Human Capital Management (HCM) through the lens of entrepreneurs and executives with an owner’s mentality. We help businesses develop their “Human Capital” to get to the next level, stay compliant, and allocate their time, money and technology toward growth. Our HCM platform empowers more than 80,000 clients to build great teams and better manage their people while staying compliant in an ever-changing HR legislative landscape. Asure’s HCM offering includes Payroll & Tax, HR, and Time & Attendance software and HR Services ranging from online compliance tools to a fully outsourced HR department.

  


***This position will report to our corporate office in Austin, Texas.***

  


**Summary:** Our Financial Analyst will work with the FP&A team and will partner with business leaders to assist in managing the annual budget process as well as monthly forecast updates, analysis of business trends and managing key performance indicators. The role will assist in preparing management reports outlining revenue and expense performance and identifying the cause of variances. The role will also contribute to bespoke projects and analysis as necessary.

 

**How you will contribute in this role**

* Partner with business leaders on a regular basis to understand their needs and changes in the business.
* Provide financial insights to key business leaders and assist with short and long-term planning.
* Provide management reporting to the business with relevant variance analysis, adjusting the outlook models to reflect operational adjustments.
* Analyze Actual variances to Budget/Forecast and review with the management team.
* Support and maintain the key metrics used in presentations for the Board of Directors, earnings calls, investors, auditors, etc.
* Develop and monitor key financial metrics and business drivers.
* Support processes to ensure accurate and timely completion of financial planning consolidations.
* Ensure reporting systems and source data are accurate and reconciled.
* Provide ad hoc analysis for business support.

  


**Qualifications and Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Finance, Accounting, CIS, or equivalent.
* 1-5 years of financial analysis experience.
* Advanced Excel modeling and data mining and analysis skills, strong PowerPoint skills. Knowledge of database systems such as SQL, etc. is an asset.
* Experience with NetSuite and Salesforce is a plus.
* Diligent, highest standards of accuracy with exceptional attention to detail and commitment to meeting critical deadlines.
* Team player and effective communicator with strong organizational and interpersonal skills and a business partnering mindset.
* Positive, proactive, can-do attitude and ability to achieve results in a collegial, team-oriented approach.
* Curious, with the ability to think critically, question the output of a financial model, and consider options for improvement.

  


**Benefits**

* Medical, Dental, Vision, HSA, FSA- effective day 1!
* Basic Life, A+D, and STD
* 401K Program
* Employee Stock Purchase Program
* PTO

 

**Our Mission**

To provide Human Capital Management (HCM) software and services that help companies grow, while nurturing a culture of growth around us.

* Helping customers grow by getting the most from their human capital.
* Helping our employees grow personally and professionally.
* Growing relationships in our communities that inspire goodness.
* Grow shareholder value

 

**Our Vision**

Be the most trusted Human Capital Management resource to entrepreneurs everywhere.

  


**Our Values**

Reflect who we are and what we stand for as a company.

* Embrace Change
* Lead with Integrity
* Own the Outcome
* Deliver Awesome
* Be a Good Human

 

*We are an equal opportunity employer. All candidates must be legally authorized to work in the US, as we are unable to sponsor or transfer Visas at this time. Criminal background checks conducted at employment offer.*

  


NO AGENCIES PLEASE

Any unsolicited resumes sent to Asure Software from a third party, such as an Agency, including unsolicited resumes sent to Asure’s mailing address, fax machine or email address, directly to employees or hiring managers will be considered Asure property. Asure will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.

title: Data Analyst (REMOTE)
description:
Everlight Solar is seeking a skilled Data Analyst who will design and maintain functional programs and applications, producing fully functional software applications according to requirements. As a Data Analyst, you play a key role in serving our clients and team members. This will be a full-time, work-from-home "remote" position.

**This is a role for Apple power-users, must know iWork and be skilled with iOS and macOS.**

Everlight Solar is a rapidly growing company and the leader of solar energy in the Midwest. We offer a unique experience that fosters individual growth and rewards performance. Our culture at Everlight is extremely important to us. The work environment is fast-paced and dynamic. We value teamwork, quality, innovation, and customer success. Our ideal candidate is self-motivated, detail-oriented, has excellent problem-solving abilities, is passionate about delivering results on-time, exceeding expectations, and ensuring success for our teams.

**Responsibilities:**

* Work with large amounts of data to draw meaningful conclusions
* Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
* Provide regular reporting and analysis to team
* Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key metrics and performance indicators
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify areas for improvement and to develop solutions to enhance business operations
* Provide training and support to team members on data analysis techniques and tools

**Requirements:**

* Minimum two years of experience with DOMO
* MajorDOMO Certification Required
* 3+ years experience in data analysis, reporting, business intelligence or financial analysis and a Bachelor's Degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Computer Sciences or related field or equivalent experience
* 2 years experience in providing people analytics reporting to organizations
* Demonstrated experience using SQL, and DOMO
* Experience with sensitive and confidential people data in a global environment
* Analyze, evaluate, improve, and document processes and workflows. Identify and take advantage of opportunities for process automation and simplification.
* Proven ability to design and implement new processes and facilitate user adoption.
* Strong understanding of Salesforce.com best practices and functionality
* Strong data management abilities
* A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion
* A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
* Excellent project management skills and a positive attitude
* Must demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills
* Must demonstrate ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization
* Must own a Mac computer and be fluent with the Apple ecosystem of software (iOS, macOS, iWork, etc.)

**Benefits:**  


* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Life Insurance
* PTO
* Sick and Safe Time
* Paid Holidays Off

**Salary: $65,000-$100,000/year**

*Everlight Solar is proudly an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity of all types and are excited to work with talented individuals from a wide range of backgrounds. Everlight is committed to inclusion and we invite people of any race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex, age groups (18+), and levels of education to apply. Authorized to work in the US and background check required.*

title: FP&A Analyst - Austin TX
description:
**Job Title: FP&A Analyst**

**Department: Finance**

AwayDay is an exciting, growing organization in the vacation rental industry. As rental property managers in key vacation destinations, we focus on providing a tremendous experience to our guest and act as responsible stewards for the properties of our owners. With over 20 brands operating in ~15 markets, we operate a national platform in diverse industry. To learn more about our company, please visit our website at www.awayday.com. 

**Position Summary:**

In this role, you will join a growing FP&A team that is building out new systems and processes to support the Company's strategic objectives. In addition to supporting the generation and analysis of financial statements and key business metrics, you will partner with stakeholders across the organization to support key strategic initiatives.

**Essential Job Duties/Responsibilities:**

* Support monthly P&L reporting and forecasting activities, ensuring timely and accurate insights for leadership
* Collaborate with Accounting and Operations teams to ensure accurate financial statements and identify key concerns
* Partner with budget owners to produce accurate budgets and recurring forecasts
* Maintain and enhance key business metrics reports to support monthly and quarterly analyses and drive strategic decisions
* Generate data for Monthly Business Review, BoD and other management deliverables
* Conduct ad-hoc projects and analyses as needed
* Other job duties as assigned

 **Education and Experience:** 

* Undergraduate degree, finance or accounting preferred but not required, with strong academic credentials
* 0-3 years of working experience in finance or a related field
* Proficient in Microsoft PowerPoint and Excel, with experience in financial analysis and / or modeling a plus
* Experience working with large datasets and synthesizing information for presentations
* Ability to collaborate cross-functionally and build relationships with stakeholders at various levels
* Attention to detail, critical-thinking skills and a proactive approach to problem-solving
* Experience with the following are not required, but would be viewed very favorably
+ Understanding of P&L structures and budgeting processes
+ Reporting, analyzing and forecasting P&L, balance sheet and cash flow statements
+ Knowledge of Workday Adaptive and PowerBI or similar

**Work Location:**

* Position will be in Austin, TX
* May require occasional travel within the U.S.

**Physical Requirements**: 

* Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer

  
*AwayDay is an equal opportunity employer that is committed to diversity and inclusion in the workplace. We prohibit discrimination and harassment of any kind based on race, color, sex, religion, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, or any other protected characteristic as outlined by federal, state, or local laws.*

*This policy applies to all employment practices within our organization, including hiring, recruiting, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, leave of absence, compensation, benefits, training, and apprenticeship. AwayDay, LLC makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time.*

title: Financial Analyst
description:
* Oversee/conduct daily, weekly, and monthly costing activities accurately and promptly to support R&D and G&A activities.
* Diligently monitor data integrity to ensure cost accuracy for appropriate vitality metrics as well business decision.
* Analyze key drivers of product costs, including material, labor and overhead analysis as it flows through our NPD process and files.
* Provide product analysis including but not limited to gross margin analysis, labor, and overhead cost analysis, and develop models for special projects as necessary.
* Analyze actual SG&A costs in preparing periodic reports comparing standard costs to actual production costs.
* Create monthly forecasts, and standard variance and monthly KPI reporting.
* Key member of the annual budgeting process.
* Track and analyze labor efficiencies and report results to management.
* Performs journal entries and account reconciliations for assigned areas.
* Assumes other special activities and responsibilities as required.

Education


Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance or related field


Experience, Knowledge and Skills:

* Expert knowledge and proficiency in Excel (Advanced)
* Expert knowledge and proficiency in SAP
* Expert knowledge and proficiency with PowerPoint and other MS Office applications including Word and Outlook
* Driven and prepared to take a hands-on and proactive approach to work.
* Position demands critical thinking and problem-solving skills. Ability to have the highest standards of accuracy and precision. Ability to identify options for solving a problem and evaluate the strengths and weaknesses.
* Ability to work collaboratively, partner, and support other functions.
* Excellent oral and written communication skills

Preferred Skills and Abilities


* High energy level, comfortable performing multifaceted projects in conjunction with normal activities.
* Strong quantitative and analytical competency.
* Well-organized.
