title: Financial Analyst
company: The University of Vermont Health Network
description:
This role has a flexible office (some days virtual) arrangement after completion of the training period. Any remaining work days will be in the office in South Burlington, VT.


The UVM Medical Center Business Analysis team is seeking a motivated individual with strong Excel and analytical skills, attention to detail, and the ability to confidently communicate and collaborate with people at all levels of the organization. They will provide the financial support for both clinical and nonclinical operational leaders across the hospital.


As a Financial Analyst on this team, you will:

* Partner with operational leaders to build annual budgets and provide ongoing analytical support,
* Work independently and with a team to support your operational leaders in decision-making that impacts The University of Vermont Medical Center and The University of Vermont Health Network, and
* Thoroughly understand the areas you support in order to creatively problem-solve and develop proactive solutions.


JOB DESCRIPTION:


Provide the primary financial management and related analysis support for one or more assigned clinical business units (e.g. Health Care Service divisions). Act as the liaison for Finance by interpreting the finance support needs of his/her customer group(s)and responding to those needs by facilitating the application of appropriate resources in conjunction with Finance. Organize and present the financial basis for strategic and operational decision making by his/her customers’ leadership team.


EDUCATION:


Bachelor’s degree in accounting, finance, or related discipline preferred. An equivalent combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge and abilities were acquired will be considered.


EXPERIENCE:


Three to five years of related experience that demonstrates knowledge and familiarity with health care finance, accounting and budgeting.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
### **Description**


*Position at KORE Solutions*
KORE Power, Inc. (KORE) is the leading U.S.-based developer of battery cell technology for the clean energy industry. With clients in energy storage, e-mobility, utility, industrial and mission-critical markets, KORE Power provides the backbone for decarbonization across the globe. As the first U.S.-based, American-owned, and fully integrated provider of cells, batteries, and solutions, KORE is uniquely positioned to serve these markets. Through the construction and operations of its large-scale battery cell manufacturing facility in the U.S., KORE is positioned to operate at 12 GWh per year capacity. The facility (the “KOREPlex”) will operate with net-zero carbon emissions through strategic partnerships and solar and storage co-generation.





KORE Power’s differentiated approach provides customers with direct access, unparalleled service, superior technology, and Tier 1 product availability. Focused on building sustainable communities, clean energy jobs, and green economic expansion, KORE Power is proud to offer a functional solution to real-world problems and fulfill market demand to deliver a zero-carbon future.





KORE Solutions, a division of KORE Power, Inc., in Waterbury, Vermont, provides custom power and battery energy storage solutions for all applications. Our products meet any energy demand and are designed to operate under any condition using clean energy sources. We have systems on every continent and in every environment.





We offer employees competitive wages and outstanding benefits in a casual but professional work environment. We are a growing company with a dedicated team supporting one another based on open communication and teamwork.


**Job Overview**
KORE Solutions is seeking an experienced Senior Financial Analyst to join our Finance department. The Senior Financial Analyst’s main responsibilities include financial modeling, budget development and reporting, margin analysis, monthly close support, and revenue forecasting.**Responsibilities*** Creates financial models to support decision making.
* Analyze business operations and strategies to identify new opportunities.
* Provide analytical, forecasting, reporting, and project support to senior management.
* Identify cost reduction initiatives to increase gross margin.
* Produce monthly reports, which include key metrics, financial results, and variance reporting.
* Assist with the annual and quarterly budgeting and forecasting processes.
* Assist with monthly and quarterly reporting.
* Respond to information requests by management.


**Reports To**
The position reports to the Director of FP&A
To be successful in this role, you should be able to timely and accurately perform your duties, pivot to the requests of management, and identify and communicate any issues or concerns in a timely manner. Further, you should possess and demonstrate excellent communication, organizational, and analytical skills.
**Qualifications*** Master's degree in accounting or finance; or relevant work experience
* 3+ years of financial planning & analysis experience.
* Strong proficiency in Microsoft Office, especially Excel.
* Working experience with an ERP/EMP system preferred.
* Strong numeracy and analytical skills.
* Good problem-solving and time-management skills.
* Highly organized and detail oriented.
* Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.


**Physical Requirements**
Ability to communicate orally. Hearing and vision within normal ranges with or without an assisted hearing device.
No heavy lifting is expected, though occasional exertion of up to 25 lbs. of force may be required.
**Work Environment**
The position is full-time in-person/on-site.
The job is primarily performed indoors in a traditional office setting. Extended periods of sitting and extensive work at a computer and phone are normal.*KORE Power is an equal employment opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, veteran status, or any other legally protected characteristics with respect to employment opportunities.*

title: Net Revenue Finance Analyst Sr.
company: The University of Vermont Health Network
description:
***This is a fully remote position.***


JOB DESCRIPTION:


The Senior Net Revenue Finance Analyst is responsible for overseeing the maintenance of the monthly Accounts Receivable net revenue model and schedules, and administering the Kodiak Revenue Cycle Analytics system. The Senior Net Revenue Finance Analyst is a key organizational contact related to all AR and net revenue questions and audits, for both internal leaders and external financial auditors, and provides internal training and education to organizational leaders and peers. The Senior Net Revenue Finance Analyst is a high level independent contributor within the UVM Medical Center. Successful performance in this position directly impacts the financial performance of the organization and is highly visible to Senior Leadership.


EDUCATION:


Minimum of a Bachelor’s Degree in finance, accounting or related business discipline required. CPA or Master’s Degree preferred. An equivalent combination of education and experience from which comparable knowledge and abilities were acquired may be considered.


EXPERIENCE:


Three or more years of progressive, successful experience in health care finance or accounting required. At least two years of experience in health care AR valuation preferred. The candidate must possess a proven ability to perform sophisticated data analysis and present results to financial and operational leadership.

title: Health System Finances Principal Analyst
description:
**Overview**
------------



The Green Mountain Care Board (GMCB) seeks a Financial Analyst to review, analyze, evaluate, and monitor the healthcare financial activity of Vermont's healthcare system. The Health Systems Finance Principal Analyst will be a member of the Health Systems Finance Team in its financial oversight work relating to the financial budgets and inter-period reporting of Vermont's 14 Community Hospitals, the Brattleboro Retreat, and the All-Payer Model/Accountable Care Organization (APM/ACO). Duties are performed under the general direction of the Director of Health Systems Finance. Additional duties will include developing workflows and using new financial data platforms, such as Tableau, to keep data and reports up-to-date and improve overall efficiency.

  


The Board supports a telework/flexible work environment.


**Who May Apply**
-----------------



This position, **Health Systems Finances Principal Analyst (Job Requisition #49213)**, is open to all State employees and external applicants.  

If you would like more information about this position, please contact Matthew Sutter at matthew.sutter@vermont.gov.  

Resumes will not be accepted via e-mail. You must apply online to be considered.


**Environmental Factors**
-------------------------



Duties are performed mainly in a standard office setting but with frequent need to attend and-or chair meetings in a variety of department, state, and private settings, frequently involving work outside of normal office hours. Travel is involved for which private means of transportation must be available. Short notice of critical meetings, quick deadlines for important reports, and need for rapid response to federal or legislative inquiries can be assumed.


**Minimum Qualifications**
--------------------------



Associate’s degree or higher in accounting, finance, statistics, economics, business administration, or related field AND four (4) years or more of experience with accounting, budgeting, fiscal auditing or analysis, or related field that includes experience managing programs, funding sources, or staff.  

OR  

Six (6) years or more of experience with accounting, budgeting, fiscal auditing or analysis, or related field that includes experience managing programs, funding sources, or staff.


**Preferred Qualifications**
----------------------------



Master’s degree or higher in relevant field.  

Experience in program planning and/or evaluation.  

Experience working with regulatory boards under Vermont’s Open Meeting Law.


**Total Compensation**
----------------------



As a State employee you are offered a great career opportunity, but it's more than a paycheck. The State's total compensation package features an outstanding set of employee benefits that are worth about 30% of your total compensation, including:


* 80% State paid medical premium and a dental plan at no cost for employees and their families
* Work/Life balance: 11 paid holidays each year and a generous leave plan
* State Paid Family and Medical Leave Insurance (FMLI)
* Two ways to save for your retirement: A State defined benefit pension plan and a deferred compensation 457(b) plan
* Tuition Reimbursement
* Flexible spending healthcare and childcare reimbursement accounts
* Low cost group life insurance
* Incentive-based Wellness Program
* Qualified Employer for Public Service Student Loan Forgiveness Program


Want the specifics? Explore the Benefits of State Employment on our website.

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
------------------------------


The State of Vermont celebrates diversity, and is committed to providing an environment of mutual respect and meaningful inclusion that represents a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. The State does not discriminate in employment on the basis of race, color, religion or belief, national, social or ethnic origin, sex (including pregnancy), age, physical, mental or sensory disability, HIV Status, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital, civil union or domestic partnership status, past or present military service, membership in an employee organization, family medical history or genetic information, or family or parental status. The State’s employment decisions are merit-based. Retaliatory adverse employment actions by the State are forbidden.

title: Cost/FP&A Analyst
description:
**JOB SUMMARY:**

STC’s Cost & Financial Planning & Analysis (FP&A) Analyst maintains and monitors cost and manufacturing accounting process and provides financial planning and analysis to support continued profit and productivity improvement for the business.

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

* Participate in the month-end close, including preparation of required journal entries, account reconciliations, and prepare month end operating review analysis package.
* Lead preparation of the monthly forecast and quarterly operating review.
* Lead and coordinate inventory costing process.
* Coordinate and compile annual physical inventory including end of life and full absorption reserve balances.
* Participate in the annual strategic planning and budgeting processes including establishing assumptions, spreadsheet modeling, consolidation, analysis and presentation preparation.
* Prepare and present various daily and weekly operating metrics to monitor business performance.
* Analyze variances in sales, manufacturing, and general expenses ensuring alignment with budget, forecast, and prior year.
* Analyze and propose improvements in working capital.
* Analyze and review bills of material to ensure accurate product costing.
* Prepare and review product cost estimates as requested by the Sales and Engineering Departments.
* Perform product line profitability analysis.
* Prepare ad-hoc financial analysis to support senior management decisions.
* Support integration into new parent company.

**DESIRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE:**

* Degree in Accounting or Finance and/or MBA required.
* 5-7 years of accounting and experience, including cost, in a manufacturing environment.
* Experience in preparing, analyzing, and implementing accounting and reporting requirements.
* Excellent computer and technological skills, including high proficiency in Consolidation Systems, ERP, and Microsoft Office Applications preferred.
* Superior verbal and written communication skills.
* Works effectively in a team environment, within and outside of the Finance Department.
* Consistently operates at the highest level of integrity and is never willing to compromise with regards to ethical standards.
* Working knowledge of SQL a plus

**INTERPERSONAL QUALIFICATIONS:**

Success in this position requires the ability to build a strong partnership with the FM and Business Unit Senior Managers and frequent communication with finance peers. These relationships must be built on respect, integrity, cooperation, teamwork, and professionalism.

* Ability to build relationships at all levels within the organization.
* Clear, precise communication skills.
* Strong business acumen and analytical skills with a demonstrated ability to gather, analyze and present data.
* Operations and commercial literacy.
* Ability to organize multiple responsibilities and deliver results in an accurate and timely manner while adapting to changes in priorities.
* Ability to influence and strategically partner with individuals of various educational and technical backgrounds, both inside and outside the organization.
* Detail and process oriented.
* Ability to manage multiple projects and meet deadlines under pressure.
* Self-starter with a strong sense of urgency and follow up skills.

**WORKING CONDITIONS:**

Work is normally performed on site in St. Albans, Vermont. Office work is performed in a climate-controlled office environment, but substantial time on the shop floor is required, which can be noisy and dusty, as well as hot during the summer. Proper safety equipment is provided by STC where necessary. Travel is anticipated to be a low percentage of time.

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:**

Work involves standing and walking for moderate periods of time, with some duties performed from a seated position. There is potential for eyestrain from reading detailed materials and computer screens. Deadlines, workloads during peak periods, and changing priorities may cause increased stress levels. Work may include occasional lifting and carrying objects or pushing/pulling carts weighing approximately 50 pounds, such as products, tools, gages, and equipment. Work normally requires finger dexterity and eye-hand coordination to operate computer keyboards at a moderate skill level. Repetitive motion injuries may occur. The company will provide adaptive devices as needed.

**Superior Technical Ceramics Corporation is an equal opportunity employer and offers employment opportunity to all qualified persons without regard to race, creed, color, religious belief, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, ancestry, place of birth, physical or mental disability, or veteran status.**

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $75,000.00 - $90,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Tuition reimbursement
* Vision insurance

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Application Question(s):

* Will you now, or in the future, require sponsorship for employment visa status? (e.g. H-1B visa status)

Work Location: In person

title: Finance Assistant
description:
**SUMMARY OF POSITION FUNCTION:**

Performs a variety of accounting functions in accordance with company and government guidelines and regulations.

  


**MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:**

 Establishes and monitors the implementation and maintenance of accounting control procedures.

 Performs accounting and auditing functions, developing data for periodic operating statements and management information in compliance with company and government regulations.

 Reviews account coding and classifications for Accounts Payable and Payroll.

 Ensures all Purchase Requisitions, including Recurring Purchase Requisitions are entered by employees in Costpoint on a timely basis.

 Processes invoices and ensures on-time payment.

 Ensures accurate and appropriate recording and analysis of revenues and expenses.

 Provides assistance to internal & external audit functions.

 Models appropriate behaviors, mentors students and monitors both positive and negative behaviors through interventions.

 Other duties as assigned.

Note: This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as needed to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

  


**SKILLS/COMPETENCIES:**

 Comprehensive knowledge of accepted accounting principles, policies and procedures

 Knowledge of laws, government rules, regulations, and reporting requirements

 Proficient in data bases, Excel, Microsoft programs and e-mail management

 Ability to analyze financial data; in-depth knowledge of accounting systems

  


**EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS:**

 Post-Secondary degree in Accounting, Business Administration or related field preferred. Directly related experience may substitute on a year-to-year basis.

  


**EXPERIENCE:**

 Two years of experience in a work related field.

title: FP&A Analyst - Virtual/Remote
description:
Enumerate needs a **Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst** for our rapidly growing team!Enumerate has grown rapidly through acquisitions and is backed by a leading Boston-based private equity firm. We expect to continue with strategic acquisitions while diversifying our product offerings to include payments-related services for its core HOA customer base.  
  
In this role, you’ll be responsible for budgeting and forecasting as well as the development and delivery of actionable and insightful analyses of both retrospective trends (actual v. planned) and prospective opportunities. Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will have a leading role in identifying, implementing, and improving upon these core requirements.  
  
You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. This position is remote eligible, with a preference for candidates in CST/EST. **Who will love this job**  
* Someone who is a critical thinker with a meticulous approach, high initiative, and the ability to explain financial concepts in “plain English” to non-financial stakeholders

**You should have*** Required: 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, either within a corporate Finance, FP&A function, or within investment banking, commercial banking, or private equity.
* Required: Bachelors in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other highly quantitative discipline.
* Required: Experience with SaaS (or subscription) revenue recognition, including familiarity with standard SaaS metrics/ KPIs.
* Fluency in O365- especially Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
* Strong financial modeling skills in Excel including a working knowledge of 3 statement models.
* Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.
* Ability to work in the US without sponsorship.
  
**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. When possible, we also like to offer fun in-person perks like pet-friendly offices, paid food trucks and company outings.

title: Financial Service Representative
description:
**Role:**

To assist the Credit Union in achieving its Service Mission to deliver Total Member Delight in each and every service interaction with both internal and external members. A key component of this external service is to identify the financial needs of each member and recommend an effective credit union product solution. In addition, to assist members and potential members with their requests; prepare loan applications, respond to questions and concerns and effectively develop and maintain financial relationships with members through a consultative selling process to determine their needs and then fill the need with a product and/or service solution.

**Responsibilities:**

* Provide general credit union information to members regarding products and services and works together to create financial options, which lead to sales closures, buyouts, and quality referrals. This process involves, but is not limited to, maintaining a thorough knowledge of credit union's share and loan products, services, policies and procedures.
* Prepare loan application for all lending requests and analyze current financial position of member. Make decision to approve, disapprove, or make recommendations and forward to a higher level for review and approval. This process includes, but is not limited to, pulling credit reports and counseling members on rates, terms and alternate methods of financing and disbursing approved loans to members.
* Process member requests such as opening/closing accounts, make address changes, payroll changes, account information and help members reconcile their checking accounts.
* Serve as Teller as needed.
* Perform other duties as required.

**Knowledge and Skills:**  
  
**Experience:** Six months to two years of similar or related experience. Internal candidates must have a minimum of 6 months as a Teller.  
  
**Education:** A high school education or GED.   
  
**Interpersonal Skills:** Work involves much personal contact with others inside and/or outside the organization for the purpose of first-level conflict resolution, building relationships, and soliciting cooperation. Discussions involve a higher degree of confidentiality and discretion, requiring diplomacy and tact in communication.

**Other Skills:** Good listening and telephone skills; able to operate a 10-key calculator, typewriter and computer keyboard; able to make decisions with minimum information.

**Position Type:** Full Time

**Hours:** 39-40 hours weekly

**Current Schedule:** 8a - 4:30p Monday - Friday

**Pay Rate:** $18.00 per hour

Actual starting salary will be determined based on skills, experience (to the extent relevant) and other job-related factors, consistent with applicable law.

**Benefits:**

Paid Time Off

Paid Holidays

401K Plan

Medical

Dental

Vision

Free Telehealth Urgent Care

Free Telehealth Mental Health Counseling

Flexible Spending Account Option

Life Insurance

Dependent and Spouse Life Insurance Options

Short Term Disability Insurance

Long Term Disability Insurance

Pet Insurance

Aflac Insurance Options

Legal/ID Shield Options

Employee Referral Program

Paid Volunteer Day

Employee Loan Discounts

  
SeaComm is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. Race/Color/Gender/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity/Religion/National Origin/Disability/Veteran.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**Fujitsu Frontech North America Inc.**

**Job Posting**

**Financial Analyst**

Full Time - Regular

  


**Pay Rate:** The starting base pay range for this role is USD $70-$75k per year. The actual base pay is dependent upon many factors, such as: training, transferable skills, work experience, business needs and market demands. The base pay range is subject to change and may be modified in the future.

**Non-Exempt/Exempt:** Exempt

**Job Status:** Full-time

**Location:** Works from home or company offices in Irvine-CA, San Antonio-TX, Norristown-PA or Plattsburgh-NY

**EEO Job Classification:** Professionals

**Reports To (Position):** Controller

**SUMMARY**

We are seeking a dynamic and experienced professional to fill the role of Finance Analyst. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in both accounting and financial analyses, with a minimum of 3 years of relevant experience. This role involves a combination of tasks from accounting, finance, as well as treasury-related functions. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in maintaining accurate financial records, analyzing data to inform strategic decisions, and contributing to the company's overall financial success.

This role involves a combination of tasks from accounting, finance, as well as treasury-related functions. The successful candidate will play a pivotal role in maintaining accurate financial records, analyzing data to inform strategic decisions, and contributing to the company's overall financial success.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES** 

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

**Essential Functions of the position include, but are not limited to;**

**Accounting Responsibilities:**

* Perform month-end and year-end closing tasks, including preparing financial reports and statements in compliance with International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS).
* Review accounting transactions for accuracy and compliance with established procedures.
* Establish and maintain financial policies that align with industry standards and company objectives.
* Reconcile financial accounts, investigating and resolving discrepancies promptly.
* Collaborate with external auditors during annual audits, providing necessary documentation and explanations.
* Ensure compliance with financial regulations and reporting standards, staying updated on changes in accounting practices.
* Collaborate with the Tax Department to support ad hoc requests and ensure regulatory compliance.
* Assist in forecasting quarterly and annual profits, as well as preparing cost projections to support financial planning.

**Financial Analysis Responsibilities:**

* Analyze and report on the company's current financial status, identifying trends, opportunities, and areas of improvement.
* Conduct in-depth research and analysis of historical financial data to provide actionable insights to the executive team.
* Collaborate with the Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and executive team to contribute to long-term financial planning and strategy.
* Compare anticipated financial results with actual outcomes, offering recommendations for enhancement of financial performance.
* Play a pivotal role in coordinating with departments and projects to support budget development, tracking, and reporting.
* Employ independent judgment and discretion to interpret financial data, making recommendations to optimize financial operations.
* Customarily exercise strong analytical skills to evaluate financial data and present findings clearly to stakeholders.
* Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure financial goals align with overall business objectives.
* Monitor and manage cash flow, optimizing liquidity to meet financial obligations.
* Contribute to the management of banking relationships.
* Regular work site attendance.
* Customarily and regularly exercises independent discretion and judgment.

**Other Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Adhere to company policies, ISO requirements, safety, and quality.
* Support continual improvement efforts.
* Additional responsibilities as assigned. This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Other, reasonable and related duties may be assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization.

**QUALIFICATIONS** 

* Excellent team player, problem solver with a high level of self-motivation and initiative
* Able to meet deadlines on a consistent basis.
* Perform quality work within deadlines with or without direct supervision.
* Interact professionally with other employees, customers, and suppliers.
* Work effectively as a team contributor on all assignments.
* Ability to work independently (and with limited supervision) while understanding the necessity for communicating and coordinating work efforts with other employees and departments at all levels within the organization.
* Ability to multi-task and work under pressure.
* Strong organizational, analytical and problem-solving skills, along with excellent verbal and written communication skills.
* Ability to analyze detail and perform structured decision-making on a daily basis.
* Must be capable of managing multiple priorities effectively and be able to identify and recommend best course of action from several alternatives.
* Quality oriented.
* High degree of initiative and ownership, attention to detail, and the discipline to follow through on assigned tasks.
* Strong influencing, collaboration and relationship-building skills both internally and externally .
* Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy.

**EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE** 

BS degree in Finance, Accounting or Economics from four-year college or university; and minimum 3 years of related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.

**CERTIFICATES, LICENSES, REGISTRATIONS** 

Relevant certification (e.g., CFA/CPA) is a plus.

**COMPUTER SKILLS** 

Demonstrate ability to effectively use computer and applicable computer software. Advanced knowledge of Excel, Word, Adobe, PowerPoint, and Outlook required. Experience with Microsoft Dynamics GP or SAP s/4 Hana a plus

**LANGUAGE SKILLS**  

Demonstrate ability to read, comprehend, and respond appropriately through written or verbal form when required; ability to demonstrate tactfulness when communicating, to include internal communication with staff members of all levels; ability to effectively communicate with a variety of audiences; ability to analyze, and interpret common scientific and technical journals, financial reports, and legal documents. Ability to respond to common inquiries or complaints from customers, regulatory agencies, or members of the business community. Ability to read and interpret documents such as safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals. Ability to speak effectively before groups of customers or employees of organization.

**MATHEMATICAL SKILLS** 

Demonstrate ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume. Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry.

  


Employment with Fujitsu is considered to be at-will, which means that both the employee and Fujitsu Frontech North America Inc. (“FFNA”) are free to end the employment relationship at any time for any reason, with or without cause. This provision can only be changed or revoked in a formal written contract signed by the CEO of FFNA and cannot be changed by any express or implied agreement based on statements or actions by any employee or supervisor. Even though the job duties, title, compensation, and benefits, as well as the Company’s personnel policies and procedures, may change from time to time, the at-will nature of employment will not change. 

We are an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws.

title: Finance Manager
description:
To manage Hunger Mountain Co-op's finances and accounting in accordance with GAAP. To provide financial information, projections, and analysis to the Council and management team. To oversee the preparation of business plans and budgets. To establish and manage internal controls and reporting procedures in support of Co-op objectives and protect its assets.

**Supervises:** Accounting/Payroll Coordinator, Accounts Payable Clerks, Payroll Coordinator, Bookkeeper, and Depositors

  
  
**Financial Management and Planning** Participate in key decisions as a member of the senior management team.

Oversee the issuance of timely, accurate quarterly financial statements and analysis for the Council, Lenders, Affiliates, and management team including Balance Sheet, Statements of Income and Cash flows, department margin, and operating P&L. Monitor performance compared to plan and work with managers to improve performance.

* Provide weekly, monthly, quarterly sales, and variance reports for managers and buyers.
* Orchestrate the preparation of the annual operating and capital expenditure budget process.
* Build a model for annual rolling three-year financial statement pro formas, including balance sheet and cash flows
* Ensure that all quarterly/yearly taxes are filed and paid when due.
* Prepare and Manage cash flow analysis to maintain appropriate levels of liquidity.
* Seek out, negotiate and recommend favorable financing options for co-op operations.
* Manage the co-op's cash within the investment policy guidelines set by the Council to maximize interest revenue.
* Act as liaison with financial institutions and ensure timely and accurate reporting of the required information.

**Qualifications:**

* Minimum of 5 years' experience and a Bachelor's Degree in Business, Accounting or related field required, and working Knowledge of GAAP; MBA and or CPA preferred.
* Ability to interpret financial reports for non-accounts.
* Experience in developing financial projections and budget models.
* Negotiating experience, excellent communication skills – verbal and written.
* Strong supervisory skills, ability to cultivate a supportive and team-oriented work environment.
* Computer literate and experience with Acumatica ERC software; strong Microsoft Excel skills, and knowledge of Microsoft 365 required.
* Demonstrated ability to follow through on commitments. and able to maintain strict confidentiality.
* Ability to work a flexible schedule based on business needs while following attendance policies of Hunger Mountain Co-op.

description:

This role actively supports the mission of the Y, a leading non-profit dedicated to community enrichment through youth development, healthy living, and social responsibility. title: Financial Analyst
description:
We are seeking an experienced, highly-motivated professional to join our underwriting team, with a specific focus on financial analysis. This person will have excellent communication skills and develop strong relationships with our business partners, both internal and external. Further, this candidate will exhibit strong analytical and investigative skills, a holistic understanding of commercial insurance, a background in financial analysis, and a desire to serve our customers with a best-in-class, value-driven insurance product. The ideal candidate will have the depth of experience and superior analytical skills necessary to complete detailed and professional analyses based on customer financial statements, prepare collateral recommendations, analyze public data and regulatory filings, and complete market reviews and additional projects as assigned. Lastly, the ideal candidate will add to and bolster DMC’s unique culture – a workplace built on enthusiasm, entrepreneurship, integrity, communication, proactive problem solving, and a genuine passion for helping our customers, brokers, and internal stakeholders.

 

**RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Evaluate the financial strength of new business and renewal transportation insurance accounts, using submitted financial statements, application materials, historic loss data, public/government information, internet research, and other relevant tools, for the sake of determining whether the account is financially viable, as well as evaluating the account’s collateral and deposit requirements.
* Contribute directly to DMC’s corporate goals of profitable growth via ensuring our financial underwriting standards are met.
* Perform market analysis as requested by management.
* Maintain an understanding of existing laws and regulations, emerging technologies, and competitor actions that can impact our customers, as well as a working knowledge of GAAP accounting standards, investment trends, our product offering, and our pricing models.
* Assist management with special projects, including but not limited to product development, form/rate/rule filings, market research, or broker/customer research.
* Other analytical and administrative duties, as assigned by management.

**Requirements:**

* Bachelor’s Degree required, preferably in insurance, finance, accounting, actuarial science, mathematics/statistics, business administration, or related field.
* Prior financial analysis experience strongly preferred, ideally in the insurance industry.
* Will abide by departmental policies and procedures and internal audit controls.
* Customer service orientation, strong listening skills, ability to present findings professionally, to an executive audience.
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite (especially Excel).
* Must be a self-starter with ability to manage time in a fast-paced environment, prioritize critical tasks, communicate with management on status, and deliver on objectives in a timely fashion.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
Are you a **Financial Analyst** who islookingto join one of the top companies within the **Manufacturing Industry****?**

Are you looking to further your career and grow?

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**Position Title:** Financial Analyst

**Financial Analyst Job Responsibilities**

Assists VP of Finance with preparation of budgets, and projections and analyzes and reports relevant financial information. Administers payroll, issues vendor payments, and maintains internal controls for costs and company expenditures.

**Financial Analyst Job Duties**

· Administer weekly and bi-weekly payroll

· Meet regularly with the VP of Finance to determine accounts payable run for the week and to develop longer term payments schedules for all vendors

· Provide financial updates to VP of Finance by evaluating, analyzing, and reporting appropriate data points

· Use the financials to analyze results, monitor variances, and identify trends that will help to develop and support financial and operational strategies

· Assist in preparation of annual Holding Company budget and monthly re-projections

· Guide cost analysis process through reporting and analysis

· Maintain internal control safeguards for costs and actual expenditures

· Collect requested items from CPA for yearly tax return and compilation

· Develop best practices for customer collections utilizing ERP system, update customer contact information in the system, and place holds on accounts as needed

· Contact customers with overdue accounts and attempt to either collect the overdue amount or negotiate a payment plan to collect it in installments

· Performs other duties as assigned

**Reporting and Supervisory Relationship(s):** Direct reporting relationship to: VP of Finance

title: FP&A Analyst - Virtual/Remote
description:
Enumerate needs a **Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst** for our rapidly growing team!Enumerate has grown rapidly through acquisitions and is backed by a leading Boston-based private equity firm. We expect to continue with strategic acquisitions while diversifying our product offerings to include payments-related services for its core HOA customer base.  
  
In this role, you’ll be responsible for budgeting and forecasting as well as the development and delivery of actionable and insightful analyses of both retrospective trends (actual v. planned) and prospective opportunities. Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will have a leading role in identifying, implementing, and improving upon these core requirements.  
  
You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. This position is remote eligible, with a preference for candidates in CST/EST. **Who will love this job**  
* Someone who is a critical thinker with a meticulous approach, high initiative, and the ability to explain financial concepts in “plain English” to non-financial stakeholders

**You should have*** Required: 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, either within a corporate Finance, FP&A function, or within investment banking, commercial banking, or private equity.
* Required: Bachelors in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other highly quantitative discipline.
* Required: Experience with SaaS (or subscription) revenue recognition, including familiarity with standard SaaS metrics/ KPIs.
* Fluency in O365- especially Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
* Strong financial modeling skills in Excel including a working knowledge of 3 statement models.
* Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.
* Ability to work in the US without sponsorship.
  
**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. When possible, we also like to offer fun in-person perks like pet-friendly offices, paid food trucks and company outings.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**Financial Analyst**

LHH has a well-known client in Indianapolis, IN who seeks a Financial Analyst on a contract opportunity!

 

This is an exciting opportunity for a candidate with strong professional accomplishments to join one of the most iconic and innovative global consumer brands. 

 

**Apply Today, Interview Tomorrow!!!**

 

Here are some of the details:

 

**Title:** Financial Analyst **Location:** Indianapolis, IN 46204 – Fully Onsite

**Contract:** 3 – 4 months contract

**Shift:** M-F 8-hour days/ 40 hours a week with possible OT for end of month

**Summary**

* 
Support reporting and analysis of restructuring programs including coordination with UTC Business Units and the UTC Controller's organization.

* 
Support the monthly UTC Financial Assessment process various analytical tasks.

* 
Directly support the Financial Manager of the Program on all financial issues, including business decision-making and budget management.

* 
Develop and analyze business case models, which will be utilized to evaluate the economic impact of business decisions on the Program.


**Responsibilities**

* 
Evaluate actual monthly results and investigate variances to plan / prior year / prior estimates.

* 
Develop and load financial forecasts for various areas and planning cycles.

* 
Prepare monthly, weekly, and ad-hoc reporting analyzing financial performance versus forecast and plan

* 
Work with leaders at month-end to understand expenses and record-related journal entries to ensure financials are accurately stated.

* 
Identify and implement process and reporting improvements

* 
Perform special projects and ad hoc business/financial analysis where needed


**Required Qualifications:**

* 
Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting or Finance

* 
2+ years of experience in an Accounting or Finance role

* 
Working knowledge of US GAAP

* 
Proven track record with financial process/reporting improvement and simplification

* 
Ability to develop and apply financial models

* 
Demonstrated PC skills, including advanced knowledge of HFM, SAP, Excel, and PowerPoint

* 
Financial/cost analysis and budgeting/forecasting skills


  
  
**Pay Details:** $47.87 per hour  
  
**Search managed by:** Ramatoulaye Barry   
  
Benefit offerings available for our associates include medical, dental, vision, life insurance, short-term disability, additional voluntary benefits, EAP program, commuter benefits and a 401K plan. Our benefit offerings provide employees the flexibility to choose the type of coverage that meets their individual needs. In addition, our associates may be eligible for paid leave including Paid Sick Leave or any other paid leave required by Federal, State, or local law, as well as Holiday pay where applicable.   
  
Equal Opportunity Employer/Veterans/Disabled  
  
To read our Candidate Privacy Information Statement, which explains how we will use your information, please navigate to https://www.lhh.com/us/en/candidate-privacy  
  
The Company will consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records subject to federal contractor requirements and/or security clearance requirements.

title: Domo Data Analyst (REMOTE)
description:
Everlight Solar is seeking a skilled Data Analyst who will design and maintain functional programs and applications, producing fully functional software applications according to requirements. As a Data Analyst, you play a key role in serving our clients and team members. This will be a full-time, work-from-home "remote" position.

**This is a role for Apple power-users, must know iWork and be skilled with iOS and macOS.**

Everlight Solar is a rapidly growing company and the leader of solar energy in the Midwest. We offer a unique experience that fosters individual growth and rewards performance. Our culture at Everlight is extremely important to us. The work environment is fast-paced and dynamic. We value teamwork, quality, innovation, and customer success. Our ideal candidate is self-motivated, detail-oriented, has excellent problem-solving abilities, is passionate about delivering results on-time, exceeding expectations, and ensuring success for our teams.

**Responsibilities:**

* Work with large amounts of data to draw meaningful conclusions
* Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
* Provide regular reporting and analysis to team
* Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key metrics and performance indicators
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify areas for improvement and to develop solutions to enhance business operations
* Provide training and support to team members on data analysis techniques and tools

**Requirements:**

* Minimum two years of experience with DOMO
* MajorDOMO Certification Required
* 3+ years experience in data analysis, reporting, business intelligence or financial analysis and a Bachelor's Degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Computer Sciences or related field or equivalent experience
* 2 years experience in providing people analytics reporting to organizations
* Demonstrated experience using SQL, and DOMO
* Experience with sensitive and confidential people data in a global environment
* Analyze, evaluate, improve, and document processes and workflows. Identify and take advantage of opportunities for process automation and simplification.
* Proven ability to design and implement new processes and facilitate user adoption.
* Strong understanding of Salesforce.com best practices and functionality
* Strong data management abilities
* A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion
* A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
* Excellent project management skills and a positive attitude
* Must demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills
* Must demonstrate ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization
* Must own a Mac computer and be fluent with the Apple ecosystem of software (iOS, macOS, iWork, etc.)

**Benefits:**  


* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Life Insurance
* PTO
* Sick and Safe Time
* Paid Holidays Off

**Salary: $65,000-$100,000/ year**

*Everlight Solar is proudly an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity of all types and are excited to work with talented individuals from a wide range of backgrounds. Everlight is committed to inclusion and we invite people of any race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex, age groups (18+), and levels of education to apply. Authorized to work in the US and background check required.*

title: Accounting Lead - Senior Financial Analyst
description:
**POSITION OVERVIEW**

dormakaba is seeking a Accounting Lead - Senior Financial Analyst based in our Indianapolis, IN location. The Accounting Lead - Senior Financial Analyst reports to the Indianapolis Plant Controller and will work closely with the Accounting & Finance team, Shared Services Center and business function Operations.

This position will be a key contributor to the North Americas Finance team and be responsible for general accounting for the Indianapolis facility (four businesses). The ideal candidate will have strong financial accounting experience, including financial statement preparation and reporting, balance sheet reconciliation, variance analysis, internal control, and audit. The individual must possess excellent analytical and communications skills.

The Senior Financial Analyst - Accounting Lead will be a critical finance contact for actual closing, budgeting and forecasting and variance explanations. They must possess excellent analytical and communications skills, work independently and be able to work with and support leadership.

**WHAT YOU WILL DO**

* Manage monthly, quarterly, and annual close process for Indianapolis and related businesses, including journal entry preparation and posting.
* Manage the Hyperion submission for respective locations and execute and coordinate the monthly intercompany reconciliation.
* Deliver on internal, external auditing and tax requirements and financial analysis.
* Complete monthly forecast submission for balance sheet, central P&L lines and cashflow
* Develop and maintain key accounting policies, controls, and documentation together with Accounting Compliance Team
* Own the balance sheet review process, perform trend analysis on balance sheet accounts with significant balances, investigating any variance, and recommending corrective actions
* Contribute to annual budget and planning processes and ensure integrity of the budgeting and forecasting.
* Establish monitoring processes for a collaboration with a business shared service center and train team members.

**WHAT WE REQUIRE**

* BS in Finance, Accounting, or similar analytical discipline
* 7 years of relevant work experience
* Strong working knowledge of accounting principles
* Sophisticated presentation skills
* Ability to communicate at all levels with self-confidence (Senior Management)

**WHAT WE PREFER**

* Advanced degree and/or financial leadership program
* Working knowledge of SAP
* Working knowledge in manufacturing
* Highly proficient in Excel, PowerPoint, hands-on experience in regular transactions of HFM and SAP (and/or similar ERP system)
* Working knowledge within Business Intelligence (BI) reporting

**WHAT WE OFFER**

* Taking Care of our Employees on Day One with Medical, Dental, Vision, Life and Disability Insurance coverage options. No waiting periods!
* Your health is our priority, we offer Medical Wellness Programs to aid in your well-being.
* Vacation and Personal Time Off
* We support your growing family; we provide Parental Leave for Moms and Dads!
* Wisely plan for your future with our 401k Matching plan beginning on Day One.
* Supporting your career development with our Tuition Reimbursement Program.
* Robust culture supporting internal advancement with our Learn and Grow Program.
* Discover your best attributes using CliftonStrengths to pave the way for success at dormakaba.
* 24/7 access to over 15,000 LinkedIn Learning courses to assist in your professional development and to expand on your individual interests.
* Employee Assistance Programs
* Voluntary Legal Insurance
* Unlimited Referral Reward Bonuses
* Corporate Discounts for shopping, travel and more!

**WHY JOIN DORMAKABA?**

Our work is IMPORTANT. YOU are important. At schools and universities, in stadiums, airports, hospitals and workplace; for every place that matters. We provide safety, security, and sustainability, providing people with the tools to shape their careers for growth. EVERY team member contributes to our mission and can make a positive difference. Our culture focuses on Growing the Business, Growing Together and Growing Ourselves. We are a global company with more than 16,000 employees worldwide giving you endless opportunities for growth and advancement.

Learn why our employees enjoy working for dormakaba: dormakaba Testimonials

dormakaba is committed to providing an environment of mutual respect where equal employment opportunities are available to all applicants and teammates without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy (including childbirth, lactation and related medical conditions), national origin, age, physical and mental disability, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, genetic information (including characteristics and testing), military and veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by applicable law. Diversity and inclusion among our teammates is critical to our success as a global company, and we seek to recruit, develop and retain the most talented people from a diverse candidate pool. dormakaba is an Equal Opportunity Employer. dormakaba is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. (EEO/AA/M/F/D/V) dormakaba does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes and will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company absent a signed agreement with approved Talent Acquisition dormakaba representative.

description:

**HGS**is a world leader in Customer Relationship and Business Process Management. With a global footprint and over three decades of experience, we have helped our clients deliver exceptional results. We develop and implement some of the best-known processes and practices to deliver a comprehensive range of industryspecific solutions. We deliver seamless service to some of the worlds most recognized brands out of and across North America, Europe and Asia.


The **HGSFinancial Analyst** works closely with the clients Credit/Finance Team to manage issues related to order analyzing results, monitoring variances, identifying trends, and recommending actions to Sr. Analyst and reconciling transactions by comparing and correcting data.

Compile and analyze data to improve customer outcomes


Perform forecasting, reporting and operational metrics tracking


Reconcile and recommend resolution for report discrepancies and problems


Work closely with Sr. Analysts to ensure accurate reporting


Create reports and spreadsheets for team to analyze trends and make informative financial decisions


Work on special projects as needed

* BA/BS degree in Finance, Accounting, Agriculture or related field
* Intermediate/Advanced knowledge of PC applications for reporting and business analysis, word processing and présentations (SAP, Salesforce, Excel - Pivot tables, VLOOKUPs, etc.)

title: Acquisitions Analyst
description:
**Acquisitions Analyst**

**The Michelson Organization**

**St. Louis, MO (In-Office)**

**$70,000 - $90,000 per year plus transaction-based bonus potential, Full Time**

 

**The Company**

The Michelson Organization is a St. Louis-based commercial real estate investment firm specializing in the acquisition and asset management of institutional quality multifamily and industrial assets throughout the United States. With over $1.5 billion of assets currently under management, The Michelson Organization has leveraged over 90 years of experience to create a dynamic, vertically integrated investment platform designed to meet the needs of multinational institutional investors.

 

**Analyst Responsibilities**

Working directly with the Acquisition and Asset Management teams, the Acquisitions Analyst responsibilities will include, but not be limited to, the following:

· Source and underwrite potential multifamily and industrial investments in target U.S. markets.

· Perform detailed research and analysis on real estate markets and submarkets to guide investment decisions.

· Coordinate and analyze due diligence and financing activities with third parties and consultants.

· Prepare investment memorandums and other offering materials for investment committee presentations.

· Maintain relationships with industry professionals for deal sourcing such as brokers, owners and developers.

· Selectively accompany senior Acquisition Team members on property tours and market evaluation trips.

· Assist in timely preparation and distribution of investor reports on a quarterly and annual basis.

**Qualifications**

· Bachelor’s or other 4-year university degree

· 1 to 3 years of related work experience in real estate, finance or private equity preferred, but not required

· Strong quantitative, financial analysis and modeling skills

· Excellent communication and presentation skills

· Highly proficient in Microsoft Office products, specifically Excel

· A relationship-oriented problem solver with the ability to manage multiple dynamic tasks simultaneously

· An entrepreneurial mindset capable of working well in a team environment while also taking ownership of tasks

· Ability to travel overnight selectively on a monthly basis 

 

**Benefits** 

· Competitive base salary

· Accretive transaction-based bonus potential

· 401(k) w/ Company Match

· Health Insurance

· Dental Insurance

· Vision Insurance

· Employee Paid Life/AD&D

· Voluntary Life/AD&D

· Paid Holidays and Time Off

(3+ weeks)

title: Financial Analyst
description:
**Financial Analyst**

**Logistics Administrative Solutions (LAS)**

Logistics Administrative Solutions offers streamlined solutions in accounting, hiring, payroll, and training, as well as safety guidance and buying consolidation services within the logistics and transportation industry.

The ideal candidate will embody our company's **Non-Negotiables**:

**Walk in Humble Confidence** *- We are experts at what we do, but we never assume we know everything.*

**Be Open, Honest and Respectful** *- We say what has to be said in a tactful, courteous way.*

**Be Fearless** *- We never fail, we only learn.*

**We are One Team** *- We achieve more together by collaboration and consensus.*

**Delivery on Commitments** *- We do what we say we will do.*

**We have a Passion to Serve** *- We are dedicated, hardworking individuals who provide exceptional service to our customers and to each other*.

  
The Financial Analyst plays a key role in supporting financial planning, analysis, and decision-making processes within the organization. This position involves analyzing business needs by assessing financial data, identifying trends, and providing insights to assist management in making strategic business decisions.

  
**Responsibilities:**

* Create reporting frameworks to ensure optimal business decisions are made:
+ Partner with stakeholders to assess, identify and prioritize performance reporting needs including key metrics.
+ Continuously improve existing reporting and forecasting to limit information gaps and to provide information to manage the business more effectively.
+ Ensure all relevant reporting deadlines are met.

* Collaborate with Operations leaders to fully understand monthly P&L reports and to drive revenue and margin growth.
+ Partner with Operations leaders to understand variances to budget and prior year each month.
+ Analyze financial results, including trends, budget, forecast and related variances.
+ Review trends and drivers of financial performance to identify opportunities for improvement.
+ Partner with leaders to gather action plans to close any performance gaps to budget.

* Produce budgeting and forecasting reports
+ Coordinate data request required to produce the annual budget.
+ Maintain ownership of the P&L, Balance Sheet and Statement of Cash Flows financial model.
+ Partnering in the design of BI models, dashboards, metrics, visualizations, and reports

* Perform additional high-profile ad-hoc analyses and decision support as required.
+ Participate in preparation of board presentations and partner requests.

* Establish and maintain strong relationships with departments and leadership to identify their needs and seek full range of business solutions.
* Assist investment and capital expenditure analysis
+ Support operations in producing business case modeling and ROI analysis.
+ Understand the business model and operations for potential investment opportunities.

* Design complex data warehousing, advanced analytics, and high impact business intelligence solutions. Design semantic layer, virtualization layer, use of BI client tools, technical components within BI client tool, and performance considerations
+ Partnering in the design of BI models, dashboards, metrics, visualizations, and reports

  
**Skills, Knowledge and Experience:**

* 3-5 years of experience in financial analysis and financial statement modeling.
* Strong sense of urgency and attention to detail; ability to meet deadlines.
* Demonstrated high energy, high inquisitiveness, and a high degree of work ownership.
* Strong desire to learn all aspects of Lanter's business, systems, data, and reporting tools.
* Strong analytical mindset and ability to make confident, fact-based decisions.
* Highly developed interpersonal communication skills. Capable of working independently and as part of a team.
* Superior organizational skills: proven ability to multi-task and manage simultaneous projects.
* Protects operations by keeping financial information and plans confidential.
* Ability to forecast issues to understand potential impact both internally and externally.
* Exposure to financial accounting systems, operating systems, data warehouses, and programming languages
* Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office suite (Excel and PowerPoint); ability to work with large datasets.

  
**Education and Certifications:**

* Bachelor's degree in Accounting or Finance
* MBA or Master's in Accounting or Finance, a plus

  
**Working Conditions:**

* The typical office hours are 8:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m. (May vary based on assigned support locations)
* Ability to work extra hours as determined by the workload and internal customer expectations
* Ability to sit for long periods of time
* Ability to travel to site locations periodically
* Ability to speak English to communicate with clients, employees, vendors, etc.

  
Logistics Administrative Solutions is proud to be an equal opportunity employer regardless of race, color, gender, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, religious beliefs, marital status, genetic information, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.

title: ERP Analyst III – Senior Techno Functional Analyst, Finance
description:
ERP Analyst III – Senior Techno Functional Analyst, Finance

 

Full-time employment opportunity with a dynamic and multi-faceted resource for economic development in the St. Louis region.

About Us

 

Since 1950, we have partnered with private and public organizations on hundreds of projects that have created thousands of jobs on both sides of the Mississippi River.

 

BSD operates with a focus on making a positive impact on the region and the nation, better connecting the Bi-State area to the rest of the world. We are impacting neighborhoods, large and small, in Illinois and in Missouri, with investments that are shaped by our unique perspective of the region and its potential.

 

Why Work Here

 

* Work for a company that strives to make a positive impact in the region
* Earn competitive salary
* Free access to 9 gyms at our facilities 24-7 as well with Personal Trainers available
* Discounted memberships with Club Fitness & Golds Gyms
* Wellness program that provides free health screenings
* Discounted cellular phone service
* Free MetroLink and MetroBus access
* Uniform allowance
* Medical, Dental, Vision coverage effective on your 1st day
* 4 weeks earned PTO
* Your Birthday is a floating holiday
* Company sponsored 401k plan
* Employee assistance program
* Eligible for Public Service Student Loan Forgiveness program
* Hybrid work environment. Will work in the office and remotely

 

 

The Role

 

To lead and support development, maintenance, and deployment of functionality related to Metro’s Oracle E-Business Suite. This position will focus on the General Accounting and Financials functional areas and requires working with our business customers and our technical team to determine, design, and implement Oracle E-Business related changes that improve business processes and business effectiveness.

Responsibilities

* Gather and evaluate business requirements. Determine approach to meet requirements with Oracle capabilities and customizations.
* Develop recommendations, business cases, and estimates for new functionality and changes in order to improve business processes and application performance.
* Develop, test, and implement new Oracle capabilities, customizations and configurations.
* Investigate Oracle e-Business Suite functionality, data, and interface problems. Determine and implement resolutions.
* Work with business customers to identify improvements, alternatives, or new capabilities that would benefit the organization.
* Document Oracle Business Suite configuration, support information, and customizations in accordance with Metro IT standard application methodology.
* Work with Metro infrastructure, database, and other applications development teams to ensure proper unit, system, user acceptance, and performance testing.
* Assist with, as appropriate, orientation and training of Oracle end users/customers.
* Mentor other IT team members as appropriate to help them grow in their capabilities.
* Document and estimate specific requests for new capabilities. Help to assess the value to the organization.

Knowledge, Skill, & Abilities

 

* **This position is 60% functional and 40% technical.**
* Ability to listen and communicate effectively with all levels of Metro Organization
* Ability to document requirements, recommendations, estimates, and system information in a clear and concise manner.
* Ability and experience with estimating work and schedules.
* Experience working in a team environment and ability to work independently and set priorities.
* Ability to investigate data, application, and processes to determine problem source in complex environment and identify and implement potential changes and solutions.
* Understanding of information technology and Oracle standards, procedures, and best practices.
* Ability to work with business customers and understand their processes and functions.
* **Ability and interest in staying current on Oracle E-Business suite and technologies**.
* Mandatory:
+ **In-depth functional configuration experience of at least two of the following Oracle E-Business Suite modules (preferably release 12.1.3): General Ledger, Receivables, Fixed Assets, Cash Management**
+ Experience providing day-to-day end-user support of at least one of the following functional areas: General Ledger, Accounts Receivable, Fixed Assets, Cash Management
+ **Ability to develop complex SQL queries.**
+ Experience troubleshooting SQL queries and PL/SQL packages.

* Special consideration will be given for the following:
+ Experience with Oracle Workflow Builder and/or Approvals Management (AME).
+ Working knowledge of Oracle Application Framework (OAF): personalizations, html pages, and java class extensions within the context of the Oracle e-Business Suite.
+ Working knowledge of Oracle Forms, Reports, and/or BI Publisher.
+ Working knowledge of OBIEE and/or OBIA.

 

 

Education

Experience

Degree: B.A./B.S. or equivalent experience required

Years: Eight (8) minimum required (Senior Level)

Field: Computer Science or related field

Filed: Oracle E-Business Suite

title: Financial Analyst/Senior Financial Analyst
description:
**Position Overview**:

The Financial Analyst/Senior Financial Analyst position is responsible for executive/owner/investor level modeling and is a key member of the Financial Planning and Analysis team. This includes financial modeling, investment analysis, property budgets, working with lenders and investors on diligence requirements, and designing ad-hoc portfolio reporting and analysis. This position works closely with the Financial Analyst Manager and other department heads which requires excellent organization and communication skills. Acute attention to detail, flexibility, and deadline management are essential functions of the position.

**Essential Functions:**

Create and maintain rolling forecasts of the performance of Gardner’s primary business units

Track expenses and revenues vs. budget and re-forecast and analyze fluctuations and prepare annual budgets for company and business unit performance

Assist executive team with new project and new loan modeling and evaluation

Implement improvements after identifying points of weakness in all financial planning, forecasting, and analyzation

Update and continually improve presentation of financial statements and supporting reports

Provide guidance to other departments and assist with special projects

Ad Hoc projects, ranging from modeling exercises to summarizing and analyzing loan agreements and other legal documents

Maintain economic models on key investments

Track projects and economic assets, to include major receivables

Assist with due diligence as needed

Other duties as assigned

**Competencies:**

Excellent communication skills and analytic expertise are needed to verbalize financial documents and plans to upper management

Staying attune to financial markets and what others are doing creatively within the development industry, to include innovative capitalization structures, etc. - - ability to ‘think outside of the box’ and look to challenge the owners’ traditional way of looking at the business

Proficiency in a variety of accounting and financial analysis functions

Exceptional organizational, time management, and prioritization skills

High ethical standards including maintaining the highest level of discretion and confidentiality

High degree of accuracy and attention to detail

Self-Starter, able to identify problem areas and brainstorm and present recommended solutions

Effective collaboration skills – can lead a team when asked

Ability to easily and quickly adapt to changing project demands and needs; high energy

**Preferred Education and Experience:**

Bachelor's degree in accounting or finance with **three plus years of related experience**

Proficiency with Microsoft Office (preferably Office 365), SharePoint and Great Plains or similar accounting software preferred

MBA, CPA, or other professional designation would be a plus

Knowledge of SQL and/or VBA a plus

**Other Duties:**

Please note this job description is not designed to cover or contain a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities and activities may change at any time with or without notice.

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
TriRinse is an award-winning, St. Louis-based provider of agricultural services including seed box management, container management, industrial cleaning, and formulation/packaging. 

 

Our biggest asset is our people. It is their integrity, resourcefulness, and customer-first mentality that drive our reputation as true problem-solvers for our industry. Grounded in a culture of collaboration, we share the accountability and passion necessary to truly innovate.

 

What's in it for you?

 

* Family owned since 1981
* 40+ years of continued business growth
* Team-Oriented Culture
* Individual Career Paths
* Outstanding Benefits

**PURPOSE OF POSITION:** We are seeking a self-driven, skilled Senior Financial Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will partner with our Chief Financial Officer, division leaders, and other functional leaders to deliver financial statements and analyses that tell a story, inform decision-making, and drive measurable performance outcomes. You will work to continuously improve our systems and help set us on the path to our next 40+ years of growth!

 

**ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:**

* Analyze data, develop models, and create reports and dashboards that support data-driven decision-making throughout the organization
* Prepare the monthly general ledger close process – all journal entries, accruals, account reconciliations, credit card coding and income statement variance analysis in a timely and efficient manner.
* Prepare consolidated monthly financial statements and accompanying analysis and commentary in accordance with GAAP, for distribution to the Executive Leadership Team.
* Assist in the preparation of the annual budgeting process and reforecasts throughout the year.
* Work with Operations Leaders to understand revenues, waste and disposal costs and identify opportunities for improvement. Develop reporting metrics to communicate operating results.
* Cross train on purchasing, accounts payable and payroll duties to back up these roles when necessary.
* Other special projects and analysis upon requests throughout the year.

  


**SKILLS/QUALIFICATIONS:** 

* College degree in finance, accounting, economics, business or related field
* 5+ years experience in accounting and financial analysis in a corporate setting
* Expertise in best-in-class data visualization, management and analysis tools, including Tableau, Microsoft Excel, Power BI, financial software, databases, and ERP systems - experience with Sage Intacct a plus.
* Comprehensive understanding of financial concepts, including financial statements, budgeting, forecasting, and financial modeling
* Thorough knowledge of Generally Accepted Accounting Principles and their application in real world situations
* Adherence to ethical standards and a commitment to maintaining the confidentiality and integrity of financial information
* Ability to quickly analyze financial and operational data for trend and variance analysis.
* Proven analytical, quantitative, and problem-solving skills
* Strong attention to detail.
* Strong written, verbal and interpersonal communication skills
* Highly organized, with a proven ability to handle and prioritize multiple tasks.
* Proven ability to meet deadlines and work independently.

 **Equal Opportunity Employer**
