* 3 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work Location: In person

title: Program Financial Analyst with clearance
description:
Program Financial Analyst with clearance
Job Category: Finance and Accounting
Time Type: Full time
Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Secret
Employee Type: Regular-Long Term Assignment
Percentage of Travel Required: Up to 10%
Type of Travel: Continental US
\* \* \***What You’ll Get to Do**:


As a CACI Program Financial Analyst, you will be a member of a small financial team that has complete responsibility to create and maintain program financial data to support the strategic plans of a Government Client and the Program Managers.

**More About this Role**:


With input from Management, you will be responsible for all program financial data and reporting to include creating and maintaining the project forecast and budget; tracking of the appropriated, unexpired resources to support the day-to-day mission activities; performing statistical and graphical analysis on various aspects of resources such as on the rate of execution of funding, fill-rates of authorized positions, workforce skills, size, cost, and etc.; assist with documenting policies and procedures specific to this program. You will also perform ad hoc analysis and reporting on various items as directed by Program Managers or the client. Duties and Responsibilities will include but are not limited to:

* Preparation of large spreadsheets (to include designing and building), invoice backup data, reports, briefing charts, and other documents with strict timelines for review and analysis.
* Preparation of program and budget information to include monthly reports and EACs for internal and external audiences.
* Interpretation of requests for data and facts; acquire, analyze, and prepare presentations of program and budget data for use in program decision-making.
* Analysis and tracking of multi-level funding requirements based on the current forecast, current execution, and historical data. Must determine burn rates, variances from prior forecasts, future funding needs, etc.
* Development and maintain complex funding profiles for programs, projects, or contracts.
* Creation and maintenance of multi-level budget with various MIPRs or financial planning for the program to identify potential variances and continually update to meet the changing need of the client and program.
* Compilation and reporting of budgets, financial presentations, and other materials to support the client and Program Managers.
* Other duties as assigned.

**You’ll Bring These Qualifications**:

* A minimum of seven (5) years of DoD or commercial experience in accounting, finance, program control, or similar position working in a high stress environment and meeting strict deadlines.
* A bachelor’s degree with a concentration in accounting or finance is desired. Relevant experience is more important than a degree.
* Experience in designing, building, and preparation of complex studies, reports, and analyses in areas such as budgets, forecasts, financial plans, government requirements, contract requirements, statistical reports is required.
* Experience in budget planning, budget design and preparation, budget execution, and budget tracking is required.
* Experience in designing and building reports and complex spreadsheets per management and client needs is required.
* Advanced Excel skills and the ability to learn new software quickly are required.
* Must be self-motivated and able to work independently to meet deadlines and function equally well as a team.
* TS/SCI must be obtainable. A Secret Clearance is required to start.

**What We Can Offer You:**

* CACI-Wexford manages the Special Operations and Asymmetric Solutions Operating Group within CACI’s Operations Support and Services Sector. As the premier provider of Special Operations capabilities; Tactical Advisory and Embedded Support; Intelligence Applications to Law Enforcement; Security cooperation and OCONUS Training Support Delivery for the company, CACI-Wexford has a reputation for uncompromising standards of quality in its people and its performance. Joining the CACI-Wexford team is a mark of excellence for those employees who complete our rigorous Mission-Focused Staffing process.
* CACI-Wexford’s mission places its personnel against the government’s most critical emerging challenges. Work with us, and you’ll be working with a team making a difference across the globe.
* CACI-Wexford offers competitive benefits as well as numerous learning and development opportunities.
* As the Prime Contractor for this effort, CACI-Wexford offers unmatched stability and growth potential within the program.

**Company Overview:**


CACI is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any other protected characteristic.

**Pay Range**: There are a host of factors that can influence final salary including, but not limited to, geographic location, Federal Government contract labor categories and contract wage rates, relevant prior work experience, specific skills and competencies, education, and certifications. Our employees value the flexibility at CACI that allows them to balance quality work and their personal lives. We offer competitive compensation, benefits and learning and development opportunities. Our broad and competitive mix of benefits options is designed to support and protect employees and their families. At CACI, you will receive comprehensive benefits such as; healthcare, wellness, financial, retirement, family support, continuing education, and time off benefits. Learn more here


The proposed salary range for this position is:


$59,100 - $124,100

title: Budget Analyst with Clearance
description:
Budget Analyst with Clearance
Job Category: Finance and Accounting
Time Type: Full time
Minimum Clearance Required to Start: Secret
Employee Type: Regular
Percentage of Travel Required: Up to 10%
Type of Travel: Local
\* \* \***What You’ll Get to Do:**

  

As a member of the CACI-Wexford group Special Operations and Asymmetric Solutions Group (SOAS) we are renowned for bringing the expertise of our motivated, innovative professionals to address customers’ most difficult challenges and requirements. Using our cutting-edge practices, tools, and technologies, CACI's SOAS offers a range of solutions to address customer needs. At CACI-Wexford you will have the opportunity to make an immediate impact by providing information solutions and services in support of national security missions and government transformation for Intelligence, Defense, and Federal Civilian customers.


In support of the Joint Navigation Warfare Center (JNWC) contract, you will be a part of our team’s efforts to empower the Department of Defense’s navigation warfare (NAVWAR) mission ensuring positioning, navigation and timing superiority. Our mission is to provide combatant commanders and joint force commanders with subject matter expertise on planning and conducting NAVWAR by providing knowledge of friendly and enemy NAVWAR Order of Battle and PNT-related successes and threats.

 **M****ore About the Role:**


Responsible for all program level financial analysis and reporting. Requirements may include: program cost control and management using cost baselines, revenue and profit recognition and forecasting, customer reporting and invoicing support, direct and indirect rate analysis, annual and multi-year planning, monthly forecasting, program compliance with FAR and GAAP regulations, and program initial set up to include project codes with work breakdown structure and billing setup.

 **You’ll Bring These Qualifications:**

* 5 or more Years of relevant Finance/Accounting experience
* Familiar with DoD and USG budgeting policies
* Prior experience with DoD finance systems to include military budgeting, ROM, and MIPR experience
* BA/BS degree in accounting, business, economics, finance, or another related field
* Certified Government Financial Manager (CGFM) certification or another equivalent
* Prior leadership or management training
* Current SECRET clearance
**What We Can Offer You:**

* CACI-Wexford manages the Special Operations and Asymmetric Solutions Operating Group within CACI’s Operations Support and Services Sector. As the premier provider of Special Operations capabilities; Tactical Advisory and Embedded Support; intelligence Applications to Law Enforcement; security cooperation and OCONUS Training Support Delivery for the company, CACI-Wexford has a reputation for uncompromising standards of quality in its people and its performance. Joining the CACI-Wexford team is a mark of excellence for those employees who complete our rigorous Mission-Focused Staffing process.

title: FP&A Analyst - Virtual/Remote
description:
Enumerate needs a **Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst** for our rapidly growing team!Enumerate has grown rapidly through acquisitions and is backed by a leading Boston-based private equity firm. We expect to continue with strategic acquisitions while diversifying our product offerings to include payments-related services for its core HOA customer base.  
  
In this role, you’ll be responsible for budgeting and forecasting as well as the development and delivery of actionable and insightful analyses of both retrospective trends (actual v. planned) and prospective opportunities. Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will have a leading role in identifying, implementing, and improving upon these core requirements.  
  
You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. This position is remote eligible, with a preference for candidates in CST/EST. **Who will love this job**  
* Someone who is a critical thinker with a meticulous approach, high initiative, and the ability to explain financial concepts in “plain English” to non-financial stakeholders

**You should have*** Required: 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, either within a corporate Finance, FP&A function, or within investment banking, commercial banking, or private equity.
* Required: Bachelors in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other highly quantitative discipline.
* Required: Experience with SaaS (or subscription) revenue recognition, including familiarity with standard SaaS metrics/ KPIs.
* Fluency in O365- especially Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
* Strong financial modeling skills in Excel including a working knowledge of 3 statement models.
* Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.
* Ability to work in the US without sponsorship.
  
**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. When possible, we also like to offer fun in-person perks like pet-friendly offices, paid food trucks and company outings.

title: Data Analyst (REMOTE)
description:
Everlight Solar is seeking a skilled Data Analyst who will design and maintain functional programs and applications, producing fully functional software applications according to requirements. As a Data Analyst, you play a key role in serving our clients and team members. This will be a full-time, work-from-home "remote" position.

**This is a role for Apple power-users, must know iWork and be skilled with iOS and macOS.**

Everlight Solar is a rapidly growing company and the leader of solar energy in the Midwest. We offer a unique experience that fosters individual growth and rewards performance. Our culture at Everlight is extremely important to us. The work environment is fast-paced and dynamic. We value teamwork, quality, innovation, and customer success. Our ideal candidate is self-motivated, detail-oriented, has excellent problem-solving abilities, is passionate about delivering results on-time, exceeding expectations, and ensuring success for our teams.

**Responsibilities:**

* Work with large amounts of data to draw meaningful conclusions
* Develop and implement data collection systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and data quality
* Provide regular reporting and analysis to team
* Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key metrics and performance indicators
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify areas for improvement and to develop solutions to enhance business operations
* Provide training and support to team members on data analysis techniques and tools

**Requirements:**

* Minimum two years of experience with DOMO
* MajorDOMO Certification Required
* 3+ years experience in data analysis, reporting, business intelligence or financial analysis and a Bachelor's Degree in Business, Statistics, Mathematics, Analytics, Computer Sciences or related field or equivalent experience
* 2 years experience in providing people analytics reporting to organizations
* Demonstrated experience using SQL, and DOMO
* Experience with sensitive and confidential people data in a global environment
* Analyze, evaluate, improve, and document processes and workflows. Identify and take advantage of opportunities for process automation and simplification.
* Proven ability to design and implement new processes and facilitate user adoption.
* Strong understanding of Salesforce.com best practices and functionality
* Strong data management abilities
* A documented history of successfully driving projects to completion
* A demonstrated ability to understand and articulate complex requirements
* Excellent project management skills and a positive attitude
* Must demonstrate exceptional verbal and written communication skills
* Must demonstrate ability to communicate effectively at all levels of the organization
* Must own a Mac computer and be fluent with the Apple ecosystem of software (iOS, macOS, iWork, etc.)

**Benefits:**  


* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Life Insurance
* PTO
* Sick and Safe Time
* Paid Holidays Off

**Salary: $65,000-$100,000/year**

*Everlight Solar is proudly an Equal Opportunity Employer. We value diversity of all types and are excited to work with talented individuals from a wide range of backgrounds. Everlight is committed to inclusion and we invite people of any race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex, age groups (18+), and levels of education to apply. Authorized to work in the US and background check required.*

title: Client Financial Coordinator
description:
**Position Purpose:**  
The Client Financial Coordinator serves as the first on-site point of contact for patient financial services. This position is responsible for coordinating and/or scheduling financial consultation appointments, collecting payments from walk-ins, obtaining insurance information, prescreening clients for self-pay, insurance or Medicaid program, and providing outstanding customer service. This position is also responsible for coordinating and performing all of the administrative/support tasks for the finance department.

* The Client Financial Coordinator provides exceptional service to internal clients through maintaining a consistent professional and approachable demeanor and taking responsibility for seeking solutions to problems.
* The Client Financial Coordinator will assist with business and operational functions of the company related to the process of client billings and accounts receivable management.
* The Client Financial Coordinator will provide support in all non-clinical aspects of intakes, obtaining client information, clarifying and verifying details of insurance, completing paperwork and/or payment plans.

**PERFORMANCE EXPECTATIONS:**  
In performance of their respective tasks and duties all employees of Turning Point Recovery Center Inc. are expected to conform to the following:  
• Uphold all principles of confidentiality to the fullest extent.  
• Adhere to all professional and ethical behavior standards of the healthcare industry.  
• Interact in an honest, trustworthy and respectful manner with participants, employees, visitors and vendors.  
• Comply with Turning Point Recovery Center’s policies and procedures.  
• Ability to stay focused and works in an error-free role.  
• Maintain a current insurable driver’s license  
POSITION PURPOSE  
The Client Financial Coordinator serves as the first on-site point of contact for patient financial services. This position is responsible for coordinating and/or scheduling financial consultation appointments, collecting payments from walk-ins, obtaining insurance information, prescreening clients for self-pay, insurance or Medicaid program, and providing outstanding customer service. This position is also responsible for coordinating and performing all of the administrative/support tasks for the finance department.  
  
**ESSENTIAL DUTIES, FUNCTIONS & RESPONSIBILITIES:**  
  
1. Outstanding listening, communication, problem-solving and research skills.  
2. Polished professional with good interpersonal, grammatical, spelling, proofreading, telephone etiquette, and social skills. Professional presentation/appearance/demeanor.  
3. Strong customer service experience demonstrating compassion and concern.  
4. Ability to use diplomacy and handle sensitive and confidential matters discreetly, exhibiting honesty, integrity, discretion, and sound judgment at all times.  
5. Good organizational, problem-solving, and analytical skills; able to manage priorities, projects, and workflow.  
6. Ability to deal effectively with a diversity of individuals at all organizational levels.  
7. Attention to detail, with a commitment to excellence and high standards.  
8. Ability to work well under pressure and multi-task routinely.  
9. Knowledge of general office concepts, practices, and procedures.  
10. Ability to work on projects with general direction and minimal guidance, managing multiple priorities through to completion in a timely manner.  
11. Proactive, motivated, and focused team-player attitude, self-sufficient, and prepared to go “above and beyond” on a regular basis.  
12. Creative, innovative individual who works well in a fast paced environment.  
13. Performs accurate client invoicing for all client receivables through the use of Quick Books.  
14. Go over client finances and have signed financial agreements on all active clients.  
15. Set up payment plans when applicable.  
16. Send monthly invoices of clients with a balance.  
17. Ongoing process on working delinquent accounts.  
18. Client refunds will be processed with a written completed request form. Then given to controller for check to be processed.  
19. Verify that transactions comply with financial policies and procedures.  
20. Daily check deposit log to see if deposits to Quick Books are needed.  
21. Receives incoming client calls pertaining to client financials. If the call includes insurance benefits then an email will be send to the biller with information attained.  
22. Calls insurance companies to verify benefits when necessary.  
23. Backs up the reception office and also a backup for admissions department when needed.  
24. Works with Operation Director on Data Collection and Analysis Projects.  
25. Has completed assigned Relias training  
26. Opens or closes building according to procedures posted.  
27. Perform other tasks and duties as assigned.  
  
**MINIMUM MANDATORY QUALIFICATIONS:**  
**Experience:**  
Experience with Microsoft Word, Excel and QuickBooks. Ability to learn and competently perform functions in an EMR program and an online clearing house. Experience in a billing department, or experience in billing for similar services.  
**Education:** HS Diploma-Some College  
**License/Certification**: CPR  
  
**PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:**  
BACHELORS DEGREE  
  
**WORK ENVIRONMENT:**  
The work environment characteristics described here are representative to those an employee encounters while performing the primary functions of this job. Normal office conditions exist, and the noise level in the work environment can vary from low to moderate. Limited overnight travel may be required from time to time. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  
  
**Mental demands:**  
There are a number of deadlines associated with this position. The employee must be able to handle frequent interruptions and must also multi-task and interact with a wider variety of people on various and, at times, complicated issues.

**Physical Demands:**

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the primary functions of this job. While performing the duties of this job, the employee may be required to frequently stand, walk, sit, bend, twist, talk, hear and perform repetitive motions. There may be prolonged periods of sitting, keyboarding, reading, as well as driving or riding in transport vehicles. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 20 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include reading, distance, computer, and color vision. Talking and hearing are essential to communicate with patients, vendors and staff. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  
  
**OTHER:**  
All employees must uphold all principles of confidentiality and patient care to the fullest extent. This position has access to sensitive information and a breach of these principles will be grounds for immediate termination.  
  
In order to provide equal employment and advancement opportunities to all individuals, employment decisions Turning Point Recovery Center Inc. will be based on merit, qualifications, and abilities. Turning Point Recovery Center Inc. does not discriminate in employment opportunities or practices on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Budget Analyst and Contract Administrator
description:
**Description**

This Budget Analyst and Contracts Administrator role, located in Albuquerque, NM is an onsite position within NNSA’s NA-84 Office of Nuclear Incident Response, Nuclear Emergency Support Team’s (NEST) Standards & Training Program (NSTP). The role serves to provide budgetary, financial analysis, and contractual management duties that ensure all participating NEST organizations have sufficient funding to perform required mission work. Focus is on delivering timely and quality analysis using interagency collaboration to meet scheduled mission training objectives. 

**Job Responsibilities**

· Work as part of a team to develop, analyze and execute budgets.

· Understand budgetary issues with programs of record and track multiple issues across programs.

· Design and develop financial reports and templates.

· Coordinate the development, collection, consolidation, interpretation, and reporting of cross-organizational monthly cost reports.

· Perform forecasting, estimating, variance and trend analyses.

· Track, report, and maintain adequate funding distribution amounts to all participating partners and agencies.

· Assist in resolving funding shortfalls or allocation problems.

· Track and record budget authority adjustments and changes.

· Assist in the preparation and maintenance of a detailed 5-year outyear budget plan.

· Create funding distribution memorandums on behalf of federal program managers and route for signature and distribution.

· Administer interagency federal contract agreements from Sponsors to multiple Service Agencies and liaison work to troubleshoot contractual issues.

· Support Executive Budget Manager tasking as directed.

 

**Desired Knowledge, Skills and Abilities**

· Demonstrated experience in cost engineering functions; including cost estimating, cost control, financial reporting systems, and cost and variance analysis.

· Knowledge of Department of Energy (DOE) budgetary methods, practices, procedures, regulations, policies, and processes.

· Knowledge of missions, functions, goals, objectives, work processes, and sources of funding pertinent to NA-84 Office of Nuclear Incident Response

· Ability to communicate effectively and strategically, verbal and written, to justify, defend, present, and/or advise on budgetary processes/actions.

· Demonstrated experience and ability to build and grow effective internal and external organizational relationships.

· Demonstrated experience in effective decision-making and creative problem solving.

· Basic knowledge and familiarity with Federal Acquisition Regulations (FAR)

· 5+ years of financial analysis or related experience or 2+ years of DOD, DOJ or Federal interagency contracting experience

**Minimum Requirements**

· Demonstrated experience in formulating, justifying, and executing multi-year budgets for a multitude of organizations and programs.

· Demonstrated advanced knowledge and experience using computer operating systems and general computer applications and software, including several basic software applications such as Microsoft Word, Excel, and PowerPoint.

· US citizenship needed to obtain and maintain required US Dept of Energy "Q" level security clearance

· Ability to obtain and maintain the required US Dept of Energy "Q" level security clearance

· Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university in accounting, finance or related business field and two (2) years of applicable professional experience

· Up to 10% travel

**Preferred Qualifications**

· Currently holds an active TS or Q clearance.

 **Benefits** 

· Employer-paid employee Medical, Dental, Vision, Long-Term Disability and Life Insurance

· Federal Holidays and three weeks of PTO annually

· 401k with employer match

**Who We Are**

On Point Associates, LLC is a veteran-owned government contractor headquartered in Woodbridge, VA. On Point Associates, LLC offers a great work environment, professional development, challenging and exciting careers and competitive compensation. 

Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national or ethnic origin, gender (including pregnancy), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability veteran status or any other characteristics protected by law. On Point Associates LLC participates in E-Verify.

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: Accountant/Fiscal Analyst - Retirement Benefit Payments
description:
The SC Public Employee Benefit Authority (PEBA) is the administrator and co-trustee of retirement and insurance programs for over half a million active and retired public employees of the State of South Carolina and their dependents.  

  

This position will perform professional duties in the analysis and maintenance of payroll accounts, refund payments, group life insurance payments, retiree death payments and all manual adjustments to annuitant payroll records, using highly automated integrated systems to record and process financial transactions.  

  

Job duties include:  

Analyzes request for post-retirement beneficiary changes by approving or denying 7201 Retired Member Change of Beneficiary Form based on statutory authority governing each system, obtaining updated benefit estimate if option change is selected, communicating with retired member, and applying appropriate changes to automated payment system. Forwards supportive documents of changes made to Quality Assurance for verification of accuracy and filing in member's imaged records.  

* 

Responds to inquiries and requests via 7403 Retired Member Information Request Form, e-mails and phone calls from staff, members, and employers within two working days. Evaluates and reviews member accounts to determine appropriate action. Adjusts member retirement and payee histories, reinstates, and suspends, performs required calculations to update current payroll records for various annuitant options.  
* 

Monitors and maintains disability earning limitations and other approved exceptions - review and make appropriate adjustments on CRIS system. Verifies the accuracy of annuity overpayments; analyzes and adjusts retired member payroll records and annuities; and communicates with members to schedule a reasonable payment plan.  
* 

Monitors and maintains service earnings limitation - review, make appropriate adjustments on automated payment system, communicate with members to set up payment plan and follow up with required correspondence.  
* 

Analyzes and researches returned EFT transactions daily and processes EFT recalls weekly using on-line Wells Fargo CEO and reports from automated payment system. Reviews daily and weekly reports; determines appropriate adjustments to be made on automated payment system, issues replacement checks and related correspondence as necessary. Communicates results of each recall to appropriate work group. Compiles and provides monthly summary of all EFT return and recall activity to Financial Accounting. Monitors Wells Fargo CEO fraud manager on a daily basis.  
* 
* Researches and processes all incoming checks, to include returned PEBA checks, payee repayment checks and rollover company reimbursement checks. Perform voids, reissues, stop payments and creation of special checks in accordance with check maintenance guidelines.

  

A bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, business, or a related field. An equivalent combination of education and related experience may be substituted for the required degree.
  

In addition to 13 paid holidays, this position is eligible for comprehensive insurance programs, retirement plans, and a generous paid leave program. Upon successful completion of one-year of service with the agency, employees may be eligible to be considered for remote work.

title: Financial Planning Specialist
description:
**Position Title: Financial Planning Specialist**

Step into an instrumental role as a Financial Planning Specialist with The Bergamot Group, a financial advisory practice of Ameriprise Financial. **The office is located in Blythewood, SC.**

The Financial Planning Specialist will primarily assist the financial advisors in the financial planning, investment management, and client service workflow. This position will consistently follow high standards of business and professional ethics and legal and regulatory requirements when dealing with others and/or performing work activities.

This role provides client relationship support through managing, gathering and analyzing client data, helping prepare preliminary financial plans and other client deliverables, working with clients to resolve issues and other practice management tasks as needed.

As a Financial Planning Specialist, you will be instrumental in creating and delivering a unique client experience that defines and differentiates the practice. The Financial Planning Specialist will assist financial advisors in working with clients to help them achieve their financial goals.

Responsibilities and time allocation may change over time to meet the needs of the practice and can include other duties as assigned by the advisors.

**Position functions:**

* Oversee the financial planning and client service process in accordance to practice preferences while providing superior support to both the financial advisors and the client.
* Owner of the financial planning process
* Prepare client agendas and meeting materials in alignment with practice preferences for all client meetings
* Review and update client information as needed
* Responsible for completing insurance proposals and re-projections
* Owner of meeting follow up process and business processing action items
* Oversee future assets, business opportunities, and new prospective client pipeline
* Owner of required minimum distributions process
* Responsible for follow-up with home office on business or compliance related issues
* Answer questions and provide readily available information to clients, if requested and as allowable, as it relates to servicing their accounts and financial planning data
* Responsible for documenting client contact/calls
* Manage and resolve client service problems
* Conduct trade completion and transaction requests as directed by financial advisor and associate financial advisor
* Attend and participate in client meetings, if necessary
* Maintain files and records in accordance with the records retention policy
* Track/hold clients accountable to agreed upon actions
* Develop appropriate product deliverables
* Manage wholesaler relationships
* Work with home office to ensure accurate account setup and resolve issues
* Maintain files and records in accordance with the records retention policy
* Executes client trades and money movement transactions
* Owns compliance system management for advisory accounts
* Leads team huddles while utilizing practice CRM dashboards

**Key traits of a successful Financial Planning Specialist:**

* Direct attention to detail and organization
* Effective communication with clients and other advisors/staff
* Effective and efficient time management
* High level of interpersonal skills
* Polite and clear phone manner
* Ability to adhere to rules and regulations as stated and required by advisor and Ameriprise
* Ability to support and provide guidance for compliance
* Willingness to take initiative
* Aptitude to identify practice systems that need improved efficiency
* Highly capable problem solver
* Positive attitude and sincere willingness to constantly learn and grow
* Functions well in a collaborative team environment
* Required experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, and Outlook
* Preferred experience with Salesforce, NaviPlan, and Thomson One

**Education and other designations:**

* 2+ years of similar experience preferred
* Already have or be able to study for and pass exams for federal and state licenses and registrations for securities, including the SIE, Series 7, Series 66, and State life, accident, and health insurance licenses

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Paid time off

Weekly schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Work setting:

* In-person
* Office

License/Certification:

* Series 7 (Required)
* Series 66 (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Columbia, SC (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Columbia, SC: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Accountant/Fiscal Analyst
description:
The South Carolina Public Employee Benefit Authority (PEBA) is the administrator and co-trustee of retirement and insurance programs for over half a million active and retired public employees of the State of South Carolina and their dependents.  

  

This position will perform professional duties required to maintain financial records (billings, collections, and account maintenance) for active and individual insurance accounts of the PEBA Insurance Benefits program.  

  

Job duties include:  

Monitors employer and member accounts- Reviews the A/R status and the Retro Failed reports which identify the balances that require research, which involves multiple systems (Unix, accounting and IA Folder) and includes comparing enrollment forms to the transactions in the operational history to determine if they are processed correctly, and also reviewing payment history. From the research, determines the appropriate action required to resolve the balance, which may include refunding over payments, transferring balances, or calculating billing adjustments. Resolution may require communication with PEBA enrollment department, employers, and members.  

* 

Monitors delinquent employer accounts- Reviews monthly A/R status reports to identify the delinquent accounts and to determine the severity of the delinquency. Takes appropriate action according to the delinquent policy and procedures, to include communication in writing and verbally with employers, changing the delinquent status and working with the supervisor.  
* 

Monitors Accounts Receivable balances for individual members- In accordance with the Accounting Monthly Cycle guidelines, runs A/R Status reports and reviews accounts using the Contact Log, Imaging folders, and Operational History. Takes appropriate action regarding refunds, balance transfers, and partial and delinquent payments. Researches and resolves all balances on reports prior to the next billing cycle.  
* 

Provides exceptional customer service to employers and members- Monitors and responds appropriately to incoming emails in the Insurance Accounting Inbox.  
* 

Resolves South Carolina Enterprise Information System (SCEIS) billing and payroll discrepancies- Reviews the monthly Accumulator report to identify discrepancies. Works closely with employers to determine the reason for the discrepancy and the appropriate action needed to resolve the balance, to include billing or balance transfer adjustments, contacting SCEIS to adjust payroll or correcting the insurance coverage.  
* 
* Enters bank deposit information in the banking portal by 4 pm daily.

  

A high school diploma and at least two years of professional experience in a related area such as accounting, auditing, finance, insurance, or banking. A bachelor's degree with multiple accounting courses may be substituted for the required work experience.
  

In addition to 13 paid holidays, this position is eligible for comprehensive insurance programs, retirement plans, and a generous paid leave program. Upon successful completion of one-year of service with the agency, employees may be eligible to be considered for remote work.

title: Financial Analyst
description:
Great Southern Homes, Inc. (GSH) sold over 1,600 homes last year in South Carolina and Georgia, and we are passionate about helping our customers achieve the American Dream of owning their own home. As an organization, we are proud of our entrepreneurial work culture that values self-starters, flexibility, and working as a team. GSH is a wholly owned subsidiary of United Homes Group, Inc. (UHG), a publicly traded company headquartered in Irmo, SC that trades on the NASDAQ under the symbol UHG.

**Job Summary**

As a Financial Analyst at United Homes Group, you will play a critical role in supporting our financial operations, contributing to our growth, and helping us achieve our strategic goals. You will work in a dynamic environment that provides ample opportunities for professional development and career advancement for a highly ranked national homebuilder.

**Responsibilities:**

* **Financial Modeling:** Utilize financial modeling techniques to support decision-making processes. You will create models for various scenarios, evaluate investment opportunities, and assess the financial viability of projects. Your models will be instrumental in guiding the company's investment decisions.
* **Financial Forecasting:** Assist with the forecasting and budgeting processes to provide insight into the company's future financial performance. This includes leveraging financial models that project revenue, expenses, and cash flows, helping the organization make informed decisions and allocate resources effectively.
* **Financial Reporting and Analysis:** Assist in month-end and quarter-end financial reporting, ensuring accuracy and completeness of financial data. Your role will involve interpreting financial results, identifying trends, and providing explanations for variances to budget and prior periods.
* **KPI Development:** Contribute to the development of key performance indicators (KPIs) and metrics to measure business performance. You will work to establish meaningful benchmarks and performance targets, ensuring that the company has the tools to assess its financial health and operational efficiency.
* **Ad-Hoc Analysis:** Provide ad-hoc financial analysis and support to management as needed. Your ability to quickly analyze data and provide actionable insights will be essential in addressing urgent business challenges and strategic opportunities.
* **Understanding of Accounting Principles:** Maintain a strong understanding of accounting principles and apply them to ensure financial statements are in compliance with Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP). You will work closely with the accounting team to reconcile accounts and resolve discrepancies.
* **Cross-Functional Collaboration:** Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including operations, sales, and project management, to analyze financial data and provide recommendations for improving business performance. Your ability to communicate complex financial information in a clear and actionable manner will be invaluable in these interactions.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, or a related field. A master’s degree or relevant financial certification (e.g., CFA, CPA) is a plus.
* Proficient Microsoft Excel Skills: Mastery of Microsoft Excel, including the ability to create complex financial models, utilize advanced functions, and work with large datasets. 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, preferably in the construction or real estate industry.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced and high-growth environment, thriving under pressure.
* Detail-oriented with a strong commitment to accuracy and meeting deadlines.
* A proactive and self-driven approach to work, with a willingness to take on new challenges and tasks.
* Strong communication skills to present complex financial information to non-finance team members.
* Strong understanding of accounting principles, including financial statement preparation and reconciliation.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $80,000.00 - $100,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Financial analysis: 2 years (Required)
* Microsoft Excel: 3 years (Required)

Ability to Commute:

* Chapin, SC 29036 (Required)

Ability to Relocate:

* Chapin, SC 29036: Relocate before starting work (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Senior Financial Analyst
description:
**Job Summary:**

We are in search for people with sense of re-inventing themselves, in pursuit of ‘doing the right thing’, willing to take more responsibility and move up. Sound like you? Be part of our top-notch team of 13,00+ professionals in Columbia, SC location where we have 3 plants co-located under the same roof. You will be joining a finance team where we have mix of mature and high growth finance professionals supporting the monthly closing, annual planning, compliance, measuring operational performance and providing guidance on how to optimize resource utilization generating maximum wealth for the business. The Senior Financial Analyst will add significant value to the company’s bottom line through improving all aspects of financial management in a multi-million dollar operating facility.

**Responsibilities:** 

* Leads annual standard cost process as well as quarterly costs movement reviews.
* Leads annual physical inventory process and related reconciliation.
* Completes all monthly reports on a timely basis with zero defects.
* Reviews transaction errors to insure proper impact on perpetual and G/L records.
* Reviews variances to determine cause.
* Drives continuous process improvements.
* Supports new product development.
* Analyzes shipments, standard cost valuations, production variance, and other costs analysis.
* Prepares and analyzes cost reports.
* Prepares forecasts for Shipments, Absorption, Inventory, Variances, etc.
* Performs the monthly accounting close process, balance sheet reconciliations and journal entry postings.
* Support compliance with Sarbanes Oxley and related audits.
* Other Ad hoc requests / projects.

**Qualifications:**

* Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting/Finance from an accredited college/ university required.

title: Analyst - Portfolio Management
description:
Description:

Asana Partners is a growing real estate private equity firm with $7.1 billion in assets under management. We acquire, enhance, and operate mixed-use and retail properties in dynamic neighborhoods across the country.


Our distinctive company culture is the key to our success. We recruit high-performing, ambitious individuals who are entrepreneurial and eager to maximize their potential in a team environment. We value relationship building – both internally and externally – and view it as the foundation for creating value for our neighborhoods and generating strong results for our investors. Asana Partners is known for our proven, strategic approach; our sophisticated, collaborative team; and our high-quality portfolio. Headquartered in Charlotte with offices in Atlanta, Boston, Columbia, Denver, and Los Angeles, we were founded to be a firm that would provide career-long opportunities for our people and a long-term partner for our investors.


For additional information about Asana Partners, visit www.asanapartners.com


The Portfolio Management Program is a three-year program during which the PMP will develop best-in-class private equity real estate skills in a team-oriented, fast-paced, entrepreneurial, and high-performance environment. Each year of the program is structured to give the PMP an increasing amount of responsibility at the firm and exposure to the private equity real estate industry while also placing heightened focus on development of interpersonal and leadership skills. As the PMP nears completion of the program, the PMP will have the opportunity to establish a career path within a distinctive value-add company vertical. Duties include:

* Work closely with senior executives and various execution teams to provide analytics, research, and execution support for the following areas: business analytics, investor relations, regional and investment strategic planning, portfolio-level budgeting and reforecasting, redevelopment underwriting, leasing decisions, and dispositions.
* Develop and maintain sophisticated projection models highlighting critical investment performance metrics
* Plan and produce investor reporting and investor meeting deliverables
* Support debt and equity financing transactions, including secured debt placements, refinancings, and equity capital raising
* Build or streamline internal processes to drive operating efficiency across all departments
* Gain expertise in a variety of technical platforms, including Power BI, Argus Enterprise, Yardi, MapDash, and WDesk


Requirements:
* Strong analytical, technology, organizational, and process design skills
* Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills
* Strong work ethic, self-motivated, and capable of effective independent judgment
* Acute attention to detail and passion for quality
* Proficiency in Excel, Word, and PowerPoint

**Education**


Degree in accounting, business, urban studies, engineering, finance, mathematics, real estate, or related field

**Travel**


 Occasional, project-related travel to various investments across the United States

description:

Monday through Friday from 8:30am to 5:00pm, with one hour for lunch.  

***Must be willing to work a flexible schedule to meet the needs of the department.***

**Job Search Category** Fiscal Accounting
  

About USC
**About University of South Carolina**
From the Upstate to the Lowcountry, the University of South Carolina system is transforming the lives of South Carolinians through the impact of our eight institutions and 20 locations throughout the state. More than 50,000 students are enrolled at one of eight institutions, including the research campus in Columbia and comprehensive four-year universities in Aiken, Upstate and Beaufort. In addition, our Palmetto College campuses in Salkehatchie, Union, Lancaster and Sumter enable students to earn associate or bachelor’s degrees through a combination of in-person, online or blended learning. All of our system institutions place strong emphasis on service — helping to build healthier, more educated communities in South Carolina and beyond.
  

**Inclusive Excellence Statement**
At the University of South Carolina, we strive to cultivate an inclusive environment that is open, welcoming, and supportive of individuals of all backgrounds. We recognize diversity in our workforce is essential to providing academic excellence and critical to our sustainability. The University is committed to eliminating barriers created by institutional discrimination through accountability and continuous process improvement. We celebrate the diverse voices, perspectives, and experiences of our employees.
  

Benefits for FTE Positions
The University of South Carolina (USC), through the State of SC and Public Employee Benefit Authority (PEBA), offers employees a valuable benefits package, including health and life insurance, generous paid leave and retirement programs. To learn more about USC benefits, access the About Benefits section on the Applicant Portal at uscjobs.sc.edu.
Position Description
**Advertised Job Summary**
The Fiscal Analyst serves in the Office of the Dean within College of Engineering and Computing. This position is responsible for the oversight of day-to-day fiscal operations in their assigned area, which consists of performing detailed, complex analysis of account activity, analyzing and reconciling accounts, processing transactions in University accounting systems, determining needed corrective actions, as well as reporting and budget forecasting, and ensuring transactions are in compliance with applicable USC, college, state, and federal regulations.
  

**Minimum Qualifications**
Bachelor’s degree and 3 or more years of experience, which may be substituted by equivalent combination of certification, training, education, and/or experience.  


  

**Preferred Qualifications**
Knowledge of University accounting processes. Experience with PeopleSoft and Finance intranet.
  

**Knowledge/Skills/Abilities**
Knowledge of the principles, practices, theories and terminology of accounting. Knowledge of state government accounting processes. Knowledge of financial EDP systems. Ability to proficiently apply mathematical concepts. Ability to analyze and interpret complex financial data and reports. Knowledge of Excel and Access.
  

Job Duties
**Job Duty**
Responsible for monitoring budgets and disbursements in assigned college accounts. Analyze transactions for appropriateness, compliance with applicable USC, state, college, and federal regulations, and make determinations on corrective action if needed. Analyze trends in spending and determine necessary actions to ensure accounts meet budgetary expectations, and perform entries as needed. Analyze college account budgets and make budget entries as needed based on the result of account activity analysis, expenditure trends, and college budget priorities. Ensure the best and most appropriate sources of revenue are used for each college expense, and all entries are made in accordance with applicable USC, college, state, and federal regulations. Perform other journal entries as needed. Provide regular reports to management on sources and uses of college resources.
  

**Essential Function** Yes
  

**Percentage of Time** 45
  

**Job Duty**
Responsible for monitoring recurring expenditures and revenues and providing regular reports to management on revenue and expenditure trends for use in budget monitoring and development. Responsible for ensuring recurring billings are completed in a timely manner each month, and recurring revenues are received as expected. Responsible for follow up on these items as needed to ensure all expected revenues and expenditures are properly recorded according to USC, college, state and federal regulations. Produce special reports as needed using PeopleSoft, Finance Intranet, Excel, and Access.
  

**Essential Function** Yes
  

**Percentage of Time** 30
  

**Job Duty**
Responsible for ensuring the proper execution of daily college reports. Verify automated reporting runs executed as planned and troubleshoot reporting database issues. Monitor regular budget reports and make determinations on corrective actions needed. Work with faculty on special data needs, and provide special reports as needed. Ensure all monthly and yearly reports are completed as required.
  

**Essential Function** Yes
  

**Percentage of Time** 20
  

**Job Duty**
Other duties as required
  

**Essential Function** Yes
  

**Percentage of Time** 5
  

Position Attributes
Employees in Safety-Sensitive or Security-Sensitive positions will be subject to pre-employment and post-employment drug testing in accordance with University policy HR 1.95 Drug and Alcohol Testing.
**Safety Sensitive or Security Sensitive** No
  

**Hazardous weather category** Non-Essential

**Desired Start Date**
  

**Job Open Date** 02/26/2024
  

**Job Close Date** 04/11/2024
  

**Open Until Filled** No

* Resume/CV
* Contact information for reference providers.

This employment site is updated on a regular basis. The length of the recruitment and screening process may vary from position to position, depending upon a variety of factors. title: Sr Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst (Hybrid, Columbia SC)
description:
Senior Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst (Hybrid in Columbia, SC)  

  

  

The AgFirst Senior Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst is to provides financial planning and forecasting support for the financial management of the Bank and associations. This is the lead analyst for bank business plan, reforecasts, and stress testing using forecasted balance sheet and interest rates, and works with Bank managers to determine volume and interest rate projections. If you have the desire and analytic skills to serve in this vital role, apply today!  

  

  

What you’ll do  

  

  

* Collaborate mindset. Partner with the credit department on various stress testing scenarios.
* Presents reports to the ALCO and Bank executives.
* Report and analyze plan projections to actual
* Monitor markets, implied forward curves, and economic data for interest rate forecasting.
* Apply interest rate shocks in comparison to baseline forecasted position.
* Back-test forecasted Net Interest Income to actual.
* Provide analysis on changes in market values and net interest income.
* Report and present stress test scenarios to Bank management and system work group

  

  

What you'll need  

  

  

* Bachelor’s degree in finance, accounting, business, or related field.
* Five years of comparable work experience.
* Position requires the ability to plan, organize and carry out assignments on own initiative in a timely and accurate manner.
* Ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with various stakeholders.
* Must possess judgmental and decision-making abilities based on interpretation of management needs, regulations, and policy requirements.
* Advanced knowledge of MS Office applications, including Excel, Access, and VBA.
* Knowledge of R, Python and SQL is highly desirable.
* Possess thorough understanding of financial management skills.
* QRM or financial simulation experience highly preferred.
* Bloomberg experience preferred

title: Accountant/Fiscal Analyst
description:
Serves as the primary support for the ACH (direct deposit) enrollment portal to include, but not limited to, uploading daily files, creating and documenting open support tickets with the portal software provider, taking calls and troubleshooting vendor questions.  

Coordinates and documents vendor outreach to include identifying vendors for outreach, tracking enrollment/attempts for enrollment, and participating in project meetings to present updates.  

Acts as the primary point of contact for vendor communication and/or research to include ACH enrollment portal, outstanding payments, and other vendor related questions.  

Reviews daily accounts payable workflow documents in the statewide accounting system. Works with State agencies as needed to train on STO policy regarding vendor payment method and payment terms.  

Must possess a high degree of emotional intelligence, positive attitude, utilize a solution-driven approach to problem solving and understand the importance of maintaining positive working relationships with both internal staff and external service providers.
  

**Agency Minimum Qualifications\*:**  

  

A high school diploma and professional experience in a related area such as accounting, auditing, finance, or banking. A bachelor's degree with multiple accounting courses may be substituted for the required work experience.  

  

Must possess excellent communication skills, both verbal and in writing, thereby facilitating communication with internal and external professional, management, and technical contacts.  

  

Must compile and report data and information accurately and in a timely manner, whether routine or by special request. Ability to organize, edit and produce detailed data within limited time frames. Extensive knowledge of various computer software packages including Microsoft Office.  

  

Must possess a high degree of emotional intelligence, positive attitude, utilize a solution-driven approach to problem solving and understand the importance of maintaining positive working relationships with both internal staff and external service providers.  

  

* *Candidates must specifically meet the Agency Minimum Requirements or an equivalent combination of education and experience to be considered for this position.*

title: REPOST Senior Accountant/Fiscal Analyst / 61015621
description:
***Special Notice: This is a REPOST - Previous applicants need not re-apply for this position.***
**Do you have a passion to provide meaningful contributions to your community?** Would you like to be part of an organization whose central mission is helping to protect, stabilize and strengthen the lives of South Carolina's children, families, and vulnerable adults? If so, the **SC Department of Social Services** has the right job opportunity for you!  

  

**Job duties:*** The Senior Accountant/Fiscal Analyst performs professional accounting duties of moderate to high complexity related to state and federal financial reporting, fiscal analysis, and agency funds management. Assists in the reporting and funds management of a federal budget of approximately $500 million, including 40 federal grants of which (7) are considered major under the Single Audit Act.

  

* Participates in agency cash management activities to include daily monitoring and maintenance of federal and other funds cash balances. Manages federal grant awards, and letter of credit systems, which ensuring compliance with federal regulations. Reconciles to the agency's general ledger reporting module.

  

* Prepares and reconciles federal quarterly reports from and to agency general ledger and grant records. Prepares journal entries and/or amended reports when needed based on reconciliation results. Assists with the preparation of the Schedule of Expenditures of Federal Assistance and many other scheuldes and reports.

  

* Assists with and participates in meetings and discussions with program staff concerning all aspects of financial management of grant programs. Answers questions as needed.

  

* Works with Budget and HR staff to keep grant funding streams current. Assists program staff, Procurement, and Accounts Payable with proper coding assignments and allocation of costs to grants.

  

* Coordinates with federal and state financial representatives and auditors concerning reviews and audits of grant programs.

  

* Prepares federal, state, and ad hoc financial reports relating to grants as needed or requested.

  

* Performs Red Cross shelter duty or other emergency shelter duty/ services as directed.

  

**State Requirements**  

A Bachelor's degree in accounting, finance, business, or a related field and professional experience directly related, such as accounting, auditing, finance or commercial lending,


  

This application for employment with the SC Department of Social Services must be completed in its entirety. **A resume may be included; but shall not be substituted in lieu of the completion of this application in part or in whole. “See Resume” is not acceptable information for the completion of any part of the requirements of this application.**If such is submitted, this employment application will be considered incomplete and may not be forwarded as eligible for consideration to hiring managers.  

  

Must possess a valid driver's license. Must be able to use standard office equipment to include personal computer, scanner, copier, and calculator. Experienced in Microsoft Office Suite, to include Outlook, Excel and WORD. Minimal lifting not to exceed 25 pounds. Position my require overtime at certain times during the year.  

  

If you certify, by completion and submission of this application, that you possess educational credentials that qualify you for the available DSS positions, you will be required to provide a certified official transcript, if you are selected for job offer.  

  

**DIVISION****:** Financial Services / Richland County

title: Sr. Financial Analyst
description:
At Trane TechnologiesTM and through our businesses including Trane® and Thermo King®, we create innovative climate solutions for buildings, homes, and transportation that challenge what’s possible for a sustainable world. We're a team that dares to look at the world's challenges and see impactful possibilities. We believe in a better future when we uplift others and enable our people to thrive at work and at home. We boldly go.  

**Position Description**  

We are in search for people with sense of re-inventing themselves, in pursuit of ‘doing the right thing’, willing to take more responsibility and move up. Sound like you? Be part of our top-notch team of 15,00+ professionals in Columbia, SC location where we have 3 plants co-located under the same roof. You will be joining a finance team where we have mix of mature and high growth finance professionals supporting the monthly closing, annual planning, compliance, measuring operational performance and providing guidance on how to optimize resource utilization generating maximum wealth for the business. The Senior Financial Analyst will add significant value to the company’s bottom line through improving all aspects of financial management in a multi-million dollar operating facility.


**Essential Job Functions**

  

* Leads annual standard cost process as well as quarterly costs movement reviews.
* Leads annual physical inventory process and related reconciliation.
* Completes all monthly reports on a timely basis with zero defects.
* Reviews transaction errors to insure proper impact on perpetual and G/L records.
* Reviews variances to determine cause.
* Drives continuous process improvements.
* Supports new product development.
* Analyzes shipments, standard cost valuations, production variance, and other costs analysis.
* Prepares and analyzes cost reports.
* Prepares forecasts for Shipments, Absorption, Inventory, Variances, etc.
* Performs the monthly accounting close process, balance sheet reconciliations and journal entry postings.
* Support compliance with Sarbanes Oxley and related audits.
* Other Adhoc requests / projects.

**Education, Experience & Skills**  

Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting/Finance from an accredited college/ university required.  

* Five to Ten (5-10) years’ experience in general accounting and cost accounting in a manufacturing environment.
* Knowledge of GAAP (Generally accepted accounting principles).
* Strong PC skills (Excel, Access, Power-Point) required.
* Sound business knowledge applicable to a manufacturing environment.
* Lives the Trane values of integrity, respect, innovation, courage, and teamwork
* Communicates compellingly
* Learns enthusiastically
* Advocates for customers
* Innovates
* Promotes change
* Strives for excellence

**Physical Requirements**  

* Ability to effectively communicate with all levels of internal company and external associates, both written and orally, including the telephone.

We offer competitive compensation and comprehensive benefits and programs. We are an equal opportunity employer; all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, pregnancy, age, marital status, disability, status as a protected veteran, or any legally protected status.

title: Business Analyst
description:
**50% remote work**  
  
**REQUIRED SKILLS (RANK IN ORDER OF IMPORTANCE):**  
1. 2+ years of experience managing or leading software release activities.  
2. 2+ years of experience working in an Agile environment  
3. 3+ years of experience in software development lifecycle  
4. 3+ years of experience working with Jira and Confluence  
5. Excellent written and verbal communications skills  
6. Excellent collaboration skills  
  
**PREFERRED SKILLS (RANK IN ORDER OF IMPORTANCE):**  
1. Experience working with and/or testing data transformation and integration applications.  
  
**REQUIRED EDUCATION/CERTIFICATIONS:**  
1. High school diploma required.  
  
**PREFERRED EDUCATION/CERTIFICATIONS:**  
1. Bachelor’s degree preferred.

 

**SCOPE OF THE PROJECT:**  
SCDHHS is seeking an expert Business Analyst - Advanced to work directly with the OIM and Medicaid Enterprise System (MES) leadership teams to ensure the successful completion of complex business solutions in accordance with the Deputy Director of OIM’s vision for the Medicaid Enterprise System.  
  
DAILY DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES:  
The Business Analyst – Advanced will serve as a liaison between development teams and QA teams to coordinate and schedule production software releases.  
  
The Business Analyst – Advanced will work with various internal teams including Project Directors/Project Managers, Technical Directors/Developers, Business and Technology Stakeholders/Subject Matter Experts (SMEs) and other Agency staff to gather and generate artifacts needed to establish the readiness of a release package.  
  
We are looking for candidates with experience in Medicaid benefit programs who are highly organized, can work independently in a fast-paced environment, and work collaboratively with stakeholders to ensure software releases are completed on schedule and with complete accuracy. Candidates should be self-starters, creative problem solvers, and have the flexibility to learn new products quickly.  
  
Essential Responsibilities  
1. Coordinate and collaborate with appropriate management staff, Product Owners, development team members, QA testers, DevOps, and other stakeholders required, to ensure successful releases.  
2. Lead the preparation of release plans that accomplish the stated goals with minimum risk.  
3. Document and track software releases and artifacts in Jira and Confluence.  
  
Program Experience:  
Current experience with South Carolina or other state Medicaid services is strongly desired and will be given the highest weight.  
  
Technical Knowledge:  
Experience managing release schedules and leading release processes is required.  
  
Experience with requirements tracing as related to System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) is required.  
  
Experience in all or most of the following domains would be considered required for this position:  
4. Medicaid Management Information Systems (or other Health Information Technologies)  
5. Agile Software Development  
6. Content collaboration/ project management software such as JIRA, Confluence, SharePoint, etc.  
7. Diagramming software such as Visio, etc.  
8. Microsoft Office Suite (Excel, PowerPoint, Outlook, Word).  
  
General Duties and Responsibilities:  
1. Coordinate and collaborate with appropriate management staff, Product Owners, development team members, QA testers, DevOps, and other stakeholders required, to ensure successful releases.  
2. Lead teams with preparation of release plans that accomplish the stated goals with minimum risk.  
3. Document and track software releases and artifacts in Jira and Confluence.

title: Senior IT Financial Analyst
description:
Job Description  
  
SUMMARY: FP&A focuses on the fin activities of the org, such as: controlling its fin resources and ensuring that all fin transactions, systems, and procedures comply with regs, accounting principles, and standards; fin analysis and reporting, taxation, insurance, credit control, AP and AR, inventory and costs control, and budgeting and forecasting; analyzing the org's revenues, liabilities, credit conditions, and other fin indicators to forecast its short, med, and long-term cash flow position; evaluating and recommending investments and other fin instruments to meet cash flow needs; presenting findings and recommendations to top execs; preparing fin reports; ensuring all tax returns, declarations, and other required reports are submitted accurately and timely.  
  
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential duties.  
* Prepares annual Budget, monthly forecast, and periodically a long range plan
* Owns financial models - builds models from scratch, improves existing models
* Partners with accounting team to ensure the integrity of the results and submits accruals when needed
* Reviews variances against forecast, Budget, and prior year; tells the story about what is going on in the business area.
* Prepares value added financial analyses and drives outcomes in business areas
* Is the trusted financial partner to multiple business partners
* Demonstrates knowledge of proper business practices

  
Supervisory Responsibilities: This position has no formal supervisory responsibilities.  
  
MINIMUM REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:  
* Bachelor's degree in accounting, economics, finance, math or a related field AND
* Three (3) years of experience in financial analysis

  
Certificates and Licenses: None required.  
  
OTHER REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:  
* Experience in Finance (Budgeting, Performance Reporting and financial analysis)
* Understanding of accounting processes, procedures and internal controls
* Experience working within the IT realm and capital expenditures
* Able to work well as part of a team
* Possess very good communication skills - written and verbal
* Excellent time management and organizational skills
* Experience with accounting and finance tools, preferably Net Suite and Hyperion PBCS
* Ability to travel 5% of the time
* Highly proficient in Microsoft Excel and Word
* Ability to clear required background check

  
DESIRED QUALIFICATIONS:  
* IT financial background
* OpEx and CapEx

  
WORK ENVIRONMENT: The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.  
  
This position is virtual and open to residents of the 50 states, D.C.  
  
COMPENSATION & BENEFITS: Stride, Inc. considers a person's education, experience, and qualifications, as well as the position's work location, expected quality and quantity of work, required travel (if any), external market and internal value when determining a new employee's salary level. Salaries will differ based on these factors, the position's level and expected contribution, and the employee's benefits elections. Offers will typically be in the bottom half of the range.

Regular

title: FP&A Analyst - Virtual/Remote
description:
Enumerate needs a **Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst** for our rapidly growing team!Enumerate has grown rapidly through acquisitions and is backed by a leading Boston-based private equity firm. We expect to continue with strategic acquisitions while diversifying our product offerings to include payments-related services for its core HOA customer base.  
  
In this role, you’ll be responsible for budgeting and forecasting as well as the development and delivery of actionable and insightful analyses of both retrospective trends (actual v. planned) and prospective opportunities. Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will have a leading role in identifying, implementing, and improving upon these core requirements.  
  
You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. This position is remote eligible, with a preference for candidates in CST/EST. **Who will love this job**  
* Someone who is a critical thinker with a meticulous approach, high initiative, and the ability to explain financial concepts in “plain English” to non-financial stakeholders

**You should have*** Required: 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, either within a corporate Finance, FP&A function, or within investment banking, commercial banking, or private equity.
* Required: Bachelors in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other highly quantitative discipline.
* Required: Experience with SaaS (or subscription) revenue recognition, including familiarity with standard SaaS metrics/ KPIs.
* Fluency in O365- especially Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
* Strong financial modeling skills in Excel including a working knowledge of 3 statement models.
* Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.
* Ability to work in the US without sponsorship.
  
**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. When possible, we also like to offer fun in-person perks like pet-friendly offices, paid food trucks and company outings.
