title: Investment Reporting Analyst
description:
**Investment Reporting Analyst**



If you like to work with people in a family atmosphere, enjoy great benefits and provide unequaled personal service to every customer, consider a career with Bell Bank.


**Company Information:**



Bell Bank was founded in 1966 and headquartered in Fargo, North Dakota. It is the largest family-and employee-owned bank in the upper Midwest, and one of the largest in the nation, with assets of more than $10 billion. Bell Bank has full-service banking locations in North Dakota, Minnesota and Arizona. Bell has empowered more than $27 million in charitable giving through its unique Pay It Forward initiative, through which every employee chooses each year how to help individuals, families and organizations in need.



Bell Bank has been recognized as a top workplace by *American Banker, Forbes and Fortune*.



If you want to work for an established, growing, forward-looking organization with world-class employees, this is the place for you.Let Bell Bank be your destination workplace.



**Bell's Values:**



As stewards, dedicated to the growth and reputation of this independently owned organization, we are committed to:


* Promoting and sustaining our family atmosphere.
* Providing unequaled personal service to each and every customer.
* “Paying it forward” by giving back to the communities we serve.


**Our Bottom Line:**



Happy Employees! Happy Customers!



**Job Summary:**



This position is responsible for investment performance analysis, including measurement and reporting, utilizing industry standard tools and reporting applications. This position will also assist in model management and trading. The primary areas of focus include performance reporting, institutional client reporting, trading and model management and monthly/quarterly GIPS performance updates. This position is viewed as a key member of the Investment Team and is relied upon as an expert within performance measurement and reporting. This position will generally assist Portfolio Managers, and Senior Portfolio Managers.



**Primary Duties:**


* Performance Reporting:
* Develop and publish high quality, routine, and ad-hoc performance measurement and analytics reporting for various stakeholders, including Institutional Clients and the Investment Team.
* Prepare investment reports for use with institutional investment committees/clients; including retirement plans, insurance companies, corporate accounts, endowments, and foundations.
* Establish and manage a schedule of reporting deliverables in satisfaction of various deadlines.
* May create/redesign/enhance existing reporting framework to meet evolving needs
* May calculate and/or validate GIPS compliant returns; fees; performance attribution, exposure, and risk analytics for investment managers, portfolio aggregates, and benchmarks
* Work directly with vendors, Investment Team, and systems to ensure complete, accurate, and timely updates to databases.
* May be a member of the reporting governance team responsible for assisting with the reporting governance processes and overall data quality
* May be a data steward for performance data within overall data management strategy.
* Perform special projects as needed.
* Trading and Model Management:
* Create, update, and assign investment models.
* Invest or raise cash for individual accounts. Rebalancing accounts to their approved model or single security trading.
* Implement model moves made by Bell Institutional Investment Management.
* Monitor portfolio drift across multiple accounts.
* Client Investment Reporting:
* Prepare investment reports for use with institutional investment committees/clients; including retirement plans, insurance companies, corporate accounts, endowments, and foundations.
* May provide Support to Marketing by assisting in preparing investment reporting information for marketing materials, Request for Proposals (RFPs), and client/industry presentations.
* Know by name and face as many customers and employees as possible, calling them by name as often as possible.
* Know and practice LOCBUTN, our Golden Rules, and Bell Bank Customer Service Standards.
* Know, understand, and live the company values and bottom line.
* Conduct activities consistent with established Bell Bank policies, procedures and systems, the Bell Bank Employee Conduct policies, the Bank Secrecy Act and all applicable state and federal laws and regulations.
* All employees are responsible for information security, including compliance with policies and standards which protect sensitive information.
* Perform other duties as assigned.


**Job Skills Required:**


* B.A. in business, finance, accounting, economics, statistics or field closely related to any of these degrees.
* 1 to 7 years of experience in the investment management/financial industry, including calculating and interpreting performance.
* Passion for the investment management, security analysis industry.
* Knowledge of the following areas:
	+ Investment terminology
	+ Investment process and markets
	+ Investment portfolio theory and practice
	+ Accounting practices
	+ Fixed income and equity securities and trading practices
	+ Spreadsheet software and financial information systems
	+ GIPS (Global Investment Performance Standards)
* Detail oriented, highly organized, self-directed, and motivated.
* Solid quantitative and qualitative analytical skills and problem-solving skills.
* Good written and verbal communication skills; ability to communicate complex topics.
* Ability to learn new technology systems to enhance investment platforms.


Bell Bank provides competitive compensation and an excellent benefits package.



**Bell Bank**

**Equal Opportunity Employer**

title: Employee Benefits Financial Analyst
description:
Are you a bright, outgoing, people-oriented person? If so, this is the career for you. At HUB, we value education and continuous learning and are excited to assist you along your career development path.
  
  

As an Employee Benefits Financial Analyst , you will provide analytical support to Account Managers. You will build relationships with internal and external customers while providing guidance and assistance. You will have continuous learning and development opportunities to work towards your career goals.
  
  

What makes us different than all the rest?
  
  

**Our Vision:** To be everywhere risk exists – today and tomorrow. Helping protect what matters most.
  
  

**Our Mission:** To protect and support the aspirations of individuals, families and businesses. To empower our employees to learn, grow and make a difference in their communities.
  
  

**Our Core Values:**  

**Entrepreneurship:** We encourage innovation and educated risk-taking.
  
  

**Integrity:** We do the right thing every time.
  
  

**Teamwork:** We work together to maximize results.
  
  

**Accountability:** We measure and take responsibility for outcomes.
  
  

**Service:** We serve customers, communities, and colleagues.
  
  

**We are the perfect fit if you:**  

Are seeking a progressive work environment at a rapidly growing organization
  
  

Have an entrepreneurial spirit and are challenged by the opportunity to grow the business
  
  

Are focused on learning and development to enhance your industry knowledge and expertise
  
  

Are a self-starter willing to invest time and energy to learn the technical aspects of our business
  
  

Believe in integrity and building success by developing relationships with others
  
  

Your job responsibilities as an Employee Benefits Financial Analyst:
  
  

You will provide analytical support to the Account Manager to meet the data and reporting needs of the firm’s clients. Serve as a reporting and analytics Subject Matter Expert (SME) for internal and external stakeholders, providing information and guidance in resolving inquiries. Develop routine reports for clients to include renewal information, renewal history, mid-year planning, stewardship, monthly or quarterly utilization, and claims analysis, etc. Create custom reports as needed to assist in answering customer inquiries, including plan cost variances, plan change analysis, claim history, claim projections, etc., and conduct complex analysis of data when required. You will prepare renewal information, which includes plan data, census, renewal history, obtaining renewal rates from the carrier, including any alternates, ensures commission schedule is correct. Create bid specifications for carrier proposal requests, obtain proposals from carriers, and prepare analysis of proposal results. Attend and participate in client meetings.
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

Bachelor's degree from an accredited college or university preferred
  
  

Minimum two years of experience in benefit brokerage, benefit data analytics, benefits/insurance administration, or related field preferred
  
  

An equivalent combination of education and/or relevant work experience may be substituted in lieu of minimum qualifications
  
  

Must be a critical thinker, with strong communication, interpersonal, multi-tasking and organizational skills
  
  

Excellent verbal and written communication skills
  
  

The preferred candidate is a team player with a great attitude, self-motivation and the ability to work in a fast-paced environment
  
  

Strong communication, interpersonal, multi-tasking, and organizational skills required
  
  

Must be thorough, detail-oriented and is responsible for working with confidential information
  
  

Ability to accommodate immediate requests, perform under short deadlines and coordinate multiple jobs
  
  

Ability to function independently with minimal supervision
  
  

Why Choose HUB?
  
  

At HUB, we believe in investing in the future of our employees and provide continuous opportunities for growth and development. Our entrepreneurial culture fosters an environment that empowers our people to make the best decisions for our customers and organization, focusing on expanding the industry knowledge of our insurance professionals to better serve our valued clients. We are committed to providing you with competitive and flexible benefits options that are rooted in your current needs yet evolves as your needs change over time. Join us in taking the first step toward creating a future that combines a diverse, challenging work environment with financial security and career satisfaction.
  
  

When you join the team at HUB International, you become part of the 5th largest global insurance broker, providing a broad array of property, casualty, risk management, life and health, employee benefits, investment and wealth management products and services.
  
  

Becoming a part of HUB means that you thrive in an entrepreneurial and fast paced team environment supported by over 16,000 professionals in 500 offices across North America.
  
  

**What we offer you:**  

A rewarding career helping local businesses in the community
  
  

Rewards for top performers
  
  

Medical/dental/vision/life insurance
  
  

Parental Paid Leave
  
  

Health Savings Account
  
  

401k matching program
  
  

Voluntary insurance options
  
  

Life and disability Plans
  
  

A rewarding career helps local businesses in the community
  
  

A work/life balance because that’s important for all of us
  
  

Opportunity to learn from the expertise of your coworkers
  
  

Growth- HUB is growing, and so can your career
  
  

Ability to be part of a motivated, winning team
  
  

\#LI-JR
  
  

\#INDUS
  
  

Department Account Management & Service
  
  

**Required Experience:** 1-2 years of relevant experience
  
  

**Required Travel:** Negligible
  
  

**Required Education:** Bachelor's degree (4-year degree)
  
  

HUB International Limited is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer that does not discriminate on the basis of race/ethnicity, national origin, religion, age, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran's status, or any other characteristic protected by local, state or federal laws, rules or regulations. The EEO is the Law poster and its supplement is available here athttp://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/ofccpost.htm.

We endeavor to make this website accessible to any and all users. If you would like to contact us regarding the accessibility of our website or need assistance completing the application process, please contact the US Recruiting Team toll-free at (844) 300-9193 orUSRecruiting@hubinternational.com. This contact information is for accommodation requests only; do not use this contact information to inquire about the status of applications.
  
  

Hi, we’re HUB.
  
  

In a rapidly changing world, we advise businesses and individuals on how to prepare for the unexpected.
  
  

When you partner with us, you're at the center of a vast network of experts who will help you reach your goals through risk services, claims management, and compliance support.
  
  

And this gives you the peace of mind that what matters most to you will be protected — through unrelenting advocacy and tailored insurance solutions that put you in control.
  
  

About HUB International
  
  

Headquartered in Chicago, Illinois, HUB International Limited (HUB) is a leading full-service global insurance broker providing property and casualty, life and health, employee benefits, investment and risk management products and services. From offices located throughout North America, HUB’s vast network of specialists provides peace of mind on what matters most by protecting clients through unrelenting advocacy and tailored insurance solutions. title: Senior Financial Planning Analyst
description:
**Overview**  

CommonSpirit Health is a nonprofit Catholic health system dedicated to advancing health for all people. It was created in February 2019 by Catholic Health Initiatives and Dignity Health. With its national office in Chicago and a team of over 150,000 employees and 25,000 physicians and advanced practice clinicians, CommonSpirit operates more than 2,000 care sites from clinics and hospitals to home-based care and virtual care services. Our world needs compassion like never before. Our communities need caring and our families need protection. With our combined resources CommonSpirit is committed to building healthy communities advocating for those who are poor and vulnerable and innovating how and where healing can happen - both inside our hospitals and out in the community. **Responsibilities** **Job Summary:**


The Senior Financial Planning Analyst works collaboratively with all members of the Finance Division to assist in the achievement of system objectives. The Senior Financial Planning Analyst assists the finance management team, in all areas of dashboard reporting, financial analysis, productivity analysis and support, long-range financial planning, operating and capital budgeting, and related activities in support of all strategies, initiatives and operational elements. Provides general direction, technical assistance and support to CHI Health management in the implementation and execution of strategic and operational initiatives.

 **Key Responsibilities:**

* Responsible for providing consultative support in the areas of financial analysis and planning, with emphasis on assigned operational areas.
* Assists in forecasting financial needs, including pro forma financial statements, break-even analysis, cash flow projections, ratio analysis, cash planning, capital planning, resource utilization, and evaluation of financing alternatives.
* Responsible for the coordination and preparation of the routine Analytical Review of operational activity which is based on a sound financial analysis, including budget vs. actual comparisons as well as benchmarking, but also incorporates operational insight in close cooperation with the affected operational personnel.
* Participates in the creation of an instrument panel of key statistics, ratio and data for use by the Senior and Executive Leadership teams.
* Provides training and support to financial analyst I and financial analyst II members of the Finance Division.
* Provides advice, counsel, suggestions for operational improvement, support and accountability of financial operations to leadership.
* Facilitates communication and acts as a point of contact between managers at the assigned areas and members of the Accounting & Finance Department.
* Provides support in the process of gathering the common statistics in an accurate/timely fashion in support of other financial, planning and operational activities and initiatives.

  

**Qualifications**  

Bachelors Degree in Business, Accounting, Finance or closely related field **Preferred**
3-5 years experience in general accounting or finance  

Masters degree and/or a CPA license **Pay Range**  

$32.08 - $46.51 /hour

title: Senior Financial Planning Analyst
description:
The Senior Financial Planning Analyst will act as a primary consultant, tasked with providing timely insight related to business results and trends while being on the leading edge of identifying future opportunities. This position will be responsible for performing financial planning and analysis along with facilitating the budgeting process for various areas of the company by working collaboratively with field management on their business plans.

  

**Specific Duties Include:**  

* Leads assigned field operation’s budgeting and business planning. This includes:


o Providing expertise in the development and refinement of a perpetual budgeting process by preparing forecasts and budgets, analyzing trends in revenue, costs, expenses and other related areas.  

o Analyzes actual results to understand budget variances and revise projections as appropriate.  

o Analysis of and recommendations on key performance indicators.  

o Consulting General Managers in creation and refinement of action plans.  

* Prepares regular financial analysis for assigned regions/stores. This includes:


o Specific analysis of a business function, department, store or region as directed and by self-identification of business information needs.
  

o Researches, analyzes and synthesizes data from the Company’s numerous data resources.  

o Interpreting financial and operational reports and explaining information to field management.  

* Drives streamlining of business processes and reporting related to business planning, performance and efficiency improvement.
* Builds a strong working relationship with General Managers and Regional Vice Presidents in order to be viewed as a valued member of their teams.
* Consults management in the development of action plans which have resulted from the financial planning and analysis activities through the MMR (monthly management review) process.
* Ensures timely delivery of information to all relevant stakeholders. This includes providing tracking of results related to action plans, stakeholder scorecard and various other key metric reports.
* Advises in creation of various Company sponsored bonus plans for field personnel.
* Develops relationships with the appropriate original equipment manufacturers (OEM).
* Provides tracking and communication related to OEM sponsored marketing and incentive programs in conjunction the marketing department.
* Provides all other ad hoc analysis as assigned.
* Assists other department personnel to ensure customer satisfaction.
* Follow all safety rules and regulations while performing work assignments and adhere to all policies and procedures as specified in company manuals and as directed in the employee handbook.
* Conduct self in the presence of customers and community so as to present a professional image of RDO Equipment Co.
* Proactively seek and participate in available company-sponsored training, in an effort to develop and advance knowledge base and skill set.
* Participate in all company/location driven communication efforts, including open book meetings, huddles, department meetings and other related efforts.
* Maintain a positive and professional working relationship with peers, management, and support resources, with a constant commitment to teamwork and exemplary customer service.
* Perform all other duties as assigned by management in a professional and efficient manner.

**Job Requirements:**  

* Bachelors degree in Accounting/Finance/Business
* 5+ years of analysis and budgeting work related experience
* Must be a self-starter who can work independently
* Familiar with standard accounting concepts, practices, and procedures
* Attention to details in conjunction with the ability to see the bigger picture
* Possess excellent analytical skills and relies on experience and judgment to plan and accomplish goals
* Excellent problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate effectively with others and being resourceful in solving problems independently
* Strong information seeking skills and drive to make things happen
* Excellent computer skills including strong Microsoft Excel skills
* Excellent customer service skills
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Ability to travel up to 20%
* Candidates must have valid work authorization and be able to work in the U.S. without company sponsorship.
  

Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities


The contractor will not discharge or in any other manner discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information, unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)

title: FP&A Analyst - Virtual/Remote
description:
Enumerate needs a **Financial Planning & Analysis Analyst** for our rapidly growing team!Enumerate has grown rapidly through acquisitions and is backed by a leading Boston-based private equity firm. We expect to continue with strategic acquisitions while diversifying our product offerings to include payments-related services for its core HOA customer base.  
  
In this role, you’ll be responsible for budgeting and forecasting as well as the development and delivery of actionable and insightful analyses of both retrospective trends (actual v. planned) and prospective opportunities. Our growth objectives make it critical that we establish reporting, budgeting, and forecasting and analytical models and processes that will enable the company to scale. You will have a leading role in identifying, implementing, and improving upon these core requirements.  
  
You will work closely with multiple teams across the company, providing leaders with an understanding of key performance drivers and how business decisions impact the company’s financial prospects. This role reports to the CFO and will partner closely with the accounting team. Salary range is $75-85k, depending on experience. This position is remote eligible, with a preference for candidates in CST/EST. **Who will love this job**  
* Someone who is a critical thinker with a meticulous approach, high initiative, and the ability to explain financial concepts in “plain English” to non-financial stakeholders

**You should have*** Required: 2+ years of experience in financial analysis, either within a corporate Finance, FP&A function, or within investment banking, commercial banking, or private equity.
* Required: Bachelors in Accounting, Finance, Economics, or other highly quantitative discipline.
* Required: Experience with SaaS (or subscription) revenue recognition, including familiarity with standard SaaS metrics/ KPIs.
* Fluency in O365- especially Excel, PowerPoint, and SharePoint.
* Strong financial modeling skills in Excel including a working knowledge of 3 statement models.
* Ability to both identify and communicate high level concepts and observations while also being able to roll up your sleeves and dive into the details.
* Patience, tact, and a good sense of humor - ability to work effectively and amicably with remote teams across the organization
* Authorized to work in the US without sponsorship.
* Travel of 5% expected for quarterly team meetings.
* Ability to work in the US without sponsorship.
  
**Culture**  
**Why Enumerate**  
  
Our team is changing the face of the HOA Property Technology space as a trusted industry leader for over 30 years. Today, our products enable over 1,500 of the highest-caliber property management companies in the world to grow and protect their organizations. We are a five-time winner of FLCAJ’s Readers Choice Awards for our solutions and support.  
  
Our approach to work is proactive, collaborative, and committed and our team of 140+ are truly passionate about creating a best-run company internally just as we create best-run Property Management Companies for our customers. Learn about our Core Values here.  
  
We offer a full slate of benefits, including competitive salaries, medical (including a $0 option for employees), dental, vision, life and disability coverage, paid vacation, paid holidays, tuition reimbursement, $1,000 employee referral program and a 401(k) plan. When possible, we also like to offer fun in-person perks like pet-friendly offices, paid food trucks and company outings.
